jobText: TXT/50559068.txt	§Business Development Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Executive§§Advertiser: §Halter§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§The Role§ §Halter is a high-growth technology company that has developed technology that enables dairy farmers to physically shift, manage and remotely monitor their herd from anywhere. This  technology will enable farming techniques that have never before been possible. § §With the first handful of customers deployed we are now looking to scale the company. As such we are expanding our Waikato Business Development team and are on the hunt for Business Development Executives to sell the world's most sophisticated cow movement and monitoring system.§ §As a successful applicant you will be passionate about farming and will enjoy being on farm speaking with dairy farmers. You will thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced working environment and use your initiative to achieve ambitious sales targets.§ §You will be backed by a team of exceptional people at Halter’s HQ and Pilot Farm to ensure this is the best job you’ll ever have.§ § § §What will you be working on?§ §Our vision is to unlock the connection between humans and animals to create a better world. This means we convert intentions that humans have into cues that animals understand and actions from animals into insights that humans can understand.§ §Over the last three years we have been on a mission to create guidance control techniques to shift cows remotely using a smart device, removing the need for fences and eliminating the manual nature of shifting animals. Farmers now have incredible new opportunities to unlock efficiency, productivity, and sustainability across all aspects of the farming operation.§ §Our GPS enabled, solar powered devices are designed to remotely guide cows. These require multiple levels of control software in order to record everything about the animal, understand it and act on this information accordingly. We use this to monitor stock health, feed, behaviour and emotion so that farmers can better understand and treat the needs of each animal. We are always pushing to use the latest advancements in technology and want you to be representing this technology. § §We are backed by a set of sophisticated investors that have supported a stream of other leading technology companies including SpaceX, Tesla, AirBNB and Spotify. We are also incredibly fortunate to count Rocket Lab CEO, Peter Beck, as an investor and board member.§ § § §Core Duties§ § § §Screen and qualify incoming leads to assess their fit and priority§ § § §Present Halter’s unique value and benefits to new leads on-farm or to groups§ § § §Clearly communicate functionality and highlight value relative to each farming operation § § § §Build and grow a pipeline of quality farms fit for Halter's product§ § § §Manage and maintain your pipeline, with swift execution of deals§ § § §Maintain relationships with customers by providing support and insight§ § § §Build and leverage industry relationships to establish and maintain Halter's brand§ § § §Provide clear lead progression reports to the Business Development Manager§ § § § §Desired Skills§ § § §At least 3 years experience building and managing customer relationships§ § § §A proven track record closing deals§ § § §Well prepared with strong communication skills§ § § §Exceptional time management skills§ § § §Ambitious and driven§ § § §Experience in dairy farming or within the agricultural sector is preferred, but not required§ § § §Relevant University degree or equivalent§ § § § §What we can offer you§ § § §A chance to define the future of farming and make the world a better place§ § § §An open and supportive environment where input from all members is encouraged§ § § §The opportunity to work with and grow alongside a dynamic, and highly talented team with diverse backgrounds§ § § §A fast-paced work environment with exposure to world first technology§ § § §Opportunity for rapid development and career progression§ § § §The excitement, risk, and reward of a high-growth technology start-up§  § § §If this sounds like you, click apply§ §and submit your CV and cover letter today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Our AS/NZS 4801 certification ensures that we work to the highest possible standard of health and safety. We work closely with Safe Work in Australia and WorkSafe in New Zealand for compliance, injury reporting, and other requirements. We continue with our hiring process during any stage of lockdown.§  §Please note: drug testing and a Ministry of Justice Police Checks are mandatory for all applicants offered work.§  § §  §To apply for this job go to: treescapecareers.com§§§§

company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Join a new and emerging sector §Build up your expertise in a NZ new industry §Contribute to the development of a new area of human and animal medicine §Lead cultivation operations in one of New Zealand’s most advanced facilities§Lead a team of horticultural specialists §§THE ORGANISATION §Cannasouth Cultivation is a fast-growing dynamic biopharmaceutical cultivation business that is a part of the Cannasouth Group which is listed on the NZX Main Board.  We are dedicated to cultivating the highest quality medicinal cannabis for prescribers and patients in New Zealand and export markets.  Our vision is To Optimise your Natural Health and Wellbeing. §At Cannasouth Group our values are: §Grow Ourselves§Lead Through Innovation§Unified Delivery§Everyone Together§THE ROLE§The Senior Grower role is key to the delivery of our vision and you will be a pivotal member of the Cannasouth Cultivation Lead team.  You will be reporting to senior leaders and will be responsible for coordinating and leading the day to day cultivation operations from propagation to harvest.  Following directions from our cultivation partners Vera Cultivation based in the USA you will be responsible for implementing cultivation plans, assigning duties, monitoring plant health, and overseeing all tasks related to the growing process.  You will need to successfully coordinate all production schedules, monitor the production budget, and ensure issues are identified and flagged accordingly.   §The key to success in this role is deliver high end medicinal cannabis products that meet our production plans, quality standards along with leading a group of highly engaged on the ground production workers. You are not required to have any knowledge of cannabis cultivation as training in this area will be provided by our cultivation partners.§Your willingness to learn will be essential as the cultivation facility is one of a kind in New Zealand, designed specifically for cultivating pharmaceutical quality cannabis. The facility incorporates many industry leading design features that will ensure it is the gold standard for cannabis cultivation here in New Zealand.§This will be a hands-on role requiring participation in all production activities with the rest of the team.  §THE PERSON§Our ideal candidate will be a horticultural extraordinaire.  You will have a diploma or degree in horticulture (or equivalent years of experience).  You will also have 3+ years’ experience in high quality greenhouse production environments operating under GAP/GACP standards. §More information about you:§A strong understanding of GAP/GACP quality standards§Experience writing and implementing operational SOP’s§Greenhouse operational experience including in depth knowledge of hydroponics and greenhouse irrigation/fertigation systems, climate automation systems, propagation, and plant management§Extensive knowledge of IPM strategies in the New Zealand environment§Prior production management or co-ordination experience§2+ years supervisory experience, preferable§Excellent computer skills§Are you: §A natural born leader§Emotionally intelligent§A critical problem solver§Time management extraordinaire §A skilled communicator both verbal and written §Positive, flexible, focused §A team player§This is a rare opportunity to get in on the ground level and become a vital part of the team in what will be one of the most advanced and high quality cannabis cultivation operations in New Zealand with environmental sustainability at it’s core. §If this sounds like you then apply today, by clicking Apply Now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP)?§§§

jobText: TXT/50575453.txt	§Kiwifruit Grower Services Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kiwifruit Grower Services Representative§§Advertiser: §Mount Pack & Cool Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Kiwifruit Grower Services Representative§ §Mount Pack and Cool is looking for a passionate and self-motivated individual to join our Grower Services team. §  §About us§  §Mpac is a mid-sized post-harvest facility, which packs and coolstores kiwifruit for export and distribution by Zespri International Ltd. We provide Post harvest services to kiwifruit growers across the wider Bay of Plenty Region. Our friendly and professional approach has attracted a loyal group of growers who benefit from a consistently high level of service and higher than industry average fruit returns. One of our principal points of difference is that we maintain a very close personal relationship with each of our growers and their businesses.§  §The Role§  §With the anticipated growth in industry crop volumes, Mpac are seeking to employ a Grower Services Representative to identify and develop new business opportunities and to assist in maintaining the existing business relationship we have with our current group of clients.§  §The successful candidate will have:§ § §A proven sales and/or business development background combined with an insatiable appetite to acquire new business.§ §A substantial level of relationship building experience based around excellent interpersonal skills and effective oral and written communication.§ §A comprehensive knowledge of kiwifruit industry orchard management and/or post-harvest service provision.§ §A demonstrated understanding of the key elements involved in delivering an effective service offering to a company’s clients in either a kiwifruit industry or related primary industry context.§ §An ability to build rapport and a trusted working relationship with grower clients, members of the management team and staff respectively.§ §An ability to adapt to change at an industry, a company, a demographic and a strategic level.§ §Highly developed planning and organisational skills and demonstrated personal initiative, self-motivation and resilience.§ §The ability to work effectively as an integral member of a team and to maintain a professional approach and manner in all circumstances.§ §Mpac takes a highly professional and personal approach to managing the relationship with our supplying grower clients and with other industry associates. We are proud of both the service level and the added value that we provide our clients and we are highly focused on enhancing the delivery of both these attributes going forward.§  §If you are currently involved in a related client services role or an orchard management role and you are looking for a new challenge then this could be the opportunity you are looking for. The successful candidate will play a key role in the company’s management team, ensuring that we effectively sustain our existing grower relationships and that we actively grow the business through the acquisition of new grower clients and fruit supply.§  §The role offers a competitive remuneration package including a company vehicle and a health insurance benefit. The company is also committed to providing the relevant training that our new Grower Services Officer may require in order to effectively acclimatise to the requirements of the role.§ § §Apply today by emailing your cover letter and CV to: §tanias@mpac.co.nz§ §Applications close on Friday 9th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

2 - 3 vintages §  §A positive and collaborative attitude§  §Strong initiative and self-motivation§  §The ability to multitask §  §The attributes of a team player with a good sense of humour (and the ability to put up with ours!)§As you will be supervising a team of fixed term vintage employees, you will have previous experience in the wine industry particularly in the winery environment during the busy vintage period. §The successful applicants would be expected to start in early March 2021, for a period of 6-8 weeks.  During the peak harvest period 12-hour shifts, six days a week can be expected.§Non NZ citizens/residents will need to have a valid NZ Work Visa.§As well as a stunning place to work, we’ll provide:§  §Competitive pay§  §Subsidised Accommodation§  §A meal if you are working a 12 hour shift§  §Night shift allowance§  §Transport to and from the winery§  §A fun, friendly environment§If this sounds like you, and you're keen to experience Vintage with one of NZ's most sustainable wineries, get in touch – we can’t wait to have you for vintage 2021!§Please note, all successful applicants will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Vintage-Cellar-Supervisor.pdf§§§§

Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§About the business§ § §Blockhouse Bay Vet Centre is a long standing, independently owned, 100% small animal clinic located in a well established suburb in West/Central Auckland.  We are a part of our local community and have a passion for providing high quality care for our patients. § § §About the role§ § §This is a full time role involving 35-40 hours per week with the role covering both medical and surgical nursing, customer and supplier relationships, and some reception work. § §There are some rostered Saturday hours (shared between the nursing team) but there is no Sunday, after-hours or on-call work.§ §The position starts mid-late October 2020 but flexibility exists for the right candidate.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §A successful candidate will work along side a further 4 veterinary nurses and 5 veterinarians.  The team is a mix of youth and experience that gives a nice balance to the overall clinic environment.§ §The veterinary nursing team are encouraged to take lead roles within areas of the business and support is offered for continued education and professional development.  Salary will be based on experience.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §The position requires a diploma qualified veterinary nurse with ideally 1-2 years of previous veterinary nursing experience, however new or recent graduates with the right attitude and aptitude are also encouraged to apply for this position.§ §The clinic is busy so good time management and a level head are essential.  A sense of humour also helps.§ §Punctuality and a sense of pride in ones overall work are desired and a willingness to learn and develop as a veterinary nurse a must.§ §Applications should include a cover letter and CV with current references/referees.§ §Applicants must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50585489.txt	§Laboratory Technician - 12 month contract§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Laboratory Technician - 12 month contract§§Advertiser: §Treasury Wine Estates Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§§About us§ §At Treasury Wine Estates (TWE) we know that it’s the thinkers, makers and doers who have the most impact as we continue to strive towards being recognised as the world’s most celebrated wine company.  We are proud of our portfolio of brands that have tremendous heritage, rich quality and a reputation for excellence across the globe.  From the iconic luxury of Penfolds, to the broad appeal of Matua, Shingle Peak, Squealing Pig, Wolf Blass and Pepperjack, we are committed to creating memorable wine experiences for our consumers.§ §About the role:§ §We are currently looking for a Fixed Term Laboratory Technician to join the Matua Marlborough team.  § §In this role you will work as part of a multi-disciplined Laboratory team who provide technical service and support to our winemaking, viticulture and cellar teams.  § §Key responsibilities include:§ § §Accurate and efficient laboratory analysis of wine samples§ § § §Interpretation and reporting of analysis§ § § §Trouble-shooting and problem solving§ § §About you§ §To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Have prior experience in a wine laboratory technician role§ § § §Be experienced in the use and maintenance of a range of laboratory instrumentation§ § § §Be tertiary qualified, preferably in a scientific field§ § § §Be able to work flexible hours as required during our peak harvest period§ § § §Show exceptional analytical, problem solving, attention to detail and organisational skills§ § § §Prove yourself to be pragmatic, self-motivated, and solutions focused§ § § §Be able to work independently as well as in a team environment§ § §What’s in it for you§ §Global opportunities across the ANZ, Asia, UK/Europe§ §Opportunity to build a career across multiple functions (we’re really good at doing this!)§ §Structured development programs to support your health, wellbeing and caree§ §Culture§ §We are a top 50 ASX global business and have been on an exciting journey over the last few years.  Operating with a growth mindset, we are a high performing team who deliver at a fast pace to ensure that we continue to grow and drive innovation in the wine industry.  We have high expectations on our team members and in turn, reward them with brilliant career and development opportunities.§ §If you’re ready to help us on our journey of becoming the world’s most celebrated wine company, please apply now!§ §How to apply§ §We move quickly at TWE and continually review applications, so if you don’t want to miss out, apply today.  Note that we prefer to deal with you directly and haven’t briefed a recruitment agency on this role.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50587764.txt	§Veterinary Nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary Nurse§§Advertiser: §St Lukes Vet Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Veterinary Nurse - Auckland Central, St Lukes, Morningside Drive. 1 year maternity leave cover § §Would you like to work in a modern spacious well equipped clinic in central Auckland?  Are you looking to improve your veterinary nursing skills?  Do you want to work in one of Auckland's  §NZVA BESTPractice ACCREDITED§  clinics?§ § We are looking for an experienced  qualified (diploma or equivalent) veterinary nurse to join our team at St Lukes Veterinary Centre to cover one of our nurses who is taking 1 year maternity leave starting the beginning of November.§ §This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a 3 vet and 6 nurse companion animal practice in a modern, large and recently refurbished clinic and would suit someone who is interested in taking their veterinary nursing skills to the next level.§ §Our dedicated team is assisted by a well equipped in-house laboratory, dedicated surgical theatre, digital radiology (including dental ) ultrasound and all the usual ancillary equipment in our spacious hospital.§ §St Lukes Veterinary Centre philosophy, is for our nurses to utilize their full range of clinical skills.  As well as  other general nursing duties you will  be placing IV catheters, blood sampling and taking x-rays. You would also be involved in anaesthetising and  monitoring patients, dental prophylaxis and scrubbing in for surgery.§ §Continuing education is encouraged and supported, with courses, online webinars and Vet Nurse Conferences. § §We have a large staff room out back with a sunny private courtyard for relaxing during breaks. There is on-site car parking. Westfield St Lukes is a 2 minute drive away. Health & Sports Gym and Pool is 200m down the road, opposite the Morningside railway station.§ §Competitive salary. Rostered weekend work is currently 1 in 4 Saturdays.  § §We are a motivated fun team with a love of animals and caring for them in the best way possible.Our ideal candidate will have a minimum of two or more  years experience who is keen to take a step up to the next level in their veterinary nursing career.§ §Please reply with CV in strictest confidence to   §andrew@stlukesvet.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50588167.txt	§Orchard Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchard Manager§§Advertiser: §Punchbowl PackCo Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§We are in the business of growing and we are looking to grow our team!§An exciting opportunity exists for a hands-on Orchard Manager to join our Orchard Team. Reporting to the Senior Orchard Manager, this is a fantastic role for a passionate and experienced Orchard Manager to take on the management of an orchard portfolio based in rural Patumahoe.§ §ABOUT THE JOB§You will be:§Implementing and managing all orchard strategies and activities§Overseeing the management of staff including training§Setting and managing orchard budgets§Supervising staff to ensure quality and work standards are met within budget and company guidelines§Training and overseeing contractors operating on site§Maximising the production and quality of our products§Getting involved in general tractor and farm work§ §ABOUT YOU§You have:§A NZ full driver's licence§3 – 5+ years' proven practical experience in the horticulture industry§Experience in tractor-driving, spraying and building structures§A hands-on approach with a desire to lead by example§Excellent communication, delegation and management skills§Experience in managing and setting orchard budgets§Functional computer skills (basic emailing, Word, Excel etc)§The ability to build relationships with growers§Industry-relevant tertiary qualifications§A First Aid Certificate (preferred)§A Growsafe certificate (preferred)§This is a permanent position and you must have a legal right to work in New Zealand.§ §ABOUT US§Situated in Patumahoe, Rural South Auckland, Punchbowl owns and operates managed and leased Kiwifruit and Blueberry orchards throughout the Auckland and North Waikato areas. We also run a busy seasonal packhouse and cool-store facility.  We pack approximately 3 million trays of kiwifruit and 25 tonnes of blueberries annually.§We pride ourselves on making a difference to the lives of our growers and employees.  We value our people and believe that they are key to our success. We look for candidates who are aligned to our Company Values: Customer Focus, Efficiency, Attitude, Integrity and Safer Workplaces. § §WHAT’S NEXT?§Opportunities like these don’t come around often and we will review applications as they are submitted, so if this sounds like you – get in quick!§Apply via the link below, with your CV and covering letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Vintage Crew 2021 Job in Marlborough - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50588520.txt	§Vintage Crew 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vintage Crew 2021§§Advertiser: §Indevin Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§We need help with 2021 Vintage in Gisborne, Hawke’s Bay and/or Marlborough! We’re looking for a number of team members to help us during our busiest period, so we can keep making delicious wine for NZ and the world. §  § §  §About Us§  §We might be a leader in the New Zealand Wine Industry but that’s not what makes us who we are. Our people are our winning formula; the secret sauce; the kiwifruit to our pavlova (yum). From our vineyard and winery teams, who work together to make sure our wine is outstanding; to our sales and admin teams, who keep everything running behind the scenes - our people are who we are.§  § §  §Find out more about us on our website: www.indevin.com §  § §  §Vintage 2021 - Dates & Shift Details§  §Vintage is our busiest time of the year! We work hard to get all the grapes in and processed into wine so we can get it out the door to NZ and international shelves. §  § §  §Typically, our vintages run from:§ § §Gisborne & Hawke’s Bay: February through to late March§ §Marlborough: March to late April/early May§ §There is some possibility of you doing two harvest periods (for example, starting in Gisborne, finishing in Marlborough)§ § §  §Because of the nature of our business, our vintage dates might change slightly but we will always keep you up-to-date with the latest information as we get it.§  § §  §The Roles§  § §  §Cellar Hands / Labourers§  §Ready to get stuck in? We need people with a can-do, will-do attitude, motivation and willingness to learn. You need to be physically fit and reliable, as you’ll be working in a very fast-paced environment with other highly motivated team members. Experience in a winery is an advantage, but we’ll give you all the training you need to be successful.§  § §  §This role involves a fair amount of manual labour and concentration, but you will be working with the same team every day so if that appeals to you, you’ll love this role! Our team usually become very close knit over vintage, so you’ll enjoy the benefits of getting to work with a fun loving, team environment who are all there to achieve the same goal.§  § §  §Cellar Supervisors / Team Leaders§  §Have experience as a Cellar Team Leader? Maybe you’ve supervised a team in agriculture or manufacturing? Or maybe you’re a sports team captain? Whatever the experience, we can train you in all things winery and cellar related!§  § §  §Working a winery vintage is not an easy task - we work long hours, and it’s an extremely fast-paced environment. Everyone needs to stay on task, on time and work together – that’s where your leadership skills come in. We’re looking for someone who can get the best out of their team and motivate them to achieve the tight deadlines and do what it takes to meet their goals. If you have strong communication skills, are great at building motivation and love a challenge, get in touch with us today!§  § §  §Vintage Forklift Operators§  §Do you have forklift experience? Maybe experience with a loader/digger? Or perhaps you’ve been a port worker? As long as you have experience with machinery and can easily get a ‘OSH’ & ‘F’ endorsement, we want to hear from you!§  § §  §This role will cover a broad range of operations ranging from barrel operations and fruit receival, to inward/outward goods and general harvest related tasks – this is a varied role, with the opportunity to get tons of experience across the board.§  § §  §Vintage Assistant Winemaker§  §You’ll have studied, or be currently studying a winemaking or science-related qualification.  Ideally you will also bring experience from a previous Winemaking role, but honestly, as long as you have some knowledge and a passion for winemaking, we can train you with all the skills you need!§  § §  §In this fast-paced role, you’ll be working closely with our Winemakers, so you’ll get tons of one-on-one experience and on-the-job insight into what it’s really like. You’ll need excellent time management and communication skills, as well as the ability to work well in a team – we have A LOT of wine to process.§  § §  §Laboratory Technicians§  §We might be bragging, but our winery lab is industry-leading, with state-of-the-art technology and a proud team who boast proficiency scores in the top percentile in the country. Our lab has it all, and a dedicated, accurate team is at the core of it.§  § §  §Ideally you’ll have some lab experience, but whether that is in a previous work place, a university lab or a winery, is not a problem for us – all our supervisor is looking for is someone who is as committed and high-performing as the rest of the team. We work under high pressure and tight deadlines during vintage, so you’ll need to thrive in that environment, work well in a team and be physically fit.§  § §  §In this role you will be responsible for grape maturity analysis, sampling and testing ferments, among other analysis consistent with industry best practice. We’ll train you to be the best.§  § §  §The Benefits§  §Though we are looking for short-term staff, our standards are so high that there is some opportunity for high-achieving vintage crew to eventually join our permanent crew – we can’t let great staff go!§  § §  §In exchange for your hard work and dedication we are offering:§ § §competitive remuneration package; § §delicious food cooked daily during vintage by our on-site vintage chef;§ §initial training & on-the-job experience;§ §assistance with accommodation, including recommendations;§ §experience with award-winning wine;§ §opportunity to get experience that can take you any where in the wine industry (and beyond).§ § §  §All successful applicants will be required to undergo and pass a Pre-employment Drug and Alcohol test in accordance with the Indevin Drug and Alcohol Policy.§  § §  §To apply, please email your CV and indicate the position you are applying for, and location if you have a preference.  Applications can be sent to §work@indevin.com§ §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50592923.txt	§Breeding Program Manager - Spring Sheep §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Breeding Program Manager - Spring Sheep §§Advertiser: §Spring sheep§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§About the role§With exponential growth in the sheep dairy sector, Spring Sheep is looking to appoint a Program Manager to oversee the genetic development and rapid expansion of our elite dairy sheep flock. §In this role you will head up our Zealandia™  Breeding Program including oversight of the genetic nucleus flocks, facilitation and analysis of performance data, maintaining close contact and coordinating with breeding partners as well as building successful relationships with our growing team of supplier farmers.§The Zealandia™ program is leading the way in dairy sheep breeding. This includes the largest fully genotyped dairy flock in NZ, specialist breeding techniques and cutting-edge research. You will be an instrumental part of shaping and implementing the direction of the program as it scales to support the growing industry. §An appreciation for on farm practices and a passion for both data and animals are required. In this role you will regularly engage with industry experts, leading our Genetics Technical Group while also maintaining links across the business to see where milk goes beyond the farm gate. §The ideal candidate will have:§A strong background and track record in animal genetics§Previous experience in a commercial role§A passion for animal data management§Great inter-personal skills§Existing knowledge of and networks with NZ’s genetic industry players and key personal.§Previous breeding program management experience§ §The opportunity to lead our breeding program through a period of significant growth will provide both a rewarding and fast paced career as we work at building a leading sheep milk breed for New Zealand.§ §About the business§Spring Sheep Milk Co. is in the business of advanced nutrition; we produce a leading range of high value dairy products from our 100% NZ sourced sheep milk. §Our farmers are leading the way in this new industry with advanced farming systems and elite sheep breeding §Discover more at: www.springsheepmilkco.com§Applicants will require the legal right to work In NZ to be considered for this role.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50598691.txt	§Technical Services Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Services Associate§§Advertiser: §MSD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Technical Services Associate §    §    §      §        §THE OPPORTUNITY§        § §        §          §            §Opportunity to join our§ Companion Animal Health division§          §          §            §Exciting 18 Months Full-Time Contract, based anywhere in§ New Zealand§          §          §            §Join our global Animal Health biopharmaceutical company§ that has been in New Zealand for more than 70 years§          §        §        § §        § §        §Our Veterinary team use their scientific background to provide technical expertise and education to our customers, sales and marketing teams. With a deep knowledge of pharmacology and animal health we engage in scientific exchange with external experts and industry leaders ensuring the scientific value of our animal health portfolio is understood.§        § §        §Reporting to the Technical Services Lead for ANZ and sitting within the Companion Animals Business Unit, you will bring your technical knowledge & effective communication skills to provide first class technical support on our products to our external and internal customers through phone calls, visits and attendance at meetings/conferences/seminars. §        § §        § §        §WHAT YOU WILL DO§        §          §            §Provide technical advice to veterinarians, veterinary and pet store staff or consumers on company products.§          §          §            §Keep informed of technical developments in veterinary medicine and companion/equine animal products and of competitor products.§          §          §            §Provide sound technical and practical input to the development, implementation and support of marketing plans.§          §          §            §Accompany the sales team on visits to veterinary clinics, pet shops and wholesalers as needed.§          §          §            §Provide technical input to Research & Development.§          §          §            §Provide training to customers on company product, as well as formal training programs for the sales and customer service teams.§          §          §            §Develop and maintain relationship with key opinion leaders (KOL’s) and key influencers such as specialists, vet schools, key accounts etc. §          §          §            §Maintain all documentation in accordance with Company and relevant quality standards.§          §          §            §Ensure pharmacovigilance (PV) reporting process and timeline requirements are fulfilled. Keep updated on PV training to ensure familiarity with requirements.§          §        §        § §        § §        §WHAT YOU MUST HAVE§        § §        §You may be an experienced Veterinarian who is looking to step into industry and utilise your skills and experience in a different capacity. Alternatively, you may be working in a similar position and looking to align yourself with an innovative pharmaceutical company who has had recent product launches.§        § §        §To be successful in this role, you will have:§        § §        §          §            §A veterinary degree and registration in New Zealand.§          §          §            §Knowledge of companion animal medicine.§          §          §            §Well-developed skills in establishing, influencing and maintaining business relationships.§          §          §            §Excellent written and oral communication skills including confidence to deliver presentations and training.§          §          §            §Strong ability in numerical analysis, technical and verbal data, with a sound and logical approach to problem solving.§          §          §            §Self-starter with initiative who works well with minimal supervision.§          §          §            §Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and to make decisions on a day to day basis concerning routine activities.§          §          §            §Ability to work within a team environment.§          §        §        § §        § §        §WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT§        § §        §          §            §Contribute to the commercial success of the business through your technical support of the marketing and sales teams.§          §          §            §Develop relationships with key internal and external stakeholders across the business.§          §        §        § §        §Our Animal Health division is a trusted global leader in veterinary medicine, dedicated to the health and well-being of animals. We are a global team of professionals working together to make a positive difference in animal care and the world’s food supply and have a deep sense of responsibility towards our customers, consumers, animals, society and our planet. We offer one of our industry’s most innovative portfolio of products, services and technologies that serve to prevent, treat, and control diseases across all major farm and companion animal species.§        § §        §Who we are…§        §Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.§        §We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue §Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives §while§ Inspiring Your Career Growth.§        §INVENT.§        §IMPACT.§        §INSPIRE.§        § §        §We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. jobText: TXT/50605112.txt	§Companion Animal Veterinary Head Nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Companion Animal Veterinary Head Nurse§§Advertiser: §Hamilton Small Animal Veterinary Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Hamilton Small Animal Veterinary Centre (previously known as Hamilton Veterinary Services) is  Hamilton’s longest standing independently owned practice. For almost 70 years we have been providing high quality, compassionate care for our animals.§  §We are an exclusively Small Animal 1st opinion Practice with three full time Vets, two part time Vets, and a Referral Surgeon. We have a team of six Qualified Nurses.§  §We are based in the lively town of Hamilton in the heart of rural Waikato, North Island New Zealand.§  §We are currently on the lookout for a qualified, professional and experienced Head Veterinary nurse to join our team.§  §About the Role§  §Apart from the normal aspects of veterinary nursing (which includes surgical nursing, anaesthesia, managing hospitalised patients and client relations), the head nurse will also be responsible for the following: § § §Leading the nursing team.§ §Leading and ensuring a culture of honesty, integrity, personal responsibility and professionalism within the nursing team.§ §All aspects of nursing team management, including recruitment, selection, development, absence reporting and monitoring.§ §The role will be full time and does include working within a weekend roster.§  §Skills and experience§ § §Animal advocacy§ §Provide exceptional customer service to every client§ §Minimum of 3 years experience § §Work well both in a team and independently § §High level of integrity and are interested in continued development§ §Good communicator§ §Confident and highly motivated§ §Well presented and professional§ §Efficient and calm under pressure§ §Ability to take direction § §A solutions focused attitude and approach to problems§ §Leadership experience preferred§ §What's on Offer?§ § §We are offering a competitive package - commensurate with experience and role type.§ §Strong focus on personal development§ §Non-corporate workplace culture§ §Work-Life balance § §Dynamic & Supportive clinic team § §The  weather is fine and you will find yourself less than an hour from superb beaches; there are walking tracks, horse trekking areas and adventure  activities galore nearby. Skiing is popular in Winter and is a couple of hours drive away.§  §We are a 7 day a week practice, with rostered weekend work. You will be working with both the general practice and referral surgery, with most of the workload being General Practice work. §  §If you are looking for more of a challenge, and you think this could be what you are looking for, then don't hesitate to apply.§  §View our website at www.hamiltonvets.co.nz§  §Please feel free to contact us with any questions.§  §Please submit with your application your C.V, Covering Letter and referees.§  §You may apply via email, in writing, or by dropping off your application to the clinic.§  §This position will close upon successful recruitment of a Head Nurse.§  §Apply in confidence to: Michelle Goncalves§  §Email:  michelle@wevc.co.nz§  §Postal: Hamilton Small Animal Veterinary Centre (Previously known as Hamilton Veterinary Services) PO Box 10373 Te Rapa Hamilton§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50605814.txt	§Veterinary Nurse Taupo§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary Nurse Taupo§§Advertiser: §Vetora Bay of Plenty§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§We have a maternity-cover veterinary nurse position available in 2021 from February to December. You will be working with a supportive, positive, small team in Taupo in a small animal focused clinic. This position will involve working closely with veterinarians and other team members, and will have a reception and hospital nurse focus.§ § § §Ideally this position requires:§ § §Strong computer skills§ §Stock management experience§ §Knowledge of large and small animal veterinary products/drugs§ §Advanced interpersonal skills with a positive attitude and enthusiasm§ §A great sense of humour § §Proven practical nursing skills including: § §Taking blood samples, placing IV catheters, calculating drug doses and fluid therapy§ §Surgical/anaesthesia experience§ §Experience with difficult clients and cases§ §Experience caring for hospitalised patients including pain relief§ § § §You would be responsible for booking and coordinating the daily activities of our veterinary team, as well as background administration tasks. §On top of this you would be dealing with our clients and patients at the front of the clinic on a daily basis, being a friendly, familiar face, and giving information on products and services. We expect that you would be on call for a 1-4 after-hours weekend roster including 3 hours on a Saturday morning.§ § § §Ideally we would like a minimum of three years’ experience and a VN diploma. § §Our clinical standards and attention to patient care are very high, and we expect that yours would be too.§ § § §The daily working hours are negotiable, the current staff member works a 9am-3pm day to work in with child care which we are open to. We also are open to a job-sharing position for this role, if you wanted to work 2-3 days a week in partnership with another suitable applicant. § § § §If this position sounds like you, please send you CV and cover letter to §careers@vetora.nz§ §Closing date for submissions will be the 30th of December.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Part-time Technician Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50606191.txt	§Part-time Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Part-time Technician§§Advertiser: §Enza Zaden (Australia) Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Enza Zaden is a global leader in vegetable seed production and plant breeding. We produce and sell seed of our varieties all over the world, both for conventional and organic growers. Our New Zealand research and development branch is based in Pukekohe, South Auckland, and specializes in onion and pumpkin breeding. We are currently seeking a part-time technician to strengthen our pumpkin breeding team in Pukekohe.§  §Enza Zaden has more than 2300 colleagues worldwide working together on the vegetables of tomorrow. We aim to achieve strong healthy, tasty, and climate-proof vegetable varieties with higher yield, and less need of crop pesticides. §  §About the role:§  §The part-time technician will support the pumpkin breeder in developing new varieties with improved fruit quality and storage. The position requires the candidate to have flexible working hours throughout the year, as this position entails full time work from November until May (20-40 hours a week, depending on the week) combined with less working hours outside the season (0-20 hours a week from June until October).§  §Responsibilities include:§ § §Design and establish breeding trials§ §Supervise all aspects of field research, including planting, pollination, harvesting, seed cleaning, post-harvest measurements and preparing seed shipments.§ §Manage data entry in the breeding software§ §Required skills:§  §To be successful you must have the following skills:§ § §A degree in agriculture or horticulture science, or equivalent experience§ §Attention to detail, record keeping, and organizational skills§ §Ability to undertake outdoor physical field work§ §Good administrative and computer skills§ §Good written and verbal communication skills, thrives in a multi-cultural team.§ §Self-motivation, proactivity and ability to direct others.§ §Works well under pressure§ §Recent graduates are encouraged to apply.§  §Please address any queries or applications to:-  §resumenz@enzazaden.co.nz§  §Applications close 20th October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Seasonal Crop Team Member - GER - Tuakau Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50606573.txt	§Seasonal Crop Team Member - GER - Tuakau§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Seasonal Crop Team Member - GER - Tuakau§§Advertiser: §T&G Global§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Seasonal Glasshouse Crop Team Member - Tuakau§Glasshouse Crop Team member§This is a seasonal position however we often have permanent vacancies arise which our seasonal staff are welcome to apply for.§Opportunities to gain qualifications in the horticulture industry§Opportunities to upskill with certificates that transcend multiple industries. E.g. forklift training, first aid, etc.§About the position:§We are looking for entry-level horticultural team members, with the positive attitude required to learn new skills, and advance your career. You do not need any previous experience or skills in horticulture, as onsite training is provided.§We want to upskill you, to enable you to progress your career in horticulture. We want you to join our team in Tuakau and help us continue building a better horticulture industry.§You will be required to learn new skills and follow reasonable instructions to achieve a high-quality product for our customers.§This is a full-time seasonal position, a minimum of 40 hours a week, Monday to Friday, 7:30am to 4:00pm. Additionally you need to be willing and available to work extra hours and weekends as requested.§What are we looking for?§The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the following skills and attributes:§Able to work in warm to hot temperatures§Able to do moderate, physical work (lifting a maximum of 25kgs)§Onsite parking available§Monday to Friday 07:30 am - 4:00 pm, and any extra hours as requested§Willingness to improve your use of the English language.§Able to work up to 3 metres if requested§Reliable transport is a must§A bit about us:§T&G is New Zealand's largest producer and packer of hothouse tomatoes. These crops are grown in state-of-the-art environmentally controlled glasshouses, across our 5 North Island sites, and are packaged for both local and export markets 52 weeks of the year.§And like you, we're fresh food lovers. We're passionate about our purpose of growing healthier futures through fresh fruit and vegetables.§If this position sounds like you and you are looking to grow your career within the horticultural industry, we want to hear from you. §Apply now!§§§§

jobTitle: National Programme Co-ordinator Arable Extension (part-time) Job in Canterbury - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50608266.txt	§National Programme Co-ordinator Arable Extension (part-time)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Programme Co-ordinator Arable Extension (part-time)§§Advertiser: §Foundation for Arable Research§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§FAR is looking for an experienced and enthusiastic extension specialist to oversee the development of a new arable industry extension framework, Growers Leading Change (GLC).§ §Working with the Communications Manager, the National Programme Co-ordinator will play a key role in developing GLC into an extension framework able to successfully package and deliver environmental, agronomic and farm business resources to meet the wide-ranging needs of New Zealand’s arable farmers. They will also manage a small group of facilitators and be responsible for monitoring and reporting on all GLC activities and outcomes.§ §This 0.5 FTE position will be based at FAR’s offices, at Templeton, Christchurch. Fixed term until September 2023.§ §Relevant skills and experience:§ §A relevant tertiary qualification and practical experience in farmer group extension and facilitation.§ § §Knowledge of, and empathy with, New Zealand arable farmers.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §Experience in managing projects, budgets and teams.§ §Confident to work with and lead industry partners from across the sector.§ §A team player with the ability to respond to the needs of colleagues.§ § § §The Foundation for Arable Research (FAR) is an applied research organisation that manages and conducts high-quality, relevant research to benefit the arable sector.§ §For further information and a full position description visit  www.far.org.nz  § §To apply, please send a CV with a cover letter detailing how your skills will benefit our business to §far@far.org.nz§.  Applications close at 11.00 pm on Sunday 11 October 2020.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50608839.txt	§Regional Facilitator Arable Extension part-time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Facilitator Arable Extension part-time§§Advertiser: §Foundation for Arable Research§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§ § §FAR is bringing together a small team of extension group facilitators as part of new arable industry extension framework, Growers Leading Change (GLC).§ §Within the GLC framework, growers will be invited to form local and national discussion groups focusing on environmental, agronomic or farm business issues and opportunities. These groups will be led by facilitators who will help them to develop extension plans and assist with the identification, development and delivery of a range of resources and activities to meet their learning needs and encourage on-farm change.§ §Four regionally based 0.5 FTE positions are available, one each to service Otago/Southland, South/Mid Canterbury, the Southern North Island and Northern North Island. Facilitators will work from home and will be reimbursed for the use of their own vehicle. Fixed term until September 2023.§ §Successful candidates will have a relevant tertiary qualification, or equivalent experience, and a sound knowledge of arable farming systems. They should have proven skills in:§ § §Organising and facilitating focused events and activities.§ §Speaking with authority and writing clearly and effectively for a farmer audience.§ §Meeting operational targets on time and within budget.§ §Working with a range of stakeholders and pan-sector / industry partners.§ §The Foundation for Arable Research (FAR) is an applied research organisation that manages and conducts high-quality, relevant research to benefit the arable sector.§ §For further information and a full position description visit  www.far.org.nz  § §To apply, please send a CV with a cover letter detailing how your skills will benefit our business to §far@far.org.nz§.  Applications close at 11.00 pm on Sunday 11 October 2020.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a facilitator?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50609979.txt	§Groomer - Kaiwharawhara§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Groomer - Kaiwharawhara§§Advertiser: §Animates NZ Holdings§§More jobs from this Animal Welfare§§§§§§Animates is New Zealand’s leading pet care company with 44 pet specialty retail stores, 29 grooming salons and 17 vet clinics and growing. §  §About the Role:§  §As an experienced Groomer you will be crucial to the success of our Kaiwharawhara grooming salon.§  §You’ll provide an ‘Awesome Experience’ to our customers and their furry friends by ensuring grooms are completed to the highest standard all whilst keeping the salon clean and hygienic.§  §With a large variety of grooming services available, it’s important you are confident with correct bathing, brushing and cutting techniques for all coat types.§  §This position is full-time (30 hours per week) applicants must be available to work weekdays, weekends, late nights and public holidays as required.§  §To be successful you'll need:§ § §Enthusiasm and passion for the care and wellbeing of pets§ §Previous dog grooming experience (2+ years in a high-volume salon preferred)§ §An exceptionally friendly manner to engage customers, build a regular client base and grow sales§ §Excellent time management and communication skills§ §High work standards and ethics§ §What’s in it for you?§  §Our salons are fast paced, but the thrill of satisfying our customers and their furry friends is huge!§  §You’ll work as part of a passionate and knowledgeable team where no two days are the same and receive on-going training developed by our in-house experts.§  §At Animates diversity & inclusion are the norm and we’re proudly a Rainbow Tick Certified Employer.§  §If you want to join NZ’s leading pet specialist, then don’t miss out and apply today!§§§§

jobTitle: Technical Services Associate Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50610308.txt	§Technical Services Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Services Associate§§Advertiser: §MSD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Technical Services Associate §    §    §      §        §THE OPPORTUNITY§        § §        §          §            §Opportunity to join our§ Companion Animal Health division§          §          §            §Exciting 18 Months Full-Time Contract, based in§ New Zealand§          §          §            §Join our global Animal Health biopharmaceutical company§ that has been in New Zealand for more than 70 years§          §        §        § §        § §        §Our Veterinary team use their scientific background to provide technical expertise and education to our customers, sales and marketing teams. With a deep knowledge of pharmacology and animal health we engage in scientific exchange with external experts and industry leaders ensuring the scientific value of our animal health portfolio is understood.§        § §        §Reporting to the Technical Services Lead for ANZ and sitting within the Companion Animals Business Unit, you will bring your technical knowledge & effective communication skills to provide first class technical support on our products to our external and internal customers through phone calls, visits and attendance at meetings/conferences/seminars. §        § §        § §        §WHAT YOU WILL DO§        §          §            §Provide technical advice to veterinarians, veterinary and pet store staff or consumers on company products.§          §          §            §Keep informed of technical developments in veterinary medicine and companion/equine animal products and of competitor products.§          §          §            §Provide sound technical and practical input to the development, implementation and support of marketing plans.§          §          §            §Accompany the sales team on visits to veterinary clinics, pet shops and wholesalers as needed.§          §          §            §Provide technical input to Research & Development.§          §          §            §Provide training to customers on company product, as well as formal training programs for the sales and customer service teams.§          §          §            §Develop and maintain relationship with key opinion leaders (KOL’s) and key influencers such as specialists, vet schools, key accounts etc. §          §          §            §Maintain all documentation in accordance with Company and relevant quality standards.§          §          §            §Ensure pharmacovigilance (PV) reporting process and timeline requirements are fulfilled. Keep updated on PV training to ensure familiarity with requirements.§          §        §        § §        § §        §WHAT YOU MUST HAVE§        § §        §You may be an experienced Veterinarian who is looking to step into industry and utilise your skills and experience in a different capacity. Alternatively, you may be working in a similar position and looking to align yourself with an innovative pharmaceutical company who has had recent product launches.§        § §        §To be successful in this role, you will have:§        § §        §          §            §A veterinary degree and registration in New Zealand.§          §          §            §Knowledge of companion animal medicine.§          §          §            §Well-developed skills in establishing, influencing and maintaining business relationships.§          §          §            §Excellent written and oral communication skills including confidence to deliver presentations and training.§          §          §            §Strong ability in numerical analysis, technical and verbal data, with a sound and logical approach to problem solving.§          §          §            §Self-starter with initiative who works well with minimal supervision.§          §          §            §Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and to make decisions on a day to day basis concerning routine activities.§          §          §            §Ability to work within a team environment.§          §        §        § §        § §        §WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT§        § §        §          §            §Contribute to the commercial success of the business through your technical support of the marketing and sales teams.§          §          §            §Develop relationships with key internal and external stakeholders across the business.§          §        §        § §        §Our Animal Health division is a trusted global leader in veterinary medicine, dedicated to the health and well-being of animals. We are a global team of professionals working together to make a positive difference in animal care and the world’s food supply and have a deep sense of responsibility towards our customers, consumers, animals, society and our planet. We offer one of our industry’s most innovative portfolio of products, services and technologies that serve to prevent, treat, and control diseases across all major farm and companion animal species.§        § §        §Who we are…§        §Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.§        §We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.§        § §        §What we look for…§        §In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue §Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives §while§ Inspiring Your Career Growth.§        §INVENT.§        §IMPACT.§        §INSPIRE.§        § §        §We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.§        § §        §Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully §Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company.  No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails. §        § §        §To be considered for this position, please visit our careers site at www.msd.com/careers and search for R73249.§        § §        § §      §    §    §    §    §  §§§THE OPPORTUNITY§  § § § § §Opportunity to join our§ Companion Animal Health division§  § § §Exciting 18 Months Full-Time Contract, based in§ New Zealand§  § § §Join our global Animal Health biopharmaceutical company§ that has been in New Zealand for more than 70 years§  § § §  § §  §Our Veterinary team use their scientific background to provide technical expertise and education to our customers, sales and marketing teams. With a deep knowledge of pharmacology and animal health we engage in scientific exchange with external experts and industry leaders ensuring the scientific value of our animal health portfolio is understood.§  § §  §Reporting to the Technical Services Lead for ANZ and sitting within the Companion Animals Business Unit, you will bring your technical knowledge & effective communication skills to provide first class technical support on our products to our external and internal customers through phone calls, visits and attendance at meetings/conferences/seminars. §  § §  § §  §WHAT YOU WILL DO§ § § §Provide technical advice to veterinarians, veterinary and pet store staff or consumers on company products.§  § § §Keep informed of technical developments in veterinary medicine and companion/equine animal products and of competitor products.§  § § §Provide sound technical and practical input to the development, implementation and support of marketing plans.§  § § §Accompany the sales team on visits to veterinary clinics, pet shops and wholesalers as needed.§  § § §Provide technical input to Research & Development.§  § § §Provide training to customers on company product, as well as formal training programs for the sales and customer service teams.§  § § §Develop and maintain relationship with key opinion leaders (KOL’s) and key influencers such as specialists, vet schools, key accounts etc. §  § § §Maintain all documentation in accordance with Company and relevant quality standards.§  § § §Ensure pharmacovigilance (PV) reporting process and timeline requirements are fulfilled. Keep updated on PV training to ensure familiarity with requirements.§  § § §  § §  §WHAT YOU MUST HAVE§  § §  §You may be an experienced Veterinarian who is looking to step into industry and utilise your skills and experience in a different capacity. Alternatively, you may be working in a similar position and looking to align yourself with an innovative pharmaceutical company who has had recent product launches.§  § §  §To be successful in this role, you will have:§  § § § § §A veterinary degree and registration in New Zealand.§  § § §Knowledge of companion animal medicine.§  § § §Well-developed skills in establishing, influencing and maintaining business relationships.§  § § §Excellent written and oral communication skills including confidence to deliver presentations and training.§  § § §Strong ability in numerical analysis, technical and verbal data, with a sound and logical approach to problem solving.§  § § §Self-starter with initiative who works well with minimal supervision.§  § § §Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and to make decisions on a day to day basis concerning routine activities.§  § § §Ability to work within a team environment.§  § § §  § §  §WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT§  § § § § §Contribute to the commercial success of the business through your technical support of the marketing and sales teams.§  § § §Develop relationships with key internal and external stakeholders across the business.§  § § §  §Our Animal Health division is a trusted global leader in veterinary medicine, dedicated to the health and well-being of animals. We are a global team of professionals working together to make a positive difference in animal care and the world’s food supply and have a deep sense of responsibility towards our customers, consumers, animals, society and our planet. We offer one of our industry’s most innovative portfolio of products, services and technologies that serve to prevent, treat, and control diseases across all major farm and companion animal species.§  § §  §Who we are…§  §Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.§  §We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.§  § §  §What we look for…§  §In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue §Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives §while§ Inspiring Your Career Growth.§  §INVENT.§  §IMPACT.§  §INSPIRE.§  § §  §We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.§  § §  §Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully §Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company.  No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails. §  § §  §To be considered for this position, please visit our careers site at www.msd.com/careers and search for R73249.§  § §  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50613393.txt	§Programme Manager: Water§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Manager: Water§§Advertiser: §Sustainable Business Network§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$85,000 - $94,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§BACKGROUND §  § The Sustainable Business Network (SBN) is a social enterprise made up of businesses, governmental agencies and organisations located across the country.  Established in October 2002, SBN is the largest and longest-standing organisation dedicated to sustainable business in New Zealand. §  §Our purpose is ‘Empowering business so people and nature prosper’. §  §Our network consists of hundreds of progressive organisations and people that collectively invest in and act on system change. §  §Our office is based in central Auckland and we embrace flexible working.  We care passionately and work collaboratively.§  §PURPOSE OF POSITION §  §Programme Managers undertake a number of significant functions to develop and lead SBN’s transformational projects and advisory work. Our projects aim to drive systems change and our advisory work moves individual organisations along a sustainability maturity curve.  The Programme Lead is someone passionate about the health of Aotearoa waterways and systems. You understand the role and opportunity for business (large and small) and key stakeholders in improving our waterway systems. You are a great communicator who proactively looks for ways to increase impact.   This is a varied role with a mixture of team management, high level strategy and leading and developing Projects and Advisory work, primarily focused on water. You will provide strategic guidance to teams and project managers in ways that promote SBN’s  culture. You will also oversee the progress of operations.  The environment is dynamic so a high degree of a flexibility is required. §  § §  §TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES § § §Develop, establish support (including financial), lead and manage strategically relevant transformational projects§ §Coordinate and oversee direction of SBN's water strategy§ §Decide on suitable strategies and objectives on an ongoing basis and best use of team resource§ §Work in an agile way across the organisation§ §Coordinate cross-project activities§ §Assess and report on programme performance and aim to maximise return on investment and impact for SBN§ §Create, monitor and report on impact measures on a monthly basis§ §Ensure annual budget allocation and deadlines for Projects and Advisory are met§ §Generate and deliver Advisory work that helps move organisations along the sustainability maturity curve and meets annual budgets§ §Support the development, maintenance, enhancement of systems, process, tools and resources to support the delivery of the Project and Advisory Services work and the interaction between the Projects and Advisory work and our investor offering § §Planning, tracking & reporting of relevant Projects and Advisory work – prepare monthly reports for CEO and board§ §General administration duties (organising & reporting on meetings etc) § §Support relevant projects and coalitions as a member of the Projects and Advisory Team where applicable§ § §  §KEY COMPETENCIES § § §Leadership §– proven manager experience, confidence with managing a growing and diverse team§ §Systems thinking§ – ability to understand the ‘big picture’, observe changes within systems, identify patterns and trends, change perspectives, and identify connections and influences within and between systems § §Strong knowledge of sustainability§ – in particular, understanding of and commitment to the health of New Zealand’s freshwater and terrestrial ecosystems § §Project Management§ – 5 years + project management experience; high proficiency in leading projects and experience managing multiple complex tasks in parallel, meeting deadlines, with successful outcomes realised and reported § §Solution mindset§ - advanced analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills§ §Strong sense of accountability and ownership§ - accept individual responsibility for seeing a task through to its completion, understand when and how to escalate, take appropriate risk (avoid unnecessary risk) and understand impact of decisions§ §Agile §– able and willing to adapt to change and work in a fast-paced environment. Demonstrate initiative and ability to advance projects while managing multiple initiatives.§ §Relationship management§ – ability to build partnerships with multiple and diverse stakeholders, including project partners, government agencies, community groups and landowners, and communicate clearly with SBN members and team§ §Sales and negotiation§ – able to bring onboard significant funding for projects§ §Entrepreneurial spirit§ - passionate, creative, positive, resilient and highly driven to achieve outcomes § §Strategic and commercial acumen§ – ability to think and operate within a strategic context and deliver financial targets § §Communication skills§ – excellent ability and confidence in all levels of verbal and written communication, including giving presentations.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a programme manager?§Do you have experience working in the not-for-profit sector?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§
