jobTitle: Orchard Foreman - Hortinvest Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50645300.txt	§Orchard Foreman - Hortinvest§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchard Foreman - Hortinvest§§Advertiser: §AgRecruit Human Resources§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Salary§§Salary based on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§At Hortinvest, we specialize in cherry and apricot production in the Central Otago region of the South Island.  Visit www.hortinvest.nz§ §We are expanding rapidly, currently having 177 hectares of cherries planted in the region. Our plan to develop out to 245 hectares will be shared with you when we meet.§ §We are now looking to appoint an experienced horticulturalist to the position of Orchard Foreman who will initially be  based at Tarras Cherry Corp. This is an established 40-hectare block near Cromwell which begins production this season.§ Feel free to take a virtual tour through the Tarras Cherry Corp Development via https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QLaN0du9SOA&t=1s§ §As Orchard Foreman, you will report to the Orchard Development Manager and work alongside our team of permanent and casual staff members.§ §You will live in the Cromwell Basin, one of the most beautiful places in New Zealand. Several lakes, walking tracks and ski-fields are right on our doorstep, the location suiting someone who prefers an outdoor, sporty lifestyle.§ §Accommodation here is plentiful and affordable.§ §As Orchard Foreman, you will have the opportunity to grow with us, helping develop our business through best practice crop husbandry techniques – embracing new technology and leading our people through evolving work practices.§ § §Experience working with cherries is not necessary, as we have the expertise to coach you and develop your skills.§ Competencies required to be successful include:§ § §Minimum three years’ in-field crop husbandry or horticultural experience§ §Experience with machinery operation – tractors, sprayers, mowers§ §In-field team leadership experience§ §A high level of computer literacy plus the ability to work with budgets§ § §This is a full time permanent role, attracting a salary which is based on your experience. A work vehicle will also be provided for your use.§ §To discuss this role in strict confidence and to request a PD, please phone Deb Francis from AgRecruit on 021 2245000. Otherwise, forward your expression of interest – covering letter and CV, by Thursday 8 October via this portal.§§§§

jobTitle: Experienced Vintage Cellar Hand Job in Marlborough - SEEK
email: All applications, complete with CV and covering letter, should be sent to recruitment@babichwines.co.nz [link removed]. Due to the border closure, we will only be accepting applications from people already in New Zealand.
jobText: TXT/50645725.txt	§Experienced Vintage Cellar Hand§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Vintage Cellar Hand§§Advertiser: §Babich Wines§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§Babich Wines is an internationally-renowned, family-owned wine company.  We have been making wine for over 100 years, producing wines from our vineyards in Auckland, Hawkes Bay and Marlborough.§We are currently looking for people to work as part of our Marlborough team as Experienced vintage cellar hands. These positions will involve work in both our Marlborough winery and vineyards.  These will be fixed term positions starting from early January until the end of Harvest 2021.  These positions may go on beyond the end of harvest for the right candidates. Applicants will have a minimum of 1 - 2 vintages experience.  The ideal candidates will have experience working in medium-sized or large-sized wineries.  Vineyard and machinery experience is also preferred.  Training will be provided in our cellar operations and our Health and Safety procedures. §All applicants for the will demonstrate strong organisational skills, be hard-working and have good communication skills.  The positions will all be hands-on, so a good level of physical fitness is required.§You will gain experience with modern Winemaking techniques in our state-of-the-art 7,500T capacity winery. This seven year old winery boasts some of the most current technologies in wine production. We produce award-winning wines including; Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Noir, Riesling, Pinot Gris, Chardonnay, Rosé, Grüner Veltliner and Albariño.    §We utilise various winemaking styles to create a wide range of wines from single vineyard and reserve wines, to larger commercial blends and 100% organic certified wines from our own organic vineyard.§We provide a fun, friendly and safe team environment for you to work in. We can arrange accommodation, transport to and from the winery, and help with Visa applications, if required. During 12-hour shifts a hot meal and fresh fruit is provided to keep you energised.§Please include in your application the cellar or lab operations you have previous experience in. §All applications, complete with CV and covering letter, should be sent to recruitment@babichwines.co.nz [link removed]. Due to the border closure, we will only be accepting applications from people already in New Zealand.§We look forward to hearing from you. §§§§

Our people and brands are what set us apart from the competition, to carry out our vision of creating brands worth reaching for.§        §About the Role§Reporting to a Vineyard Manager, this role is in the vineyards where the journey of our award-winning wine begins.  You would be responsible for daily duties that bring us quality year after year: machine operation, supervising seasonal workers, and caring for our vineyards.§        §Key Responsibilities§        §          §Following all safety procedures, ensuring proper PPE, incident reporting, etc§          §Supervision of seasonal workers§          §Mulching, spraying, trimming, plucking, and general maintenance of the vines§          §Trellis and irrigation maintenance§          §Harvest operations§        §        §About You§        §          §A team player with a can-do attitude§          §Experience in vineyards or in a similar industry is preferred; Growsafe, first aid and onsite training is provided§          §Seasonal work (harvest, spraying, frost fighting, etc) may require flexibility of hours or shift work§          §A current driver’s license§        §        §Benefits and Culture§Our benefits include a bonus scheme, overtime rates, travel allowance, Safe Ride Home Programme, eligibility for Family Member Scholarships, Wellness Programme, annual bonus incentive, eligibility for Southern Cross insurance subsidy, and more. This is your opportunity to work for a company that put its people first.§        §Constellation Brands is a member of Diversity Works New Zealand. We are committed to diversity and inclusion. We value and encourage participation of all applicants regardless of their background.§        §If you’re interested, apply now via the relevant link before the close date on 12 October 2020. Here at home and in Australia, our innovation continues to hit store shelves with Crafters Union, Selaks Taste Collection and more. Our people and brands are what set us apart from the competition, to carry out our vision of creating brands worth reaching for.§ §About the Role§Reporting to a Vineyard Manager, this role is in the vineyards where the journey of our award-winning wine begins.  You would be responsible for daily duties that bring us quality year after year: machine operation, supervising seasonal workers, and caring for our vineyards.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Following all safety procedures, ensuring proper PPE, incident reporting, etc§ §Supervision of seasonal workers§ §Mulching, spraying, trimming, plucking, and general maintenance of the vines§ §Trellis and irrigation maintenance§ §Harvest operations§ §About You§ § §A team player with a can-do attitude§ §Experience in vineyards or in a similar industry is preferred; Growsafe, first aid and onsite training is provided§ §Seasonal work (harvest, spraying, frost fighting, etc) may require flexibility of hours or shift work§ §A current driver’s license§ §Benefits and Culture§Our benefits include a bonus scheme, overtime rates, travel allowance, Safe Ride Home Programme, eligibility for Family Member Scholarships, Wellness Programme, annual bonus incentive, eligibility for Southern Cross insurance subsidy, and more. We are committed to growing our employees and we develop leadership and technical expertise at all levels of our company. Whilst you will receive great support from the team, the nature of this role is very autonomous, so time management/ planning, organisational skills and administrative experience will set the foundation for success.§Duties and responsibilities:§Marketing and sales of livestock services to existing and potential clients.§Maintain and grow the client base in your area through strong business relationships.§Planning and self-management of work.§Regular travel within region.§Skills and experience:§Knowledge and experience in the Dairy industry is essential; broader Livestock industry experience is an advantage.§Ability to build lasting professional relationships; sales experience is an advantage.§Excellent oral and written communication skills.§Computer/tablet literacy and administration skills.§A full, current and clean New Zealand driver licence is essential.§PGG Wrightson is one of New Zealand's leading nationwide providers of products and services to the rural sector. jobText: TXT/50648345.txt	§Contract Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contract Manager§§Advertiser: §Pivot Horticulture Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Kiwifruit Opportunity – §Contract Manager§ §Pivot Horticulture is a trusted and independent orchard management company providing personal individual service to our wide range of clients.  We deliver a proficient and tailored orchard management service to valued clients and pride ourselves on pioneering new ideas while providing maximum returns to our Growers.§ §We are looking to employ a full time Contract Manager to join our close-knit team and provide management of contracts between our valued clients and labour contractors as well as administration support.  This is a key role to our business and the successful applicant will need to have at least one year’s experience in the Kiwifruit industry, management related qualifications and an understanding of the on-orchard process required during the four unique seasons.§ §The successful candidates will need to have the key levels of expertise:§ § §Business or management related qualifications§ §Strong relationship building skills§ §Proven leadership skills of teams and clients§ §Excellent negotiation and communication skills§ §Knowledge of relevant NZ legislation§ §High proficiency of Microsoft office products§ §Ability to fit and contribute to our team focused environment§ §If you feel you have the above skills and expertise, we would love to hear from you, please forward your CV and a covering letter to §admin@pivothort.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50648661.txt	§Vineyard Operator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vineyard Operator§§Advertiser: §Booster Wine Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§Booster, through its Booster Tahi investment arm, is making significant investments in New Zealand’s agricultural business including avocados, kiwi fruit, and through investments in Awatere River Wine Company, Waimea Estates, Bannock Brae and Sileni Estates, the wine industry.  It is here where a dynamic, reliable team player is required to join our Awatere River Vineyards as a machinery operator.§ §You will be part of our viticultural operations team that will be responsible for ensuring the effective implementation of our operations across all vineyards in Marlborough. With over 200 hectares in production, this is a hands-on role that involves operations over multiple vineyard sites. § §Our ideal candidate will possess:§Understanding and ability to work flexible hours from time to time throughout the viticulture year§Ability to work well in a small team and lead casual staff when required§Day-to-day machine operations skills§Ability to perform duties as directed, safely, effectively, and efficiently, using viticulture best practice§Practical knowledge of machinery and implement use including ATVs, tractors, and vineyard equipment§The ability to undertake basic vineyard machinery and equipment maintenance§Ideally be familiar with harvest activities including, but not limited to, gondola and harvester operation§A GrowSafe Certificate & Approved Handler Certificate is preferable but, training can be provided for the right person§Previous experience operating and working with machinery, irrigation, young vines, trellis, and property maintenance would be a definite advantage§An enthusiastic attitude, open mind, self- motivation, organised, detail focus, and strong communicator with great time management skills will get far in this role.§General vineyard duties relating to this job will include:§Seasonal work – harvest, spraying, trellis repairs§Assisting with the Grape spray programme§Use of vineyard machinery, including tractors, ATV’s, mowers, sprayers, trimmers and other vineyard equipment§Irrigating, young vine training, trellis, and property maintenance§ §A driver’s license is essential for this role. All onsite training will be given. Competitive pay rates and other benefits will be discussed at the interview stage and will depend on the experience of the successful candidate. Only people eligible to work in New Zealand should apply for this position. Please provide evidence of your work visa or citizenship.§ §To find out more about the role or to apply please contact Annabella Challis or simply click “Apply Now”.§annabella.challis@boosterwinegroup.nz§ [link removed]§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50649847.txt	§Technical Adviser (Fisheries)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Adviser (Fisheries)§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Fishing & Aquaculture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Technical Adviser (Fisheries) §      §The Western and Central Pacific Fisheries Commission (WCPFC) is a treaty-based organisation established to conserve and manage highly migratory fish stocks across the Pacific Ocean.  Samoa is a member country and, as such, is expected to integrate all decisions and regulations made by WCPFC.  The Fisheries Division Team within the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF) is responsible for the integration.§  § A volunteer is needed to strengthen the knowledge and expertise of the Fisheries Division as they aim to successfully integrate these decisions and regulations.  Key to the role will be supporting the team to understand their obligations and how they integrate with current operations.§ Day to day you will work alongside staff to map their obligations against existing operations, as well as provide support to plan for implementation of future conventions, decisions and regulations.§  § This is a 1-year opportunity to support the Fisheries Division of MAF and ultimately Samoa, to fulfil its national, regional and international obligations in relation to fisheries development, research, management, and monitoring, control and surveillance.§ §We are looking for a volunteer with:§        §          §Technical expertise and policy knowledge around multilateral organisations§          §Experience implementing policies within large organisations§          §Experience in representation and negotiation to protect and promote national interests in national, regional or multilateral meetings§          §Experience in aligning multiple strategic directions into a cohesive organisational plan§          §Experience leading a team§        § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/SAM-41299-Technical-Adviser-Fisheries-FINAL-AD.pdf §  § §VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§   § Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   § Meanwhile, Programme Managers are working with partner organisations and on updating assignment descriptions. This work will help us determine which skills and experience our volunteers will need once we begin to redeploy people in the Pacific.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Western and Central Pacific Fisheries Commission (WCPFC) is a treaty-based organisation established to conserve and manage highly migratory fish stocks across the Pacific Ocean.  Samoa is a member country and, as such, is expected to integrate all decisions and regulations made by WCPFC.  The Fisheries Division Team within the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF) is responsible for the integration.§  § A volunteer is needed to strengthen the knowledge and expertise of the Fisheries Division as they aim to successfully integrate these decisions and regulations.  Key to the role will be supporting the team to understand their obligations and how they integrate with current operations.§ Day to day you will work alongside staff to map their obligations against existing operations, as well as provide support to plan for implementation of future conventions, decisions and regulations.§  § This is a 1-year opportunity to support the Fisheries Division of MAF and ultimately Samoa, to fulfil its national, regional and international obligations in relation to fisheries development, research, management, and monitoring, control and surveillance.§ §We are looking for a volunteer with:§ § §Technical expertise and policy knowledge around multilateral organisations§ §Experience implementing policies within large organisations§ §Experience in representation and negotiation to protect and promote national interests in national, regional or multilateral meetings§ §Experience in aligning multiple strategic directions into a cohesive organisational plan§ §Experience leading a team§ § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/SAM-41299-Technical-Adviser-Fisheries-FINAL-AD.pdf §  § §VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§   § Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   § Meanwhile, Programme Managers are working with partner organisations and on updating assignment descriptions. jobText: TXT/50650025.txt	§Agribusiness Development Mentor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Agribusiness Development Mentor§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Agribusiness Development Mentor §      §Bougainville consists of two large islands and is home to a population of approximately 200,000 people. There are twenty one distinct languages, eight sub-languages, and 39 dialects. There is also considerable cultural diversity between locations making it a rich and interesting place to discover. The people of Bougainville are extremely resilient. Having emerged from a decade of conflict they are now focused on becoming a peaceful, strong, independent nation.§   § Part of this positive future is delivering a ‘just, safe, secure and free Bougainville’ and this responsibility lies with the department of Police and the correctional and justice services.§   § Mabri Juvenile Rehabilitation Centre (MJRC) focuses on practice such as restorative justice that involves both the family and the community in a young person’s rehabilitation journey. They target the core issues contributing to individual’s behaviour, with the aim of working towards sustainable positive change in the juvenile’s behaviours and attitude.§   § The farming of pigs, chickens and vegetables is currently underway on the land. This simultaneously feed the juveniles as well as generating income to cover operational costs. In this assignment you will work with the current staff to review current farming practices. You will advise ways to increase both the standard of animal husbandry and production, capacity building with the staff and expanding their knowledge in these areas. You will also seek new revenue streams by analysing the current market, economic environment and buying patterns.§   § This is a chance for an adventurous person with basic Agricultural and animal husbandry knowledge, to put their experience into a much needed area of development.§We are looking for a volunteer with:§        §          §Wide ranging practical experience in agribusiness (including: breeding, production, contracts, distribution, marketing and sales)§          §Experience providing on the job training and mentoring in the agricultural sector §          §Experience and knowledge of poultry or pigs, or other livestock production§          §Training/qualification in a relevant discipline e.g. agriculture, agribusiness, business administration or related field§        § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/41074-BOU-ArgBusMentor.pdf §   § §VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§   § Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   § Meanwhile, Programme Managers are working with partner organisations and on updating assignment descriptions. This work will help us determine which skills and experience our volunteers will need once we begin to redeploy people in the Pacific.§§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Bougainville consists of two large islands and is home to a population of approximately 200,000 people. There are twenty one distinct languages, eight sub-languages, and 39 dialects. There is also considerable cultural diversity between locations making it a rich and interesting place to discover. The people of Bougainville are extremely resilient. Having emerged from a decade of conflict they are now focused on becoming a peaceful, strong, independent nation.§   § Part of this positive future is delivering a ‘just, safe, secure and free Bougainville’ and this responsibility lies with the department of Police and the correctional and justice services.§   § Mabri Juvenile Rehabilitation Centre (MJRC) focuses on practice such as restorative justice that involves both the family and the community in a young person’s rehabilitation journey. They target the core issues contributing to individual’s behaviour, with the aim of working towards sustainable positive change in the juvenile’s behaviours and attitude.§   § The farming of pigs, chickens and vegetables is currently underway on the land. This simultaneously feed the juveniles as well as generating income to cover operational costs. In this assignment you will work with the current staff to review current farming practices. You will advise ways to increase both the standard of animal husbandry and production, capacity building with the staff and expanding their knowledge in these areas. You will also seek new revenue streams by analysing the current market, economic environment and buying patterns.§   § This is a chance for an adventurous person with basic Agricultural and animal husbandry knowledge, to put their experience into a much needed area of development.§We are looking for a volunteer with:§ § §Wide ranging practical experience in agribusiness (including: breeding, production, contracts, distribution, marketing and sales)§ §Experience providing on the job training and mentoring in the agricultural sector § §Experience and knowledge of poultry or pigs, or other livestock production§ §Training/qualification in a relevant discipline e.g. agriculture, agribusiness, business administration or related field§ § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/41074-BOU-ArgBusMentor.pdf §   § §VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. jobTitle: Summer Rangers - Western Parks Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50652251.txt	§Summer Rangers - Western Parks§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Summer Rangers - Western Parks§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Summer Rangers - Western Parks §      §        §•    Based at our Western Regional Parks§•    3-months paid work as a summer park ranger§•    Accommodation provided if needed§        § §        §A paid internship - providing you with relevant career experience through the summer months at our Western Regional Parks.§        §We are on the lookout for students to take the lead, protecting and enhancing the environment and natural landscapes of Auckland's Western Regional Parks. From vast forests with magnificent Kauri to the black volcanic sand surf beaches synonymous with Auckland's west coast, the Western Regional Parks encompasses everything that New Zealand is world-renowned for. At the Waitakere Ranges Regional Park, you’ll find the wild and beautiful west coast black-sand surf beaches of Whatipu, Karekare, Piha, Te Henga and Muriwai.§        §If your studies would benefit from this experience, a summer with the Auckland Council could be the best summer ever. You'll work with some of Auckland's best minds, supported in a friendly and stimulating environment and gain valuable real-world experience.§        §If you haven't already read through the information sheets, now is the time to do so - they outline the different regions and will provide information on what sort of tasks to expect at careers.aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity §        §Auckland’s Regional Parks play a fundamental role in preserving our unique and iconic landscapes across the region. Receiving up to 6 million visits a year, they are home to many rare and threatened ecosystems and native species.§        §This year we are on the hunt for 14 Student Summer Rangers to join our Regional Parks team for a 3-month internship! We are on the lookout for students to take the lead, protecting and enhancing the environment and natural landscapes of Auckland's Western Regional Parks. From vast forests with magnificent Kauri to the black volcanic sand surf beaches synonymous with Auckland's west coast, the Western Regional Parks encompasses everything that New Zealand is world-renowned for. jobText: TXT/50653915.txt	§Seasonal Beekeepers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Seasonal Beekeepers§§Advertiser: §Three Peaks Manuka Honey§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Labour§§§§§§Apiarists and Beekeepers for Pure Manuka Honey Limited based at Te Kowhai, near Hamilton and Oropi, Tauranga.§ § §Join a team of Apiarists and Beekeepers dedicated to the production of high quality "Three Peaks" Mānuka honey.§ §Pure Mānuka Honey Limited is one of the Perry Group of companies.  We have beekeeping positions available at both our Te Kowhai, Hamilton and Oropi, Tauranga sites.  Roles would require travel and potential overnight stays, to enable servicing hives across the central North Island.§ §We offer a good team culture and opportunities for training and career advancement.  There are opportunities for experienced Senior Beekeepers (Apiarists) as well as Junior Beekeepers.§The hourly wage will depend on qualifications and experience.  There are seasonal roles with October start dates, contract ending March 2021.  These roles will require weekend work and some early morning starts so you will need to be up for the challenge.§ §Reporting to Santi Baldo, Head of Apiary.§ §ROLE§• Nuc building and management§• Queen production§• Hive manipulation§• Disease detection and control§• Pollination§• Truck and forklift operation§• Beehive supering§• Honey harvesting§• Honey extraction§• Preparation and feeding of bee colonies for wintering,§• Shed work, such as woodwork, equipment maintenance, and other preparation and cleaning projects. § §SKILLS & EXPERIENCE§• Beekeeping qualification, skills and experience. §• Working as part of a team and following a system.§• Good organisational skills, initiative and ability to work without supervision.§• Be prompt and attentive.§• Good attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines.§• This role involves strenuous field work for long hours, and hence a high level of health and fitness is important.§Applicants for these positions must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. Please do not apply if you are based overseas and do not hold a visa.  You will also be required to complete a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.§ §www.threepeaksnz.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Operations Manager, Kaiwhakahaere - Te Runanga o Ngati Awa Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50654503.txt	§Operations Manager, Kaiwhakahaere - Te Runanga o Ngati Awa§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Manager, Kaiwhakahaere - Te Runanga o Ngati Awa§§Advertiser: §Intepeople Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Operations Manager, Kaiwhakahaere - Te Runanga o Ngati Awa §      §        §          §Lead a field team of 10§          §Assist with operational delivery of Korehaha Whakahau objectives§          §Enjoy a mix of field based and office work§        §        § §        §Te Runanga o Ngati Awa is the mandated iwi authority of the Ngati Awa Iwi.  Formed in 2005 after their settlement with the Crown, their role is to represent the interests of Ngati Awa, including managing their collective taonga and resources. Based in Whakatane, the Runanga manage the financial assets of the iwi and promote culture, language, educational and economic development in the region.  The Runanga is about to launch Korehaha Whakahau – the first Iwi led Predator Free Aotearoa 2050 eradication project that aims to eliminate possums from the region.  §        §Reporting to the Manager Taiao, the Operations Manager – Kaiwhakahaere is responsible for the operational delivery of project goals.   Leading a field team of 10, the focus is to oversee all aspects of daily field operations. This includes coaching and developing staff, coordinating people and resources, budget management and ensure the overall achievement of project milestones and timeframes.  You will develop partnerships and relationships with a variety of internal and external stakeholders including other Iwi, government agencies, local authorities and community groups, ensuring the Iwi interests are represented.  You will collaborate and contribute to the Taiao portfolio as well as wider pest management strategies and innovations.  §        §To be successful in this role, you will need prior experience leading teams and projects and have a collaborative and consultative style. You will need relevant experience in pest management, biodiversity, biosecurity or environmental management.  A sound knowledge of health and safety and use of relevant technology is also required.  Above all, you will have a track record of engaging with Iwi and an affiliation with Ngati Awa values and kaitiakitanga principles.  This position will involve working outdoors in all types of landscapes and environments; therefore you’ll need to be physically fit.  §        §A great leadership role and opportunity to make a positive difference to our taiao and wider biodiversity management.§        §Applications to be received by Friday 16 October 2020.§        §Check out the §job description§. §        §For further enquiries, please contact Odette Shearer 021 270 8657 or §odette.shearer@intepeople.co.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Lead a field team of 10§ §Assist with operational delivery of Korehaha Whakahau objectives§ §Enjoy a mix of field based and office work§ §Te Runanga o Ngati Awa is the mandated iwi authority of the Ngati Awa Iwi.  Formed in 2005 after their settlement with the Crown, their role is to represent the interests of Ngati Awa, including managing their collective taonga and resources. Based in Whakatane, the Runanga manage the financial assets of the iwi and promote culture, language, educational and economic development in the region.  The Runanga is about to launch Korehaha Whakahau – the first Iwi led Predator Free Aotearoa 2050 eradication project that aims to eliminate possums from the region.  §Reporting to the Manager Taiao, the Operations Manager – Kaiwhakahaere is responsible for the operational delivery of project goals.   Leading a field team of 10, the focus is to oversee all aspects of daily field operations. This includes coaching and developing staff, coordinating people and resources, budget management and ensure the overall achievement of project milestones and timeframes.  You will develop partnerships and relationships with a variety of internal and external stakeholders including other Iwi, government agencies, local authorities and community groups, ensuring the Iwi interests are represented.  You will collaborate and contribute to the Taiao portfolio as well as wider pest management strategies and innovations.  §To be successful in this role, you will need prior experience leading teams and projects and have a collaborative and consultative style. You will need relevant experience in pest management, biodiversity, biosecurity or environmental management.  A sound knowledge of health and safety and use of relevant technology is also required.  Above all, you will have a track record of engaging with Iwi and an affiliation with Ngati Awa values and kaitiakitanga principles.  This position will involve working outdoors in all types of landscapes and environments; therefore you’ll need to be physically fit.  §A great leadership role and opportunity to make a positive difference to our taiao and wider biodiversity management.§Applications to be received by Friday 16 October 2020.§Check out the §job description§. §For further enquiries, please contact Odette Shearer 021 270 8657 or §odette.shearer@intepeople.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Notice Period§Residency Status§Desired Region§Mobile Number§§§

We aim to provide first-class care for our patients and exceed the expectations of our patient’s, owners and family.§  § We are currently looking for §a Full Time, dedicated Receptionist§ to join our lovely team.§  § §Working approximately 75 hours per fortnight,§ the right candidate will possess attention to detail, outstanding customer service, a positive attitude and a caring demeanour, the recipe for providing superior care to our clients to the highest of professional standards.§  § §Duties include, but are not limited to:§ § §Managing multiple incoming telephone lines as well as serving clients.§ §Booking appointments and diary management.§ §Taking payments and balancing the till at the end of the day.§ §Product sales and client education.§ §Computer data entry and general administration.§ §Managing the reminder system and sending out client letters.§ §Unpacking of daily orders and stocking shelves.§ §Ensuring front of the house and consult rooms are always clean and presentable.§ §Assisting the veterinarian and nursing team where necessary§ §  § §The ideal candidate should have:   § § §At least 1 years’ reception or veterinary nursing experience and a passion for the pet care industry.§ §The ability to work well within a team environment and work autonomously.§ §Possess excellent customer service and communication skills.§ §Be able to multi-task, remain calm under pressure and be detail orientated.§ §A willingness to learn and inform our clients about animal health.§ §  § §Sounds great, how do I apply!§ § If you are interested in working with a great team with plenty of support, please apply now or send your Resume and Cover Letter.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50655917.txt	§Large Animal Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Large Animal Technician§§Advertiser: §Canterbury Vets Ashburton§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Canterbury Vets is an independently owned and operated mixed animal veterinary practice, servicing the Mid Canterbury community under new ownership. § §An opportunity has become available for a full-time large animal Veterinary Technician.  The successful applicant will ideally hold a Bachelor of Veterinary Technology, or recognised qualification; and have previous experience working as a Technician.§ §This is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic person passionate about the industry to join our small, friendly team. This is a strong support role to our veterinarians and will include a wide range of tasks, such as: surgical anaesthetics, medical and diagnostic procedures, ultrasound pregnancy testing, disbubbing, teatsealing, disbudding, and metrichecking.§ §The successful applicant will need the following:§ § §Competent in all aspects of veterinary technician duties including surgical anaesthetics, medical and diagnostic procedures, as well as general health and welfare of animals.§ §A good understanding of veterinary legislation and the Animal Welfare Act§ §Good animal handling ability§ §Ability to work well within a team, as well as independently§ §Flexibility with start and finish times to meet client’s needs.§ §To apply, please email your cover letter and CV to jonathanc@canvet.co.nz§ §Applications close 9th October 2020.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Regional Lead, Tiakina Nga Manu Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50657396.txt	§Regional Lead, Tiakina Nga Manu§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Lead, Tiakina Nga Manu§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Regional Lead, Tiakina Nga Manu §        §          §Are you looking for a leading role in protecting native wildlife across the Waikato and Taranaki regions?  An exciting opportunity has become available within the Operations Planning team for a Regional Lead for DOC's Tiakina Ngā Manu predator control programme. §          §Tiakina Ngā Manu (formerly Battle for our Birds) is DOC's nationally coordinated, landscape-scale predator control programme.  The purpose of the programme is to protect New Zealand's most threatened native species and ecosystems, through the sustained control of predators such as possums, rodents, and mustelids.  The position will integrate with the Waikato Regional Council's landscape-scale pest control programme.§          §This is a permanent, full-time role based in Hamilton, with the option of flexible working arrangements.  Office time will be shared between the DOC office in Rostrevor Street and the Waikato Regional Council.  Some travel to district offices will be involved.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §DOC's predator control programme is expanding; Tiakina Ngā Manu contributes to Predator Free 2050 goals, as well as the NZ Threatened Species and Biodiversity Strategies.   As our new Regional Lead - Tiakina Ngā Manu, you will be responsible for coordinating multiple predator control operations across the Waikato and Taranaki regions.§          §In this role, you will:§          §            §Plan, coordinate and support landscape-scale predator control projects§            §Provide strategic advice to the Regional Operations Director and senior Council staff.§            §Coordinate and support operational teams across the region delivering the work§            §Help build effective teams across the region and with the national Tiakina Ngā Manu team§          §          §The appointee will join our DOC Operations Planning whānau based in Hamilton, supporting the whole of DOC's Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region, as well as parts of the Central North Island region.  This team includes a Biodiversity Planner, Recreation Planner, Treaty Partnership & Community Planner, Asset Planners, Inspectors, and Works Officers. §          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §The successful applicant will have:§          §            §A high level of knowledge and practice of large-scale pest control operations.§            §The ability to coordinate and support multiple, complex operations simultaneously.§            §The skill to build and maintain strong collaborative relationships.§            §The ability to analyse and improve DOC national systems.§            §Excellent team member skills.§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §The Waikato and Taranaki regions hold exceptional threatened species populations and rare ecosystems, and this is your opportunity to contribute to their protection.  The successful applicant will be in the unique position of working both with DOC and the Waikato Regional Council to help deliver our predator control ambitions.§          §This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          §We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiries, please contact §hamilton@doc.govt.nz§, quoting vacancy 400/9495.§  §          §Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 12 October 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§          § §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Are you looking for a leading role in protecting native wildlife across the Waikato and Taranaki regions?  An exciting opportunity has become available within the Operations Planning team for a Regional Lead for DOC's Tiakina Ngā Manu predator control programme. §Tiakina Ngā Manu (formerly Battle for our Birds) is DOC's nationally coordinated, landscape-scale predator control programme.  The purpose of the programme is to protect New Zealand's most threatened native species and ecosystems, through the sustained control of predators such as possums, rodents, and mustelids.  The position will integrate with the Waikato Regional Council's landscape-scale pest control programme.§This is a permanent, full-time role based in Hamilton, with the option of flexible working arrangements.  Office time will be shared between the DOC office in Rostrevor Street and the Waikato Regional Council.  Some travel to district offices will be involved.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§DOC's predator control programme is expanding; Tiakina Ngā Manu contributes to Predator Free 2050 goals, as well as the NZ Threatened Species and Biodiversity Strategies.   As our new Regional Lead - Tiakina Ngā Manu, you will be responsible for coordinating multiple predator control operations across the Waikato and Taranaki regions.§In this role, you will:§§Plan, coordinate and support landscape-scale predator control projects§Provide strategic advice to the Regional Operations Director and senior Council staff.§Coordinate and support operational teams across the region delivering the work§Help build effective teams across the region and with the national Tiakina Ngā Manu team§§The appointee will join our DOC Operations Planning whānau based in Hamilton, supporting the whole of DOC's Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region, as well as parts of the Central North Island region.  This team includes a Biodiversity Planner, Recreation Planner, Treaty Partnership & Community Planner, Asset Planners, Inspectors, and Works Officers. § §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§The successful applicant will have:§§A high level of knowledge and practice of large-scale pest control operations.§The ability to coordinate and support multiple, complex operations simultaneously.§The skill to build and maintain strong collaborative relationships.§The ability to analyse and improve DOC national systems.§Excellent team member skills.§§ §§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§The Waikato and Taranaki regions hold exceptional threatened species populations and rare ecosystems, and this is your opportunity to contribute to their protection.  The successful applicant will be in the unique position of working both with DOC and the Waikato Regional Council to help deliver our predator control ambitions.§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §For any enquiries, please contact §hamilton@doc.govt.nz§, quoting vacancy 400/9495.§  §§Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 12 October 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. jobTitle: Worm Farm Assistant Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50657458.txt	§Worm Farm Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Worm Farm Assistant§§Advertiser: §Verkerks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Labour§§§§§§Ashburton Meat Processors Limited operates year-round from its premises in Bridge Street, producing a range of meat cuts on-time and to specification for a number of significant local and national clients. § §Due to retirement we have a rare vacany in our Worm Farm and Irrigation department and we are subsequntley seeking applicants for a role as a Worm Farm Assistant.§ §To be suitable, you must:§ § §Be eligible to work in New Zealand.§ §Be physically fit and able to lift up to 30kgs.§ §Be reliable and turn up to work on time and willing to work outside year round.§ §Able to work in a small team.§ §Must be able to pay attention to detail and have excellent record keeping skills.§ §Experience operating farm machinery.§ §Experience with irrigation systems (roto rainer) and consent compliance monitoring.§ §The ideal candidates will be self-motivated, have a willingness to learn, physically fit and a positive attitude. This is a year round Monday to Friday day shift role. Applicants with experience working on a farm would be preferred and would specifically suit a retiring farmer, however for the right candidate, full training would be provided.§ §We offer a competitive hourly rate, year-round job security and a busy work environment.  Applicants may be required to undergo a pre-employment medical assessment including a drug and alcohol test.§ §To apply, email your details to §admin@ab32.co.nz§  If you would like further details, contact Amanda Morley on §03 308 2019§.  § §Applications close Friday 16th October 2020.§§§§

jobTitle: Net Maker (Purse Seine Fishing) Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50662020.txt	§Net Maker (Purse Seine Fishing)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Net Maker (Purse Seine Fishing)§§Advertiser: §Pelco NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Fishing & Aquaculture§§§§§§Leading the way in pelagic fishing§, Pelco is well established and recognised within the industry.  We are a privately owned and operated family business and proud to promote the fact we consider the whole team as whanau.  Our future lies in innovation and a determination of striving to be the best. To be the best our team is a key element of our continued success and due to company growth, new and exciting opportunities continue; and we now search for an experienced and knowledgeable purse seine net maker/repairer                                                           §  §Reporting to the Operations Manager, the ability to contribute and engage within a highly demanding environment is paramount.  Although this role is primarily autonomous you will feel you belong to a team who ensure our whole operation is safe, fit for purpose and runs smoothly within minimal downtime. §  §This role requires someone who can self manage; carry out maintenance, repairs and inspections, having the ability to anticipate delays and create solutions. You must be able to think outside the box with the ability to handle distractions from major projects to adhoc requests; this will not phase you!§  §It is essential to plan and complete tasks around vessel movements and fish unloading thereby being prepared to work outside of ‘normal’ working hours is an accepted part of this role. Weekend work is required at times and will be structured on a shared roster basis with the team.§  §About you…§ § §A driven personality and an aptness for forward planning on a daily, weekly and monthly basis§ §Forthcoming in the sharing of knowledge and ideas § §Highly motivated with a positive, 'can do' attitude.§ §Willingness to take ownership of faults and/or issues and see them through to successful conclusions§ §Understand decision making and the impact of downtime for the business§ §Hands on role including relative duties; maintenance and repairs § §Ability to relate well with and develop relationships§ §Effective communicator§ §Liaison with and support the Unload Supervisor and crew§ §Fit, healthy and hands on to undertake physical work and work unsociable hours on occasion to get the job done§ §Carry out duties in accordance with safe working practices within statutory and Company guidelines and follow procedure manuals where applicable§ §Travel may be required on occasions § §Skills and Abilities/Competencies…§ § §Working knowledge and the ability to recognise potential issues with the nets§ §Experience with running nets, maintaining and fault finding § §Ability to work unsupervised and complete tasks as directed§ §Ability to keep track on time spent and complete job cards with necessary detail§ §Adhere to and promote H&S compliance and due diligence§ §Health and Safety situational awareness; operate all types of equipment, hand and power tools in accordance with manufacturers’ guidelines§ §New Zealand resident§ §Our overall aim is to provide a sustainable environment for everyone to work in that is managed, safe and secure as well as being fair, encouraging and stimulating. The foundation of our company wide philosophy combined with our values ensure we provide an enjoyable working environment.§  §In addition to a competitive remuneration package, we offer an exciting and varied job where you will work alongside experts in the industry.   §  §Although this role is primarily based in Mount Maunganui, relocation support will be considered for applicants who are willing to move for this rare opportunity. Due to the nature of the role and working environment a Pre-Employment Drug & Alcohol Test will apply.§  §Please apply via email with a covering letter, salary expectations and cv to: §rachel@pelco-nz.com§ no later than 30 October 2020§  §Thank you for your interest and we look forward to hearing from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50663058.txt	§Kennel Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kennel Assistant§§Advertiser: §The Dog Bach Boarding Kennels§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§We are a first class, family run, Dog Kennels and Doggy Day Care business operating in the Wellington area. We have 2 full time permanent positions available and therefore, we are looking for 2 mature and responsible people to join our team as kennel assistants.  These positions are for 32 hours a week for each role and worked on a 5 from 7 week. It will include weekends, public holidays and split shifts. If you have completed an animal welfare course, have a background in veterinary nursing, or previously worked in kennels, or simply would love to work with animals please read on...§ §The essential requirements include: a passion for dogs; their safety and well-being, to have a positive happy and friendly nature in order to greet our clients. Confidence in handling dogs of all sizes is essential. You also need to be a confident driver with a full driver's license. We are a total smoke-free work place due to our location.§ § § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ §Various duties to include§ §Most importantly - loves dogs§ §Daily duties including, feeding, cleaning kennels and outside runs/exercise areas. Medicating where necessary. Supervising and playing with dogs§ §The collection and dropping off of dogs that are staying for Doggy Day Care or boarding. Entering data on to the computer programme and filing paperwork§ §Our client's pets welfare is our priority, you will need to pay attention to details, reporting/taking action where needed regarding the health of the pets.§ §You will need to be flexible with your time management, be prepared to carry out the main routine of the day as well as do the unexpected. We are looking for someone who is punctual, reliable and has a great work ethic; someone that will go the extra mile for the dogs and their owners.§ §Process the arrivals and check outs and complete data input in a timely fashion, general office duties: including answering the telephone.§ § § §Skills and experience§ §A sound knowledge of dogs is important, experience in a similar field is an advantage, but not essential. The ability to be flexible and to use initiative is a must. To have some basic computer knowledge is essential.  Training will be given. Full Driver's Licence essential§ §Please apply with covering letter and CV to Seek.§ §Closing Date: 9th October 2020 at 5pm§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have professional dog grooming experience?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50663279.txt	§Senior Biosecurity Field Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Biosecurity Field Officer§§Advertiser: §AsureQuality Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§The Opportunity:§Our Biosecurity Field team provide services to support with the protection of New Zealand against exotic pests, disease incursions, surveillance trap monitoring for the MPI surveillance programmes and eradication.§We are currently looking for a Senior Biosecurity Field Officer to join our Hastings team on a 9 month fixed term basis from September 2020 to May 2021. This is a part time role working a minimum of 16 hours a fortnight.§The Senior Field Officer will lead a small team of individuals as well as manage a range of Biosecurity monitoring activities. This is inclusive of trapping, site selection, inspection, data entry and sampling. This includes assigning trapping locations, monitoring weather conditions, following set procedures and processes, problem solving, and ensuring that electronic data is recorded accurately.§About you:§You will be passionate about motivating, leading and inspiring a small team and have prior experience as a leader who can foster and maintain strong relationships, together with the ability to think on your feet and provide direction.§In addition, you enjoy the great outdoors and field based work. You have prior experience with carrying out trapping functions in accordance with set procedures.§You will pride yourself in having a strong health and safety focus, a clean drivers licence along with a keen interest in technology.§Your verbal and written communication skills, eye for detail and passion for quality are second to non. You will have a natural ability to build and maintain positive relationships, be detail orientated, and have a resilient nature with resolving challenges.§Prior experience in the primary sector (farming, forestry, horticulture) and Inspection would see you do well in this role as well as knowledge and skills in Biosecurity. Current registration with Growsafe and/or a Chem handler's certificate would be advantageous but is not essential.§Please note: You must have your own appropriate and reliable vehicle, you will be compensated for kilometres covered in relation to this role.§About us:§Everyday our experienced team of 1800+ people work alongside farmers, producers, and others throughout the food supply chain to help them uphold what Aotearoa stands for in food - a higher standard of quality and safety.§We are passionate about our shared role as Kaitiaki Kai, guardians of food, and have a deep responsibility to do the right thing for food and the environments it comes from.§We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining great people, and supporting them to be the best they can be. We know diverse teams are stronger teams and we believe in fairness and opportunity for all.§Helping Aotearoa shape a better food world§§Job Reference : 42631§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50664236.txt	§AB Technician Pre-Employment Training - Upper South Island§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§AB Technician Pre-Employment Training - Upper South Island§§Advertiser: §LIC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §We are kiwi innovators at the forefront of dairy science and we're looking for talented people to lead us to success in our industry.§      §AB Technician Pre-Employment Training - Upper South Island §      §        §Each year our seasonal artificial breeding (AB) technician's carry out around 4.2 million inseminations in the national dairy herd, ensuring the arrival of the next generation of cows. It's a crucial part of protecting New Zealand's status as a premium producer of milk and meat§        §        §Join us this season§        §LIC has trained AB technicians for more than 70 years and we are super proud of their contribution to our business and the dairy industry over that time. Our technicians come from all walks of life, sharing our passion for empowering livestock farmers.§        §Each year we aim to train 100 new technicians through completing our exclusive 12-month apprenticeship programme and applications are now open for our 2021 season.§        §Interviews take place from late January after we finish our spring mating duties. Applicants that have successfully interviewed will need to pay the training fee of $899 (plus GST) before being accepted for our training course.§        §The fee covers participation in our exclusive 12-month apprenticeship programme involving on the ground training and four national unit standards administered by Primary ITO (a nationally recognised training organisation). Once you have successfully passed our full apprenticeship, you will be eligible for a refund on your training fee as part of the Government's apprenticeship programme.§        §Our training courses run between February and May and are made up of 2x one-week block courses. Should you pass week 1, the 2nd week may not necessarily be consecutive.§        §        §﻿Do you have?§        §          §The right to work in New Zealand§          §An affinity with animals§          §Good communication skills§          §A connection or interest in the dairy industry with a customer focus§          §Basic computer literacy (e.g. can you operate a smartphone and iPad)§          §Strong attention to detail for accurate recording of breeding information§          §A driver's licence.§        §        §** Please note that there is a minimum height requirement for this role (you must be at least 160cms tall)**§        §So come and join our team of 900 LIC AB technicians.§        §For more information and to apply, go to our website www.careers.lic.co.nz§        §Job code§:§ 37823§        §Applications close: 30 January 2021§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Each year our seasonal artificial breeding (AB) technician's carry out around 4.2 million inseminations in the national dairy herd, ensuring the arrival of the next generation of cows. It's a crucial part of protecting New Zealand's status as a premium producer of milk and meat§§Join us this season§LIC has trained AB technicians for more than 70 years and we are super proud of their contribution to our business and the dairy industry over that time. Our technicians come from all walks of life, sharing our passion for empowering livestock farmers.§Each year we aim to train 100 new technicians through completing our exclusive 12-month apprenticeship programme and applications are now open for our 2021 season.§Interviews take place from late January after we finish our spring mating duties. Applicants that have successfully interviewed will need to pay the training fee of $899 (plus GST) before being accepted for our training course.§The fee covers participation in our exclusive 12-month apprenticeship programme involving on the ground training and four national unit standards administered by Primary ITO (a nationally recognised training organisation). Once you have successfully passed our full apprenticeship, you will be eligible for a refund on your training fee as part of the Government's apprenticeship programme.§Our training courses run between February and May and are made up of 2x one-week block courses. Should you pass week 1, the 2nd week may not necessarily be consecutive.§§﻿Do you have?§The right to work in New Zealand§An affinity with animals§Good communication skills§A connection or interest in the dairy industry with a customer focus§Basic computer literacy (e.g. can you operate a smartphone and iPad)§Strong attention to detail for accurate recording of breeding information§A driver's licence.§** Please note that there is a minimum height requirement for this role (you must be at least 160cms tall)**§So come and join our team of 900 LIC AB technicians.§For more information and to apply, go to our website www.careers.lic.co.nz§Job code§:§ 37823§Applications close: 30 January 2021§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50670072.txt	§Livestock Breeding Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Livestock Breeding Consultant§§Advertiser: §neXtgen Agri Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$45,000 - $49,999§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§neXtgen Agri is a small company with big aspirations.  We bring innovation, training and support to the sheep and beef industries of New Zealand and Australia.  At our core is enabling genetic improvement in these industries and we take a very broad approach to achieving this outcome. Our clients range from commercial and seed stock producers through to industry organisations.  Our projects range from farmer education through to technology development. §  §We are looking for a new team member to help us serve the needs of our  on-farm and online clients.  The successful applicant will work closely with all aspects of neXtgen Agri and will provide support to the team while learning on the job.  The position is broad and no two days will be the same, it will include interacting with farming clients on the phone, on video conference and on farm.  It will also involve working with sheep, working with cattle, production of digital media and manipulating data in excel and other software.  The position is well suited to a recent graduate or someone with equivalent experience.  This is an excellent opportunity to fill your CV with a wide range of experience. §  §A few things worth knowing about how we work:§ § §we work all over the place - regular travel is a feature of our job and this travel can be at short notice§ §we work in Agriculture, it doesn’t all happen 9-5, Monday to Friday - flexibility is key, this cannot be overstated§ §things change, all the time, often outside of our control - we don’t get uptight about it and neither should you§ §we are a small team, there is plenty of time working alone and some working together.§ §The position is initially for an 8-month period in line with client demand.  It is a full-time position and it is expected that you will have the ability to work from your home office.  We are based in Christchurch and our ideal candidate will be Canterbury based to allow for sufficient face to face catchups and training and the ability to travel to client farms in the South Island.  Phone and laptop will be supplied, and reasonable personal use is encouraged.  The position will report to Dr Mark Ferguson, Director and Senior Consultant.§  §Our ideal candidate will meet these minimum requirements:§ § §An obvious passion for pastoral agriculture and particularly for applying genetic principles to improve the productivity and welfare of sheep and cattle§ §An understanding of New Zealand and Australian farming conditions§ §Have a degree in a related field or equivalent industry experience§ §An excellent working knowledge of technology and an ability to rapidly learn new technologies§ §Have a creative edge and a passion for quality digital production§ §An ability to write in a clear and concise way that informs your audience§ §Demonstrated ability to understand and manipulate data and a passion for accurate data collection and handling§ §A healthy balance of professionalism and fun and an infectious personality.§ §If you would like further information, please call Nisha on §0204 003 4093§ or email §nisha@nextgenagri.com§.  If you would like to apply, please email through a current CV (Maximum 2 pages including 2 referees) and a cover letter detailing why you are interested in the position and the skills and attitude you will bring to it.  This should include a description of how you meet the minimum requirements.  We are busy people, your ability to clearly articulate your skills and passion in a concise way will increase the likelihood of you getting through the first round.  Applications close 16th October 2020.§  §If you do not provide your CV and a cover letter, we will not review your application.§  §This is an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated individual who wants to make their mark on pastoral agriculture.  If you have unquestionable integrity, a passion for breeding great sheep and cattle, are willing to give anything a go, are not afraid of hard work, are willing to learn, are able to think outside the square and have a creative edge, please get in touch.§  §As a small company each staff member can have a large impact on our ultimate success.  This is a specific and unique role and we will not fill the position unless we can find the right person.§  § §  §Nisha Powell, §0204 003 4093§   §nisha@nextgenagri.com§, www.nextgenagri.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

ability to work without supervision.§• Be prompt and attentive.§• Good attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines.§• This role involves strenuous field work for long hours, and hence a high level of health and fitness is important.§Applicants for these positions must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. Please do not apply if you are based overseas and do not hold a visa.  You will also be required to complete a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.§ §www.threepeaksnz.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§With our clinic continuing to grow, we are looking for an experienced, well organised and passionate Head Nurse to lead our fantastic team of five nurses in our busy and vibrant Hastings Clinic.§ §We are looking for a head Nurse with that “X” factor who has:§ § §exceptional nursing skills to compliment a busy veterinary team§ §proven team leadership skills and the ability to grow team culture and enhance operational efficiency§ §superior organisational skills and the ability to co-ordinate multiple resources for roster efficiency in the both the nursing team and clinic as a whole§ §coaching and mentoring skills to help drive development of the wider nursing team§ §an understanding of delivering first class customer service and experience to companion animal client§ §a solutions based
