jobTitle: Veterinary Nurse  Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670752.txt	§Veterinary Nurse §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary Nurse §§Advertiser: §SPCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Veterinary Nurse §      §        §Contract:§ Permanent, full time §        §Hours:§ 7.30am- 4.00pm or 8.00am- 4.30pm §        §Location:§ SPCA Auckland Centre §        §We are currently on the lookout for a full time, motivated, compassionate, fully qualified vet nurse with an excellent work ethic, and a minimum of 3 years full time clinical experience. Our dedicated team of veterinary nurses provide professional support to our hospital vets to achieve the best outcome for animals. §        §You will be expected to demonstrate a high level of professionalism and empathy, and as part of the team, ensure that the animals receive best practice care and treatment. In return, we are able to offer the successful applicant a great team to work with, a unique, challenging environment and an opportunity to further develop and strengthen your nursing skills. §        §SPCA is a great place to work where some of the benefits include a caring team environment, lots of fun staff events and discounted pet food and accessories. §        §You will be required to work some weekends and public holidays on a rostered basis. §        §Our ideal candidate will have/be: §        §• Veterinary nursing qualification §        §• Minimum of 3 years full time practical experience §        §• Able to do IV injections, IV placement, blood collection and other laboratory processing, x-rays, general anesthetic monitoring, surgical and inpatient nursing §        §• Dedication to animal welfare §        §• A great team player §        §• Excellent communication skills §        §• Great time management §        §• Able to work with and support both staff members and volunteers §        §SPCA is one of the best loved and most respected charities in New Zealand, with a proud history of helping animals in need and advocating for animal welfare since 1872. If you are interested in a role where no two days are the same, and the work you do every day makes a difference to the lives of animals in need, we want to hear from you! §        §Please apply now with your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role and how your skills match the criteria. Applications without a cover letter will NOT be considered. A position description is available on request.§        §Applications close on Friday 23rd October 2020.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Contract:§ Permanent, full time §Hours:§ 7.30am- 4.00pm or 8.00am- 4.30pm §Location:§ SPCA Auckland Centre §We are currently on the lookout for a full time, motivated, compassionate, fully qualified vet nurse with an excellent work ethic, and a minimum of 3 years full time clinical experience. Our dedicated team of veterinary nurses provide professional support to our hospital vets to achieve the best outcome for animals. §You will be expected to demonstrate a high level of professionalism and empathy, and as part of the team, ensure that the animals receive best practice care and treatment. In return, we are able to offer the successful applicant a great team to work with, a unique, challenging environment and an opportunity to further develop and strengthen your nursing skills. §SPCA is a great place to work where some of the benefits include a caring team environment, lots of fun staff events and discounted pet food and accessories. §You will be required to work some weekends and public holidays on a rostered basis. §Our ideal candidate will have/be: §• Veterinary nursing qualification §• Minimum of 3 years full time practical experience §• Able to do IV injections, IV placement, blood collection and other laboratory processing, x-rays, general anesthetic monitoring, surgical and inpatient nursing §• Dedication to animal welfare §• A great team player §• Excellent communication skills §• Great time management §• Able to work with and support both staff members and volunteers §SPCA is one of the best loved and most respected charities in New Zealand, with a proud history of helping animals in need and advocating for animal welfare since 1872. If you are interested in a role where no two days are the same, and the work you do every day makes a difference to the lives of animals in need, we want to hear from you! §Please apply now with your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role and how your skills match the criteria. Applications without a cover letter will NOT be considered. A position description is available on request.§Applications close on Friday 23rd October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50670760.txt	§Nursery Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Nursery Technician§§Advertiser: §New Seed Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§About the business§ § §New Seed Solutions operates seed productions, processing, nursery services and seed testing. Group production is spread over multiple locations in Australia and New Zealand.§ §We are a communicative team, that interacts well together while at work and socially.  We are not be afraid to use our initiative and put forward ideas for improvement.  We follow a logical and rational approach to agronomy as well as all other aspects of the business.  We believe in:§ §Working methodically§Transparency§ Equal opportunities§Respect for all§Innovation and adaptability to achieve performance§ § §About the role§ § §The role of Nursery Technician is to assist with all seed production activities and to provide assistance to other nursery and production locations or other divisions of the business when requested. § §Primarily, the role exists to assist with all aspects of nursery work and seed quality. The incumbent works with the Nursery Lead, Nursery Team, Nursery Agronomist, Logistic Coordinator and Operations Manager.§ §The role is hands-on work including equipment operations and requires a physically fit person who is capable of, but not limited to:§ §Preparing the HP (Hand Pollinated) field ready for planting with line markings.§Plant plots and delay plots with focus on key parameters (timing, place, depth).§Organise and manage crews for the HP Nursery along with the Nursery Manager.§Record data such as flower dates, silk dates and pollination counts in the Nursery to a very high standard to ensure forecasted harvest information.§Ensure staff working in the Nursery is trained appropriately.§Enforce the daily productivity goals and ensure staff are meeting requirements.§Work with Nursery Manager to plan and allocate staff to blocks in order to get the tasks done effectively.§Be proactive in thinking of ways to improve Nursery processes § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § §New Seed Solutions provides a transparent environment which enforces staff to work as a wholesome team. We are looking for someone who thrives in a challenging environment, works well under pressure and has a positive and "can do" attitude. § § §Skills and experience§ § §The position requires a high degree of organisation, motivation focus and problem solving.  You will be required to be an independent thinker, act logically and be highly focused so that the very high standards currently in place are not only maintained but also improved upon.§ §Good understanding of Nursery processes.§Excellent communication skills.§Ability to work well within a team and to lead a team - « Hands-on » attitude.§Excellent time management, problem solving, organisation and planning skills.§High productivity rate in shoot bagging, hanging and pollinating.§Good computer skills.§Strong attention to detail. §Good written and spoken english.§Enthusiastic and energetic.§Honest, consistent and reliable.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Winemaker Job in Marlborough - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50671271.txt	§Winemaker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Winemaker§§Advertiser: §Yealands§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§In 2008, a wild and rugged stretch of coastline on the north-eastern tip of New Zealand’s South Island became home to one of the most sustainable wineries in the world. §In just 12 years, Yealands has grown to be one of NZ’s most recognised wine labels with an award winning reputation.§The Opportunity §We are looking for a skilled Winemaker to join our team to help us to continue to deliver award winning wines. Our Senior Winemaker is moving on, leaving a gap within our team. Depending on experience, this role can be scoped from Production Winemaker through to a more senior role.  We are small, tight knit team, so personality and fit is crucial.§Reporting directly to the Chief Winemaker, you will be an integral part of the team seeing our wines through from grape to bottle. §You will be responsible for:§  §Planning daily workflows§  §Dispatch and blend management§  §Working closely with our Supply Chain Team and other Winemakers to ensure production timeframes are met §  §Key in all blending and balancing decisions§  §Ensuring maximum productivity, efficiency, accuracy and quality standards every step of the way §To be successful in this role you will:§  §Have exceptional attention to detail, be highly organised and a great communicator§  §Have proven winemaking experience working in a medium to large winery environment§  §Have a passion for wine and the Marlborough wine region§  §Highly competent using winemaking software (we use Vintrace)§  §Be agile with exceptional organisational and time management skills §  §Be positive, friendly and a great team player§  §Love to work in a fast paced environment with many moving parts§  §Show strong initiative and be self-motivated, working well under pressure§  §Have the ability to work extended hours over the vintage period §Yealands is commitment to sustainability and we endeavour to work with like-minded people who will champion this throughout the organisation and wider community. §What’s in it for you? §  §Competitive salary, health insurance, dental plan and wine allowance§  §A day off on your birthday! §  §A great team, fun working environment§  §A stunning location, like no other §This role is based at our stunning Winery Estate in Seddon. A progressive and ambitious workplace you will be inspired and enthusiastic about the winemaking process. If you thrive in a fun, vibrant, fast-paced environment, our winemaking team would love to meet you.§If this sounds like you then get in touch now! You can apply by sending your CV and cover letter through the “Apply Now” button. §Please note, successful applicants will be required to undergo a preemployment drug & alcohol test. §You must be legally entitled to work in NZ to apply for this role.§Applications close 23 October 2020§For a copy of the Job Description visit §2020-09-29-Winemaker---Production.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Team Leaders - Primary Industries Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50672629.txt	§Team Leaders - Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Leaders - Primary Industries§§Advertiser: §WSP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Team Leaders - Primary Industries §    §    §      §        §§WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.§With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.§We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§Needed is two Team Leaders to join our growing Primary Industries team. We are looking for a Team Leader Rural and Water and Team Leader Rural Infrastructure. The successful candidates will successfully lead nationally based teams, communicate a clear vision inspiring, influencing and aligning the other teams to achieve business goals. You will support the development and growth of the WSP Regional Business focused on the Primary Industries within New Zealand and will meet the needs of clients through the provision of professional consulting services. You will also contribute to the success of the business unit in meeting its business plan through the development of an ongoing and sustainable client base within the Primary Industries Sector. In addition, you will work collaboratively with the team to improve upon collaborative working, project management skills and project deliverable technical standards.§The Team Leaders will monitor market trends, securing new clients, opening new territories, implementing new services with existing clients based on strong technical understanding of the Agrisector.§These roles can be held in Whangarei, Wellington, Hamilton or Palmerston North.§Skills and Experience:§• Agriculture or Horticulture Degree qualified or similar relevant equivalent (Environmental Science Degree also applicable for the Team Leader Rural and Water)§• Chartership or registration status§• 8+ years’ consultancy/professional experience§• Current full and clean Drivers Licence§Experience in the following areas will be an advantage:§Team Leader Rural Infrastructure: §• Irrigation design and construction.§• Wetlands and natural storage design and construction.§• Agriculture engineering.§• Effluent systems.§• Fisheries and forestry systems.§• Freshwater, sediment and erosion control.§Team Leader Rural Land and Water:§• Water resources science.§• Irrigation and soil moisture management.§• Wetlands and natural storage design and management.§• Agriculture and horticultural production systems.§• Effluent treatment methods and systems.§• Fisheries and forestry systems.§• Sediment and erosion control.§How to Apply:§If this sounds like you, we want you to be part of what makes us great. jobTitle: Tūhura & Living Environments Coordinator Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673743.txt	§Tūhura & Living Environments Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tūhura & Living Environments Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Otago Museum§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§We are seeking an experienced and motivated individual to coordinate the day-to-day operations within the Tūhura Otago Community Trust Science Centre, its Tropical Forest and wider Living Environment areas.§  §Key functions of the role include:§ § §Primary responsibility of the care and development of all live animals and plants within the Otago Museum§ §Managing the Tropical Forest containment facility in accordance with all relevant legislative and contractual standards and obligations;§ §Ensuring quality control of pupae and butterflies, and maintaining relationships with suppliers and transportation agents;§ §Overseeing educational and science engagement activities within the Tropical Forest;§ §Coordination of maintenance and operations of science interactives, and allied signage and consumables, within the Tūhura Science Centre;§ §Coordination of developmental activities related to both these areas, including liaison and reporting to regulators and funding bodies§ §The role would be suited to someone who is both hands-on and detailed orientated to ensure compliance and smooth day-to-day operations, whilst also being able to work at a strategic level required to support the future development of these facilities.§  §You will work in conjunction with other staff to engage our visitors through appealing and interesting interactions and programmes to ensure optimum functioning of facilities and equipment. You will develop and maintain our live animal and plant exhibits ensuring all ethical and legal standards are met and the animals and plants are healthy and well cared for.§  §Applicants will have highly developed organisation and communication skills with proven ability to build ongoing relationships with external suppliers and stakeholders as well as managing time-lines and budgets. Along with a relevant tertiary qualification the preferred applicant must have at least two year’s experience with animal husbandry and the administration of relevant authorities, permits and approvals.§  §Please note that the closing date for applications is Tuesday 13 October 2020.§  §We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage anyone who is legally entitled to work in New Zealand to apply via our job page at www.otagomuseum.nz/jobs.§  §If you would like more information please contact Gina Cavanagh, HR Manager, at §vacancy@otagomuseum.nz§ or §(03) 474 7474§ ext 889.§§§§

wider Society events;§ §Championing and supporting development of the Forest & Bird Youth Network;§ §Helping to raise the profile of the Forest & Bird Youth Network, both internally and externally; and§ §Facilitating information sharing and collaboration between the Youth Network, National Office, Forest & Bird Branches and other Networks.§ §To be successful in this role, you will need the following:§ § §Tertiary qualification or relevant practical work experience. § §At least 2 years’ experience working with young people (ideally 14-25 years), including experience in training and mentoring of young people.  Experience with both online and in person training would be advantageous.§ §An understanding of the principles and practice of volunteering and volunteer programmes, and messenger). § §An interest in conservation and environmental issues and practice. §If this role excites you, send us your details!§  §Please email a Cover Letter telling us why you are the person we jobText: TXT/50678721.txt	§Vintage Cellarhands§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vintage Cellarhands§§Advertiser: §Spring Creek Vintners Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§Spring Creek Vintners Ltd is a 12,000t independent winemaking facility located in Spring Creek, Marlborough. With state of the art facilities, we produce premium wine for some of New Zealand’s leading wineries as well as our own award winning Rapaura Springs and Summerhouse labels. Joining our harvest team offers the opportunity to work with some of Marlborough's best winemakers, gaining exposure to a broad range of techniques and winemaking practices.§  §We are currently seeking a dynamic crew to join our dedicated team. Typically, vintage runs from March through to early May. During the busiest period of vintage, we run 2 x 12 hour shifts.  We offer competitive hourly rates, a hot meal per shift and can assist in finding accommodation should you require. We believe in working hard, having fun and are passionate about making great wine.§  §Cellar Supervisors:§ To be successful in this role, applicants must have §a minimum 5 years winery experience§. We are looking for a highly motivated, practical and proactive people with excellent leadership qualities. Applicants must be§ §fluent in the English language§ §and have outstanding communication skills. Supervisors are responsible for directing vintage cellar staff in their daily winery operations.§  §Experienced RDV operators§: Applicants must have experience operating a Rotary Drum Vacuum Filter (RDV) at a large production facility. Valued skills for this position include the ability to multitask, exhibit solid communication, strong organisation as well as a self-motivating individual. §  §Cellar hands and Laboratory Technician:§ completion of one full vintage in either the winery or laboratory and a formal qualification would be looked upon favourably but are not considered essential. Full cellar training will be supplied. Successful applicants should have a good level of physical fitness; demonstrate strong organisation, initiative, as well as the ability to work to deadlines and under pressure. A willingness to learn and working within a team are essential qualities.§  §Applications are invited until all positions are filled.§  §International applicants are required to obtain a work visa. We will assist with the paper work if required.§  §Please accompany your CV with §available references§ (English speaking preferred).§  §Applications to §harvest@scvl.co.nz§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following forklift licences do you have?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§

We are looking for 2 team member who enjoy building relationships, working with words (in all their forms) and finding solutions.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §Based in Queenstown, working from our Arthurs Point office, you will work closely with the wider District Team, as well as Iwi, local businesses and communities, to contribute to the delivery of statutory work and business/community engagement across the district. Hours generally 8am - 5pm, Mon-Fri, with occasional weekend work required. §          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §Our Community Rangers are responsible for:§          §            §Providing high quality analysis and reporting advice in relation to permits for activities such as filming, guiding, sporting events, Crown Pastoral Land Act and RMA applications§            §Juggling a high volume of varied applications, some with competing deadlines§            §Supporting and working directly with local conservation groups and consulting with our Treaty Partners§            §Co-operating with colleagues across district boundaries and agencies on statutory activities§            §Working with the District Team on the other weird and wonderful projects that come our way!§          §          §The ideal team members will have:§          §            §A tertiary qualification, or equivalent experience, which demonstrates a proven ability to think critically and remove complexity without losing context/content§            §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including a proven ability to write accurate, clear and concise plain English reports§            §Demonstrated competence working with a range of private and public entities including Councils, businesses and community groups§            §Proven excellent organisational skills, the ability to balance competing demands, meet deadlines and have a problem-solving approach - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre with a CV and cover letter §demonstrating how you meet the requirements above and the competencies in the five "Capability Areas" outlined in the Role Description. Note, you may use examples gained through community, family or unpaid work to demonstrate your capability.§          §For any enquiries, please contact Lisa Nilsen, §lnilsen@doc.govt.nz§ or 027 276 9322 quoting vacancies 400/8282 and 400/8283.§          §Applications close at 5pm on Friday, 16 October 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Come and join our tight-knit community team to help manage conservation in the Wakatipu District. We are looking for 2 team member who enjoy building relationships, working with words (in all their forms) and finding solutions.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§Based in Queenstown, working from our Arthurs Point office, you will work closely with the wider District Team, as well as Iwi, local businesses and communities, to contribute to the delivery of statutory work and business/community engagement across the district. Hours generally 8am - 5pm, Mon-Fri, with occasional weekend work required. § §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§Our Community Rangers are responsible for:§§Providing high quality analysis and reporting advice in relation to permits for activities such as filming, guiding, sporting events, Crown Pastoral Land Act and RMA applications§Juggling a high volume of varied applications, some with competing deadlines§Supporting and working directly with local conservation groups and consulting with our Treaty Partners§Co-operating with colleagues across district boundaries and agencies on statutory activities§Working with the District Team on the other weird and wonderful projects that come our way!§§The ideal team members will have:§§A tertiary qualification, or equivalent experience, which demonstrates a proven ability to think critically and remove complexity without losing context/content§Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including a proven ability to write accurate, clear and concise plain English reports§Demonstrated competence working with a range of private and public entities including Councils, businesses and community groups§Proven excellent organisational skills, the ability to balance competing demands, meet deadlines and have a problem-solving approach - all with a smile on your face and a ‘can do' attitude§Some experience in engaging and working in partnership with iwi and tangata whenua would be an advantage§A track record for working well both independently and as part of a team§A passion for protecting the environment, and connecting others with conservation§§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§The chance to be part of a fantastic and supportive team, working collaboratively to fulfil our role as a regulator, advocate, storyteller and Treaty partner.§Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§Respect, recognition and opportunities for personal growth.§Excellent employee wellbeing initiatives including the employee assistance program and discounted insurance.§Free accommodation in our huts and campsites as well as general travel and accommodation discounts.§Job satisfaction from contributing to crucial and meaningful work.§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre with a CV and cover letter §demonstrating how you meet the requirements above and the competencies in the five "Capability Areas" outlined in the Role Description. Note, you may use examples gained through community, family or unpaid work to demonstrate your capability.§For any enquiries, please contact Lisa Nilsen, §lnilsen@doc.govt.nz§ or 027 276 9322 quoting vacancies 400/8282 and 400/8283.§Applications close at 5pm on Friday, 16 October 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture.§§§§

jobTitle: Forester Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680015.txt	§Forester§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Forester§§Advertiser: §Hancock Forest Management (NZ) LTD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Forester §      §        §Our Business§Hancock Forest Management NZ Ltd (HFM NZ) protects and manages the forest assets owned by the Hancock Natural Resource Group’s investment clients. These institutional investors own 230,000 hectares of plantation forests in New Zealand, producing an annual harvest volume of approximately 5 million m3. Providing a safe and inclusive workplace for its employees and contractors and managing all operations to ensure excellence in environmental outcomes are HFM NZ’s highest priorities.§        §The Role§Due to an internal promotion, we are seeking an experienced Forester to join our global business. As part of the Forestry Operations Team, the role will assist in the management of establishment, tending and forest protection functions. This includes management of contractors and crews to ensure professional and best practice operations. Ensuring excellence in health, safety and environmental outcomes is paramount.§        §What We Can Offer You§HFM NZ is New Zealand’s largest forest management company and will offer a highly competitive package to our chosen candidate. Along with base salary and annual bonus, a work vehicle (choice of 3) including private use is supplied. We also provide a suite of benefits including health insurance, trauma, income protection and life insurance, additional KiwiSaver contributions, gym subsidy and long service leave. Generous financial support for formal external tuition can be accessed to ensure our employees can learn and grow while working with us. HFM NZ also supports employee health and wellbeing and the importance of work/life balance and provides flexible work arrangements wherever possible.§        §What We’re Looking For§The successful applicant will ideally hold a tertiary qualification in forestry or a related field and/or have significant experience in forestry operations. We’re particularly interested in candidates with forestry operations planning and spraying experience who can take on a leadership role within the team. We need a great team player who has strong relationship and people management abilities as there may be the opportunity for the role to grow in the future. Sound computing skills are also desirable. Above all else, an unwavering commitment to delivering the highest health, safety and environmental standards is a must.§        §To Apply§If you’d like to join our small but committed team and work with some of the best in the business, more information can be found on our website www.hfm.nz. Please send applications in the form of a cover letter and CV to our Human Resources Team at §hfmnzcareers@hnrg.com§ by 18 October 2020.§HFM NZ§      §      §      §    §  §§§Our Business§Hancock Forest Management NZ Ltd (HFM NZ) protects and manages the forest assets owned by the Hancock Natural Resource Group’s investment clients. These institutional investors own 230,000 hectares of plantation forests in New Zealand, producing an annual harvest volume of approximately 5 million m3. Providing a safe and inclusive workplace for its employees and contractors and managing all operations to ensure excellence in environmental outcomes are HFM NZ’s highest priorities.§ §The Role§Due to an internal promotion, we are seeking an experienced Forester to join our global business. As part of the Forestry Operations Team, the role will assist in the management of establishment, tending and forest protection functions. This includes management of contractors and crews to ensure professional and best practice operations. Ensuring excellence in health, safety and environmental outcomes is paramount.§ §What We Can Offer You§HFM NZ is New Zealand’s largest forest management company and will offer a highly competitive package to our chosen candidate. Along with base salary and annual bonus, a work vehicle (choice of 3) including private use is supplied. We also provide a suite of benefits including health insurance, trauma, income protection and life insurance, additional KiwiSaver contributions, gym subsidy and long service leave. Generous financial support for formal external tuition can be accessed to ensure our employees can learn and grow while working with us. HFM NZ also supports employee health and wellbeing and the importance of work/life balance and provides flexible work arrangements wherever possible.§ §What We’re Looking For§The successful applicant will ideally hold a tertiary qualification in forestry or a related field and/or have significant experience in forestry operations. We’re particularly interested in candidates with forestry operations planning and spraying experience who can take on a leadership role within the team. We need a great team player who has strong relationship and people management abilities as there may be the opportunity for the role to grow in the future. Sound computing skills are also desirable. Above all else, an unwavering commitment to delivering the highest health, safety and environmental standards is a must.§ §To Apply§If you’d like to join our small but committed team and work with some of the best in the business, more information can be found on our website www.hfm.nz. Please send applications in the form of a cover letter and CV to our Human Resources Team at §hfmnzcareers@hnrg.com§ by 18 October 2020.§HFM NZ§§§§

Rostered hours will be Monday-Friday between 7.30am and 8pm and Saturdays between 8.30am and 1.30pm.§ §Hours will be approximate 30 hours (PT) per week plus rotating Saturday shifts and Puppy Preschool evenings.§ §The ideal applicant:§ § §Has a Certificate or Diploma in Veterinary Nursing.§ §Able to work a variety of hours on a rostering system.§ §A team player.§ §Is a fast learner and able to think on their feet.§ §Able to prepare for and assist with surgery.§ §Confident monitoring anaesthetics.§ §Compassionate and efficient.§ §Has outstanding customer service skills.§ §If this sounds like you, please email a copy of your CV and cover letter to §yolande@selwynvet.com§.§ §New graduates are welcome to apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? removing substandard or diseased plants to maintain quality standards;§ §Assist determination rates of fertilisers as required by the crops and directs the application of them;§ §Assist with development of growing procedures for new species in product line and new cultivation techniques;§ §Advise on growing supplies;§ §Maintain records of growing techniques and production; reviews records and reports to identify trends and to forecast future space and production needs;§ §Train employees in new growing techniques and activities;§ §Maintain a current knowledge of growing techniques and technologies.§ §Maintain an awareness of new state of the art equipment and provide input into equipment and facilities upgrades and replacements;§ §Communicate regularly with the Cultivation Manager on issues as they arise and collaborate on effective solutions;§ §Provide support in all aspects of cultivation operations as directed.§ §What you will bring:§ § §Degree in plant science or related field, or equivalent combination of tertiary qualifications and experience;§ §3+ years experience in a similar role;§ §Experience with biological controls and no spray techniques;§ §Tech savvy and experience with automated agricultural equipment;§ §Strong analytical and problem solving skills;§ §Experience and knowledge of industry compliance requirements;§ §Proven ability to work to tight deadlines.§ §What’s in it for you?§ § §Become part of the rapidly growing, innovative medical cannabis industry in New Zealand.§ §Great people and a fantastic work environment! When you join our team, you become part of the Rua whanau.§ §Opportunities for growth and development: We develop our people and promote from within.§ §Flexibility: We are whanau friendly and we want our staff to maintain a healthy work/life balance.§ §Fun! We work hard so we think it’s important to make time to celebrate our successes too.§ §Offers of employment are subject to the satisfactory outcome of a criminal conviction check and a pre-employment medical check including a drug test.§  §Please include a cover letter and updated CV with your application.§  §Rua Bioscience is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and building a culture that values diversity and inclusion; one that celebrates peoples’ unique backgrounds and qualities and enables everyone to reach their full potential.   §  §ruabio.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? jobTitle: Senior Assistant Farm Manager Job in Waikato - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50681263.txt	§Senior Assistant Farm Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Assistant Farm Manager§§Advertiser: §Bellevue Enterprises LTD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Salary§§$55,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§Bellevue Enterprises runs an elite genetic breeding programme (and the dairy and Drystock farms associated with this breeding program) focusing on high quality cows producing high quality milk and superior on farm performance. We work in conjunction with the top breeding and genetic companies in New Zealand with the end result being high genetic value animals. These animals will then go on and be the future of the New Zealand dairy and beef industries. §This role sits at the centre of our genetic improvement business and technical dairy farming operation. §The role will suit someone that has an interest in animal husbandry and genetics, grass and cow management, and is highly organised with a willingness to learn and desire to excel. Bellevue supports its employees with development programs, excellent support and the support required to become a highly skilled dairy manager. § §The key areas of this role are as follows:§Feed allocation and pasture management§We run a level 3 to 4 feed system requiring accurate pasture and supplementary feed management that focuses on profitable milk production. The assistant manger will play a key role in this on farm implementing feed plans and having direct influence on pasture management and the subsequent profitability of the business.§Animal health§Every calf born on farm is of high genetic value. This requires real attention to detail and excellent husbandry and animal health skills when it comes to calf survival and subsequent calf rearing. In this role you will learn best practices from qualified and experienced practitioners when it comes to calving cows and associated animal health practices.§Day to day running of a high production Dairy farm§Assist dairy farm manager in the day to day running and managing of the farm with a development plan to develop into a farm manager.§Staff Management§Be involved with a business that runs a high-quality health and safety programme and help develop a supportive team culture of excellence within the business.§Future professional growth§The company has multiple farms that offer staff the opportunity to learn outside of their core role. This offers staff to develop their skill set for future employment and or internal promotion within the business.§Key Relationships§Key relationships and interaction with wider stakeholders within the business offers the candidate growth opportunities outside dairy farming.§§ §Bellevue Enterprises is a forward-thinking and future-looking company who continues to think outside the box when it comes to agriculture in New Zealand with a culture of support and excellence.  We acknowledge that to achieve our goals we need highly motivated and skilled people to join our team.§To apply you must have the right to work in New Zealand, a current driver’s licence is essential and a pre-employment drug test is required.§ §Please forward your cv to: §johne@abreeds.co.nz§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Team Manager Otari Native Botanic Garden and Wilton's Bush Reserve Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50681674.txt	§Team Manager Otari Native Botanic Garden and Wilton's Bush Reserve§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Manager Otari Native Botanic Garden and Wilton's Bush Reserve§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§Would you love to contribute to one of Wellington's most valued open spaces and be involved in cutting edge native plant conservation?§Ōtari is the only Botanic Garden in New Zealand dedicated solely to native plants. Ōtari 's plant collections contain about 1,200 species, hybrids and cultivars from across New Zealand. As well as the 5ha of cultivated collections, Ōtari consists of 95ha of native bush, the largest intact bush remnant left in Wellington. It also has a plant nursery where seedlings of threatened species are raised and kept in the Garden for conservation or returned to the wild in conservation recovery programmes. Then there is the Lions Plant Conservation Laboratory which provides staff with facilities to conduct essential research into propagation and long term storage of New Zealand's threatened plants. Ōtari is part of the Capital City's Wellington Gardens group which includes Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Bolton Street Cemetery ki Paekākā and Truby King Park. Wellington Gardens is committed to growing and communicating with plants for conservation, health and well being, culture and heritage, education and amenity and landscape. Otari is a Green Flag garden and an RNZIH Garden of International Significance.§You would lead a dedicated team and have a collaborative approach to make best use of complementary skills within the wider Council to oversee an integrated and visitor minded operation. You must be highly skilled at building and maintaining relationships. A key part of this role is working alongside other organisations, volunteers and the wider community to deliver the best outcomes for New Zealand's native plants and visitors to Ōtari.§We are looking for a strategic thinker who is future focused, and understands the challenges and opportunities that we face. You will need to demonstrate leadership behaviours in all that you do, and inspire others to help you achieve your vision. You will model Council's and the Gardens' team values which include building our people, honesty and integrity, putting people at the heart of what we do and working together.§To be eligible for this role you must be permanent New Zealand resident and you will have a full clean Class 1 driver's licence. You will agree to complete both drug and alcohol screening and a musculoskeletal assessment. Click the apply button to submit an application and/or to view the position description. For further information or if you have any questions about the role, please contact David Sole, Wellington Gardens Manager at 021 227 8296 or email §David.sole@wcc.govt.nz§.§All applications must be submitted online, applications close §Monday, 02 November 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Auckland Inner Islands team but are ‘live-on' Island based roles.  Accommodation is provided on the Islands on a ten-days-on, four-days-off basis, or five-days-on, two-days-off so will need to have their own accommodation in or around Auckland for days off.  §This is a 3-year posting with the opportunity to extend a further 2 years.§          §Duties§          §            §Work collegially with other staff and contractors on the island.  Staff and contractors may be working on biodiversity, historic, cultural, community or visitor assets projects.  It is expected that all staff will work for understanding and commitment to the Departments health and safety culture "Injury Free, safe home every day".§            §Coordinate and work with community groups and volunteers§ infrastructure maintenance is an advantage.)  Specialist maintenance contractors are used when required.§            §Contribute to the management of visitor facilities, such as the track system and public toilets.§            §Contribute to the management of biodiversity programmes, including planting, weeds, flora and fauna monitoring§          §          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §You will be a self-motivated individual that can operate well both in an isolated environment and as part of a team.  With good practical skills, experience in working on jobTitle: Super Surgeon Needed Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50682063.txt	§Super Surgeon Needed§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Super Surgeon Needed§§Advertiser: §Animates NZ Holdings§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Are you keen to do mostly surgery and spend your week doing what you love? We have a group of clinics looking for an in-house surgeon to refer to. There is also opportunity for you to grow our other vets’ surgical skills if you love to teach and mentor.§ §Your expertise and specialist interest skills will provide our patients an option outside of referral practice, and allow our eager grads and experienced Vets the opportunity to continue learning and advancing their skills and knowledge alongside you! § §Where:§ §We have an exciting new opportunity for a Senior Vet with a special interest in surgery to join our awesome, busy multivet practice in Wellington. Our Petone clinic has a large team with an incredible caring and positive culture who enjoy fast paced small animal practice.§ §Wellington is known as the cultural hub of New Zealand, famous for its award-winning restaurants, tucked away bars, quirky cafes with awesome arts and music at your fingertips. Wellington was recently named “the coolest little capital in the world” by Lonely planet. It has everything from golden sand inner city beaches, to action packed adventures like mountain biking and kayaking. It’s a great place to call home.§ §About you:§ §Naturally, you’ll be passionate about doing the best for your patients, and skilled in a range of surgeries including orthopaedics. We are looking for a rockstar vet helping to lead our clinics into the future. Your enthusiasm and passion for your patients and clients is important to us, and you must enjoy working as part of a team.§ §You’ll also have:§ § §A recognised Bachelor of Veterinary Science or equivalent qualification§ §Proficiency in all-round medicine and surgery in companion animal practice § §Special interest surgical skills e.g. orthopaedics is beneficial, but not essential§ §Ideally you will have a certificate or membership in surgery, or be working towards achieving them (we can help with this!)§ §Why join us?§ §A generous salary reflective of your experience is just the tip of the iceberg.§ §We also offer:§ § §MANZCVS membership scholarships available worth $10,000§ §Generous continuing education budget§ §Opportunities to attend conferences§ §Internal career development and progression opportunities§ §Paid VCNZ Registration§ §Visa sponsorship for you and dependants if applicable§ §Relocation allowance if applicable§ §If this sounds like you, don’t miss out and apply today!§ §If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please email Kylie Lawson (GM - Clinics) §klawson@vetcaregroup.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Nursery, Viticulture and Winemaking Intern Job in Marlborough - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50682189.txt	§Nursery, Viticulture and Winemaking Intern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Nursery, Viticulture and Winemaking Intern§§Advertiser: §Only Human - HR Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§About the business§ § §The three organisations:§ §Marlborough based New Zealand Wineries, Ormond Nurseries and SLT have joined forces to create a new ongoing full-time role working across all three businesses during the wine growing year.§ §In a nutshell, New Zealand Wineries provide winemaking services for premium New Zealand and international wine producers, Ormond Nurseries specialises in propagating top quality grafted grape plants for the New Zealand wine industry and SLT use modern technology and operate top-quality equipment to provide a high quality of workmanship over the full range of vineyard operations.§ § §About the role§ § §Following the journey from vine to wine, this is an exciting opportunity to gain year-round full-time employment propagating vines, operating vineyard machinery and making wine. This role is unique in that the Intern will get to work across the full scope of nursery, vineyard and winemaking operations – ensuring there is a variety of work and learning opportunities.§ §From May to November the Intern will work at Ormond Nurseries as a Propagation Technician, duties for this role include; processing plants in the nursery, budwood and rootstock collection, grafting, boxing and planting grapevines.§ §From December to February the Intern will work at SLT where they will operate modern vineyard machinery to upkeep and maintain vineyards during the growing season for clients across the Marlborough district.§ §Finally, from March through to April the Intern will undertake vintage at New Zealand Wineries learning all the core aspects of wine making, including receiving grapes, processing into juice, barrel and tank work, filtering, fermenting and forklift operations.§ §Health and Safety is top priority across all the roles and full training will be provided.§ §Additionally, a clear remuneration and development plan is in place across the three employers to ensure the successful candidate grows and develops and is rewarded for the skills they acquire along the way. It is envisaged that high performers will be promoted to Team Leader positions.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §We are looking for several candidates to fulfil our requirements and the best thing is you do not need experience as full training will be provided.§ §You will however be motivated, willing and flexible. With high energy you will be physically fit. Change orientated with loads of initiative you will be practical. You will also be able to work an iPhone and various Apps. Most importantly you will be a team player.§ §If you are looking for a new and exciting opportunity, please apply using the Seek link now.§ §Please attach your CV and outline in your cover letter why you think you would be well suited to this opportunity and what skills and attributes you can bring.§ §For further information please email Kirsty Trolove at §kirsty@onlyhuman.co.nz§ §Applications close by 5 November 2020. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Field Support Job in Waikato - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50682641.txt	§Field Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Field Support§§Advertiser: §Halter§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§We are an award-winning, innovative startup, designing and building advanced technology to automate farming. Our world leading guidance control techniques shift cows remotely removing the need for fences and eliminating the manual nature of shifting animals. Halter aims to enable a new generation of more efficient, sustainable farming globally.§ § § §What will you be working on?§ §Our GPS enabled, solar powered devices are designed to remotely guide cows. These require robust, long-range wireless communication and conservative power consumption. They also require multiple levels of control software in order to record everything about the animal, understand it and act on this information accordingly. We use this to monitor stock health, feed, behaviour and emotion so that farmers can better understand and treat the needs of each animal. We are always pushing to use the latest advancements in technology and we want you to be a part of this process. Being a young, dynamic company, there is potential for a person in this role to have a big influence on Halter’s future direction.§ § § §Core Duties§ § § §Support the onboarding, training and implementation of the Halter system on customers' farms, ensuring all relevant farm owners, managers and workers are able to successfully use the system§ § § §Master the art of collar fitting and delight our customers by kicking off the deployment process§ § § §Assist Halter’s production engineers in preparing our collars for deployment§ § § §Build genuine relationships with our farmers and their teams, families and animals§ § § §Provide transparency to the customer and drive communication and coordination between the customer and the company to ensure we deliver on our commitments§ § § §When not working on customer implementation, work as part of the team to deliver on the day-to-day operations of the test farm § § § §Act as a role model of organisational values, behaviours, operational and farming best practices.§ § § §Ensure the highest standards of personal health and safety, ethics, compliance and environmental performance throughout the farming operation§ § § § §Who are we looking for?§ § § §Strong practical hands on practical experience working with dairy cattle§ § § §Relevant university degree is preferred, but not essential§ § § §Excellent time management skills§ § § §Strong communication skills§ § § §Creative problem solving abilities§ § § §Ability to work weekends§ § § § §This role is about two things - supporting Halter’s farmers all the way through the process to make their farms more productive and efficient, and building genuine and lasting relationships with farmers. These objectives are naturally intertwined and the best candidates will be motivated and excited excelling in both areas. The role is well-suited to a generalist who is as comfortable sitting around the kitchen table talking as they are in the milkshed and don’t mind getting their hands dirty and helping out on the farm!§ §We are looking for big thinkers who know how to execute. We’re looking for people who are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where they will be challenged on a daily basis. To succeed you will need to be able to learn quickly and utilise your own initiative while working under pressure and to tight deadlines.§ §If this sounds like you, click apply§ §and submit your CV and cover letter today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50684363.txt	§Dog Handlers/Drivers and Farm Managers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Dog Handlers/Drivers and Farm Managers§§Advertiser: §Pets and Pats§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Pets and Pats - Doggy Day Care & Farmstay - Albany § §Pets and Pats is a luxury farm based 20 mins from the CBD in Dairy Flat, near Albany where dogs come for daycare, training or to stay overnight.§ §We started 10 years ago so have loyal and discerning clients throughout Auckland.   For convenience we have brand new customised school vans that pick up and drop off the dogs from their homes to the farm.§ §We have acres of play paddocks and bush, a dedicated doggie swimming pool and a tennis court for our ball obsessed kids.  The dogs enjoy their own safe, private, gated country estate where they have plenty of room to run, play and receive plenty of cuddles. With only a small number of clients and a 24/7 dedicated team of petcare professionals with years of experience and qualifications, parents can relax knowing their baby is safe and happy with us.§ §Our boutique service means we have clients as young as 12 weeks and as old as 18, and we cater for the pawty animals, the lounge lizards, the athletes and the more shy and retiring types. The farm is like a resort where the doggies can enjoy doing as much or as little as they like.§ § § §About the role§ § § §Due to growth we are currently recruiting fives roles.  About the roles. § §1.   Remuera Dog Handler and Driver§ §Start and finish in Remuera Mon-Fri 7;30am to 4:30pm§ §This position involves picking up our central Auckland dogs and bringing them to our farm for the day and then dropping them home tired and happy in our customised Dog School Bus.  You are responsible for transporting the dogs safely and for exercising, loving and looking after them while they are with us. As you will also be seeing clients when you pick up and drop off their furchildren you will have good customer service skills.§ §2. Ponsonby Dog Handler and Driver§ §Start and finish in Ponsonby Mon-Fri 7:30am to 4:30pm:- same role as above§ §3.    Dairy Flat Dog Handler and School bus driver§ §Start and finish at our Dairy Flat Farm, Mon-Fri 7:00am to 6 pm - same role as above§ §4. Dairy Flat Farm Managers Mon-Sun 7am to 6pm§ §5. Dairy Flat Weekend Lodging Supervisors Sat and Sun 7am to 6pm§ §Start and finish in Dairy Flat 7am-6pm Sat and Sun§ §The above positions are farm based and involve looking after our daycare dogs who are dropped off by their parents, our lodgers and the farm.  You will be loving, feeding, exercising, washing dogs and also maintenance jobs around the farm.§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Country estate that has been designed around the safety and fun for our doggies and team members.§Enjoy working with a team of pet care professionals with years of experience and qualifications.§Opportunities to expand and grow within the team is encouraged and supported.§Customized vehicles provided making transportation of the doggies safe for them and our drivers. §Work with dogs everyday§A fun supportive team§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS - NON NEGOTIABLE**§ §You will be an experienced dog handler, with the qualifications and experience to back it up. It's not enough to say you have your own dog or you "love" dogs.§ §You are kind and caring, with a strong attention to detail and safety.  Dogs and people love you.  You can work well within our small, close-knit team or independently. You are, dependable, responsible, reliable, trustworthy and honest.  You are also physically fit.  You have a strong work ethic and a positive attitude and don't mind rolling your sleeves up.  You are happy to work outdoors in all sorts of weather. You will have a full clean driver's license, be able to drive vans and have a clean police record. Finally please note, when you work with animals, there is a lot of cleaning involved,  so you must be comfortable with this.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Head Veterinary Nurse Job in Auckland - SEEK

With a high level of professionalism and technical skills, you will be enthusiastic to pass on your knowledge to develop your team’s skill-set, while also broadening your own. The work is varied and you and your team play a key role in ensuring that the animals receive a high standard of care.§        §What we can offer you§        §· The chance to make an actual difference for New Zealand’s animals, and work with a team of highly passionate people§        §· The opportunity and support to further develop and strengthen your nursing and leadership skills.§        §· qualification with at least 5 years' experience.§        §· Have the ability to lead and motivate a team on an ongoing basis.§        §· Be confident in surgical and hospital nursing (including animal handling skills, general anaesthetic monitoring, surgical and inpatient nursing).§        §· Be a self-motivated team player, who is enthusiastic and passionate about animal welfare.§        §· Provide mentorship and support to the vet nurses, students and volunteers in the effective and efficient care of animals in the centre.§        §· Working closely with a team of highly proficient, skills.§        §· Strong attention to detail and ability to monitor and manage Controlled Drugs register§        §· Have a flexible approach to the hours of work, and be able to prioritise and effectively manage workloads.§        §· Have excellent computer skills.§        §· Demonstrate empathy and resilience§        §· Have the ability to work in a fast paced environment and must have a love for working with both people and animals.§        §Who we are§ §        §SPCA is one of the best loved and most respected charities in New Zealand, with a proud history of helping animals in need and advocating for animal welfare since 1872. §        §Does this sound like the ideal role for you? With a high level of professionalism and technical skills, you will be enthusiastic to pass on your knowledge to develop your team’s skill-set, while also broadening your own. The work is varied and you and your team play a key role in ensuring that the animals receive a high standard of care.§What we can offer you§· The chance to make an actual difference for New Zealand’s animals, and work with a team of highly passionate people§· The opportunity and support to further develop and strengthen your nursing and leadership skills.§· Onsite parking §· Regular rostered hours with no late nights and minimal weekend work§What we need from you§ §Our ideal candidate will:§· Have a Veterinary nursing qualification with at least 5 years' experience.§· Have the ability to lead and motivate a team on an ongoing basis.§· Be confident in surgical and hospital nursing (including animal handling skills, general anaesthetic monitoring, surgical and inpatient nursing).§· Be a self-motivated team player, who is enthusiastic and passionate about animal welfare.§· Provide mentorship and support to the vet nurses, students and volunteers in the effective and efficient care of animals in the centre.§· Working closely with a team of highly proficient, strongly motivated Veterinarians including the Head Vet who will provide positive support and expertise§· Be able to prioritise and effectively manage workloads with excellent time management skills.§· Strong attention to detail and ability to monitor and manage Controlled Drugs register§· Have a flexible approach to the hours of work, and be able to prioritise and effectively manage workloads.§· Have excellent computer skills.§· Demonstrate empathy and resilience§· Have the ability to work in a fast paced environment and must have a love for working with both people and animals.§Who we are§ §SPCA is one of the best loved and most respected charities in New Zealand, with a proud history of helping animals in need and advocating for animal welfare since 1872. §Does this sound like the ideal role for you? Join the team and experience the satisfaction of contributing to make Wellington City a green and great place to be. Our team is responsible for;§Day to day maintenance of over 14,000 street trees and 700km of road network§Maintaining Wellington's Parks and Reserves, including Karori cemetery, Botanic Gardens and Town Belt§Contributing to the safe and efficient day to day running of the team and its resources§In this role, you will be responsible for carrying out all operations relating to tree works and assist with the development of the Arboriculture team. jobText: TXT/50685922.txt	§Field Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Field Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Hill Laboratories§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Exciting full-time opportunity to join a leading New Zealand laboratory in the role of Field Team Leader for our team based in Mount Maunganui, Bay of Plenty. This team operates seven days a week during the kiwifruit season and collects fruit samples from orchards for maturity and residue testing a key component of Zespri's assurance programmes.§The role§The Field Team Leader will work closely with the Field Operations Manager to manage all aspects of field operations. This will include recruitment, training, organising, scheduling and coordinating daily operations and the day-to-day management of staff ensuring that daily collection targets are achieved. This role is more than just a desk job and will spend time not only in the office, but also out in the orchards working with the team to ensure both quality, safety and productivity targets are being achieved.§About you:§May have a tertiary qualification in Agriculture/Horticulture or management discipline (preferred)§Previous staff management/supervisory experience in a similar role, including scheduling and staff training§Experience working with casual/seasonal staff or the kiwifruit industry an advantage§Excellent operational focus with attention to time management, prioritisation and work allocation to achieve the required turn-around times§Excellent organisational and communication skills§Comfortable with technology such as smart phones and productivity software§Team player who is able to work collaboratively and create a good working relationship with other staff in the team and across the business§Actively contributes to and supports change initiatives§The successful candidate will have a proven history of high personal and professional work standards in a field based environment with at least three years previous field and staff management experience.§What we offer§We are offering a competitive package for the right candidate.§Hill Laboratories is a commercial provider of analytical services to a wide range of customers in New Zealand and overseas. We provide an excellent environment for fostering and developing talent and enabling innovation in a family-friendly, values driven and mature New Zealand owned business.§Our staff gain value from a wide range of benefits such as job related learning and development opportunities, a career advancement framework, subsidised employee schemes as well as more holistic benefits such as social events and health initiatives.§How to apply§If this role sounds like a good fit for you, click apply now via the link or on our website.§Please include a cover letter with your CV detailing why you feel you are the best candidate for this position.§Applications close Monday, 19 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50686312.txt	§Senior Regional Adviser (Canterbury)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Regional Adviser (Canterbury)§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Senior Regional Adviser (Canterbury) §        §          §"Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi" (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the role§          §This is an opportunity to be part of an exciting team that supports the primary sector and rural communities to be thriving, sustainable and resilient.§          §The role will be part of the Rural Communities and Farming Support group, and will have the chance to lead and participate in some key pieces of work, including:§          §            §Supporting rural communities, farmers, growers, and their families through changing times and challenging situations. We have a key role in responses and recovery following adverse events affecting the primary sector and rural communities.§            §Providing regional intelligence on issues and opportunities affecting the primary sector and rural communities, and sharing on the ground perspective into policies, programmes and services.§          §          §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako - Skills & Experience§          §To be successful, we are looking for someone who has the following attributes:§          §            §Experienced analyst, ability to think critically and provide intellectual leadership§            §Relevant technical experience and qualifications, such as a background in economics, applied sciences (e.g. agriculture), public policy or resource management, and able to apply this expertise across the primary sector and rural communities§            §Experience/knowledge of the ‘Machinery of Government'§            §Excellent relationship management skills, able to relate to a range of key regional and sector stakeholders, and front and resolve complex issues§            §Excellent communication skills, including an ability to prepare high quality advice (written and verbal) and credibly represent interests§            §Ability to apply a high degree of independent initiative within MPI frameworks.§            §Local and primary sector knowledge and networks relevant to this role.§            §Project / programme management skills §          §          §If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a strong team of professionals, then we want to hear from you!§          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) is responsible for ‘Growing and Protecting New Zealand'. It's no mean feat, and we have a team of hard working and passionate people in a variety of roles both on the ground and in the office supporting us to make this happen.§          §MPI has a focus on career pathways and we will work with you to help you grow.§          §To see the benefits of working at MPI, please click §here§          §Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to apply§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click on the "APPLY" button or visit our MPI Careers site.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers' portal. §          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options. §          §Applications close: Sunday 18 October 2020§          §If you have any questions about the role, please contact §Vivien.Smith@mpi.govt.nz§.  §          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. jobText: TXT/50686472.txt	§Farm Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Farm Manager§§Advertiser: §Rural Directions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Farm Manager §      §Patoka – Hawke’s Bay §      §        §Sheep, Beef & Dairy Grazing Operation §        §Incentive/Equity Partnership Opportunities §        §Excellent Local Community §      §      §        §Glencoe Livestock Company is a business with a proud heritage located in the established farming district of Patoka, an area with a reputation for consistent seasons and excellent farming conditions. The property is a 560ha sheep, beef and dairy grazing operation that has seen significant investment across fencing, water systems and pasture/forages to ensure it is purpose-built to suit the livestock systems in place; the Owners place high value on improvements and aesthetics.§        §This mixed-enterprise farming business is structured to capture the seasonal opportunities over and above the status quo policy of mixed aged ewes, terminal cows and dairy grazing. All sheep progeny are finished and there is also a trade element on the designated clover finishing blocks as conditions allow. Dairy grazing Heifers arrive on-farm in December for 18 months, with two age groups on farm from December to May.§        §The Owners of this property are seeking a Farm Manager who is motivated to develop a long-term relationship with them and explore the possibility of entering into some form of equity partnership agreement in the future. From the outset of the relationship, an incentive for superseding agreed target growth rates will be in place for the dairy grazers as a mechanism of taking the first step towards aligned goals for all.§        §This Farm Manager role will suit those with excellent communication skills who are driven to measure results, document their planning and strategise in order to seek opportunities. Tools and support will be supplied for the benefit of all parties with a particular focus on utilising technology to assist in growing farm productivity and the appointees’ capability. FarmIQ (operational) Farmax (strategic) and Figured (fiscal) are the operating tools currently supporting the business.§        §Patoka has an excellent local community with a well-resourced school and early childhood centre. The three bedroom house on-farm has just undergone renovations including a new kitchen and extended living room with great views and deck. If progression is your focus then this role must be considered!§        §Employee references are available by request.§        §To view a Job Information Pack or to apply, please visit www.ruraldirections.co.nz or phone the Rural Directions team in confidence on §06 871 0450§ (Reference #2525).§        §Applications close 5pm Monday, 26th October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Glencoe Livestock Company is a business with a proud heritage located in the established farming district of Patoka, an area with a reputation for consistent seasons and excellent farming conditions. The property is a 560ha sheep, beef and dairy grazing operation that has seen significant investment across fencing, water systems and pasture/forages to ensure it is purpose-built to suit the livestock systems in place; the Owners place high value on improvements and aesthetics.§ §This mixed-enterprise farming business is structured to capture the seasonal opportunities over and above the status quo policy of mixed aged ewes, terminal cows and dairy grazing. All sheep progeny are finished and there is also a trade element on the designated clover finishing blocks as conditions allow. Dairy grazing Heifers arrive on-farm in December for 18 months, with two age groups on farm from December to May.§ §The Owners of this property are seeking a Farm Manager who is motivated to develop a long-term relationship with them and explore the possibility of entering into some form of equity partnership agreement in the future. From the outset of the relationship, an incentive for superseding agreed target growth rates will be in place for the dairy grazers as a mechanism of taking the first step towards aligned goals for all.§ §This Farm Manager role will suit those with excellent communication skills who are driven to measure results, document their planning and strategise in order to seek opportunities. Tools and support will be supplied for the benefit of all parties with a particular focus on utilising technology to assist in growing farm productivity and the appointees’ capability. FarmIQ (operational) Farmax (strategic) and Figured (fiscal) are the operating tools currently supporting the business.§ §Patoka has an excellent local community with a well-resourced school and early childhood centre. The three bedroom house on-farm has just undergone renovations including a new kitchen and extended living room with great views and deck. If progression is your focus then this role must be considered!§ §Employee references are available by request.§ §To view a Job Information Pack or to apply, please visit www.ruraldirections.co.nz or phone the Rural Directions team in confidence on §06 871 0450§ (Reference #2525).§ §Applications close 5pm Monday, 26th October 2020.§§§§
