As Manager, you will be responsible for managing staff, strategic planning, maintaining relationships with landowners, meeting sales targets, and supporting the successful production of honey.§ §To be successful in this role, you will have:§Demonstrated supervisory experience in successful commercial honey businesses or similar honey-based industries including a sound knowledge of beekeeping, Queen rearing and breeding (minimum of five years in position of responsibility)§Experience in management principles involved in planning, budgeting, leadership, and management of people and resources§Relevant tertiary degree (Apiculture or similar) and DECA certified§Ability to build and maintain relationships with landowners and customers§Ability to work effectively independently and demonstrate initiative§Excellent team management skills, and the ability to communicate information and ideas§Ability to liaise and develop constructive internal relationships§ §As an Iwi owned organisation, a knowledge of Te Reo and tikanga Māori would be beneficial (knowledge of Ngāti Whare Iwi, history, settlement and people would also be advantageous).§ §The start date for this role will be December 2020.§ §For more information, please email §mel@ngatiwhareholdings.co.nz§ to obtain a job description. §OR§Submit your covering letter and CV by email to the above email address or post to:§Whare Honey Limited Partnership§PO Box 1712§ROTORUA 3040§ §Closing Date: Friday, 30 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Maturity Support Manager Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50687519.txt	§Maturity Support Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Maturity Support Manager§§Advertiser: §Zespri International Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Zespri is more than simply the world’s single-largest marketer of kiwifruit. We like to think of ourselves as fruit on a mission and as rebels with a cause: to help people, communities and the environment around the world thrive through the goodness of kiwifruit.§ §We supply one of the world’s healthiest little superfruits to millions of people around the world in more than 50 markets. We are one of New Zealand’s best-known international brands, dedicated to creating sustainable long-term value for growers.§ §We are growing quickly, driven by our success in engaging more and more consumers and by offering the world’s best kiwifruit 12 months of the year. We have bold ambitions and aim to grow sales from approximately $3 billion in 2018 to $4.5 billion by 2025.§ § § § §Maturity Support Manager§ This is a newly created role within Zespri as the organisation builds an in-house maturity clearance function. This role will oversee the Maturity Clearance function.§ §This roles purpose is to ensure a high level of performance amongst the Maturity Clearance System (MCS) Support Team and service providers through day to day management and direct feedback.§   § §Responsibilities:  § § §Implement and manage the various robust processes put in place for the administration, support, and management of the Zespri MCS.§ §Build and maintain strong relationships with postharvest, representing MCS team and relevant industry groups and forums.§ §Oversee the distribution of workflows between the MCS Support Assistants set out by the Team Leader and provide leadership and a mentor responsibility to these roles.§ §Ensure the Maturity Support Team and service providers are meeting their KPIs.§ §Own the contract management process for service providers.§ §Contribute to the business requirements for any Zespri innovation funded projects related to fruit maturity sampling and testing.§ §Review and assess the impact of the industry’s ongoing requirements for Zespri’s MCS, in collaboration with the Global Technical and Quality team who are responsible for collating and determining the industry’s ongoing requirements.§ §Oversee the delivery of agreed enhancements to the Zespri MCS.§ §   §   § §Qualifications and Experience:§  §   § § §Tertiary education or equivalent relevant experience Ability to manage teams remotely§ §Understanding of Zespri’s global supply position§ §Experience in Customer Service (minimum of 2 years preferred)§ §Experience in management of at least 4-5 staff (minimum of 4 years preferred)§ §Experience in Vendor Management§ §Experience in contract management and services procurement§ §Technically skilled in Word, Excel, SAP, CRM packages, SharePoint, and other admin support software tools§ §Strong Communication Skills§ §Industry knowledge is strongly preferred§ §   §   § All applications should be submitted by Friday 23rd October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50687630.txt	§Dog Groomer/Valet§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Dog Groomer/Valet§§Advertiser: §icu BIG§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Nose to Tail§ is a recognised landmark on Bush Rd in Albany. We've been loving and looking after dogs for almost 18 years. We got great feedback in a recent customer survey, our valued clients scored us 87/100 as a business that they would recommend to others - those in the know tell us that's a high score for any business. At heart we're fairly humble and while we are committed to doing a great job we are also focused on how we can improve.§ §Our core offer is all about Grooming and Valet wash. Nose to Tail also offers a DIY service, has been at the forefront of offering hydrotherapy to care for dogs recovering or ageing and has a dynamic retail offer.§ §In the current climate we know it's key that we keep doing a great job and providing excellent service - central to that is having outstanding people in our team.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We are strong believers in the phrase 'Attitude is everything'. As much as we are looking for someone who has dog grooming experience we also need someone who is flexible and willing to assist in other parts of the business.§ §The role will include Grooming, Valeting and supporting other team members with their duties. Not only do we need someone who is awesome with our 4 legged friends, your ability to deliver a great service to our 2 legged ones is also key.§ §You will be rostered 40 hours and your willingness to be flexible (weekends and some public holidays) is key.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §In return for your skills, expertise and dedication, you'll be provided with a dynamic and supportive working environment, a competitive hourly rate, training and uniforms.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §The fact that you can groom and love working with dogs is a given. As you are probably aware the scope of this kind of work requires stamina so you need to be not just physically fit but also have patience and mental perseverance - not all our 'customers' want a haircut. Experience suggests that the role has variety and with that in mind we'll ask you to do other team/customer focused activities within Nose to Tail.§ §In the first instance apply with a CV and a brief letter outlining your suitability for the role. THANKS for taking the time to show interest in our business.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have customer service experience?§What is the maximum weight that you are comfortable and able to lift?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have professional dog grooming experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50688075.txt	§Orchard Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchard Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Craigmore§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Orchard Development Manager§                                                §NZ managed large Agricultural business§New position (Based in Kerikeri)§Excellent opportunity to be involved in the ground up development of orchards - Horticulture sector§Craigmore manages farm and forest investments throughout New Zealand. Our aim is to be a long term producer of high quality food and forest products whilst managing land sustainably, developing our people and maintaining a balance of growing and diversifying existing investment strategies. Being reasonably new to the Horticulture sector there is an opportunity for growth, and we are looking for an Orchard Development Manager in Northland to support our Business Manager.§Reporting to the Business Manager based in Kerikeri your primary responsibility will be to work with the Business Manager to manage the development of orchards. § Key accountabilities in the role include:§Assisting the Business Manager to proactively manage contractor’s day to day activities§Manage orchard development plans, ensuring they are on track and any risks identified at the earliest opportunity§Create productive relationships with contractors§Assist the Business Manager and contractors to manage orchards§Developing your own orchard management knowledge§A diploma in Horticulture or related field and/or 5+ years proven experience in the Horticulture sector is a must.  A natural ability to relate to others and build relationships is essential to this role.  You will be working for a very experienced Horticulture expert and will have the opportunity to develop your own orchard management skills under his mentoring so the desire to learn is critical in this role.§If this sounds like you and you are ready to take on a position that provides you with the opportunity to develop your skills and experience, click on the APPLY button and submit your CV and cover letter.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§

jobTitle: ZQrx Project Coordinator Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50688268.txt	§ZQrx Project Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§ZQrx Project Coordinator§§Advertiser: §The New Zealand Merino Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§Who is The New Zealand Merino Company (NZM)?§ §Formed in 2001, NZM is an integrated sales, marketing and innovation company that continues to transform the wool industry. NZM's model moves away from treating wool as a commodity and offers more sustainable solutions for the industry, promoting direct fibre supply contracts based on fair prices that both the grower supplier (farmers) and brand partners can work with.§ §NZM is an award-winning New Zealand success story. Through innovation and their brand stories they have transformed New Zealand merino into premium branded fibre and meat sought after by discerning customers globally.§ §NZM are on a mission to add to the team with smart go-getters who thrive on bringing great ideas to life in a dynamic, high energy team to create value for our grower suppliers and brand partners alike.§ §What is ZQrx?§ §ZQrx is a programme designed by NZM, that defines regenerative farming principles and how they apply to growers, and to our broader supply and brand partners businesses. This is implemented on farm by supporting growers to benchmark their business and accelerating small meaningful actions that have the power to solve big global challenges. ZQrx represents a journey of continuous improvement.§ §We need a superstar to:§ § §provide extension and support to growers and the NZM team in communicating and executing the ZQrx programme§ §assist with research and development (R&D) activities associated with ZQrx programme§ §undertake on farm assessments and projects to demonstrate ZQrx progress and performance§ §provide input and assistance to the wider ZQrx team that brings to life the ZQrx vision for growers and brand partners alike§ §What skills, experiences and attitudes are needed§ §You will have a degree in environmental science, sustainable agriculture, or an associated field, and preferably 2 years proven experience within a similar role. § §You will have a deep knowledge of farming systems, land management, sustainability, and general farm management.  Although not essential, a farming background would be desirable, and empathy with the farming community is a must.§ §You will be a gifted science communicator, capable of distilling complex concepts to simple and compelling sound bites.  § §To have the ‘X factor’ you will be solution focused, forward thinking and enjoy contributing to new ideas.  Being organised and having an exceptional eye for detail will be one of your strengths.§ §We are looking for someone who is passionate in this field, a real self-starter who enjoys variety within their work.§ §You will thrive in a busy and dynamic environment that allows you to be part of a team, but also work independently. § §As this role will see you getting out on farms, a current drivers license is essential.  § §Sounds like you, then apply§ §If you feel this role is for you, hit the ‘apply now’ button to submit your CV and cover letter.§ §For a copy of the position description please visit the careers section of our website https://www.nzmerino.co.nz/§ §Applications will close on Sunday 1 November unless an appointment is made earlier.§§§§

jobTitle: Veterinary nurse Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50689489.txt	§Veterinary nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary nurse§§Advertiser: §The Village Vet Paihia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§The Village Vet Paihia, in Paihia, Bay of Islands, is looking for a qualified veterinary nurse to work 3.5  full days a week, although the hours are negotiable and could be reduced to fit in with collecting children from school etc.§We are a small, friendly but well-equipped provider of small animal veterinary services and work to high professional standards. We allow 30 minutes for consultations to communicate well with our clients as well as to reduce work stress. You would be very well supported working one on one with a very experienced and supportive veterinarian. There is no after hours requirement. We have a wonderful clientelle who really love and look after their pets. We also do some native bird work, including treating moreporks, penguins and kiwis!  §We need a vet nurse who likes people as much as animals, can monitor anesthesia effectively and above all things, enjoys their work.§If this sounds like you please email Natalie at §natternatter@xtra.co.nz§ or phone §09 4026155§.§Feel free to look at our website wwwthevillagevetpaihia.com which links to our facebook page.§We pay well and the rate will depend on the applicants experience. We would consider a newly graduated vet nurse as well.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years' experience do you have as a perioperative / surgical nurse?§§§

jobText: TXT/50692602.txt	§Project Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Lead§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Wanganui§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Project Lead §        §          §Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§          §·   §          §·       §Establish extension service projects with key regional partners§          §·       §Share information & provide insights and advice to NZ's farmers & growers§          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua§ - §About MPI§          §MPI provides policy and regulatory advice, market access and trade services, and manages major regulatory systems of biosecurity, food safety, forestry, fisheries management, and animal welfare. MPI also has strong relationships with other government agencies, primarily within the economic, border, and natural resources sectors. With the New Zealand economy set to grow, MPI's important role in leading, regulating, and enabling the primary sectors will only increase. The Agriculture and Investment Services Business unit works with those on the land today and in the future. Supporting communities of farmers and growers to achieve their aspirations, and to meet the expectations of customers, government, and the public. And investing in tomorrow's world, as partners to increase primary industries' value and sustainability.§          §Mō tō mātou rōpū§ - §About our team§          §The Extension Services team is responsible for delivery of practical advice, information and tools for farmers and growers to improve their operations on the ground.  One of the ways we will achieve this is by pulling together clusters of farmers and growers in different regions across the country, to share information, insights and advice with like-minded people who understand local issues.  This initiative sits in the wider Productive and Sustainable Land Use Programme. §          §Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§          §We have an exciting new opportunity for a Project Lead North Island (extension services). MPI has clear targets to achieve through the Extension Services Programme, this role has responsibility for delivering extension services projects in our regions.  The role focuses on establishing extension service projects with key regional partners and plays an on-going governance role to ensure effective delivery for intended outcomes.   To be successful in this role you will need to have experience in the governance and management of projects ideally in the primary industries.  You will need to have excellent relationship management skills to ensure the project is well connected to communities and the primary sectors to achieve the outcomes regions need to thrive in the future.§          §Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - §How to Apply:§          §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          §In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand or via Skype.§          §If you have any questions about the role, you may contact §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§          §Applications close Sunday 18 October 2020§          § §          § §          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§          §Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§          §Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§          §We have an exciting new opportunity for a Project Lead North Island (extension services). MPI has clear targets to achieve through the Extension Services Programme, this role has responsibility for delivering extension services projects in our regions.  The role focuses on establishing extension service projects with key regional partners and plays an on-going governance role to ensure effective delivery for intended outcomes.   To be successful in this role you will need to have experience in the governance and management of projects ideally in the primary industries.  You will need to have excellent relationship management skills to ensure the project is well connected to communities and the primary sectors to achieve the outcomes regions need to thrive in the future.§          § §          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua§ - §About MPI§          § §          §MPI provides policy and regulatory advice, market access and trade services, and manages major regulatory systems of biosecurity, food safety, forestry, fisheries management, and animal welfare. MPI also has strong relationships with other government agencies, primarily within the economic, border, and natural resources sectors. With the New Zealand economy set to grow, MPI's important role in leading, regulating, and enabling the primary sectors will only increase. The Agriculture and Investment Services Business unit works with those on the land today and in the future. Supporting communities of farmers and growers to achieve their aspirations, and to meet the expectations of customers, government, and the public. And investing in tomorrow's world, as partners to increase primary industries' value and sustainability.§          § §          §Mō tō mātou rōpū§ - §About our team§          § §          §The Extension Services team is responsible for delivery of practical advice, information and tools for farmers and growers to improve their operations on the ground.  One of the ways we will achieve this is by pulling together clusters of farmers and growers in different regions across the country, to share information, insights and advice with like-minded people who understand local issues.  This initiative sits in the wider Productive and Sustainable Land Use Programme. §          § §          §Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - And investing in tomorrow's world, as partners to increase primary industries' value and sustainability.§Mō tō mātou rōpū§ - §About our team§The Extension Services team is responsible for delivery of practical advice, information and tools for farmers and growers to improve their operations on the ground.  One of the ways we will achieve this is by pulling together clusters of farmers and growers in different regions across the country, to share information, insights and advice with like-minded people who understand local issues.  This initiative sits in the wider Productive and Sustainable Land Use Programme. §Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§We have an exciting new opportunity for a Project Lead North Island (extension services). MPI has clear targets to achieve through the Extension Services Programme, this role has responsibility for delivering extension services projects in our regions.  The role focuses on establishing extension service projects with key regional partners and plays an on-going governance role to ensure effective delivery for intended outcomes.   To be successful in this role you will need to have experience in the governance and management of projects ideally in the primary industries.  You will need to have excellent relationship management skills to ensure the project is well connected to communities and the primary sectors to achieve the outcomes regions need to thrive in the future.§Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - §How to Apply:§To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand or via Skype.§If you have any questions about the role, you may contact §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§§Applications close Sunday 18 October 2020§ § § §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§§Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§We have an exciting new opportunity for a Project Lead North Island (extension services). MPI has clear targets to achieve through the Extension Services Programme, this role has responsibility for delivering extension services projects in our regions.  The role focuses on establishing extension service projects with key regional partners and plays an on-going governance role to ensure effective delivery for intended outcomes.   To be successful in this role you will need to have experience in the governance and management of projects ideally in the primary industries.  You will need to have excellent relationship management skills to ensure the project is well connected to communities and the primary sectors to achieve the outcomes regions need to thrive in the future.§ §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua§ - §About MPI§ §MPI provides policy and regulatory advice, market access and trade services, and manages major regulatory systems of biosecurity, food safety, forestry, fisheries management, and animal welfare. MPI also has strong relationships with other government agencies, primarily within the economic, border, and natural resources sectors. With the New Zealand economy set to grow, MPI's important role in leading, regulating, and enabling the primary sectors will only increase. The Agriculture and Investment Services Business unit works with those on the land today and in the future. Supporting communities of farmers and growers to achieve their aspirations, and to meet the expectations of customers, government, and the public. And investing in tomorrow's world, as partners to increase primary industries' value and sustainability.§ §Mō tō mātou rōpū§ - §About our team§ §The Extension Services team is responsible for delivery of practical advice, information and tools for farmers and growers to improve their operations on the ground.  One of the ways we will achieve this is by pulling together clusters of farmers and growers in different regions across the country, to share information, insights and advice with like-minded people who understand local issues.  This initiative sits in the wider Productive and Sustainable Land Use Programme. § §Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - §How to Apply:§To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand or via Skype.§If you have any questions about the role, you may contact §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§§Applications close Sunday 18 October 2020§ § §§§§

We have grown more than twentyfold since 2002, and we aspire to grow even further in the future. We have state-of-the-art wineries and world-class vineyards in the prime grape growing regions of New Zealand and Australia, and we focus exclusively on making the world’s most sought-after Super Premium wines and brands including Oyster Bay and Barossa Valley Estate.  However, we believe deeply that it is our people that bring our plans to life, turn our goals into reality, and truly make the difference.§        §We are looking for people who want an opportunity to be part of our passionate team where there is plenty of scope to reach your full potential.§        §Work with us in a supportive environment where quality outcomes are our goal. You will get a variety of opportunities to share your skills and develop knowledge for a recognised career in vineyard operations.§  §We are all about supporting our people, we recognise and reward experience, offer on-going practical skill-building opportunities where we place you in a role that matches your skills, training, and aspirations.§  §Apply your practical knowledge and skills on a day-to-day basis;§ § §Tractor and machinery operations§ §Spray applications§ §Irrigation operations§ §Hands-on vineyard maintenance§ §Harvest operations§ §Please apply via our website or call Delegat National Viticulture Office for an application form on §(03) 572 6300§, 1st Floor, Riverview House, 13 Alfred Street, Blenheim 7201. §§§§

The Engineer's role is to work closely with the Production Teams - not only to ensure the efficient operation of our machinery, but to play a major part in the Continuous Improvement of our operations.  This permanent role attracts a competitive salary and reports to the Production Manager.§        § §        §Key Responsibilities§        § §        §          §Carry out planned & breakdown maintenance, including related documentation.§          §Optimise plant reliability and minimise operating costs§          §Proactively work to make improvements on cost, quality and downtime.§          §Looking for opportunities to truly make a difference§          §Manage relationships internal and external customers.§        §        § §        §Your profile§        § §        §          §A relevant Mechanical or Electrical Trade Certificate and relevant experience§          §Excellent communication and leadership skills and the ability to work effectively with others.§          §Experience in recruitment, development, motivating and retaining staff.§          §Well-developed planning, analytical and process skills with a high level of attention to detail.§          §Ability to apply conflict resolution techniques.§          §A good working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, Inventory software.§          §Ability to manage and prioritise multiple or conflicting priorities in a highly complex deadline driven environment.§          §System and process improvement mindset.§        §        § §        §Apata Group Ltd operates a drug and alcohol free workplace. This role is considered safety critical and accordingly testing for this is incorporated in our pre-employment screening and ongoing random drug testing program.§        § §        §A position description available on request. §        § §        §Applications close on 19th June 2020 at 5pm§      §      §      §    §  §§§Apata Group Limited is a fast growing long established and highly regarded post-harvest facility, specialising in the packing and cool storage of both Kiwifruit and Avocados. The Engineer's role is to work closely with the Production Teams - not only to ensure the efficient operation of our machinery, but to play a major part in the Continuous Improvement of our operations.  This permanent role attracts a competitive salary and reports to the Production Manager.§  § §  §Key Responsibilities§  § § § §Carry out planned & breakdown maintenance, including related documentation.§ §Optimise plant reliability and minimise operating costs§ §Proactively work to make improvements on cost, quality and downtime.§ §Looking for opportunities to truly make a difference§ §Manage relationships internal and external customers.§ § §  §Your profile§  § § § §A relevant Mechanical or Electrical Trade Certificate and relevant experience§ §Excellent communication and leadership skills and the ability to work effectively with others.§ §Experience in recruitment, development, motivating and retaining staff.§ §Well-developed planning, analytical and process skills with a high level of attention to detail.§ §Ability to apply conflict resolution techniques.§ §A good working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, Inventory software.§ §Ability to manage and prioritise multiple or conflicting priorities in a highly complex deadline driven environment.§ §System and process improvement mindset.§ § §  §Apata Group Ltd operates a drug and alcohol free workplace. This role is considered safety critical and accordingly testing for this is incorporated in our pre-employment screening and ongoing random drug testing program.§  § §  §A position description available on request. §  § §  §Applications close on 19th June 2020 at 5pm§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50693472.txt	§Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §Whakatane Kiwi Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§The Whakatāne Kiwi Trust is a charitable trust that aims to promote the protection of kiwi and other indigenous species in the Whakatāne area, through advocacy, education and fundraising. § §We are seeking an experienced, motivated and visionary individual to join our team. The successful applicant will have a conservation background and ideally be able to demonstrate experience in the following:§ § §Project management including budgeting, goal setting and reporting§ §Working with volunteers§ §Contract management§ §Relationship management§ §Strategic and business planning§ §Health and safety systems§ §Funding applications§ §Strong communication skills and the ability to build relationships § §A full, clean driver’s license § §This is an exciting opportunity to join an established and successful kiwi conservation project and work with many amazing people. You will be reporting directly to a Board of Trustees and be responsible for the oversight of a team of contractors delivering predator control, education, species management, volunteer and events coordination, administration and marketing and funding. § §This is a part time contract role (negotiable up to 20 hours per week)§ §To apply for this role please send a CV with referees to admin@whakatanekiwi.org.nz by 18 October 2020. § § Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions on the role. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

Are you ready to be part of a global team§ that's driving one of the most successful Super Premium wine§ companies on Earth?§      §        §Vineyard Operator, Wairau Valley Vineyard §        §Marlborough, NZ §      §      §        §The opportunity§        §We are looking for people who want an opportunity to be part of our passionate team where there is plenty of scope to reach your full potential. Due to continuous growth, we have a number of opportunities across our many Vineyards. §        §Work with us in a supportive environment where quality outcomes are our goal. You will get a variety of opportunities to share your skills and develop knowledge for a recognised career in vineyard operations.§        §We are all about supporting our people, we recognise and reward experience, offer on-going practical skill-building opportunities where we place you in a role that matches your skills, training, and aspirations.§        §Apply your practical knowledge and skills on a day-to-day basis;§        §          §Tractor and machinery operations§          §Spray applications§          §Irrigation operations§          §Hands-on vineyard maintenance§          §Harvest operations§        §        §About us§        §At Delegat Group we are building a leading global Super Premium wine company. We have grown more than twentyfold since 2002, and we aspire to grow even further in the future. We have state-of-the-art wineries and world-class vineyards in the prime grape growing regions of New Zealand and Australia, and we focus exclusively on making the world’s most sought-after Super Premium wines and brands including Oyster Bay and Barossa Valley Estate.  However, we believe deeply that it is our people that bring our plans to life, turn our goals into reality, and truly make the difference.§        §Please apply via our website or call Delegat National Viticulture Office for an application form on §(03) 572 6300§, 1st Floor, Riverview House, 13 Alfred Street, Blenheim 7201. §      §      §      §      §    §  §§§The opportunity§ §We are looking for people who want an opportunity to be part of our passionate team where there is plenty of scope to reach your full potential. Due to continuous growth, we have a number of opportunities across our many Vineyards. § §Work with us in a supportive environment where quality outcomes are our goal. We have grown more than twentyfold since 2002, and we aspire to grow even further in the future. We have state-of-the-art wineries and world-class vineyards in the prime grape growing regions of New Zealand and Australia, and we focus exclusively on making the world’s most sought-after Super Premium wines and brands including Oyster Bay and Barossa Valley Estate.  However, we believe deeply that it is our people that bring our plans to life, turn our goals into reality, and truly make the difference.§ §Please apply via our website or call Delegat National Viticulture Office for an application form on §(03) 572 6300§, 1st Floor, Riverview House, 13 Alfred Street, Blenheim 7201. §§§§

We are looking for someone talented and enthusiastic to join our mixed practice team. We are a proactive and progressive team who strives for the best care and service every day.  We are looking for a team mate to join us on this adventure into our bigger, brighter, better future. This is a part-time position working 4 days per week (approximately 32 hours per week), including rostered Saturdays.§ §Our ideal candidate will possess the following attributes and skills:§ § §Work well individually and as part of a close team§ §Keen to drive the nursing role and get involved with all aspects of the clinic§ §Knowledge of on farm animal health products and practices§ §Passionate about outstanding client and patient care§ §Great communication skills§ §Enthusiastic and driven with a willingness to learn§ §Compassionate, understanding and friendly with an outgoing personality!§ §To be successful in your application we require someone with great relationship skills, time management, attention to detail and reliability.  You will have a Certificate or Diploma in Veterinary Nursing.  Previous nursing experience is essential.§ §There's never been a better time to take the next step in your career.§ §Has your time come?§ §Apply by clicking on the link.  Applications close 26th October 2020 at 5:00pm.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50696637.txt	§Veterinary Nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary Nurse§§Advertiser: §Veterinary Hospital Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Veterinary Hospital Group§'Where pets are precious'§www.vethospital.co.nz§ §Remuera Veterinary Hospital§228 Orakei Road, §www.vethospital.co.nz/vet-clinics/remuera-veterinary-hospital§ §Part-time or Full-time role§We are looking for an experienced Veterinary Nurse to join our friendly team at our Remuera branch. This well established clinic will be based in a new purpose-built facility at Orakei Bay Village which opens in October§Nearby are many cafes, bars, restaurants as well as Orakei basin reserve which offers stunning scenic views§The clinic is well equipped with digital xray, high-speed dental unit, in house laboratory, patient monitoring equipment, fluid pumps etc§We have an on-site boutique cattery catering to small numbers§Our clientele are dedicated pet owners who want to provide the best of care to their pet family§The role can be part-time or full-time, our priority is finding a nurse with the technical skills and stand-out customer care that we are looking for!§Some duties will include:§Preparing patients for anaesthesia (placing i/v catheters, calculating & drawing up medications, surgical-site clipping, organising all materials required etc)§Monitoring anaesthesia & recovering patients§Sterilising & maintaining surgical kits/equipment§Admitting/discharging patients for procedures§General nursing duties including in patient/cattery care§Some reception and admin duties§Supervising puppy play sessions at the clinic§Veterinary Nurses with 2yrs+ experience are welcomed to apply - if you feel you have particular attributes but less experience we invite you to contact us also§Please apply for this position by emailing your CV & cover letter to §sarah@vethospital.co.nz§ § § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50697483.txt	§Seasonal Labour Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Seasonal Labour Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Summerfruit New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§About us§ §Summerfruit New Zealand is the organisation that represents summerfruit growers, packers and exporters. This role, based in Central Otago, is remote from the main team, and will be a self starting role.§ §Qualifications & experience§ § § §Operational planning and execution ability and experience§Flexible and adaptive, able to think outside the box to meet the needs of an evolving industry§Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and social media. Proven ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of stakeholder audiences§An ability to quickly establish trusted networks and to build and sustain constructive and effective relationships, including with Government agencies§Ability to promote Central Otago as an attractive place to live and work Experience in creating attraction packages/campaigns would be advantageous§Own vehicle necessary, mileage fully recoverable at IRD rates§Knowledge of the horticulture sector or wider primary sector would be an advantage but is not essential§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ § § §This role is to support access to seasonal labour for horticultural and viticultural operations in Central Otago. The role will connect employers and potential employees, and support the attraction and retention of seasonal workers to the region§Actively monitoring labour demand and supply in the Central Otago horticultural and viticulture industry and providing updates to the Summerfruit NZ WG and sector leads/CEOs§Provide feedback on employer and employee issues with visas, pastoral care, accommodation, transportation. Collate feedback on employment non-compliance and Social Practice accreditation (GRASP/NZGAP)§Ensuring Central Otago job listings on the WorktheSeasons (WTS) website are current to ensure accurate information is available for potential employees§Actively manage the WTS listings by engaging with potential employees when labour demand is low to maintain interest§Promoting Central Otago as an attractive region to work and job listings through a single digital portal, and in person presentations to groups, social media, and local media§To update and publicise enabling arrangements to employers as available/established§Work with the Summerfruit NZ Labour Working Group to develop and implement a system for coordinating seasonal labour requirements in Central Otago§To quickly develop and manage a regional attraction package to be available to seasonal workers, that leverages the region's tourist and adventure activities (e.g. a seasonal worker discount).§Develop relationships with employers (growers/packers/wineries); employee contacts; other stakeholders; and Government agencies within the region§ § § §Benefits§ § § §Work in a sector leading the regional economic recovery from Covid - share in making a contribution to the future§Attrractive salary on offer§Highly motivated stakeholders to work with§Chance to build some great local networks, and make new friends§Potential to work from a range of locations in the Central Otago region depending on chosen candidates home location§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobText: TXT/50698636.txt	§National Sales Manager - ADAMA§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Sales Manager - ADAMA§§Advertiser: §AgRecruit Human Resources§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§ADAMA§ is a world leading crop protection innovator. Our comprehensive and differentiated product portfolio of more than 270 active ingredients and over 1,000 end-use products is one of the world's largest.§ §In New Zealand, we focus on the development and supply of innovative solutions which support changing farming practices and the needs of New Zealand & Pacific Island growers. These include crop protection, novel agricultural technologies and complementary non-crop products.   § §Our growth strategy demands environmental stewardship, technical leadership and significant investment in local product development.§ § §Visit§ https://www.adama.com/new-zealand/en/§ to learn more about what we are achieving at ADAMA.§ §Due to an internal promotion plus significant recent extension of our reach, we are now actively searching for a senior level primary industry professional to take the position of National Sales Manager, answering to our NZ based CE. §           Your New Zealand base for this role is flexible and by negotiation.§ §As National Sales Manager you will lead our close knit, experienced commercial team through growth and innovative change. You will be an agribusiness leader who is interested in the impact of international events, technological advancement and consumer demand on our distributor partners, farmer and grower stakeholders.§ §You will be comfortable developing and executing commercial and partnership strategies in conjunction with our distributor partners, ensuring their continued growth and support.§ §A crop protection background is not required for you to be successful in gaining  in this role.§ We are interested in meeting you if you possess the following attributes:§ § §An innovative and strategic mindset§ §An understanding of the NZ agribusiness supply chain & its stakeholders§ §The ability to proactively assess & respond to changing customer needs  § §A successful leadership & influencing profile forged in primary industry§ §Strong commercial acumen and financial literacy§ § §To discuss this role in strict confidence or to request more information, please phone Deb Francis from AgRecruit on (+64) 21 2245000.§ §Otherwise, forward your expression of interest and CV via this portal.§§§§

jobTitle: Ranger - Pūtaringamotu/ Riccarton Bush Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701112.txt	§Ranger - Pūtaringamotu/ Riccarton Bush§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ranger - Pūtaringamotu/ Riccarton Bush§§Advertiser: §Riccarton House and Bush§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§The role of Ranger at Pūtaringamotu/ Riccarton Bush has become available.  Pūtaringamotu/ Riccarton Bush has a rich bi-cultural history and is the most significant stand of indigenous forest on the Canterbury Plains. §  §Pūtaringamotu/ Riccarton Bush receives over 70,000 visitors per year so you will interact with a variety of people of all ages and from all cultures.§  §The job is never boring with heaps of variety that include education, engagement and running a predator free reserve with a rich bi-cultural history.§  §This is a highly rewarding and interesting position, with exciting projects and daily changing circumstances allowing you to be creative at finding solutions.§  §You get the chance to work in a beautiful location with a group of talented and passionate people.A modern three-bedroom house is available and, although not a requirement, our preference is for the Ranger to live on site. §  §The ideal person will have:§ § §A tertiary qualification or equivalent experience in science, ecology or natural heritage management.§ §Experience in, and passion for, conservation and providing opportunities for people to connect with nature, including through guiding and interpreting.§ §An appreciation of the bi-cultural history of New Zealand.§ §A practical background in general infrastructure maintenance.§ §A reasonable level of fitness.§ §Personal Attributes§ § §Team player who takes personal responsibility and is accountable.§ §Flexible and adaptive to ever-changing work demands and outcomes.§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills.§ §Positive, energetic and results driven.§ §Ability to develop creative yet practical solutions.§ §Appreciates the dynamics of a not-for-profit organisation with limited resources and community needs, so is willing to roll up their sleeves and do whatever it takes.§ §Able to work flexible hours (evenings and weekends) occasionally, if required.§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§  §A Job Description is available. Please contact Shona Willis §manager@riccartonhouse.co.nz§ §  §Applications close at 5pm on Tuesday, 27 October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50701257.txt	§Orchard Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchard Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §Rockit Global Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§About The Role§ §Reporting to the General Manager-RMS, The Operations Manager will be responsible for implementing processes, strategies and standards across Orchard production including orchard development, thinning and harvest planning, strategic plans for trials, environmental planning, and pest and disease programmes.§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Assist the GM-RMS to develop, plan and implement budgets in accordance with company objectives§ §Develop internal capability and drive business process improvements which ensure maximum efficiency§ §Oversee and guide the Orchard Management team§ §Skills and Experience§ § §Proven business leadership experience, along with proven management of running multiple orchards.§ §Sound knowledge of the horticultural industry and best practices, Having sound judgement along with a record of achieving challenging operational business goals is essential§ §Proven operational experience including a minimum of 10 years’ Management experience in the Pipfruit industry;§ §Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to work quickly and efficiently under pressure combined with a naturally high level of motivation and initiative;§ §Sound knowledge and ability to develop, monitor and meet budgets;§ §Physically fit and willing to be hands on where needed;§ §Computer competency.§ §Relevant tertiary qualifications§ §Rockit Global’s core values are at the heart of what drives RMS and you will ideally relate to and role model these values in guiding our orchard management team.§ §Benefits§ § §Competitive remuneration§ §Opportunity for career progression at a pivot stage of Innovation and growth in a Primary Industry§ §Health Insurance available§ §Company Ute, mobile phone, and other necessary tools of the trade§ § § §About Rockit§ §Rockit Global Limited is an innovative and vertically integrated fruit grower, parker, exporter and marketer of unique miniature apples under the Rockit™ apple brand. Rockit Management Services manages the operational aspects of the orchards and is in an exciting phase of continued significant growth and development in the Hawkes Bay region. Not only in Orchard upsurge but Including the expansion of state of art Packhouse and Coolstore facility on Irongate road.§ §How to apply§ §If this sounds like you, and what you are looking for, join the Rockit™ apple team and enjoy a career that will be full of exciting and fulfilling experiences.§ §Upload your CV and Cover Letter addressed to:§ §RMS General Manager§ §Telephone 027 418 6519  § §Applications close §Sunday 8 November 2020§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Business Development Manager - Vet Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701539.txt	§Business Development Manager - Vet§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Manager - Vet§§Advertiser: §Nestle NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Bonus + Car§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Business Development Manager - Vet §      §        §          §            §§            §              §At Purina, it's no secret that pets are our passion§              §A passionate, collaborative team and a pet-friendly office§              §Opportunity to work with market leading brands§              §Build your career with a global organisation§            §            § §            §Our Story§At Purina, it's no secret that pets are our passion. Our vision is to be the world’s most trusted company in enriching the lives of pets and the people who love them. We’re dedicated to improving the health and lifestyle of cats and dogs through quality nutrition and care. Put simply, we believe a healthy pet makes for a happier home and our commitment to dogs, cats and their owners has made us a world leader in pet care.§            § §            §Your Opportunity§An exciting new opportunity exists for a Business Development Manager - Vet to join our Purina Specialty Team. §            §This unique role will drive the Vet business growth through the creation of targeted acquisition plans leveraging account leads, cold calling and Purina sponsorship.§            §Your key responsibilities will include§:§ §            §              §Ensure achievement of agreed targets/KPIs§              §Plan, create, communicate and execute Vet field activity plan§              §Responsible for the execution of the Cycle plans in stores for own assigned territory§              §Work closely with key Retail stores and field team to identify opportunities, analyse, plan and achieve Pro Plan growth via growing current base and through the acquisition of new Vets. Development of Promotional plans and in-store incentives for events to drive purchase§              §Lead, plan and attend events that showcase the benefits of using Purina Prescription Diets. Leverage these events into sales opportunities§              §Develop highly effective relationships with all key customers and key internal stakeholders§              §Proactively manage effective general cost of doing business, identify opportunities for profit improvement and cost savings management§              §Responsible for reviewing business performance on a regular basis (monthly or bi-weekly as appropriate)§            §            § §            §About You§            §Passionate about pets, you will have a solid background in Sales with a proven record of seeking out and securing new business within a Vet retail environment. You will have successfully delivered on KPIs throughout your career and value collaborative and developmental ways of working with team members. Strong understanding of the requirements to encourage recommendation of super premium nutrition and a technical/nutritional & training background in Veterinary or Animal Science would be highly desirable. Strong commercial acumen and effective communication skills are essential.  A strategic mind-set, innovative approach and ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders will see you succeed in this role. §            § §            §This really is an amazing career opportunity for someone wanting to join a fast-paced business with plenty of future career opportunities.§            § §            §Interested?§ Apply online to register your details. Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand.§            § §            §Nestlé Oceania believes diversity in our business is an asset that impacts the way we think and the way we work together. We are committed to an inclusive workplace that respects all cultures, different ways of thinking and supports our people to perform at their best and develop to their full potential§          §        §      §    §    §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §At Purina, it's no secret that pets are our passion§ §A passionate, collaborative team and a pet-friendly office§ §Opportunity to work with market leading brands§ §Build your career with a global organisation§ § § §Our Story§At Purina, it's no secret that pets are our passion. Our vision is to be the world’s most trusted company in enriching the lives of pets and the people who love them. We’re dedicated to improving the health and lifestyle of cats and dogs through quality nutrition and care. Put simply, we believe a healthy pet makes for a happier home and our commitment to dogs, cats and their owners has made us a world leader in pet care.§ § § §Your Opportunity§An exciting new opportunity exists for a Business Development Manager - Vet to join our Purina Specialty Team. § §This unique role will drive the Vet business growth through the creation of targeted acquisition plans leveraging account leads, cold calling and Purina sponsorship.§ §Your key responsibilities will include§:§ § § §Ensure achievement of agreed targets/KPIs§ §Plan, create, communicate and execute Vet field activity plan§ §Responsible for the execution of the Cycle plans in stores for own assigned territory§ §Work closely with key Retail stores and field team to identify opportunities, analyse, plan and achieve Pro Plan growth via growing current base and through the acquisition of new Vets. Development of Promotional plans and in-store incentives for events to drive purchase§ §Lead, plan and attend events that showcase the benefits of using Purina Prescription Diets. Leverage these events into sales opportunities§ §Develop highly effective relationships with all key customers and key internal stakeholders§ §Proactively manage effective general cost of doing business, identify opportunities for profit improvement and cost savings management§ §Responsible for reviewing business performance on a regular basis (monthly or bi-weekly as appropriate)§ § § §About You§ §Passionate about pets, you will have a solid background in Sales with a proven record of seeking out and securing new business within a Vet retail environment. You will have successfully delivered on KPIs throughout your career and value collaborative and developmental ways of working with team members. Strong understanding of the requirements to encourage recommendation of super premium nutrition and a technical/nutritional & training background in Veterinary or Animal Science would be highly desirable. Strong commercial acumen and effective communication skills are essential.  A strategic mind-set, innovative approach and ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders will see you succeed in this role. § § § §This really is an amazing career opportunity for someone wanting to join a fast-paced business with plenty of future career opportunities.§ § § §Interested?§ Apply online to register your details. Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand.§ § § §Nestlé Oceania believes diversity in our business is an asset that impacts the way we think and the way we work together. We are committed to an inclusive workplace that respects all cultures, different ways of thinking and supports our people to perform at their best and develop to their full potential§§§§

jobText: TXT/50701840.txt	§Manager Animal Health and Exports§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Animal Health and Exports§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Manager Animal Health and Exports §        §          §Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§          §mō te tūranga§ - §About the role§          §The Animal Health and Welfare Directorate is looking for a highly capable people leader to hold a significant high profile portfolio in animal health and exports for the Ministry of Primary Industries.§          §This new position will have the responsibility for facilitating the export of live animals and germplasm and help develop the standards to enable this to happen. Livestock export is a challenging and dynamic area so you'll need to be comfortable with fluid environments and managing people in them.§          §You'll also have responsibility for developing a new animal health team that provides trusted veterinary and scientific advice focused on domestic animal health for the veterinary and primary animal production sectors.§          §At a system and strategic level, this is an exciting and dynamic leadership role with operational, regulatory and technical challenge and you will play a key central role in improving integration and alignment of the animal health and welfare systems in NZ. Managing technical people to deliver practical outcomes will be a proven strength.§          §This is a permanent full time position based in Wellington, the remuneration for this role will be paid commensurate to the experience of the successful candidate, the salary range is from $148K to $201K with a mid-point at $175K.§          §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§ - §Skills and Experience§          §You'll hold a veterinary qualification (registerable in NZ) or tertiary biological science qualification, and will have experience at Senior Management level with a track record of successful strategic leadership.§          §Up-to-date knowledge of current trends in the international and domestic animal health regulatory environments, with a demonstrated background as a leader;  you will understand how to lead, motivate and develop technical staff, and your ability to see the big picture while remaining flexible and adaptable to political pressures will underpin your success in this role.§          §Mō tō mātou rōpū- About our Team§          §The Animal Health and Welfare Directorate plays a significant and vital role in both animal health and welfare systems domestically and internationally. Situated in a growing farmer-facing Agriculture and Investment Services Business Unit within MPI, it is undergoing a period of significant growth. §          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua§ - §About MPI§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) is responsible for ‘Growing and Protecting New Zealand'. It's no mean feat, and we have a team of hard working and passionate people in a variety of roles both on the ground and in the office supporting us to make this happen.§          §MPI has a focus on career pathways and we will work with you to help you grow§.  §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do, please click §here§          §To see the benefits of working at MPI, please click §here§          §If you want a career where you help to grow and protect New Zealand in a very real way then this could be it. Our team is collegial, supportive and hard working. MPI has a focus on career pathways so take this step in your career with us.§          §Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - §How to apply§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click on §"APPLY NOW"§ or visit the MPI Careers site.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          §For internal candidates please make sure your current manager is aware of your application. Please note this is an opportunity to move into trade policy at your current level.§          §Applications close Sunday 1 November 2020.§          §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Vivien Smith Senior Recruitment Adviser on §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§          §          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§§mō te tūranga§ - §About the role§The Animal Health and Welfare Directorate is looking for a highly capable people leader to hold a significant high profile portfolio in animal health and exports for the Ministry of Primary Industries.§This new position will have the responsibility for facilitating the export of live animals and germplasm and help develop the standards to enable this to happen. Livestock export is a challenging and dynamic area so you'll need to be comfortable with fluid environments and managing people in them.§You'll also have responsibility for developing a new animal health team that provides trusted veterinary and scientific advice focused on domestic animal health for the veterinary and primary animal production sectors.§At a system and strategic level, this is an exciting and dynamic leadership role with operational, regulatory and technical challenge and you will play a key central role in improving integration and alignment of the animal health and welfare systems in NZ. Managing technical people to deliver practical outcomes will be a proven strength.§This is a permanent full time position based in Wellington, the remuneration for this role will be paid commensurate to the experience of the successful candidate, the salary range is from $148K to $201K with a mid-point at $175K.§Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§ - §Skills and Experience§You'll hold a veterinary qualification (registerable in NZ) or tertiary biological science qualification, and will have experience at Senior Management level with a track record of successful strategic leadership.§Up-to-date knowledge of current trends in the international and domestic animal health regulatory environments, with a demonstrated background as a leader;  you will understand how to lead, motivate and develop technical staff, and your ability to see the big picture while remaining flexible and adaptable to political pressures will underpin your success in this role.§Mō tō mātou rōpū- About our Team§The Animal Health and Welfare Directorate plays a significant and vital role in both animal health and welfare systems domestically and internationally. jobTitle: National Manager, Quality, Compliance and Assurance Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50702319.txt	§National Manager, Quality, Compliance and Assurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Manager, Quality, Compliance and Assurance§§Advertiser: §INSIDE Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §National Manager, Quality, Compliance and Assurance §      §        §          §Senior leadership opportunity to grow and develop a new function§          §Broad and Strategic position, influence across the organisation§          §Energised, important not-for-profit organisation§        §        § §        §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. It is an integrated service provider, providing end to end disease management expertise at a national level, protecting and enhancing the reputation of New Zealand’s primary industries.§        § §        §As OSPRI progress through the implementation of an improved operating model a pivotal senior leadership position has formed. This is an exciting opportunity for a proven leader to drive the strategic development and delivery of OSPRI’s quality, compliance and assurance management function.§        § §        §As National Manager, you will take charge in leading and shaping this critical new function for OSPRI. You will apply a strategic lens and set clear foundations for the way the function will operate, while also taking the lead on continuous improvement across the business. You will grow and develop a high performing team, ensuring responsibilities and skillsets are aligned to succeed. You will advance OSPRI’s processes and frameworks for audit, verification and compliance, while also establishing reporting and data procedures for improved intelligence across OSPRI. Finally, you will form effective working relationships internally and externally, with the relevant compliance and legislative stakeholders.§        § §        §We are looking for an engaging and motivated leader, passionate about quality management, continuous improvement and growing successful teams, to join an impressive, high performing senior leadership group at OSPRI. You will require a technical background in assurance, quality, compliance, or risk management. Additionally, clear experience in business process design and implementing compliance initiatives, with hands on change leadership in transforming environments. Beyond that, you will be a proven self-starter, who can take a holistic view towards prioritising the best course of action and can work collaboratively to achieve valued outcomes.§        § §        §This is a unique opportunity to combine your technical and managerial skillset, to build, shape and grow a critical function within OSPRI. If you enjoy working at pace and you are someone that gets excited about leading change and making a genuine difference, this could be the role for you.§        § §        §To submit your application, please ‘Apply’ now. For a confidential discussion please call Jeremy McLeod on §(04) 974 8490§.§        § §        §Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically. Applications for this role close on Wednesday 28th October at 5pm.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Senior leadership opportunity to grow and develop a new function§ §Broad and Strategic position, influence across the organisation§ §Energised, important not-for-profit organisation§ § § §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. It is an integrated service provider, providing end to end disease management expertise at a national level, protecting and enhancing the reputation of New Zealand’s primary industries.§ § § §As OSPRI progress through the implementation of an improved operating model a pivotal senior leadership position has formed. This is an exciting opportunity for a proven leader to drive the strategic development and delivery of OSPRI’s quality, compliance and assurance management function.§ § § §As National Manager, you will take charge in leading and shaping this critical new function for OSPRI. You will apply a strategic lens and set clear foundations for the way the function will operate, while also taking the lead on continuous improvement across the business. You will grow and develop a high performing team, ensuring responsibilities and skillsets are aligned to succeed. You will advance OSPRI’s processes and frameworks for audit, verification and compliance, while also establishing reporting and data procedures for improved intelligence across OSPRI. Finally, you will form effective working relationships internally and externally, with the relevant compliance and legislative stakeholders.§ § § §We are looking for an engaging and motivated leader, passionate about quality management, continuous improvement and growing successful teams, to join an impressive, high performing senior leadership group at OSPRI. You will require a technical background in assurance, quality, compliance, or risk management. Additionally, clear experience in business process design and implementing compliance initiatives, with hands on change leadership in transforming environments. Beyond that, you will be a proven self-starter, who can take a holistic view towards prioritising the best course of action and can work collaboratively to achieve valued outcomes.§ § § §This is a unique opportunity to combine your technical and managerial skillset, to build, shape and grow a critical function within OSPRI. If you enjoy working at pace and you are someone that gets excited about leading change and making a genuine difference, this could be the role for you.§ § § §To submit your application, please ‘Apply’ now. For a confidential discussion please call Jeremy McLeod on §(04) 974 8490§.§ § § §Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically. Applications for this role close on Wednesday 28th October at 5pm.§§§§
