jobText: TXT/50739273.txt	§Cellar-hand§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Cellar-hand§§Advertiser: §Villa Maria Estate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§§About Us§A leader in sustainability, innovation and quality, Villa Maria is a family owned winery recognised as an icon in the New Zealand wine industry. Listed as in the ‘Top 10 Most Admired Wine Brands in the World’. Villa Maria now exports to over 60 countries.§Our state-of-the-art Auckland winery is unique, offering our employees the opportunity to work with premium fruit sourced onsite from our Auckland Vineyards, as well as receival and processing of wine from Villa Maria Wineries in Hawkes Bay and Marlborough.§About the Role§This full-time position which will report to the Cellar Manager, you will be working with a small team of highly motivated people who are committed both to the wine industry and the pursuit of excellence. As a Cellar Hand, you will receive training in all aspects of the winemaking process and will be required to operate all types of winery equipment, from vintage to bottling. §About You§We are seeking individuals with good mechanical aptitude, experience in the wine industry or an interest in wine. This role is highly physical, so would suit fit and healthy applicants. jobText: TXT/50718798.txt	§Island Ranger Summer 2020/21 Positions Available!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Island Ranger Summer 2020/21 Positions Available!§§Advertiser: §Rotoroa Island Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$20 - $22.50 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§ §About us§ §About the RolesThe Rotoroa Island Trust is seeking reliable and friendly temporary staff to work on Rotoroa island in the southern Hauraki Gulf. Two 5-month fixed term contract roles are available - for either 2 individuals or a couple. You must be in good health and physically fit, adaptable, organised and prepared to do anything. You must also be realistic about working on an island where sometimes getting off for breaks may not be possible for an extended period due to weather. Please note these are live in jobs. It is not possible to commute daily to the job§ § § §Qualifications & experience§ §Proven work experience in similar roles working indoors and outdoorsProfessional, friendly, flexible, can do, enthusiastic attitudeAbility to take instructions, work independently and to a high standardCurrent 1st Aid certificate, full NZ driver’s licence Fluency in English – reading and spoken.§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ §House-keeping, cleaning and working with visitors.Servicing of holiday houses: cleaning, bed making,exterior, and grounds maintenanceGuest transfers between accommodationLaundry duties Ferry arrival and departure: Wharf safetyAssisting with bio-security checksDelivery of arrival brief. §Cleaning of public facilities including remote toilets and bbqs.Beach Checks,liaison with the boating community in support of biosecurity/pest freeAssist with corporate, public day events and volunteer days.General grounds maintenance.Leading guided nature walks as requiredVegetation clearance.§ § § §Benefits§ §Benefits Friendly and supportive team environmentFully furnished shared accommodation Ferry tickets on and off the Island for agreed rostered days offUniform and PPE Gear ProvidedTraining Competitive hourly rates§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§§§

jobTitle: Assistant Orchard Manager Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50728087.txt	§Assistant Orchard Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Orchard Manager§§Advertiser: §Blueberry Country Ltd.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Blueberry Country is a family owned business based in Ohaupo in the Waikato. We have established Orchards in Ohaupo, Ngatea, and Otautau (Southland) and have an orchard under development in Waipu (Northland). We are New Zealand’s Largest holder of Blueberry land with 560 acres (230 hectares) currently in production.                        § §Our head office and main packing facilities are located just 20 minutes south of Hamilton, and the blueberries are grown, harvested, frozen and packed all on site. We also run Pick Your Own (PYO) and café operations through the summer across all our existing orchards.§ §The Role:§ §As a result of our on-going and projected growth, we have a newly created role for a full time Senior Orchard Worker.  This exciting opportunity will suit either an experienced orchard worker or a person that is able to show they are reliable, motivated, quick to learn and enthusiastic to work in the horticultural industry. This hands-on position will be solely based at our Ngatea orchard and reports to the Orchard Manager - Ngatea.                             § §Initially you will be introduced to basic day to day seasonal tasks within the blueberry orchard expanding to develop skills and experience, but not limited to,§ §• Customer service§• Weed control§• Planting§• Pruning§• Spraying§• Pest control§• Mowing§• Fertilizer§• Machinery maintenance & operation§ §Responsibilities:§ §• Visitor and staff safety§• Crop health§• Harvest quality§• Assisting orchard manager with property and asset security§• During orchard managers absence, ensure timely opening and secure close-down of property and system processes.§ §Further development may be offered to the ambitious applicant involving maintaining accurate administrative records of orchard activities including spray registers, work progress, payroll, health & safety reports and expenditure records combined with expanded management responsibilities.§ §Key Personal Attributes:§ §• Previous orchard experience and/or relevant qualifications.§• NZ drivers’ licence.§• Excellent communication skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships.§• Strong interpersonal skills, ability to multitask and a keen eye for detail.§• Ability to train, supervise and lead staff.§• Willingness to work in all weather conditions.§• Willingness to work flexible hours during the peak seasons (Dec-Mar). §• Basic math & computer skills.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§

jobTitle: Come and do your OE (Orchard Experience) in sunny Hawke's Bay! Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
advertiser: The Fresh Fruit Company Of New Zealand Ltd
jobText: TXT/50728072.txt	§Come and do your OE (Orchard Experience) in sunny Hawke's Bay!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Come and do your OE (Orchard Experience) in sunny Hawke's Bay!§§Advertiser: §The Fresh Fruit Company Of New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Freshco orchards are wide spread from Havelock North to Taradale in Hawkes Bay. Our task is to grow the best fruit and vegetables in New Zealand! Then we get them to the consumer, anywhere in the world, as quickly as possible in the FRESHEST condition. Freshco orchards currently produce nine apple varieties including our IP varieties such as Breeze, Sonya and Cheekie.§  §Orchard work is available all year round for a limited number of employees, but we require a large number of seasonal workers from November through to May during picking season. This is where you come in.§  §Freshco is continually looking to add motivated, hardworking people to our team. If you enjoy working outdoors and are prepared to work hard, we have employment opportunities waiting for you. Whether you're a skilled worker with your forklift ticket, or just getting into the workforce, we've got a Job for you: Picking, Packing, Tractor Operator, Forklift Operator, Coolstore work, Quality Contro,l Data Entry, Machinery Operator.§  §At Freshco there’s a job for everyone, no matter what kind of qualifications, and there’s guaranteed work all the way until April next year.§  §If you’re after a summer in the sun and to keep the money coming in while there’s less going out please head to www.theorchardexperience.co.nz and click on the ‘apply for work’ tab. Fill out the online employment form and our recruitment team will be in touch to get you started for work asap!§  § §  §Check out our video at https://vimeo.com/§463694604§§§§

(MSQP) delivers a comprehensive food safety sampling programme for the bivalve shellfish industry in the Top of the South. Every week of the year MSQP takes water and bivalve shellfish samples to allow our globally leading mussel and oyster farmers to harvest their amazing products.§MSQP Inc. is a wholly industry funded organisation which ensures the sampling and analysis of the water samples and shellfish takes place every week of the year.§We are seeking a Sampling Officer to work 3 days a week (Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday) in association with our contract vessel operator covering the Marlborough Sounds, from Croisille’s Harbour and Okiwi Bay in the West to Port Underwood in the East.§You will be somebody who enjoys working on boats and relishes the opportunity to see the rugged beauty and isolation of the Marlborough Sounds up close. Early mornings will be a fact of life, perhaps even a point of pride for you.§You will definitely be able to follow detailed instructions carefully and precisely; you will have an eye for detail and a pride in delivering a quality service. §Holding a skipper’s ticket, or a willingness to work towards one, would be favourably viewed.§We are looking for someone to start in the next two weeks preferably, but this can be negotiated.§If you have questions please contact the Executive Officer, Colin Johnston on §+61 409457535§ or email §colin@brightwaterconsulting.co.nz§ [link removed]§Applications (CV and covering letter) should be sent to §admin@msqp.co.nz§ [link removed]§§§§

jobText: TXT/50745418.txt	§Experienced Orchard Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Orchard Manager§§Advertiser: §Trevelyan's Pack & Cool Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Experienced Orchard Manager §    §    §      §        §Trevelyan’s Managed Orchards is a division of Trevelyan’s Pack & Cool Ltd. We are a Te Puke-based Kiwifruit and Avocado post-harvest company packing 16 million trays of Kiwifruit and over 700,000 trays of Avocados covering the wider Bay of Plenty and Hawke’s Bay. This role will be based at our Te Puke site on No 1 Road.§        §We are a motivated and innovative group of passionate orchardists who pride ourselves on being industry leaders.§        §As an Orchard Manager, you will play a key role in our orchard management team. Reporting to our Orchard Operations Manager, this role requires that you will attend to all tasks required daily to manage a kiwifruit orchard.§        §Being part of Trevelyan’s Managed Orchards means:§        §You'll have:§        §          §Prior Orchard Management experience (this is not a trainee role)§          §A passion for horticulture and enjoy being outdoors with the team and being present in the orchard, with an eye for detail§          §A drive to achieve above industry/regional OGR's§          §A commitment to a long-term role as a manager is important§          §Work-life balance in your role as a goal§          §An interest in regenerative horticulture§        §        §You'll be:§        §          §Able to plan and deliver excellent results which include non-financial measures§          §Able to plan for job/task variety within your role and the team§          §Highly skilled at developing and motivating a tight team§          §Proficient at training and mentoring a team§          §Open minded to learning and applying new concepts§          §Able to develop and manage orchard budgets§          §A competent communicator.§          §Willing and able to manage work-life balance into your career.§        §        §An immediate start is available.  Applications close 13 November§        §Please direct applications and CV's to:§        §Kirsty Mortensen - We are a Te Puke-based Kiwifruit and Avocado post-harvest company packing 16 million trays of Kiwifruit and over 700,000 trays of Avocados covering the wider Bay of Plenty and Hawke’s Bay. This role will be based at our Te Puke site on No 1 Road.§ §We are a motivated and innovative group of passionate orchardists who pride ourselves on being industry leaders.§ §As an Orchard Manager, you will play a key role in our orchard management team. Reporting to our Orchard Operations Manager, this role requires that you will attend to all tasks required daily to manage a kiwifruit orchard.§ §Being part of Trevelyan’s Managed Orchards means:§ §You'll have:§ § §Prior Orchard Management experience (this is not a trainee role)§ §A passion for horticulture and enjoy being outdoors with the team and being present in the orchard, with an eye for detail§ §A drive to achieve above industry/regional OGR's§ §A commitment to a long-term role as a manager is important§ §Work-life balance in your role as a goal§ §An interest in regenerative horticulture§ §You'll be:§ § §Able to plan and deliver excellent results which include non-financial measures§ §Able to plan for job/task variety within your role and the team§ §Highly skilled at developing and motivating a tight team§ §Proficient at training and mentoring a team§ §Open minded to learning and applying new concepts§ §Able to develop and manage orchard budgets§ §A competent communicator.§ §Willing and able to manage work-life balance into your career.§ §An immediate start is available.  Applications close 13 November§ §Please direct applications and CV's to:§ §Kirsty Mortensen - HR Department, Trevelyan's Pack & Cool Ltd. 310 No.1 Road, RD 2, Te Puke§ §or employment@trevelyan.co.nz or call Adam Franklin on 027 537 0016 for a discussion at any time.§ §All applications and enquiries will be treated as confidential.§ §Applicants for this position should have New Zealand residency or a valid New Zealand work visa.§ § § §All applications and enquiries will be treated as confidential.§ § § §Applicants for this position should have New Zealand residency or a valid New Zealand work visa.§ § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50728033.txt	§Orchard Supervisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchard Supervisor§§Advertiser: §OPAC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§The role is responsible for providing support to the orchard manager and to manage and lead teams, providing training with the ability to motivate staff.  You will need to be able to make informed decisions and judgments and problem-solve to complete jobs within a set timeframe at a high standard.§  §This is a permanent position with the potential for career progression for the right candidate.§  § §  §Capability and Experience required: § § §A strong team player, able to lead others and collaborate§ §Experience with orchard equipment and machinery§ §Strong verbal and interpersonal skills§ §Experience in the orchards and kiwifruit Industry (4+ years)§ §Ability to adapt, be flexible, and problem solve§ §Computer knowledge required§ §Able to speak a second language (Samoan an advantage)§ §Has a strong understanding of the RSE Programme§ § §  §Role/Responsibilities § § §Manage, train, lead and mentor orchard staff during the seasonal activities ie pruning, picking, thinning, pollination, vine training, and spraying gained through practical orcharding experience§ §Record and submit digital timesheets for staff and manage working hours§ §Assist in planning and prioritising workloads§ §Ensure Health and Safety & Food Policy and Procedures are followed§ §Committed to improving orchard performance and achieving goals§ §Foster a culture of continuous improvement in our processes and people.§ § §  §If this sounds like you, please send your application to §Marcella.Maher@opac.co.nz§. for more information, the Job Description is available on request. §§§§

Instead we’ll provide everything you need to feel supported on the ground so you can get on with doing what you do best as a veterinary professional – providing gold standard care for our patients.§ §Our vision to be the best vet and nurse friendly clinics and provide all the equipment and help you need to do your job well and grow as a valued member of our established and busy team. § §About You:§ § §You have a recognised Diploma in Veterinary Nursing or equivalent qualification§ §You are proficient in all-round clinical and surgical nursing with at least a year’s experience working as a vet nurse§ §You’ve got customer service experience and you work well in a team§ §You have computer skills and don’t mind learning new technology§ §You’re passionate about the veterinary industry and high standards of patient care§ §You can be flexible with hours of work to participate in our rosters that include some evenings, weekends and public holidays§ §What we’re offering:  § § §Upgraded equipment in our clinics§ §An awesome CPD budget for our vets and nurses with potential to travel for learning and development opportunities§ §Central support team made up of experienced veterinary professionals§ §The chance to be a part of a supportive local team and national clinical group§ §We’ll help you take the next step in your veterinary nursing career. What are you waiting for?§ §Animates Vetcare is a Rainbow Tick Certified employer.§§§§

We operate throughout New Zealand and the wider Asia Pacific region, working with a diverse range of Government, NGO and primary sector partners. §  §We are looking for motivated, self-reliant person to undertake surveillance work in urban, farm and plantation forest locations. §  §Duties include§ § §Pest and disease surveys in plantation forests, horticultural properties and urban green spaces§ §Pest responses for insects, weeds and plant pathogens§ §Assisting with offshore programmes§ §Location§ § §This position is based with our Auckland Team, located in Penrose. However, consideration will be given to being based in other locations for the right applicant§ §Qualifications and requirements§ § §Have at least 3 years relevant experience in biosecurity or the primary sector, and ideally hold a tertiary qualification in biological sciences, forestry or horticulture§ §Experience, fitness and confidence to work at times in remote and challenging locations§ §Have tree identification/ botanical skills or an interest to learn§ §You will need to already be in NZ and have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit§ §Be willing to travel away for up to 2 weeks at a time (usually only 5 days)§ §Have no colour blindness § §Have a full, clean driver’s license (experience driving a 4WD would be helpful)§ §If you think this sounds like the career for you and want to work with a diverse, friendly team, please send a current CV and any other relevant employment related documents to jessica.wallace@spsbiota.co.nz . jobText: TXT/50736693.txt	§PACKHOUSE MANAGER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PACKHOUSE MANAGER§§Advertiser: §A S Wilcox & Sons Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Due to an internal promotion, an exciting opportunity has arisen for an exceptional individual to lead our Domestic Packhouse team  based in Pukekohe.§ § § §The role of Packhouse  Manager is a critical one for Wilcox and requires a candidate who is able to work in a fast moving packhouse where tight deadlines need to be met. You will take responsibility  for the day to day operations of the packhouse, ensuring  delivery to our  domestic customers.  There is a strong CI component to this role  to improve and streamline processes.  You will be able to demonstrate developing commercial and financial understanding and you will be confident in ensuring budget and throughput targets are met and managing  labour resources.  The role is well supported with an experienced team and quality control personnel.§ §Our ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:§ § §Leadership and supervision of staff § §Experience in a manufacturing environment§ §Written and oral communication skills§ §Ability to organise and co-ordinate activities in a busy environment§ §Experience with ERP systems and proficient with Excel§ §Ability to work under pressure with minimal supervision§ §Supply chain management§ §Leading projects § §Understanding/experience in continuous improvement.§ §Leading H&S culture§ §We are looking for  an energetic individual with a can do attitude who is ready to step up and take full ownership of the role.  In return, Wilcox offer excellent working conditions, opportunities for personal development and career progression.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50754108.txt	§Client Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Services§§Advertiser: §Totally Vets Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Totally Vets (T/A Tararua Veterinary Services) is a dynamic veterinary company, providing services and products in the Manawatu, Taumarunui and Tararua areas for companion, equine, and production animals. §We are looking for two enthusiastic Customer Service people to join our Business Support Team in Pahiatua.  You will need to be focused on providing excellent service to our varied list of clientele and provide support for our veterinary teams. §Ideally, we are looking for people who have the following qualities:§A passion for customer service, with excellent communication skills§Enjoys working in a busy environment and being busy all day§Rural, farming or agricultural experience and knowledge§Veterinary practice experience and knowledge§Good knowledge of the upper Tararua areas and geographical locations§Previous experience in managing calls, booking diaries and appointments§Ability to work under pressure, to multi-task and to use initiative§Excellent computer skills §Confident, positive personality with strong interpersonal skills§Ability to work in a team environment with a focus on detail and going the extra mile§Both available positions are full-time Business Support roles, however each position will have a different focus in terms of responsibilities within the clinic.§Customer Service Role§This role will be customer facing in a reception type environment. You will be a first point of contact for our customers and visitors, answer animal health questions and provide appropriate solutions, this position has a strong focus on sales and all aspects of stock control. You will be required to provide support for our business support and veterinary teams.§Administration Support Role§While there is an element of customer service and support to the front counter team, this position is more focused on administrative roles, ability to work to a deadline, possession of analytical skills are essential to this role.§Previous experience within a customer service, veterinary or agricultural sector would be advantageous; however, training will be given to the right person who can fit in and contribute to the team environment. § §If you have some or all the above qualities, please apply by email, post or via Seek by 5pm 30th October 2020. Please include in your cover letter which position you are applying for.§ §A copy of the position description is available on request to Amanda.bills@tvg.co.nz [link removed]§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50764713.txt	§Ranger§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ranger§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Ranger §        §          §Are you someone who is passionate about conservation and enjoy working in the great outdoors?  Do you want to make a difference in protecting New Zealand's natural heritage?  §          §We have an exciting role located in Geraldine as a Ranger in our Biodiversity team.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §Your primary focus will be delivering on biodiversity work programmes.  In addition, you will be contributing to other conservation areas such as community work and recreation.  Your day to day work will take you across the district carrying out biodiversity, recreation and community-based work programmes according to the district work plan.  As such, we are looking for someone with a range of technical skills and a proactive attitude to bring to the team. §          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §Your skills and experience in field work will be of great help as your role includes leading and supporting community groups, volunteers, contractors and members of your team doing conservations work in the field.§          §Ideally you will have knowledge of the local landscape of the area and be living or looking to relocate.§          § §          §Required:§          §            §The ability to work in true partnership with others across DOC and external stakeholders including local whānau, hapū and iwi§            §A full NZ Drivers Licence§            §Knowledge of one or more biodiversity areas such as; marine, freshwater, animal pest control, management of threatened species and/or statutory delegations§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          §The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          §Excellent development opportunities across region.§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above.§          §For any enquiry, please contact Shane P Reid, §spreid@doc.govt.nz§, or telephone §(02) 77024626§, quoting vacancy 400/7326.§          §Applications close at 5pm, time on Monday, 2nd November 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context. §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Are you someone who is passionate about conservation and enjoy working in the great outdoors?  Do you want to make a difference in protecting New Zealand's natural heritage?  §We have an exciting role located in Geraldine as a Ranger in our Biodiversity team.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§Your primary focus will be delivering on biodiversity work programmes.  In addition, you will be contributing to other conservation areas such as community work and recreation.  Your day to day work will take you across the district carrying out biodiversity, recreation and community-based work programmes according to the district work plan.  As such, we are looking for someone with a range of technical skills and a proactive attitude to bring to the team. § §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§Your skills and experience in field work will be of great help as your role includes leading and supporting community groups, volunteers, contractors and members of your team doing conservations work in the field.§Ideally you will have knowledge of the local landscape of the area and be living or looking to relocate.§ §Required:§§The ability to work in true partnership with others across DOC and external stakeholders including local whānau, hapū and iwi§A full NZ Drivers Licence§Knowledge of one or more biodiversity areas such as; marine, freshwater, animal pest control, management of threatened species and/or statutory delegations§§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§Excellent development opportunities across region.§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above.§For any enquiry, please contact Shane P Reid, §spreid@doc.govt.nz§, or telephone §(02) 77024626§, quoting vacancy 400/7326.§Applications close at 5pm, time on Monday, 2nd November 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context. §§§§

(e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

however, training will be given to the right person who can fit in and contribute to the team environment. §If you have some or all the above qualities, please apply by email, post or via Seek by 5pm 30th October 2020. Please include in your cover letter which position you are applying for.§Part-time hours are 8am to 2pm Monday – Friday and will be mainly companion animal focused. Full-time hours are 7.45am – 5.15pm and will mainly support our rural/production animal customers, therefore rural, farming or agricultural experience and knowledge will be highly regarded. Both roles will be required to participate in a 1:6 roster on Saturdays 9.30am – 12.30pm.§ §A copy of the position description is available on request to Amanda.bills@tvg.co.nz [link removed] §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50756619.txt	§Senior Groomer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Groomer§§Advertiser: §Animates NZ Holdings§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Animates is New Zealand’s leading pet care company with 44 pet specialty retail stores, 29 grooming salons and 17 vet clinics and growing. § §Our highly passionate and knowledgeable Kilbirnie team are committed to living our vision of being the best pet company in the world and providing an 'Awesome Experience' for our customers by understanding their needs, providing an outstanding groom along with information and advice for the best possible care of their pets.§ §As Senior Groomer at our Kilbirnie salon, you will be crucial to the success of Animates. Your proven experience in grooming and leadership will ensure you provide effective support and coaching to your team, control wages and costs, train and upskill salon team members, and manage the day-to-day operations of the salon. § §Our salons are fast-paced but the challenge of satisfying new customers, meeting their needs, building a client base and reaching targets is huge.§ §To be successful you'll need:§ § §Previous dog grooming experience (3+ years in a high-volume salon preferred);§ §Experience managing and training new/experienced groomers;§ §Sound operational experience in a complex environment;§ §A solid understanding of animal welfare and care;§ §An exceptionally friendly manner to engage customers, build a regular client base and grow sales;§ §Strong verbal and written communication skills; and,§ §High work standards and ethics.§ §This position is full-time and applicants must be available to work weekdays, weekends, late nights and public holidays as required.§ §To find out more about our grooming service visit our website: https://www.animates.co.nz/pet-services/grooming§ §Animates is a Rainbow Tick Certified Employer.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50758014.txt	§Organics Compliance Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Organics Compliance Analyst§§Advertiser: §Pāmu§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §    §      §Organics Compliance Analyst §      §        §We have a fantastic opportunity for a Business Analyst who specialises in compliance to join our growing organic farming business as our Organics Compliance Analyst.§        §This exciting new role will specialise in compliance assurance and be the trusted advisor to Farm and Business Managers. In essence, you will be the organics' 'champion' for our dairy organics operation.§        §You'll use your data management, business analytical skills and attention to detail to ensure the technical integrity of climate, soil, forage, and animal management policies are maintained and monitored to meet business objectives.§        §With the support of a specialised organics Business Manager, you'll be responsible for the ongoing development and management of all documentation required as part of the registration, certification and operation of our organics farms and provide a clear pathway for continual compliance for organic certification.§        §At Pāmu we're working to achieve better water quality, lower greenhouse gases, and produce higher-value sustainable food and fibre products for kiwis and the world. We're looking at innovative ways to use the land that will have the least environmental impact whilst still creating value. You will be managing our activities in accordance with our long-term goals for ecosystem health improvements, focused on water quality and biodiversity. A passion for the concept of land care is essential, as the role includes liaising with community, landowners and many other stakeholders on sustainable land use change.§Responsibilities:              §Develop and manage Project Parore’s operational plan and consolidated works program, engaging with catchment communities and encouraging landowners to develop land environmental plans§Manage catchment community and contractor relationships including coordinating and monitoring restoration work, facilitating review meetings and processing monthly claims and invoices.§Work with the Board in the identification and procurement of sponsors and the preparation of funding grant applications§Oversee robust administration, financial control, work in progress reporting to the board and reporting obligations to funders.§Develop and maintain effective relationships with Bay of Plenty Regional Council, primary industry, landowners, volunteers, community organisations, local and central government agencies, iwi, other NGOs and businesses§Required Attributes§Demonstrated experience of working with complexity e.g. planning, facilitation, stakeholder engagement and decision making. jobTitle: Horticultural Technician Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50765721.txt	§Horticultural Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Horticultural Technician§§Advertiser: §Lincoln University§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§As the longest-running agriculturally-based university in the Southern Hemisphere, Lincoln University's story begins with farming, but it certainly doesn't end there. As New Zealand's economy diversified, so have we. Lincoln University is here to enhance and enrich lives. To grow the knowledge of our students so they can shape a world that benefits from a greater understanding of the relationship between our land, the food produced from it and the ecosystems within it. With three academic faculties, one teaching division, several research centres and a range of corporate service units, the University draws its students from throughout New Zealand and from over 60 countries. Lincoln University has a student roll of around 3,000 and approximately 700 staff.§The Faculty of Agriculture and Life Sciences comprises four departments: Agricultural Sciences; Ecology; Soil and Physical Sciences and Wine, Food and Molecular Biosciences. We currently have a permanent, fulltime position available for a technician who will be responsible for the provision of technical support for the horticultural activities based at the Field Research Centre and Horticulture Research Area.§The position will support the teaching efforts and research based activities within the Faculty of Agriculture & Life Sciences, and it is important the person appointed has the ability to encourage, train and support undergraduate and postgraduate students in their studies. The appointee will also work with Crown Research Institutes and commercial partners.§You will have:§Orchard and vineyard management experience including pruning, thinning and harvesting§Experience with application of herbicides, fungicides and insecticides§Technical experience that includes maintenance of horticultural spray equipment, frost protection and irrigation systems§Experience with quad bikes, tractors and associated agricultural equipment§Good organisational skills and ability to work independently§Please apply online with your CV and cover letter.§For more information, please refer to the position description on the Lincoln University careers page or contact Patrice Wilkin, Recruitment Business Partner, on §03 423 0312§.§Applications close on 1/11/2020.§§§§

Realising that the shorter the time from harvest to drying the higher the product quality FDL has built New Zealand’s newest and most sophisticated on farm hot air-drying operation.§ §FDL grows and processes certified organic barley grass, certified organic wheatgrass and other certified organic leaf crops in New Zealand’s cereal growing heartland – the Canterbury Plains. § §This is a unique opportunity to join our specialised process team and to progress your career with an expanding company.§ §Being one of two, as a Production Supervisor you will oversee the Production team and the seasonal workforce, managing an assigned shift to ensure maximum efficiency and achievement of daily production targets.§ §A mix of people skills, quality and process knowledge will make you a perfect fit for this role.§ §Reporting directly to the General Manager your main responsibilities will include:§ § §Effective supervision of 12 hour shifts and quality targets through the team.§ §Ensuring §Health and Safety – with an uncompromising attitude towards Health and Safety standards.§ §You will also need:§ § §A proven willingness to take accountability for plant practice and daily performance.§ §Excellent time management skills§ §Previous experience of upskilling a team§ §A solid mechanical understanding for maintenance and care of a plant§ §Full Class 1 Drivers License.  Tractor driving experience would also be an advantage§ §Two or more years' experience as a Supervisor, in a food production facility or farming would be of benefit§ § § §How to Apply§ §If this sounds jobText: TXT/50767868.txt	§Clinical Pathologist - Veterinary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Clinical Pathologist - Veterinary§§Advertiser: §Healthscope§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Clinical Pathologist - Veterinary §    §      §      §      §        §          §            §Flexible location - Auckland, Hamilton, Palmerston North, Christchurch, or Dunedin§            §An attractive remuneration and relocation package on offer§            §Permanent role, full-time or part-time§          §          §Gribbles Veterinary Pathology is New Zealand's leading veterinary pathology provider with a team of 16 Veterinary Pathologists located in five dedicated veterinary laboratories across New Zealand providing diagnostic pathology services for livestock, companion animal veterinarians, university and research facilities, as well as zoo and wildlife organisations.§          §Due to our customer-centric focus, Gribbles continues to achieve growth across our New Zealand business, we are currently seeking an enthusiastic and dynamic Veterinary Clinical Pathologist with a client-oriented approach and excellent communication skills for a permanent full or part-time position.§          §Primary duties include the evaluation and interpretation of haematology, cytology, clinical chemistry, endocrinology, urinalysis, serology, microbiology and molecular results. Provision of specialist advice and phone consultation to veterinary clients is also expected. Our supportive professional environment provides opportunities for further career development through continuing professional education and active participation in continuing education seminars for clients.§          §Essential to this position is a veterinary degree suitable for New Zealand registration, previous experience in diagnostic veterinary pathology and a demonstrated commitment to providing a high-quality pathology service. Board certification by the ACVP/ECVCP or Fellowship of the ANZCVS is preferred, although board-eligible or other highly qualified applicants will also be considered.§          §We will consider applications for any of our laboratory sites within New Zealand. Gribbles Veterinary has laboratories located in Auckland, Hamilton, Palmerston North, Christchurch, and Dunedin. An attractive remuneration and relocation package can be negotiated with the successful applicant.§          §If you would like to work in New Zealand, known for its beautiful, untouched national parks, mountains, outdoor pursuits and cosmopolitan cities and be a valued member of a dedicated team, please apply now.§          §There is no formal closing date and applications will be considered individually on receipt.§          § §          §To apply for this job go to: healthscopecareers.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5252210. §        §      §      §      §      §Healthscope - a career without boundaries§        §healthscopecareers.co.nz§      §    §  §§§ §Flexible location - Auckland, Hamilton, Palmerston North, Christchurch, or Dunedin§ §An attractive remuneration and relocation package on offer§ §Permanent role, full-time or part-time§ §Gribbles Veterinary Pathology is New Zealand's leading veterinary pathology provider with a team of 16 Veterinary Pathologists located in five dedicated veterinary laboratories across New Zealand providing diagnostic pathology services for livestock, companion animal veterinarians, university and research facilities, as well as zoo and wildlife organisations.§ §Due to our customer-centric focus, Gribbles continues to achieve growth across our New Zealand business, we are currently seeking an enthusiastic and dynamic Veterinary Clinical Pathologist with a client-oriented approach and excellent communication skills for a permanent full or part-time position.§ §Primary duties include the evaluation and interpretation of haematology, cytology, clinical chemistry, endocrinology, urinalysis, serology, microbiology and molecular results. Provision of specialist advice and phone consultation to veterinary clients is also expected. Our supportive professional environment provides opportunities for further career development through continuing professional education and active participation in continuing education seminars for clients.§ §Essential to this position is a veterinary degree suitable for New Zealand registration, previous experience in diagnostic veterinary pathology and a demonstrated commitment to providing a high-quality pathology service. Board certification by the ACVP/ECVCP or Fellowship of the ANZCVS is preferred, although board-eligible or other highly qualified applicants will also be considered.§ §We will consider applications for any of our laboratory sites within New Zealand. Gribbles Veterinary has laboratories located in Auckland, Hamilton, Palmerston North, Christchurch, and Dunedin. An attractive remuneration and relocation package can be negotiated with the successful applicant.§ §If you would like to work in New Zealand, known for its beautiful, untouched national parks, mountains, outdoor pursuits and cosmopolitan cities and be a valued member of a dedicated team, please apply now.§ §There is no formal closing date and applications will be considered individually on receipt.§ § § §To apply for this job go to: healthscopecareers.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5252210. §§§§

We are looking for full-time and casual applicants. The Vetora Bay of Plenty team operate out of five clinics in the Central North Island. This position is based at our purpose-built Animal Hospital in Rotorua.§The Rotorua companion animal hospital team work in a magnificent facility including four consult rooms, two surgical rooms, spacious prep room plus laboratory and diagnostic room. The Animal Hospital is fitted with the latest equipment including endoscopy, digital radiography, full dental suite, doppler, ultrasound, orthopaedic equipment and complete IDEXX in house laboratory. §About the Role§As an experienced Veterinary Nurse, you already have an understanding of the day-to-day requirements of being a great member of a dynamic nursing team behind any great clinic.  Here are just a few of the key responsibilities that you will be contributing to together with the rest of our team:§Hands-on surgical and diagnostic assistance§Patient monitoring and treatment§Nurse consults§Client relations§Rostered Late-nights and after hours§About You§You genuinely care for pets, your colleagues and our clients§You work well both in a team and independently§You have a high level of integrity and are interested in continued development§You are a good communicator§You have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in Veterinary Nursing along with a relevant qualification§What’s on Offer?§The opportunity to assist in more complex surgical procedures§A highly professional Vet practice with Best Practice Accreditation §A fantastic location with an abundance strong work ethic, are enthusiastic and keen to join a dynamic and progressive team where you can explore and develop your skills plus work in a modern purpose-built veterinary facility then please apply now!§For general enquiries, email Ryan Johnson, Operations Manager – §ryan.johnson@vetora.nz§.§Applications close on 20 November 2020.§Only applicants who have the right to work in New Zealand permanently need apply.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§How many years' experience do you have as a perioperative / surgical nurse?§§§

We are a growing mixed animal practice, located across four sites in Tauranga. We are the only NZVA Best Practice Accredited Clinic in Tauranga, and see a wide range of interesting and challenging cases which will stretch your knowledge and skill daily.§  §Our clinics provide in-house blood machines (CBC and biochemistry), digital x-ray, ultrasonography, dental x-ray, all within a purpose built facility.  We offer a referral imaging service and also accept a variety of medical and surgical referrals from other practices.§  §For the clinical position, we are seeking a §Part Time Veterinarian §professional. jobText: TXT/50767929.txt	§Visitor Services Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Visitor Services Representative§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Visitor Services Representative §      §        § §        §          §Part time position – be part of our small visitor team§          §Do you have a passion for visitor experiences?§          §Do you have knowledge of tracks in the Waitakere Ranges? §        §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        §Kia Ora, Arataki Visitor Centre are looking for a friendly part-time Visitor Services Representative to help stimulate stewardship of the Waitakere Ranges. This customer focused position is to ensure the visitors experience in the Waitakere Ranges is safe and well informed.§        §This role would be ‘Friday through Sunday (week 1) Friday and Saturday (week 2) on consecutive weekends, (40 hours per fortnight). As part of the team you will be involved in assisting visitors with track information along with helping with activities, craft, events and school holiday programmes. §        §It’s your challenge to offer exceptional manaakitanga. You will provide visitors with a wide variety of information on all Auckland Council Regional Parks, focusing primarily on the Waitakere Ranges - where to go, what to see. You will educate visitors on caring for the environment, share our local history, instruct people on how to be a kauri protector, by explaining kauri dieback disease. You will also take bookings for activities, community groups and general enquiries - as well as assisting visitors in the unique retail store, to find that perfect purchase to remember their visit. §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §Your background would ideally include customer service and possibly additional experience in outdoor tourism, recreation, conservation and visitor centres.§        §The ideal person for this role will be someone who has:§•    A love of people and enjoys providing quality customer service§•    Understanding of the Waitakere Ranges and surrounding area - essential.§•    A passion for the environment, conservation and have respect for kauri dieback§•    Administration skills, including Microsoft Office (a bonus would be experience on Advanced Retail)§•    The ability to think outside the square and share your ideas for activities and events and find solutions to unplanned problems – be part of a team, but still work independently when needed.§•    A full, clean New Zealand driver's licence or an applicable way to travel across the region is required§•    Intermediate or fluent Te Reo would be a bonus§        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        §The Arataki Visitor Centre is a popular location for tourists and locals alike. You will have the opportunity to assist a range of visitors, from all over the world, all walks of life and all ages. We are a passionate team which get to contribute to some fun events and activities for the community. Did we mention the views are exceptional? This is a unique opportunity that doesn't come around often, so if the above sounds like you, apply now. §        §This role is deemed safety sensitive and in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing.  Auckland Council is committed to the protection and wellbeing of children.  This role is classified as a Children's Worker role under the Vulnerable Children Act 2014. As such applicants will be required to undergo police vetting prior to commencing employment. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check.§        §Applications close Monday, 26 October 2020.§  For more information, please contact Enna Cecilio on 021 223 2212.§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. jobText: TXT/50769500.txt	§Greenhouse Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Greenhouse Assistant§§Advertiser: §Sidekicker§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.00 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Greenhouse Assistant §      §        §Greenhouse assistant required for a busy NZ herb supplier, that has been supplying speciality fresh herbs to New Zealand for the last 20 years.  Be part of a team that distributes freshness from Kaitaia to Invercargill and all the way to Asia.§        § §        §What's Sidekicker you ask?§        §Sidekicker is home to Australia and New Zealand's friendliest and hardest-working workforce, known as Sidekicks.§        §We offer thousands of unique and exciting shifts (like this one) to Sidekicks every month in hospitality, promotions, events, business admin, and retail/warehousing which can all be found and applied for via an easy-to-use mobile app.§        §As a Sidekick, you get to choose WHEN and WHERE you work, meaning you have complete control over the hours you work. Work as much or as little you'd like.§        § §        §About the role:§        §We are looking to find an excellent Picker Packer to work within our state of the art facility. You will be required to support our team with a number of duties to ensure we are getting our product out to our customers on time.§Location: Helensville (Parakai)§        §We are looking for people to work on an ongoing basis (MINIMUM 4 WEEKS), and for the right individual, there could be an opportunity for long term work and career development.§        §Must be available to work SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. Manager in ensuring plant health and soil conditions are monitored and maintained and relevant safeguards are put in place to avoid loss or damage to science projects. § §About you§ §You’ll either Our vision is for profitable farmers and thriving farming communities, valued by all New Zealanders.§The Independent Director position has been designed to bring independent judgement, outside experience and objectivity to the board table. We want to strengthen the board in key areas of Maori agri-business, marketing and information technology. Candidates should have specific skills in one or more of these areas.§The successful candidate will have proven experience in governance and be committed to a successful and thriving New Zealand sheep and beef sector, be collaborative in nature, possess sound judgement and be willing to demonstrate strong leadership to the sector, and B+LNZ management.§This is a board who has a great culture and enjoys challenging each other, while overseeing farmer investment that underpins one of New Zealand's significant export sectors.§We are looking for the following qualities:§Highest of ethical standards and behaviours§Independence in thinking; be prepared to challenge, and be challenged§Be future focused, value continuous improvement, innovation and responsiveness to the sector's challenges and opportunities§Proven and effective governance and executive level expertise, strategic planning and execution§Effective, persuasive and respectful communicator§Empathy with sheep and beef farmers and their rural communities§A role model for the values of the organisation§This is a remunerated position and will commence 1 January 2021 and is for a three-year term. commensurate with experience and role type§ §Strong focus on personal development§ with an ongoing focus on your career interests§ §Non-corporate family workplace culture§ – become a member of the CareVets family§ §Fantastic location§ §Work-Life balance is important to us§, so rosters are geared with this in mind§ §Dynamic & supportive clinic team§ along with a responsive leadership team§ §Access to a wide network§ of like-minded colleagues across the North Island (and the opportunities that come with such a network)§ § § §To express your interest in this role ‘apply now’ via SEEK with your CV and cover letter attached.  Any applicants shortlisted will be contacted directly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§§§

jobText: TXT/50777392.txt	§Summer Student Intern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Summer Student Intern§§Advertiser: §Lindsay ANZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§If you are looking for a hands-on role helping to trial world-leading irrigation technology on farm then we have a great opportunity for you. We are looking for a keen and hard-working student to assist in carrying out farm-based trials using our latest technology, gathering regular data and then presenting these results. This is a great opportunity for a driven individual to take ownership of an interesting project, taking it through to completion where their work will be published for the benefit of other farmers.§The successful candidate will need to possess excellent time management skills, be self-motivated and eager to get stuck in. They shall be familiar with farming operations and comfortable working in with farmers to gather trial data. §The role would suit someone interested in precision agriculture, agricultural science, irrigation and/or engineering. And preferably having completed their second year or above at university.§The job will be primarily based in Canterbury but will involve travel throughout the region. A current driver’s license is therefore a must. There is also the likelihood of a visit to the main office in the North Island, travel and accommodation costs will be covered by the company. Support and supervision will be provided by our staff in New Zealand and Australia and by our South Island dealer network.§To be successful in this role you must be happy to work independently, have a mature manner when representing the company at all times and a friendly disposition towards customers. We are looking for someone with strong analytical skills with experience running trials as part of their university degree. They must show a high standard of report writing skills and be a confident communicator. §If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you. The role will be 40 hours a week, however while working in the field you may be expected to work slightly longer hours as required. The position is available as soon as the successful applicant is able to start, and will end when university begins in 2021. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50777097.txt	§Operations  Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations  Manager§§Advertiser: §EcoFX Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§Operations Manager - EcoFX Limited§                             §Looking for a new career and are passionate about protecting the environment and making a difference to New Zealand’s unique biodiversity?§EcoFX is one of New Zealand’s leading providers of Conservation and Biosecurity Pest Control Services.  As a privately owned company leading the industry for over 20 years, we require an Operations Manager to manage and support our growing business. We are passionate about the work we do in protecting our natural heritage for our current and future generations. We are looking for a person who is also passionate about our environment and wants to be part of this exciting industry for the long term.§With our Otorohanga Head Office based in the Waikato, EcoFX specialises in providing pest control and ecological restoration services primarily across the Northern North Island, but also periodically in other regions of New Zealand.  With a focus on landscape scale animal pest control, as well as undertaking other ecological works, we undertake projects for a wide range of clients. These include Regional Councils, the Department of Conservation, OSPRI, private landowners, community groups and restoration trusts.§This position is responsible for providing operational management for all business activities.  Working with the Managing Director, this role will assist with the ongoing strategic development of the company, including aligning EcoFX with projects to support Predator Free 2050 outcomes.§As Operations Manager, your duties will be varied and include preparing and maintaining budgetary control, managing operations in line with health and safety processes and quality assurance.§EcoFX is seeking a person with the following skills:§Essential Skills:§Proven leadership and excellent communicator§Business experience encompassing budgeting and financial analysis.§Detailed operational and project management skills§Logistical planning and management§Key Responsibilities:§Operational scheduling and client reporting§Deliver projects within budgets and to performance targets§Manage staff and sub-contractors§Be part of the Management Team to develop the company and assist with the strategic direction.§Prior experience in this industry is desirable but not essential.  Relevant tertiary study in Business Management or Logistical planning would be advantageous.§Otorohanga and its environs are centrally situated, located 45 minutes south of Hamilton, 40 minutes from Cambridge and 20 minutes from Te Awamutu. Otorohanga is a vibrant rural Waikato town with access to a wide range of outdoor activities.§Applications for this position close on 18 November 2020. A position description can be obtained by contacting Judi Phillips on §07 873 8130§ or §admin@ecofx.co.nz§You must have the right to work in New Zealand.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an operations manager?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§Do you have experience preparing and submitting tenders?§§§

You will also proactively build connections, secure and deliver land use studies and projects in relation to farm management plans. You will have general Agrisector knowledge including the social, cultural and environmental aspects of food production systems. In addition, you will be working with the wider Primary Industries team to secure and deliver projects on farm environmental management plans, nutrient management plans, farm technical risk assessments, and farm operating efficiency audits.§Skills and Experience:§• Masters or PhD in Soil Science or equivalent§• Advanced Nutrient Management Certificate (Massey)§• Preferred Certified Nutrient Management Advisor (CNMA)§• Understanding of a range of NZ farming systems§• Understanding of Regional Plans and NPSFW; consents and policy§• Preferred expertise in land management including farm management planning, soil mapping, LUC classifications and erosion control§• Networks and relationships with key stakeholders in the regions of work§• Technical writing skills§• 3+ years professional experience§• Current clean Drivers Licence§How to Apply:§If this sounds like you, we want you to be part of what makes us great. Are you ready to be part of WSP?§For further information, please view the position description. To apply, just follow the link and apply online.§WSP recognises and values the range of characteristics that make people unique, and do this in an environment that celebrates individual and collective achievement. We believe embracing diversity and inclusion delivers positive experiences for people and clients.§§He aha te mea nui o te ao. He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata.§What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people.§§§§

Are you known as a research ninja? Do you have mad excel skills? Have you got a commerce or finance background and an appetite for learning? Would you like to be in a work environment where your input is sought after and valued?§        §The dairy industry is changing and we're looking for a Business Analyst who can help us as we take a leadership role in tackling critical farming issues. We're working to achieve better water quality, lower greenhouse gases, and produce higher-value sustainable food and fibre products for kiwis and the world. There's a huge variety of work and plenty of scope for you to follow your interests and develop your strengths. If you're smart, proactive, curious, and keen to make an impact, this role's for you.§        §Having a background in agriculture would be great but we also want you to have the confidence to ask questions, tackle new subject matters, and use your critical thinking skills to suggest and follow through on strategies for developing efficiencies. You'll develop relationships with and work across every team in our business which means you'll be learning from some of the sharpest minds in NZ agribusiness.§        §You'll facilitate conversations, provide your analytical insight to complex problems, help transition our agribusiness to a land use company. We're committed to our people and to our animals and you'll be in the unique position to participate at the forefront of these decisions and changes.§        §We'll provide you with a supportive team and tons of growth opportunities here in Wellington or nationwide if you'd like. Being able to engage with all levels of stakeholders will be the cornerstone of your success in this role. The role offers a variety of mentally and physically demanding challenges, so being energetic and fit is important.§ §Previous experience in animal husbandry is a must. We are specifically looking for candidates with Primate experience. You should have an understanding of the zoo industry as well as a BScTech, Certificate in Animal Management (captive wild animals) or similar qualification or experience.§ §To view the full position description, §click here§ §The role is a full time working on a roster across 7 days of the week.§ §Hamilton Zoo, owned and operated by the Hamilton City Council, is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§ §This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§ § §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. This role is covered by the Children’s Act 2014, which means that shortlisted candidates will be required to undergo all safety checking requirements under the Act before commencing employment, as well as during employment. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies.§§§§
