jobTitle: Seasonal Sample Collector Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50791392.txt	§Seasonal Sample Collector§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Seasonal Sample Collector§§Advertiser: §Hill Laboratories§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§ §This is a great role for someone looking for seasonal work in the outdoor environment, with opportunities to travel around your local district!§We are§looking for Seasonal Sample Collectors to join§our Team based around Auckland, South Auckland, Waikato, Coromandel, Waihi - Tauranga, Te Puke, Whakatane & Opotiki for the 2021§Kiwifruit season. Our branch operates 7§days a week during the kiwifruit season and collects and tests samples of fruit from orchards to see if they meet the§Zespri guidelines for export. §No experience is necessary and full training§is provided.§§THE ROLE§This§role is for a Fixed term period with training beginning in December and§some seasonal work through January- February ramping up from March to June, working variable§hours per week. Duties will include driving to§orchards and collecting kiwifruit (on foot) as§required for each sample, and then driving the collected samples to the nearest§drop off point. It is expected that Samplers will be ready to start§collecting at the first orchard at day break and will generally be finished by§mid-afternoon. Samplers will be assigned their work for the following day§between 7-9pm.  Samplers§may work alone or in pairs and will be well§supported by our Field Team Leaders. §SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§§Good map reading§skills§Ability to work within§set timeframes§Flexible due to the§seasonal nature of this role§Ability to use phone§and software apps§Excellent communication skills§Ability to demonstrate resilience and adapt quickly to§change §Clean driving history, full Class 1 drivers licence§An ability to work unsupervised & to be§self-motivated§Maintain professionalism and§respect confidentiality§Team player, able to§create a good working relationship with other staff in the team and across the§company§Candidates are expected to§have a good level of fitness, you will walk up to 16km per day and collect fruit samples weighing 12-16kg.§§All§field activities must adhere to our Quality and Health & Safety standards§and sample collection is carried out rain or shine§so long as it is safe to do so.§This role will suit outdoor§practical people who enjoy working outdoors. Ideally suited to candidates§already working in the kiwifruit industry with time available March - June or§kiwifruit orchardists looking to observe other orchard operations whilst§filling an important industry role.§Experience working in orchards is§an advantage.§WHAT WE OFFER§§Competitive hourly rates§Brand new company cars provided§Early starts and early finishes§You will be supported with the tools and§equipment to carry out the role including smartphone or tablet, job management§application and lone worker monitoring solution§A positive company culture§§ Hill Laboratories is a family-friendly, values driven and§mature New Zealand owned business.  As a§Seasonal Sample Collector you will be part of a great team providing services§to the wider Kiwifruit industry. §This role is open to all candidates – those§on a work visa or working holiday visa are welcome to apply§ § § Apply Now§ § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Portfolio Manager, Crown Property Job in Wellington - SEEK
email: Please see the attached position description for further detail. For further information on this role please contact opportunities@linz.govt.nz and a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.
xenophobe: Our Crown Property group provides the leadership and direction for Crown-owned property, looking for opportunities to maximise these assets for the benefit of New Zealanders. Day-to-day, we manage about two million hectares of Crown land, including surplus Crown assets, commercial and residential properties, pastoral leases and forestry licences.
jobText: TXT/50791439.txt	§Portfolio Manager, Crown Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Manager, Crown Property§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Portfolio Manager, Crown Property §      §      §      §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), we underpin New Zealand's success with information about ‘where' - ensuring New Zealand has accurate information about where people and places are, that people have confidence in their property rights, now and for future generations.§        §Our Crown Property group provides the leadership and direction for Crown-owned property, looking for opportunities to maximise these assets for the benefit of New Zealanders. Day-to-day, we manage about two million hectares of Crown land, including surplus Crown assets, commercial and residential properties, pastoral leases and forestry licences.§        §To further support our Crown Property group in the vital work we do, we are searching for Portfolio Managers, to help us provide management and oversight across a nationwide portfolio of exciting, complex, and challenging projects.  You'll undertake the core disposal of land functions for LINZ managed properties set aside and held for Treaty settlement purposes.  This role also includes monitoring LINZ's compliance with post settlement commitments that will enhance the Crown/Māori partnership relationship.  This role gives you the opportunity to see a tangible impact from the work you are doing helping New Zealanders, on a national basis.§        §Key to succeeding in this role will be your communication skills. You'll be collaborating across various iwi/Māori groups and work together with Te Arawhiti primarily but also with other government departments to facilitate the transfer of Treaty redress.  Some experience in land registration and negotiation for the sale and purchase of property would assist you in this role but training will be provided.§        §With your knowledge of land and property management, you'll apply your experience to proactively continue developing your expertise as you contribute to the development of Crown Property portfolio understanding and management practices. Our work can be reactive at times, you'll have worked in agile, networked ways previously and will be confident in your ability to support the delivery of the team functions and apply a "continuous improvement" mindset to the work you are doing.§        §At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success and long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. If you feel you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed above and, in the PD, then we would like to hear from you.§        § §        §How to Apply§        §To apply, please click §"Apply Online."§ You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV and Cover Letter. §        §Please keep in mind when including your CV and Cover Letter to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description. We're not just all about formal professional experience here at LINZ, if your application also includes some information about the community engagement or volunteering work you've done - we'd love to hear about it!§        § §        §Applications close Wednesday 4th November 2020§        §Please see the attached position description for further detail. For further information on this role please contact opportunities@linz.govt.nz and a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), we underpin New Zealand's success with information about ‘where' - ensuring New Zealand has accurate information about where people and places are, that people have confidence in their property rights, now and for future generations.§Our Crown Property group provides the leadership and direction for Crown-owned property, looking for opportunities to maximise these assets for the benefit of New Zealanders. Day-to-day, we manage about two million hectares of Crown land, including surplus Crown assets, commercial and residential properties, pastoral leases and forestry licences.§To further support our Crown Property group in the vital work we do, we are searching for Portfolio Managers, to help us provide management and oversight across a nationwide portfolio of exciting, complex, and challenging projects.  You'll undertake the core disposal of land functions for LINZ managed properties set aside and held for Treaty settlement purposes.  This role also includes monitoring LINZ's compliance with post settlement commitments that will enhance the Crown/Māori partnership relationship.  This role gives you the opportunity to see a tangible impact from the work you are doing helping New Zealanders, on a national basis.§Key to succeeding in this role will be your communication skills. You'll be collaborating across various iwi/Māori groups and work together with Te Arawhiti primarily but also with other government departments to facilitate the transfer of Treaty redress.  Some experience in land registration and negotiation for the sale and purchase of property would assist you in this role but training will be provided.§With your knowledge of land and property management, you'll apply your experience to proactively continue developing your expertise as you contribute to the development of Crown Property portfolio understanding and management practices. Our work can be reactive at times, you'll have worked in agile, networked ways previously and will be confident in your ability to support the delivery of the team functions and apply a "continuous improvement" mindset to the work you are doing.§At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success and long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. If you feel you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed above and, in the PD, then we would like to hear from you.§ §How to Apply§To apply, please click §"Apply Online."§ You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV and Cover Letter. §Please keep in mind when including your CV and Cover Letter to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description. We're not just all about formal professional experience here at LINZ, if your application also includes some information about the community engagement or volunteering work you've done - we'd love to hear about it!§ §§Applications close Wednesday 4th November 2020§§Please see the attached position description for further detail. For further information on this role please contact opportunities@linz.govt.nz and a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§        §§§§

jobText: TXT/50786439.txt	§Principal Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Adviser§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Principal Adviser §        §          §Ma tau rourou, ma t§a§ku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§          § §          §mō te tūranga§ - §About the role§          §In July 2020 MPI released its roadmap, Fit for a better world - accelerating our economic potential, which sets out actions to bring together opportunities the Government considers will accelerate the productivity, sustainability and inclusiveness of the primary sector, to deliver more value for all New Zealanders.§          § §          §Water security and the productive use and storage of water are key elements within this roadmap. To help realise the potential of water storage MPI is creating a national strategic plan for water storage in conjunction with key partners including, government agencies, local government, Māori, Food and Fibre sector leaders and rural communities to focus future investment. §          § §          §As the Principal Adviser you will provide MPI with strategic leadership in relation to the development and implementation of the Water Storage programme, by developing a strategic overview of the Water Storage programme and acting as the programme ambassador to Senior Stakeholders.§          § §          §This role is fixed term to July 2021 and we will consider secondments from within MPI or across government.§          § §          §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§ - §Skills and Experience§          §To succeed in this role you'll have§          § §          §            §Substantial government agency experience§            §Understanding of the Treaty of Waitangi and Treaty principles§            §Significant experience of writing a range of papers and documents, e.g. Cabinet papers§            §The ability to manage key relationships and utilise existing internal and external networks.§            §Experience in strategic and intellectual leadership.§          §          § §          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) is responsible for ‘Growing and Protecting New Zealand'. It's no mean feat, and we have a team of hard working and passionate people in a variety of roles both on the ground and in the office supporting us to make this happen.§          § §          §MPI has a focus on career pathways and we will work with you to help you grow§.  §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do, please click §here§          § §          §To see the benefits of working at MPI, please click §here§          § §          §If you want a career where you help to grow and protect New Zealand in a very real way then this could be it. Our team is collegial, supportive and hard working. MPI has a focus on career pathways so take this step in your career with us and we will help you develop.§          § §          §Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - §How to apply§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click on §"APPLY NOW"§ or visit the MPI Careers site.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          § §          §For internal candidates please make sure your current manager is aware of your application.§          §Applications close  Wednesday 4 November 2020§          § §          §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Vivien Smith Senior Recruitment Adviser on §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§           §          § §          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Ma tau rourou, ma t§a§ku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§§ §§mō te tūranga§ - §About the role§In July 2020 MPI released its roadmap, Fit for a better world - accelerating our economic potential, which sets out actions to bring together opportunities the Government considers will accelerate the productivity, sustainability and inclusiveness of the primary sector, to deliver more value for all New Zealanders.§ §Water security and the productive use and storage of water are key elements within this roadmap. To help realise the potential of water storage MPI is creating a national strategic plan for water storage in conjunction with key partners including, government agencies, local government, Māori, Food and Fibre sector leaders and rural communities to focus future investment. § §As the Principal Adviser you will provide MPI with strategic leadership in relation to the development and implementation of the Water Storage programme, by developing a strategic overview of the Water Storage programme and acting as the programme ambassador to Senior Stakeholders.§ §This role is fixed term to July 2021 and we will consider secondments from within MPI or across government.§ §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§ - §Skills and Experience§To succeed in this role you'll have§ §§Substantial government agency experience§Understanding of the Treaty of Waitangi and Treaty principles§Significant experience of writing a range of papers and documents, e.g. Cabinet papers§The ability to manage key relationships and utilise existing internal and external networks.§Experience in strategic and intellectual leadership.§§ §§Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§The Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) is responsible for ‘Growing and Protecting New Zealand'. It's no mean feat, and we have a team of hard working and passionate people in a variety of roles both on the ground and in the office supporting us to make this happen.§ §MPI has a focus on career pathways and we will work with you to help you grow§.  §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do, please click §here§ §To see the benefits of working at MPI, please click §here§ §If you want a career where you help to grow and protect New Zealand in a very real way then this could be it. Our team is collegial, supportive and hard working. MPI has a focus on career pathways so take this step in your career with us and we will help you develop.§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§ - §How to apply§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click on §"APPLY NOW"§ or visit the MPI Careers site.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§ §For internal candidates please make sure your current manager is aware of your application.§Applications close  Wednesday 4 November 2020§§ §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Vivien Smith Senior Recruitment Adviser on §Vivien.smith@mpi.govt.nz§           § § §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. jobText: TXT/50786873.txt	§Regional Partner, Extension Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Partner, Extension Services§§Advertiser: §OSPRI§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Regional Partner, Extension Services §      §        §About OSPRI§        §OSPRI is a non-profit organisation which operates in partnership with New Zealand’s primary industries and government to achieve on-farm biosecurity objectives through animal disease management and traceability.  We work closely with our shareholders, Beef and Lamb New Zealand, Dairy NZ, Deer Industry New Zealand and the Ministry for Primary Industries, plus a range of other stakeholders, to deliver on our value statement: §Farmers and markets can depend on us to provide assurance as to the health and status of animals§.§        §OSPRI has a key role in the biosecurity system to contribute to New Zealand’s national and international reputation in animal products.  TBfree and National Animal Identification and Tracing are OSPRI programmes.§        §With a new Chief Executive at the helm, significant and exciting changes have been made over the last 12 months and the next step in OSPRI’s evolution is to establish a high performing, collaborative and forward-thinking organisation with a strong emphasis on organisational agility. §        § §        §About the Role§        §The Regional Partner, Extension Services role is to support farmers, industry groups, and other key stakeholders on their obligations towards traceability and animal disease management. This includes delivering extension services through running workshops and events in the region, building relationships with the community, and preparing and communicating planned operation activities with farmers, stakeholders, the relevant councils and community groups. In this customer-centric role, a proven success of people and process management is matched with a thorough understanding of primary industry, farm management and OSPRI’s services. Often the direct point of call for farmers and landowners, this position will also look for opportunities to partner with organisations to extend OPSRI’s reach and make improvements through engagement with industry groups.§        § §        §What will you be doing? §        §The Regional Partner, Extension Services' role is to support farmers, industry groups, and other key stakeholders on their obligations towards traceability and animal disease management.§        §This includes delivering extension services through running workshops and events in the region, building relationships with the community, and preparing and communicating planned operation activities with farmers, stakeholders, the relevant councils, and community groups.§        §In this customer-centric role, proven success of people and process management is matched with a thorough understanding or interest in primary industries, farm management, and OSPRI’s services. overnight travel is required §          §          §            §Able to use a variety of technology and tools including Microsoft 365 products, mobile devices, online applications. §          §          §            §Able to balance field and office duties effectively §          §        §        § §        §In return we offer §        §          §            §A supportive and energetic team, interesting and exciting work and development opportunities§          §          §            §Flexible working options§          §          §            §Employer funded Life and Trauma Insurance§          §          §            §Annual flu vaccinations§          §          §            §Employee Assistance Program§          §        §        §Please view a copy of the position description by visiting https://www.ospri.co.nz/careers/vacancies/ or email careers@ospri.co.nz .§        §How to apply§       §        §To apply please click ‘Apply for this role’ and include your cover letter and CV.§        §Applications close at 5 pm, Friday 06 November 2020. §We will be assessing and interviewing suitable applicants as applications are received. jobText: TXT/50792276.txt	§Veterinarian Mixed Animal - Full Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinarian Mixed Animal - Full Time§§Advertiser: §Tauranga Veterinary Services Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Are you looking for great team culture, a supportive work environment, a balance of large and small animal in a beautiful part of the country?§  §Tauranga Veterinary Services Ltd is the largest veterinary business in the Western Bay of Plenty servicing Companion animal, Large animal, Lifestyle and Equine clients with four clinics in Papamoa, Tauranga, Te Puna and Katikati. We are proud to be a local and family owned business, with a team of 34 highly skilled and engaged team members.§  §This key position will embody the culture of our organisation as we strive to provide Best Care for our clients and their animals. We have won both the "Service Excellence" and "Customer Experience" awards at the Westpac Business Awards 2017 and 2018, so we are seeking someone who is familiar with providing exceptional levels of care.§  §Based in our Te Puna Clinic, we’d like the successful applicant to be part of our team that strives hard to achieve our practice goals and has a clinical medicine interest, studying towards or has some postgraduate advancement in the area of Equine or Large Animal veterinary practice.§  §We are the only NZVA Best Practice® Accredited Clinic in Tauranga, we strive for excellence in every aspect of our business.§  §The successful applicant will;§ § §Be an experienced Mixed Animal Veterinarian.§ §Have excellent general small animal medical and surgical skills.§ §Be enthusiastic and passionate about the veterinary profession and growing the practice.§ §Have a great team spirit and enjoy being supported by an outstanding team of veterinarians, nurses and support staff.§ §We are looking for someone who is professional, pays attention to detail, is self-directed and has an empathic approach. They will need the ability to relate to both animals and clients and be dedicated to a philosophy of Best Care.§  §This role is full-time including weekends and on-call as per roster.§  §The remuneration package will be commensurate on the skills that you will bring to the practice.   §  § §  §Applications can be sent to David McDonnell Business Manage Tauranga Veterinary Services Limited.§  §davidmcdonnell@bopvets.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary science?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50801162.txt	§Silviculture Forester§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Silviculture Forester§§Advertiser: §Labourworks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§You will actively manage all facets of forestry planning and forest operations from establishment through to harvesting, forest protection and forest acquisitions.  You will also be responsible for providing local and company-wide support to the Technical and Resources Manager. §You will be working for a respected industry leader in land and resource management that takes great pride in growing and marketing renewable forest products around the globe. You will be based in their NZ Forestry Operations in Timaru and work in a small team where you will be subjected to a wide range of tasks and have opportunities to discuss business progress and key issues to grow your role and your business objectives within this highly successful organisation.§The successful candidate will be offered an attractive remuneration package, work vehicle and attractive staff benefits.§Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:§Assisting the Silviculture Operations Manager in all aspects of operations in Silvicultural operations including planning and day to day operational supervision§Ensuring compliance with Health and Safety, Environment, and other legislative requirements§Collecting and entering information for maintaining comprehensive stand record system for the South Island Estate§Assist in managing all aspects of risk (current and future) and protecting South Island Forest and Land Assets§Assisting the Technical and Resources Manager in preparing and implementing a technical programme for the South Island including providing local contact for research providers and technical staff from other organisations§Liaise closely and build effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders including local Iwi, Regulatory Authorities, Contractors, Suppliers, Customers, HS&E Manager, Senior Management Staff and other PB Employees§Qualifications, Experience and Abilities:§Tertiary Qualification – Forestry Bachelor’s degree§Management / Supervision experience – At least 3 years’ experience in successfully managing Contractors involved in the Silviculture function§Experience in Silviculture programme accountability§Experience in areas of Technical Management in Silviculture§Financial and strategic experience – interpreting financial reports, developing, and managing budgets§High level understanding of the concepts around forest economics and investment decisions§Ability to read, analyse, and interpret general business periodicals and information, journals, technical procedures, or government regulations§Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and policy and procedure manuals§Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public§High level of math and reasoning ability§Advanced working knowledge of forest management information systems including GIS, Harvest planning software, Forecaster and Woodstock§Advanced knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint§You will be required to provide two recent and relevant work-related references, complete a drug and medical exam, and have clean driver’s license and criminal conviction check.§We look forward to receiving your application.  Please email your CV and covering letter to §rachel@labourworks.co.nz§ or call Rachel Davis on 027 562 7679 for a confidential discussion.§All applications will be managed by Labourworks NZ Ltd on behalf of Port Blakely.§Applications close 13th November 2020§ § §    § § §§§§

Instead we’ll provide everything you need to feel supported on the ground so you can get on with doing what you do best as a veterinary professional – providing gold standard care for our patients.§ §Our vision to be the best vet and nurse friendly clinics and provide all the equipment and help you need to do your job well and grow as a valued member of our established and busy team. § §About You:§ § §You have a recognised Diploma in Veterinary Nursing or equivalent qualification§ §You are proficient in all-round clinical and surgical nursing with at least a year’s experience working as a vet nurse§ §You’ve got customer service experience and you work well in a team§ §You have computer skills and don’t mind learning new technology§ §You’re passionate about the veterinary industry and high standards of patient care§ §You can be flexible with hours of work to participate in our rosters that include some evenings, weekends and public holidays§ §What we’re offering:  § § §Upgraded equipment in our clinics§ §An awesome CPD budget for our vets and nurses with potential to travel for learning and development opportunities§ §Central support team made up of experienced veterinary professionals§ §The chance to be a part of a supportive local team and national clinical group§ §We’ll help you take the next step in your veterinary nursing career. jobTitle: Mixed Veterinarian  Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50804412.txt	§Mixed Veterinarian §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Mixed Veterinarian §§Advertiser: §Vetora§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§VETORA§ is a large and modern veterinary practice that has been providing Vet services to the Waikato for over 75 years.  We specialise in providing both practical and technical expertise and excellent customer service support to our large and small animal clients through our five clinics in the Waikato region.§Due to an increase in demand, we have a vacancy for a §Mixed Practice Veterinarian§ at our §Vetora Putaruru§ branch.§This full-time position is predominantly dairy focused however there will be an element of participating in small animal consultations and surgeries on a weekly basis. §A number of our clients are very progressive and use our veterinary services to maximise their animal health and production. The client base is composed almost exclusively of privately owned enterprises, so you will regularly get to engage with key decision makers. We endeavor to keep ahead of the game and engage with new techniques and technology.§The after- hours component is not too onerous, allowing for easy access to local recreational pursuits, with numerous lakes, rivers, forests and beaches within an hours drive. §In terms of experience, we will look at candidates from new graduate to late career as there are plenty of ongoing professional development opportunities within the group. Having an exceptional team spirit and a collaborative attitude is a must, as you will be working as part of a high performing team to provide the best veterinary service for our farming and small animal clients.§Vetora offers a comprehensive remuneration and benefits package. If you think you might have what it takes to work in our dynamic team, please apply today.  §To apply, send your CV and Cover letter through Seek. §Applications close: Friday 20 November 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50792614.txt	§Veterinarian - Maternity Cover Fixed Term Six Months§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinarian - Maternity Cover Fixed Term Six Months§§Advertiser: §Tauranga Veterinary Services Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Are you looking for great team culture, a supportive work environment, a balance of interesting small animal medical cases and surgery, in a beautiful part of the country?§  §Tauranga Veterinary Services Ltd is the largest veterinary business in the Western Bay of Plenty servicing Companion animal, Large animal, Lifestyle and Equine clients with four clinics in Papamoa, Tauranga, Te Puna and Katikati. We are proud to be a local and family owned business, with a team of 34 highly skilled and engaged team members.§  §Our clinics provide in-house blood machines (CBC and biochemistry), digital x-ray, ultrasonography, dental x-ray, all within a purpose built facility.  We offer a referral imaging service and also accept a variety of medical and surgical referrals from other practices.§  §We are seeking a full-time Veterinarian professional to work Monday - Friday and on call (covering mixed animal preferable) for a fixed term maternity cover of six months.§  §The successful candidate will have good general small animal surgical and medical skills and some sole charge may be required. §  §We strive to offer our clients the very best in care so being passionate about your role, an effective communicator and the ability to demonstrate positive behaviours are key to working within our practice. §  §In return we will offer you ongoing support, professional development and a team that you are proud to work alongside and look forward to seeing daily.§  §If this role sounds like you and you are passionate about joining our team, email your CV and a cover letter to David McDonnell at §davidmcdonnell@bopvets.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary science?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

MPI Verification Services (MPI VS) provides a range of food safety and biosecurity verification and certification services to support market access strategies and setting standards.§          § §          §About the role: Kōrero mō te tūranga§          §We are looking for a VTS2 to join the team based at AFFCO Wairoa in Wairoa, Hawkes Bay.§          §Wairoa, the hub of Northern Hawke's Bay district has a rich culture and heritage with natural beauty that rivals any in New Zealand! The town itself is easy access to local fishing, a number of hikes & walking tracks, surfing and this base also gives you the opportunity to explore the wild and beautiful Te Urewera and Lake Waikaremoana, the beach Mahia Peninsula, and the Morere Hot Springs.§          §In this position, you will work closely with the VTS1 and the other VTS2 to provide MPI VS services for the multi-species plant which processes cattle, lamb, adult sheep and goats. The plant runs two shifts during the peak summer months including some weekends and you will be rostered onto shifts within a 3-vet team, working a 5x8 pattern.§          §This role is suitable for newer verifiers to build up their knowledge of a wide variety of plant processing, or those looking to put down roots in a rural town at a substantially compliant plant.§          § §          §Skills & Experience: Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako §          §            §A qualified and registered Veterinarian§            §Knowledge of the principles and practices associated with HACCP, Quality Assurance systems, Risk Management Systems§            §Verbal and written skills, verbal and analytical reasoning skills§            §Integrity and trust, ethics and values, resilience, adaptability and openness§            §Persuading and influencing, team work, planning and organising§            §Computer literacy - can operate standard and customised software to an acceptable standard e.g. word-processing, excel, internet, email, database, secure sites, electronic certification, residues etc§            §An understanding of basic food technology§            §A willingness to embrace the verification services Triple O way of working§          §          § If this sounds like you we want to hear from you!§          § §          §About MPI - Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) has a strength of common purpose and a passion to sustainably grow and to protect Aotearoa, for the benefit of all New Zealanders. It's no mean feat and we have a team of hard working and dedicated people in a variety of roles supporting us to make this happen. Our overall ambition is for New Zealand to be the most trusted source of high value natural products in the world. We're working towards sustainability, protection, growth and participation.§          §For more information about MPI does - continue §here.§          § §          § §          §How to Apply:  Me pēhea te tuku tono§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae) please "APPLY NOW" in order to be directed to our website. Further information on this process can be found on our careers site under the application process, on pre-employment checks.§          § §          §Applications close Sunday 08 November 2020§ §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§          § §        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Veterinary Technical Supervisor 2 - Wairoa § §The Team Manager Establishments for Hawkes Bay is looking for a Veterinary Technical Supervisor 2 (VTS2) to join the team in Wairoa.§This role sits within the Verification Services directorate. It's no mean feat and we have a team of hard working and dedicated people in a variety of roles supporting us to make this happen. Our location in North Canterbury means we enjoy all the benefits of rural town living, with everything that Christchurch the ‘Garden City’ and Canterbury have to offer on our back doorstep. Close to the Southern Alps, lifestyle choices abound with a wide range of recreational pursuits, fishing, boating, tramping, climbing, and we are 2 hours away from some of the best snow skiing in the country, without the crowds.§  §Ideally we are looking to recruit a recently graduated veterinarian, with a strong focus on Dairy, starting January 2021.  We may also accept applications from New Graduates.  The location is Culverden where we have 11 Vets who are supported by a further 8 Vets at our other 3 clinics.§We are a mixed rural practice with Dairy, Sheep & Beef and Companion Animal being the main focus, so there is plenty of opportunity to grow your skills with the support of experienced staff.§We operate our own 24/7 after hours’ emergency service, and you will ease into the roster with support from our more experienced Team members.§  §We are looking for someone with great interpersonal skills to build relationships, passionate about Dairy and herd performance as well as being a great team player.§We have a proven track record of developing new graduates, and our team are more than willing to share their knowledge and skills to help you grow.§You will also be supported by our wider team of LA Technicians, Nurses, Animal Health Reps and Administration.§  §The successful candidate will be offered a competitive salary package, medical insurance, staff discount and purchasing privileges, a personalised training and development plan, generous CPD opportunities both internally and externally, and we can support an application to the Vet Bonding Scheme upon meeting the specified criteria as set by MPI.§  §If you are looking to kick start your new career in a supportive and friendly environment, then please email your cover letter and CV to me before jobText: TXT/50799708.txt	§Farm Research and Development Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Farm Research and Development Lead§§Advertiser: §Halter§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§We are looking for someone hungry to make an impact on the world to join us as our Farm Research and Development Lead. We want to talk to people from all backgrounds who can continue to make our team greater than the sum of its parts. We’re looking for people who are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where they will be challenged on a daily basis. To succeed you will need to be able to learn quickly and use your own initiative while working under pressure and to tight deadlines. We embrace learning, we strive to help each other succeed, and will help you make this the best job you’ll ever have.§ § § §What will you be working on?§ §You will be a part of our multi-disciplinary on-farm research & development team composed of engineers, farmers and everything in between. We believe that team culture is vital for our success as a team and as a company and as a result work hard to maintain a fun and casual atmosphere in which you can thrive and develop. § §Our days never look the same; we find ourselves doing anything from wearing gumboots and working with the cows to sitting in our on-farm base working on the next big challenge. We focus on developing new features that our customers will be using in the day-to-day running of their farm using Halter. From the first day you join, you'll be able to have a direct impact on what our product looks like and how farmers use it. Your opinion and input will be vital to the success of this company. § § § §Core Duties§ § § §Acceptance testing all new and current technical features of the Halter product on farm§ § § §You will play a critical part in finding technical issues and reporting them back to the engineering team§ § § §Running research projects on the farm and ensuring that they are completed with methodology , analysis and conclusions documented§ § § §Collecting and analysing data from research projects and tests in order to make reliable conclusions§ § § §Help to brainstorm and come up with potential solution for problems with the way systems work on farm, with our customers at the forefront of the decision making§ § § §Assist in the process and development of the process for training cows§ § § §Day to day operations of the farm activities to ensure work on the farm is completed in an effective and efficient manner§ § § §Keep an up to date understanding of the companies priorities and use this to direct how time is spent on farm§ § § §You will be Halters go-to for providing and communicating farming lingo to the wider business§ § § § §Desired Skills§ § § §You have fantastic organisational skills and have no issues managing competing deadlines and tasks§ § § §You’ve got several years experience in the dairy farming industry and know how stock handling works§ § § §You’re technical and able to pass this knowledge on to your team§ § § §Sound communication comes naturally to you. You’re able to work with farmers, technical folk and everyone in between§ § § §Relevant University degree or equivalent preferred but not required§ § § §You are comfortable with ambiguity and you thrive in a fast paced environment§ § § §You have managed a team before. You’ll play a key part in building and developing this team. You know how to lead a team to achieve success!§  § § §What we can offer you§ § § §An open and supportive environment where input from all members is encouraged§ § § §The opportunity to work with and grow alongside a dynamic, and highly talented team with diverse backgrounds§ § § §A fast-paced work environment that enables and encourages knowledge sharing and skill development§ § § §Opportunity for rapid development and career progression§ § § §Competitive package and perks§ § § §The excitement, risk, and reward of a high-growth technology start-up§ § § § chance to define the future of farming and make the world a better place§ § §If this sounds like you, click apply§ §and submit your CV and cover letter today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50791471.txt	§Biosecurity Field Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Biosecurity Field Officer§§Advertiser: §AsureQuality Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§The opportunity§Our Biosecurity team provide services to help protect New Zealand against exotic pests and disease incursions. Our team provides biosecurity surveillance trap monitoring for the MPI surveillance programmes and eradication work for the National Invasive Ant Surveillance programme. As a member of our team you will cover a range of tasks such as trapping, inspection and sampling.§We are looking for a trapping superstar in the Napier region. We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining great people, and supporting them to be the best they can be. We know diverse teams are stronger teams and we believe in fairness and opportunity for all.§Helping Aotearoa shape a better food world.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Science Officer – 2020-21 Antarctic Voyage Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50808032.txt	§ Science Officer – 2020-21 Antarctic Voyage§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§ Science Officer – 2020-21 Antarctic Voyage§§Advertiser: §Talley's Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Fishing & Aquaculture§§§§§§  §Talley’s are looking for a Science Officer to join our Longline crew onboard the F.V Janas on her 2020/21 summer voyage to the Ross Sea in Antarctica.§The vessel is licenced by the NZ Govt and the Commission for the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources (CCAMLR) to take part in the Toothfish Research fishery in Antarctica. §The vessel will depart Nelson in mid-November and the voyage is anticipated to take between 60-100 days. It will see the vessel operating in one of the most highly regulated fisheries in the world.§The vessel takes part in various research activities within the Ross Sea during the fishing season and the Science Officer is responsible for administering the many compliance reporting requirements mandated by the CCAMLR licence as well as carrying out the practical side of the research, including fish tagging, assisting in biological sampling and other data collection activities. §They will also be tasked with assisting the two CCAMLR Observers and may be involved in hands on duties in the Hauling room and Factory. §The successful applicant would ideally have a scientific background; however, this is not essential. It may suit a grad student with an interest in Fisheries or the Antarctic field.§The successful applicant will be proficient with MS Excel and extremely detail-oriented, particularly when working with data, as complying with the many critical reporting requirements and accurate data administration is the key function of this role. §Full training will be provided to the successful applicant. §The role is physically demanding, so the successful candidate must be fit and healthy. They will be required to undertake a full pre-employment medical and a drug test and provide evidence of a recent dental check.§If this sounds like you, please send your CV and cover letter to §§§§

jobText: TXT/50795691.txt	§Qualified Weed-eater operator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Qualified Weed-eater operator§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Qualified Weed-eater operator §      §        § §        §          §Work outdoors at the Waiheke Depot§          §Competitive hourly rate                    §          §Opportunity to learn and grow your career in Horticulture§        §        § §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        § §        §Are you looking to make a difference locally? Amenities & Infrastructure Maintenance Services (AIM Services) staff are proud to care for our local parks, community facilities and infrastructure for the enjoyment of everyone in our region.§ §        §Waiheke Island is a special place, and this is your opportunity to work outdoors and take on the island's beautiful beaches and parks as you help keep the island in pristine condition.§ §        §We are currently looking for qualified/experienced weed eater opperator to join our team at Waiheke Depot. In this role, you will be responsible for the upkeep of a wide range of parks and Tracks §        § §        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §You will be an Enthusiastic person who enjoys outdoor work and can adapt to all weathers. Ability to work in a team and comply with health and safety requirements will be key to your success. Listed as ‘Third Most Admired Wine Brand in the World’ Villa Maria now exports to over 60 countries. We are now seeking Vintage Cellarhands to join us in Marlborough for the 2021 harvest season. So, we need experienced and inexperienced people to join our team as we have different levels of Cellarhand roles to offer.§What we need from you:§  §Share our culture of Health & Safety first and be eager to learn our processes and procedures.§  §Be physically fit and have a positive attitude with a hands-on approach.§  §Be self-motivated and energetic with a great work ethic.§  §The ability to multitask and work well under pressure while having a strong attention to detail.§  §Forklift competency will be highly valued.§What we will offer you:§  §A competitive remuneration rate§  §A daily shift meal§  §Relevant training depending on the experience you bring§  §A safe and supportive work environment§Vintage Cellarhand§If you come with a willingness to learn and have an optimistic, can do attitude and enjoy physical work will be offered a full induction and training program for their role. Shift work will be required and during the peak of harvest working up to 10 hour shifts across 6 days.§Due to border closures we will only be accepting applications from New Zealand Residents or international applicants who are currently in New Zealand. §Evidence of a Work Visa or Residency will be required. Don't miss out on an opportunity to join our 2021 vintage team. Apply now.   §§§§

jobTitle: Biosecurity Champions Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50818253.txt	§Biosecurity Champions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Biosecurity Champions§§Advertiser: §Randstad Assessment Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Biosecurity Champions §      §        §If you are passionate about keeping Aotearoa, New Zealand's flora, fauna, and natural resources clean and green, or if you have an interest in biosecurity then this will be the role for you! We are seeking reliable individuals who want to protect this beautiful country. Serious biosecurity issues, including Kauri Dieback disease [link removed], rodents, and plague skinks to name a few, are affecting Tāmaki Makaurau, Auckland's landscape, and we want you to be a champion to prevent any more damage. §        § §        §You will be educating visitors hiking through Tāmaki Makaurau, Auckland's tracks and traveling from the waterfront to the Hauraki Gulf Islands, on the importance of preventing the spread of pests and diseases. As a Biosecurity Champion, you will provide friendly education and advice to increase awareness of these issues and what people can do themselves. This is an important role that will allow you to be an advocate for Aotearoa, New Zealand's landscapes, and natural §taonga §and our collective wellbeing. With the potential for ongoing work into 2021, this perfect opportunity to take on exciting summer work and kick-start your new year. There are full time and part-time opportunities available. §        § §        §Being a Biosecurity Champion means you will be stationed at popular tracks in local and regional parks across Tāmaki Makaurau, Auckland, and/or at key waterfront ferry and boat departure points. You will be scheduled on a seven-day roster and will be required to work weekends and public holidays from early/mid-November 2020 to April 2021. All Champions must also be comfortable working solo, outdoors all day and sometimes in remote locations. §        § §        §Key responsibilities:§        §          §Engaging with people in meaningful conversations, and educating visitors to tracks, parks and islands§          §Encouraging best biosecurity practices, such as checking and cleaning shoes, bags, gear and vehicles§          §Collecting data and reporting this to the Biosecurity Champion Coordinator§          §Reporting any issues and non-compliance immediately to the Biosecurity Co-ordinator§          §Monitoring stock levels and distributing collateral as needed§          §Attending briefing and training sessions as required §§        §        §Must-haves:§        §          §Has a demonstrated interest in New Zealand biosecurity and conservation issues§          §Access to a reliable means of transport §          §Access to a reliable smartphone §          §Organised and reliable worker§          §Strong communication and people skills §          §Outgoing and engaging personality §          §Ability to problem solve effectively and make key decisions in a timely manner§          §Ability to work around a 7-day roster§        §        § §        §Desirable but not required:§        §          §Knowledge/experience of general native ecology and threats (such as mammalian pest and kauri dieback) and/or§          §BSc or relevant tertiary qualification in biosecurity, biodiversity, related environmental or agricultural science and/or§          §Previous experience working in an environmental advocacy role and/or§          §Experience working within, or studying, an ecological or conservation field§          §Having worked for any volunteer organisations or community groups with a focus on the environment or conservation§          §Holds a current first aid certificate§        §        § §        §If you this sounds like you or you are interested in finding out more please click apply now or contact Jessica Suri via email §jessica.suri@randstad.co.nz§ or phone §09 336 0361§.§        § §        §We look forward to hearing from you!§        §At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.§      §      §      §    §    §randstad.co.nz§  §§§If you are passionate about keeping Aotearoa, New Zealand's flora, fauna, and natural resources clean and green, or if you have an interest in biosecurity then this will be the role for you! As a Biosecurity Champion, you will provide friendly education and advice to increase awareness of these issues and what people can do themselves. This is an important role that will allow you to be an advocate for Aotearoa, New Zealand's landscapes, and natural §taonga §and our collective wellbeing. With the potential for ongoing work into 2021, this perfect opportunity to take on exciting summer work and kick-start your new year. There are full time and part-time opportunities available. § §Being a Biosecurity Champion means you will be stationed at popular tracks in local and regional parks across Tāmaki Makaurau, Auckland, and/or at key waterfront ferry and boat departure points. You will be scheduled on a seven-day roster and will be required to work weekends and public holidays from early/mid-November 2020 to April 2021. All Champions must also be comfortable working solo, outdoors all day and sometimes in remote locations. § §Key responsibilities:§Engaging with people in meaningful conversations, and educating visitors to tracks, parks and islands§Encouraging best biosecurity practices, such as checking and cleaning shoes, bags, gear and vehicles§Collecting data and reporting this to the Biosecurity Champion Coordinator§Reporting any issues and non-compliance immediately to the Biosecurity Co-ordinator§Monitoring stock levels and distributing collateral as needed§Attending briefing and training sessions as required §§Must-haves:§Has a demonstrated interest in New Zealand biosecurity and conservation issues§Access to a reliable means of transport §Access to a reliable smartphone §Organised and reliable worker§Strong communication and people skills §Outgoing and engaging personality §Ability to problem solve effectively and make key decisions in a timely manner§Ability to work around a 7-day roster§ §Desirable but not required:§Knowledge/experience of general native ecology and threats (such as mammalian pest and kauri dieback) and/or§BSc or relevant tertiary qualification in biosecurity, biodiversity, related environmental or agricultural science and/or§Previous experience working in an environmental advocacy role and/or§Experience working within, or studying, an ecological or conservation field§Having worked for any volunteer organisations or community groups with a focus on the environment or conservation§Holds a current first aid certificate§ §If you this sounds like you or you are interested in finding out more please click apply now or contact Jessica Suri via email §jessica.suri@randstad.co.nz§ or phone §09 336 0361§.§ §We look forward to hearing from you!§At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. jobText: TXT/50820005.txt	§Box Quality Control§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Box Quality Control§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Box Quality Controller § §CentralPac is a cherry orchard deep in the heart of Central Otago, New Zealand, growing premium cherries for export. We grow, pack and sell cherries nationally and internationally.§ §We are seeking a Box QC to conduct random samples of completed boxes from export and local lines to ensure that the boxes meet grade standards. This year our season is anticipated to start in Nov/Dec 2020 and finishes in Feb/March 2021.  This role will be for a fixed term period of 10-13/14 weeks.  Full time hours up to seven days a week.  Applicants must be available for the whole season.§ §Duties include:§ §Take a completed box from one of the lines - record the grade and size details on the inspection form, check the quality defects, brix and firmness and record the findings on the inspection form       §Distribute completed inspection forms to the Production Manager and Operations Manager            §Remove any defects from the box and dispose of them before returning the box to the correct line to be topped up      §Advise the QC Manager immediately of any issues with the line of fruit       §Do inspections on random samples from waste bins and record the results on the appropriate inspection form          §Advise the QC Manager of any health and safety issues   §Carry out other duties as instructed by Management      § §Minimum one year, quality control experience working specifically with cherries is required.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a quality control (QC) role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50830649.txt	§Practicing Veterinarian / Lecturer in Production Animal Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practicing Veterinarian / Lecturer in Production Animal Health§§Advertiser: §Massey University§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Practicing Veterinarian / Lecturer in Production Animal Health §    §    §      §      §      §        §College of Sciences§Palmerston North§        §Du​e to Covid-19 and the worldwide pandemic, we are currently only accepting applications from New Zealand Citizens, New Zealand Residents who are either residing in New Zealand or overseas OR applicants who hold a valid work visa and are currently living in New Zealand.§        §To view academic salary scales, please §click here§        §The School of Veterinary Sciences at Massey University invites applications for the position of §Lecturer / Senior Lecturer / Practicing Veterinarian / Senior Practicing Veterinarian in Large Animal Health and Production §based in the mighty Manawatū of New Zealand. This is a permanent full-time position. Depending on the background of the successful applicant, the role can be focussed predominantly on clinical service and teaching, or can also encompass clinical research and advanced practice.§        §Why you are right for this role§        §If you are interested in inspiring and engaging the next generation of veterinarians this is the ideal opportunity for you. §The position is suited to an ambitious large animal veterinarian who wishes to further develop their career in large animal health and production. You will provide clinical services to clients of the Farm Services group within the Veterinary Teaching Hospital and participate in teaching during on-farm visits, in practical's, tutorials and lectures. If you have a specialist qualification in a production animal discipline, there is scope to continue to develop in your specialisation and to train interns and residents. Depending on your background, qualifications and ambitions, there may be opportunities to develop a research focus in conjunction with your clinical duties.§        §While you will be working directly in a dynamic team of production animal veterinarians and support staff, this position will also provide you with a variety of opportunities to develop your career alongside veterinary and animal scientists with world-class expertise in education, pastoral animal health, preventative medicine, pastoral nutrition, information systems, pathology, theriogenology and epidemiology.§        §You must hold a veterinary degree registrable in New Zealand and have clinical experience.§        §We embrace diversity, talent and performance, and provide staff and students with an extensive range of opportunities to develop intellectually, professionally and personally.§        §Why Massey?§        §The School of Veterinary Sciences advances knowledge in animal health and welfare, biosecurity, conservation and sustainable productivity. We are a world-leader in our field, working with governments, other universities, international and national organisations and companies to improve animal health and production, and human health. https://bit.ly/38isehV§        §Seeking work/life flexibility?§        §If you are not familiar with Palmerston North, it is a family-friendly, eminently bikeable, compact city of approximately 82,000 people and is centrally located in the North Island of New Zealand https://www.manawatunz.co.nz/live-work/working-here/§        §Enquiries of an academic nature may be directed to Dr Danielle Gifford (§d.gifford@massey.ac.nz§) or Prof Richard Laven (§R.Laven@massey.ac.nz§).§        §Closing date: 9 November 2020§Reference number: CS_SVSFS_587_10/20§        §For further information and to apply online, visit: http://masseyunicareers.nga.net.nz§      §      §      §      §We are inspired by our name §Te Kunenga Ki Pu-rehuroa§; from inception to infinity. Massey is not simply defined by what we do, but by how we do it. As a Tiriti-led University we are committed to demonstrating authentic leadership in contemporary Aotearoa New Zealand as we uphold Te Tiriti o Waitangi, the founding document of our nation, and its principles through our practice.§        §        §Toi te mana, toi te reo, toi te Tiriti§      §    §    §  §§§College of Sciences§Palmerston North§Du​e to Covid-19 and the worldwide pandemic, we are currently only accepting applications from New Zealand Citizens, New Zealand Residents who are either residing in New Zealand or overseas OR applicants who hold a valid work visa and are currently living in New Zealand.§To view academic salary scales, please §click here§The School of Veterinary Sciences at Massey University invites applications for the position of §Lecturer / Senior Lecturer / Practicing Veterinarian / Senior Practicing Veterinarian in Large Animal Health and Production §based in the mighty Manawatū of New Zealand. This is a permanent full-time position. Depending on the background of the successful applicant, the role can be focussed predominantly on clinical service and teaching, or can also encompass clinical research and advanced practice.§Why you are right for this role§If you are interested in inspiring and engaging the next generation of veterinarians this is the ideal opportunity for you. §The position is suited to an ambitious large animal veterinarian who wishes to further develop their career in large animal health and production. You will provide clinical services to clients of the Farm Services group within the Veterinary Teaching Hospital and participate in teaching during on-farm visits, in practical's, tutorials and lectures. If you have a specialist qualification in a production animal discipline, there is scope to continue to develop in your specialisation and to train interns and residents. Depending on your background, qualifications and ambitions, there may be opportunities to develop a research focus in conjunction with your clinical duties.§While you will be working directly in a dynamic team of production animal veterinarians and support staff, this position will also provide you with a variety of opportunities to develop your career alongside veterinary and animal scientists with world-class expertise in education, pastoral animal health, preventative medicine, pastoral nutrition, information systems, pathology, theriogenology and epidemiology.§You must hold a veterinary degree registrable in New Zealand and have clinical experience.§We embrace diversity, talent and performance, and provide staff and students with an extensive range of opportunities to develop intellectually, professionally and personally.§Why Massey?§The School of Veterinary Sciences advances knowledge in animal health and welfare, biosecurity, conservation and sustainable productivity. We are a world-leader in our field, working with governments, other universities, international and national organisations and companies to improve animal health and production, and human health. https://bit.ly/38isehV§Seeking work/life flexibility?§If you are not familiar with Palmerston North, it is a family-friendly, eminently bikeable, compact city of approximately 82,000 people and is centrally located in the North Island of New Zealand https://www.manawatunz.co.nz/live-work/working-here/§Enquiries of an academic nature may be directed to Dr Danielle Gifford (§d.gifford@massey.ac.nz§) or Prof Richard Laven (§R.Laven@massey.ac.nz§).§Closing date: 9 November 2020§Reference number: CS_SVSFS_587_10/20§For further information and to apply online, visit: http://masseyunicareers.nga.net.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50835408.txt	§Veterinarian§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinarian§§Advertiser: §YourVet Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§YourVet Ltd is a rapidly growing independent, mixed animal practice situated in beautiful Bream Bay, an area renowned for having some of the best coastal locations in NZ (and the world) including Langs Beach, Waipu Cove, One Tree Point and Ruakaka.§  §If you want to live a Northland coastal lifestyle while working in a progressive vet practice, this is your opportunity to work in a place most other people only get to visit on holiday and is only two hours (and decreasing) north of Auckland.§  §You will become the fifth veterinarian in our experienced team and this position will require a motivated person to assist in the continued growth of our practice. This is a mixed role suited to someone interested in working with both farm and companion animals - though any applicant with a small or large animal preference would be considered.§  §Our purpose-built building is located on State Highway One, giving us a high profile and easy access for our clients. We offer a wide range of high quality service to both production and companion animals and their owners. Our clinic houses an excellent range of equipment including digital x-ray, in-house lab, full dental cart, orthopaedic equipment including TTA, small and large animal ultrasound and new equine facility.§  §An equipped 4x4 vehicle, laptop, and mobile will be provided as part of an attractive salary package.§  §Please apply with your CV and cover letter through Seek.§  §Any queries please phone Mike Macartney on 027 432 0500§  § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50833399.txt	§Senior Beekeepers and Assistant Beekepers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Beekeepers and Assistant Beekepers§§Advertiser: §Tweeddale's Honey§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§About us§The values of hard work and care for nature have spanned over 70 years and four generations to create one of New Zealand’s largest and oldest family-owned honey producers, Tweeddale’s. Every pot of Tweeddale’s honey is imbued with passion, respect, and expertise. It results in a very special product - premium quality, traceable and certified pure New Zealand honey.§§Qualifications & experience§§Senior Beekeeper must have 5+ years experience in Commercial Beekeeping§Assistant Beekeeper must have 1 to 2+ years experience as a Trainee Beekeeper§New Zealand Certificate in Apiculture (Level 4) or similar qualifications and level of experience§Familiar use of basic technology required for our electronic timesheet clock in and out and general communications.§§§Tasks & responsibilities§§Team Leader & Senior Beekeepers - Management, plans, organises, controls, coordinates and operates apiaries to produce honey, queen bee pollen, beeswax and royal jelly, breed queen bees and pollinate crops§Swarm control, Disease identification and control, feeding bees, re-queening hives, making successful nuclei, shifting hives, removal of honey, wintering hives, organic treatment of varroa and more §You will be responsible for aspects of the planning, organisation, control, coordination and performance of apriaries operations to breed, raise and increase Tweeddale's Honey Apiaries production§Assistant Beekeeper - Feeding beehives, assisting in swarm controls, placing honey boxes, harvesting honey boxes, assist in preparation of beehives for winter season§Repairing as instructed beehive components, washing trucks and general apiary duties from transportation and maintenance assistance as required§From time to time to be expected to perform Beekeeper duties. As such, they will be responsible under the ultimate supervision and guidance of Senior Staff and/or Management§§§Benefits§§Leading the industry in Commercial Honey Production§Remuneration based on Experience and Skill Levels§Work within a well establish NZ Family owned business§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§
