jobText: TXT/50820915.txt	§Technical Specialist - Animal Nutrition§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Specialist - Animal Nutrition§§Advertiser: §PGG Wrightson§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Technical Specialist - Animal Nutrition §      §        §Fielding§        §PGG Wrightson is New Zealand's largest provider of products and services to the agricultural and rural sector. To support our Retail and Water business we have built a dynamic team of technical specialists to support PGG Wrightson staff and farming clients. We are now seeking an experienced and qualified Vet with a passion for ruminant nutrition to join this team. There is flexibility as to where this role is based. As the role involves support of our North Island store network a company car is provided and being close to a regional airport is an advantage.§        §This role will utilise technical knowledge in veterinary science/ruminant nutrition to support and train in-field sales and store staff, advise key clients, maintain industry interaction and contribute to marketing strategies. This is an opportunity to combine a passion for technology transfer and rural extension with knowledge of New Zealand farming. The Technical Team enjoy close working relationships.§        §The opportunity to understand the interactions of soil science, agronomy, nutrition and animal health in successful farms systems is a real attraction of this job. We are looking for someone with the personality to fit in and add to this team.§        §The successful candidate will have an aptitude for adult education and training, this will be balanced with practical hands on experience in the New Zealand farming industry including in depth knowledge of large and small ruminant nutrition in forage based farm systems.§        §The successful candidate will:§        §          §Work independently to achieve the goals of the team§          §Have relevant qualifications and a minimum three years practical experience, with the ability to successfully build strong working relationships and autonomously manage your own time§          §Have a passion for New Zealand agriculture§          §Have a high level of written and verbal communication skills with the ability to transfer knowledge and be able to present to large groups§          §Have a sound level of commercial focus and acumen§          §Have the ability to travel the North Island as required.§        §        §Come and join a great team with a proven track record and be part of a group of passionate, knowledgeable and engaging people.§        §For further information, please call Milton Munro, Technical Team Manager on 027 705 4714.§        §Apply now or to find out more about working at PGG Wrightson or view other opportunities visit https://careers.pggwrightson.co.nz/search and enter reference number 15982SK§        §Applications close on Tuesday, 17 November 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Fielding§PGG Wrightson is New Zealand's largest provider of products and services to the agricultural and rural sector. To support our Retail and Water business we have built a dynamic team of technical specialists to support PGG Wrightson staff and farming clients. We are now seeking an experienced and qualified Vet with a passion for ruminant nutrition to join this team. There is flexibility as to where this role is based. As the role involves support of our North Island store network a company car is provided and being close to a regional airport is an advantage.§This role will utilise technical knowledge in veterinary science/ruminant nutrition to support and train in-field sales and store staff, advise key clients, maintain industry interaction and contribute to marketing strategies. This is an opportunity to combine a passion for technology transfer and rural extension with knowledge of New Zealand farming. The Technical Team enjoy close working relationships.§The opportunity to understand the interactions of soil science, agronomy, nutrition and animal health in successful farms systems is a real attraction of this job. We are looking for someone with the personality to fit in and add to this team.§The successful candidate will have an aptitude for adult education and training, this will be balanced with practical hands on experience in the New Zealand farming industry including in depth knowledge of large and small ruminant nutrition in forage based farm systems.§The successful candidate will:§Work independently to achieve the goals of the team§Have relevant qualifications and a minimum three years practical experience, with the ability to successfully build strong working relationships and autonomously manage your own time§Have a passion for New Zealand agriculture§Have a high level of written and verbal communication skills with the ability to transfer knowledge and be able to present to large groups§Have a sound level of commercial focus and acumen§Have the ability to travel the North Island as required.§Come and join a great team with a proven track record and be part of a group of passionate, knowledgeable and engaging people.§For further information, please call Milton Munro, Technical Team Manager on 027 705 4714.§Apply now or to find out more about working at PGG Wrightson or view other opportunities visit https://careers.pggwrightson.co.nz/search and enter reference number 15982SK§Applications close on Tuesday, 17 November 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50827610.txt	§Shepherd§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Shepherd§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Labour§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Shepherd §      §        § §        §          §Be directly involved in the region’s largest urban farming enterprise§          §Southern Auckland location, covering Southern and Western farms§          §Take this opportunity to further develop your shepherding skillset§        §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §Auckland Council’s farming operation spans across 19 Regional Park locations throughout the Auckland region and at 1430ha is thought to be one of the world’s largest urban farming enterprises. The farming operations comprise 6650 sheep/1200 cattle in total, both breeding and finishing. Stock class management, breed type, stocking rates and sheep to cattle ratio are set on the best fit for managing public land without compromising the park resources and wider objectives.§ §With a new structure in place, Auckland Council now requires a Shepherd to work on the region’s Southern and Western farms. The key focus of this position is to work collectively with the Farming Operations Manager and Block Supervisors to implement the operational plan in a way that optimises farm performance. This is a fantastic opportunity to further develop your shepherding skillset with involvement in all day-to-day tasks on farm including stock work, animal health, pasture management and general maintenance.§ §He kōrero mōu: About you§ §The successful applicant for this position will have 1 – 3 dogs under good command along with proven practical farming skills such as stockmanship, fencing, general maintenance and the ability to use farm machinery and equipment safely. You will be committed to ongoing self-development and receptive to learning new technologies to help improve farm productivity and profitability.§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§ §Auckland Council stands for excellent environmental, social and farming outcomes and has committed a specialised business unit to ensure the farming strategy is executed. We are using innovative technological solutions designed in collaboration with other organisations which are an increasingly important part of the council’s efforts to improve its farming practices.  This is your chance to be involved in a farming business where quality land, livestock, infrastructure and the best people are central to its goals. § §If you are high performing, passionate about Auckland and the world around you and would like the chance to be a part of how we manage the farm as a holistic system so we can balance it being a green space, a productive farm and a key part of the natural environment, then join us. Apply today (telling us why you are interested in and right for this opportunity) by cover letter along with your CV.§ §Applications close Wednesday, 11th November 2020§ §You will be required to have a valid NZ driver's licence.§ §This role is deemed safety sensitive and, in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug & alcohol testing.§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ § §Be directly involved in the region’s largest urban farming enterprise§ §Southern Auckland location, covering Southern and Western farms§ §Take this opportunity to further develop your shepherding skillset§ §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §Auckland Council’s farming operation spans across 19 Regional Park locations throughout the Auckland region and at 1430ha is thought to be one of the world’s largest urban farming enterprises. The farming operations comprise 6650 sheep/1200 cattle in total, both breeding and finishing. Stock class management, breed type, stocking rates and sheep to cattle ratio are set on the best fit for managing public land without compromising the park resources and wider objectives.§ §With a new structure in place, Auckland Council now requires a Shepherd to work on the region’s Southern and Western farms. The key focus of this position is to work collectively with the Farming Operations Manager and Block Supervisors to implement the operational plan in a way that optimises farm performance. This is a fantastic opportunity to further develop your shepherding skillset with involvement in all day-to-day tasks on farm including stock work, animal health, pasture management and general maintenance.§ §He kōrero mōu: About you§ §The successful applicant for this position will have 1 – 3 dogs under good command along with proven practical farming skills such as stockmanship, fencing, general maintenance and the ability to use farm machinery and equipment safely. You will be committed to ongoing self-development and receptive to learning new technologies to help improve farm productivity and profitability.§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§ §Auckland Council stands for excellent environmental, social and farming outcomes and has committed a specialised business unit to ensure the farming strategy is executed. We are using innovative technological solutions designed in collaboration with other organisations which are an increasingly important part of the council’s efforts to improve its farming practices.  This is your chance to be involved in a farming business where quality land, livestock, infrastructure and the best people are central to its goals. § §If you are high performing, passionate about Auckland and the world around you and would like the chance to be a part of how we manage the farm as a holistic system so we can balance it being a green space, a productive farm and a key part of the natural environment, then join us. Apply today (telling us why you are interested in and right for this opportunity) by cover letter along with your CV.§ §Applications close Wednesday, 11th November 2020§ §You will be required to have a valid NZ driver's licence.§ §This role is deemed safety sensitive and, in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug & alcohol testing.§Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

conserve and manage highly migratory fish stocks across the Pacific Ocean.  Samoa is a member country and, as such, is expected to integrate all decisions and regulations made by WCPFC.  The Fisheries Division Team within the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF) is responsible for the integration.§  § A volunteer is needed to strengthen the knowledge and expertise of the Fisheries Division as they aim to successfully integrate these decisions and regulations.  Key to the role will be supporting the team to understand their obligations and how they integrate with current operations.§ Day to day you will work alongside staff to map their obligations against existing operations, as well as provide support to plan for implementation of future conventions, decisions and regulations.§  § jobText: TXT/50832000.txt	§Potted Plant Production - Nursery Grafter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Potted Plant Production - Nursery Grafter§§Advertiser: §Riversun Nursery§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Riversun is focused on “Growing Excellence”- providing a safe and nurturing environment for our people, our plants, our community and our planet.  We are committed to achieving genuine sustainability - having already eliminated artificial fertilisers, systemic sprays and herbicides from our field nursery operations.  We have been carboNZero certified since 2018 and have many other exciting sustainability initiatives well underway.  Riversun is New Zealand’s premier supplier of certified plant material.§ §Riversun is based in beautiful Te Tairawhiti, first City to see the sun, home of beautiful sandy beaches, fantastic surfing, fishing and hunting.  We may be small, but we punch well above our weight when it comes to our beauty and natural resources.  A traffic jam in Gisborne mean’s it takes you 15 minutes to get somewhere instead of 10, a crowded beach is when you can see someone a few hundred metres down from you and there are such things as your “good” shorts when you go out in Summer!  Gisborne offers a more relaxed and family friendly way of life, where you won’t be stuck in your vehicle for hours each day commuting, where the beach or bush is truly on your doorstep and Lake Waikaremoana is just up the road.§ §Tasks & Responsibilities§ § §Perform the proper techniques as per training and SOP’s for Avocado, Kiwifruit, Persimmons, Potted Grapevines, Super vines, Rootstocks and future products.§ §Harvesting of budwood to be used as rootstock and scion.§ §The grading, sorting and preparation of plants for grafting process.§ §Graft plants and trees into different rootstock by inserting and tying buds into incisions in rootstock.§ §Grading, sorting and preparation of plants for dispatch to clients is undertaken in a timely manner and in conjunction with dispatch request, standard operating procedures and quality measures.§ §Plant health is activity monitored and your team leader is immediately notified of any observations to ensure plant health is maintained at optimum levels.§ §High level of attention to detail and work ethic.§ §Qualifications & Experience§ § §Horticultural experience an advantage§ §Adaptable, flexible, able to change plans based on the changes in the plants, a problem solver.§ §Self-aware, regimented/understands and works to the time sensitive nature of the plants.§ §Takes responsibility for results, organised, sets standards§ §Strong interpersonal skills, a clear communicator, collaborates well with others, builds relationships.§ §Benefits§ § §Company Medical Insurance Plan§ §Lunch provided 4 days a week§ § § §To Apply§ §Download the full job description at: §www.riversun.co.nz/employment/§ and if this sounds like the job for you please apply with a cover letter and your CV attached to:§ §Anna Thorpe§Riversun Nursery Ltd§Email: info@riversun.co.nz §Or drop your application into our offices at 257 Awapuni Road, Gisborne.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

achieving genuine sustainability - having already eliminated artificial fertilisers, systemic sprays and herbicides from our field nursery operations.  We have been carboNZero certified since 2018 and have many other exciting sustainability initiatives well underway.  Riversun is New Zealand’s premier supplier of certified plant material.§ §Riversun is based in beautiful Te Tairawhiti, first City to see the sun, home of beautiful sandy beaches, fantastic surfing, fishing and hunting.  We may be small, but we punch well above our weight when it comes to our beauty and natural resources.  A traffic jam in Gisborne mean’s it takes you 15 minutes to get somewhere instead of 10, a crowded beach is when you can see someone a few hundred metres down from you and there are such things as your “good” shorts when you go out in Summer!  Gisborne offers a more relaxed and family friendly way of life, where you won’t be stuck in your vehicle for hours each day commuting, where the beach or bush is truly on your doorstep and Lake Waikaremoana is just up the road.§ §Tasks & Responsibilities§ § §Train, coach and lead staff§ §Make sure all equipment required is in good order, calibrated if required and available prior to operations commencing§ §Be proactive in learning about plant health, pest and disease to assist in the production of top-quality plants§ §Play a hands-on role in all Nursery projects and activities, as directed by the Production Supervisor.§ §Assist with the Nursery operation ensuring traceability is not compromised and contribute to the ongoing training of staff.§ §Make sure activities are carried out as per SOP and be proactive with suggestions of improving the process and efficiency.§ §Ensure all documentation that you are required to carry out is done accurately, according to SOP and in a tidy manner.§ §As part of the Nursery team you are encouraged to learn about the industry we work in and bring forward ideas that may improve the way we do things.§ §Safe use and appropriate application of agri-chemicals§ §Plant health is activity monitored to ensure plant health is maintained at optimum.§ §Quality control issues and problems are reported on. A positive attitude towards quality is developed, maintained and rewarded across all areas of production. An environment of continuous quality improvement is maintained.§ §Qualifications & Experience§ § §Minimum 2 years relevant experience at a comparable level§ §Current Full New Zealand Driver’s License§ §Adaptable, flexible, able to change plans based on the changes in the plants, a problem solver.§ §Self-aware, regimented/understands and works to the time sensitive nature of the plants.§ §Takes responsibility for results, organised, sets standards§ §Strong interpersonal skills, a clear communicator, collaborates well with others, builds relationships.§ §Benefits§ § §Company Medical Insurance Plan§ §Lunch provided 4 days per week§ § § §To Apply§ §Download the full job description at: §www.riversun.co.nz/employment/§ and if this sounds like the job for you please apply with a cover letter and your CV attached to:§ §Anna Thorpe§Riversun Nursery Ltd§Email: info@riversun.co.nz §Or drop your application into our offices at 257 Awapuni Road, Gisborne.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50819686.txt	§Marlborough Laboratory Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marlborough Laboratory Manager§§Advertiser: §Villa Maria Estate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§ Villa Maria internationally renowned for producing super premium New Zealand wines, recognised as one of the top 10 most admired wine brands in the world by Drinks International, and has remained New Zealand’s most awarded winery for the past 35 years.§About the Role§Working within a smaller Marlborough winemaking team, the Marlborough Lab Manager role is responsible for managing, implementing and adhering to all laboratory protocols whilst delivering accurate on-time analysis and managing the Marlborough laboratory operating budget.§During our grape harvest period (March – May), the Lab Manager is responsible onboarding and repeatedly training a team of 5-6 technicians across two shifts of 12 hours, to provide all grape maturity, fruit receival, and ferment analysis including fermentation sensory checks, as well as manage our yeast propagation protocol during the busy and exciting vintage months. §About You§Excellent people skills are required to ensure clear communication between the winemaking team and cellar supervisors, as well as key organisational skills to facilitate workflow in the laboratory to meet bottling deadlines with a continual focus on wine quality. Other qualities we are seeking below:§  §A motivated team player with multiple years experience in a Marlborough based, category 3 winery as a prerequisite.§  §Our preferred candidate will have gained their Oenology Degree and have previous experiences in a supervisory laboratory role, ideally on 12 hour      night-shifts.§  §Proven experience with Ezy winemaking software, Microsoft Excel graphing and csv file uploading, and Vinea software are essential.§  §Sound working knowledge and troubleshooting ability for Thermofisher Gallery auto-analyser, Density meters, Dissolved gasses C-Box, Alcolyzer, yeast      cell counts, as well as a foundation in wet chemistry including      conductivity measurements, auto-titrations and SO2 aspiration method.§  §Familiarity with BRC, IOC, WSMP, Biogro audits, including maintaining accurate calibration and training records.§  §Candidates must be eligible to work in New Zealand indefinitely.§If this sounds like the perfect role for you, please apply today!§Applications close Tuesday 10 November 2020.§ §For a copy of the Job Description visit §PD-Lab-Manager-2020.pdf§§§§

Lely's head office is located in Hamilton, but you could live in most locations in NZ south of Waikato, as this is where work will take you. There are plenty of opportunities to progress with this company if you are ambitious too.§If you wish to hear more about this job, and you can say YES to all of the above, please apply online without delay. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50856209.txt	§Ranger, Biodiversity§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ranger, Biodiversity§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Ranger, Biodiversity §        §          §The Tamaki Makarau/Auckland Mainland Biodiversity team is looking for an experienced person to join the team as our next Biodiversity Ranger. This is an exciting opportunity for the right individual to become part of a committed and professional Biodiversity team to achieve high quality conservation outcomes. §          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§§          §The focus of this role will be to primarily support the Tamaki Makaurau Mainland district's biodiversity team with a specific focus on wildlife response.  You will deliver the Biodiversity engagement work plans, in particular but not limited to:§          §            §Supporting or leading wildlife responses: triaging, prioritising and where appropriate responding.§            §Leading the relevant aspects of the 24/7 DOCHOT response kits to ensure information is up to date, and Duty and Stand-by rangers are appropriately trained.§            §Ensuring the correct approach is taken to mitigate issues regarding injured or deceased wildlife§            §Providing data analysis and reports, as required to support the Senior Biodiversity Ranger and Operations Manager.§            §Working with community groups to grow their conservation§            §Developing relationships and partnerships to grow conservation§            §Possible involvement in threatened species work§            §Management of volunteers§          §          § §          §The work of the Biodiversity Ranger is complex and requires continuous triaging and prioritising.  The work may also include implementation or contract management for predator control operations, or pesticide applications. There is a range of office-based work to write and manage contracts, reports and documentation.  A rough estimation would be 50:50 field to office work. The role requires flexibility and travel across the Auckland region to engage with various teams or communities and to attend to wildlife call outs.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §What we are looking for:§          §The following experience/skills are essential:§          §            §Excellent public facing demeanour in order to successfully take care of wildlife responses§            §Ability to work and build successful relationships with Iwi, Whanau & Hapu to grow conservation as kaitiaki on whenua managed and public conservation land.§            §A minimum of 3 years' experience in the practical management of New Zealand flora and fauna is essential.§            §A relevant Tertiary qualification in Ecology/ Environmental Sciences or Conservation§            §Relationship management experience§            §Project/ contract management experience§            §Familiar with heath and safety practices in the workplace and the field§            §A natural heritage or conservation management qualification§            §Ability to work and build successful relationships with community, stakeholder, local government to grow and protect Te Taiao through joint partner initiatives.§            §Team player whom can work closely with others in a collaborative to deliver and achieve conservation outcomes across the district.§            §Physically fit§            §Excellent communicator with the ability to decipher complex technical work into simple terminology.§            §Excellent computer skills with experience using Microsoft Office and report writing is essential§            §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§            §Specialist experience in terrestrial or marine life is preferred.§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          §We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§          §DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiry, please contact Molly Hickis on §mhicks@doc.govt.nz§ or 027 3642673.§          §Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 16 November §2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§The Tamaki Makarau/Auckland Mainland Biodiversity team is looking for an experienced person to join the team as our next Biodiversity Ranger. This is an exciting opportunity for the right individual to become part of a committed and professional Biodiversity team to achieve high quality conservation outcomes. § §§He angitūtanga: About the Role§§The focus of this role will be to primarily support the Tamaki Makaurau Mainland district's biodiversity team with a specific focus on wildlife response.  You will deliver the Biodiversity engagement work plans, in particular but not limited to:§§Supporting or leading wildlife responses: triaging, prioritising and where appropriate responding.§Leading the relevant aspects of the 24/7 DOCHOT response kits to ensure information is up to date, and Duty and Stand-by rangers are appropriately trained.§Ensuring the correct approach is taken to mitigate issues regarding injured or deceased wildlife§Providing data analysis and reports, as required to support the Senior Biodiversity Ranger and Operations Manager.§Working with community groups to grow their conservation§Developing relationships and partnerships to grow conservation§Possible involvement in threatened species work§Management of volunteers§§ §The work of the Biodiversity Ranger is complex and requires continuous triaging and prioritising.  The work may also include implementation or contract management for predator control operations, or pesticide applications. There is a range of office-based work to write and manage contracts, reports and documentation.  A rough estimation would be 50:50 field to office work. The role requires flexibility and travel across the Auckland region to engage with various teams or communities and to attend to wildlife call outs.§ §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§§What we are looking for:§The following experience/skills are essential:§§Excellent public facing demeanour in order to successfully take care of wildlife responses§Ability to work and build successful relationships with Iwi, Whanau & Hapu to grow conservation as kaitiaki on whenua managed and public conservation land.§A minimum of 3 years' experience in the practical management of New Zealand flora and fauna is essential.§A relevant Tertiary qualification in Ecology/ Environmental Sciences or Conservation§Relationship management experience§Project/ contract management experience§Familiar with heath and safety practices in the workplace and the field§A natural heritage or conservation management qualification§Ability to work and build successful relationships with community, stakeholder, local government to grow and protect Te Taiao through joint partner initiatives.§Team player whom can work closely with others in a collaborative to deliver and achieve conservation outcomes across the district.§Physically fit§Excellent communicator with the ability to decipher complex technical work into simple terminology.§Excellent computer skills with experience using Microsoft Office and report writing is essential§Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§Specialist experience in terrestrial or marine life is preferred.§§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Our plan to develop out to 245 hectares will be shared with you when we meet.§ §We are now looking to appoint an experienced horticulturalist to the position of Orchard Foreman who will initially be based at Tarras Cherry Corp. This is an established 40-hectare block near Cromwell which begins production this season.§ Feel free to take a virtual tour through the Tarras Cherry Corp Development via https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QLaN0du9SOA&t=1s§ §As Orchard Foreman, you will report to the Orchard Development Manager and work alongside our team of permanent and casual staff members.  §This is a hands-on, task-focused role.  We work as a team, each of us pitching in to help with in-field tasks as required.  § §You will live in the Cromwell Basin, one of the most beautiful places in New Zealand. jobText: TXT/50844905.txt	§Lead Veterinary Epidemiologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Veterinary Epidemiologist§§Advertiser: §OSPRI§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lead Veterinary Epidemiologist §      §        §About OSPRI§        §OSPRI is a non-profit organisation that operates in partnership with New Zealand’s primary industries and government to achieve on-farm biosecurity objectives through animal disease management and traceability.  We work closely with our shareholders, Beef and Lamb New Zealand, Dairy NZ, Deer Industry New Zealand, and the Ministry for Primary Industries, plus a range of other stakeholders, to deliver on our value statement: §Farmers and markets can depend on us to provide assurance as to the health and status of animals§.§        §OSPRI has a key role in the biosecurity system to contribute to New Zealand’s national and international reputation in animal products.  TBfree and National Animal Identification and Tracing are OSPRI programmes.§        §With a new Chief Executive at the helm, significant and exciting changes have been made over the last 12 months and the next step in OSPRI’s evolution is to establish a high performing, collaborative and forward-thinking organisation with a strong emphasis on organisational agility.§        § §        §What will you be doing? §        §The Lead Veterinary Epidemiologists role supports both the General Manager, Disease Control Planning and Integration, and the Chief Advisor, Disease Management through advising, investigating, and reporting on the diagnosis and control of disease management and outcomes in line with OSPRI’s programmes and national standards.§        §As part of the Disease Control Planning and Integration group, you will be involved in the research, analysis, and applied design of new disease management programmes. You will also innovate and mitigate risks in the existing programmes while also predicting future needs for OSPRI in line with their commitment to disease management. This group forms an integral role within OSPRI while also maintaining our external strategic relationships with government and industry. The group is also responsible for setting the policies and minimum standards for the operations of the TBfree programme including both disease management and vector control.§        § §        §    What we’re looking for§        §          §A veterinary degree, postgraduate training in epidemiology, and current registration with the Veterinary Council of New Zealand§          §Experience in disease management and control programmes such as bovine tuberculosis§          §Applied knowledge of the ecology and control of wild animal pests in TB in New Zealand alongside previous experience with the national disease database§          §The ability to undertake epidemiological analyses and interpret their biological and statistical significance§          §Knowledge and recent research findings on; Tuberculosis in cattle, deer, and wild animals alongside immunology of TB and associated diagnostic tests§          §Previous experience in leading and managing technical teams§          §Ability to use spatial software and interrogate databases§          §Strong problem resolutions skills§          §Proficiency in Office 365§          §Full driver’s license§        §        § §        §In return we offer §        §          §A supportive and energetic team, interesting work and development opportunities§          §Flexible working options§          § §          §Employer funded Life and Trauma Insurance§          §Annual flu vaccinations§          §Employee Assistance Program§          §Wellness Checks§        §        §Please view a copy of the position description by visiting https://www.ospri.co.nz/careers/vacancies/ or email careers@ospri.co.nz .§        § §        §How to apply§       §        §To apply please click ‘Apply for this role’ and include your cover letter and CV.§        § §        §Applications close at 5pm, Friday 13 November 2020. §We will be assessing and interviewing suitable candidates as applications are received. We encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience§        § §        §Please note: §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory and this role requires a Ministry of Justice criminal history check and pre-employment drug and alcohol testing§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About OSPRI§ §OSPRI is a non-profit organisation that operates in partnership with New Zealand’s primary industries and government to achieve on-farm biosecurity objectives through animal disease management and traceability.  We work closely with our shareholders, Beef and Lamb New Zealand, Dairy NZ, Deer Industry New Zealand, and the Ministry for Primary Industries, plus a range of other stakeholders, to deliver on our value statement: §Farmers and markets can depend on us to provide assurance as to the health and status of animals§.§ §OSPRI has a key role in the biosecurity system to contribute to New Zealand’s national and international reputation in animal products.  TBfree and National Animal Identification and Tracing are OSPRI programmes.§ §With a new Chief Executive at the helm, significant and exciting changes have been made over the last 12 months and the next step in OSPRI’s evolution is to establish a high performing, collaborative and forward-thinking organisation with a strong emphasis on organisational agility.§ § § §What will you be doing? § §The Lead Veterinary Epidemiologists role supports both the General Manager, Disease Control Planning and Integration, and the Chief Advisor, Disease Management through advising, investigating, and reporting on the diagnosis and control of disease management and outcomes in line with OSPRI’s programmes and national standards.§ §As part of the Disease Control Planning and Integration group, you will be involved in the research, analysis, and applied design of new disease management programmes. You will also innovate and mitigate risks in the existing programmes while also predicting future needs for OSPRI in line with their commitment to disease management. This group forms an integral role within OSPRI while also maintaining our external strategic relationships with government and industry. The group is also responsible for setting the policies and minimum standards for the operations of the TBfree programme including both disease management and vector control.§ § § §    What we’re looking for§ § §A veterinary degree, postgraduate training in epidemiology, and current registration with the Veterinary Council of New Zealand§ §Experience in disease management and control programmes such as bovine tuberculosis§ §Applied knowledge of the ecology and control of wild animal pests in TB in New Zealand alongside previous experience with the national disease database§ §The ability to undertake epidemiological analyses and interpret their biological and statistical significance§ §Knowledge and recent research findings on; Tuberculosis in cattle, deer, and wild animals alongside immunology of TB and associated diagnostic tests§ §Previous experience in leading and managing technical teams§ §Ability to use spatial software and interrogate databases§ §Strong problem resolutions skills§ §Proficiency in Office 365§ §Full driver’s license§ § § §In return we offer § § §A supportive and energetic team, interesting work and development opportunities§ §Flexible working options§ § § §Employer funded Life and Trauma Insurance§ §Annual flu vaccinations§ §Employee Assistance Program§ §Wellness Checks§ §Please view a copy of the position description by visiting https://www.ospri.co.nz/careers/vacancies/ or email careers@ospri.co.nz .§ § § §How to apply§       § §To apply please click ‘Apply for this role’ and include your cover letter and CV.§ § § §Applications close at 5pm, Friday 13 November 2020. §We will be assessing and interviewing suitable candidates as applications are received. We encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience§ § § §Please note: §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory and this role requires a Ministry of Justice criminal history check and pre-employment drug and alcohol testing§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50840256.txt	§Shepherd§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Shepherd§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Labour§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Shepherd §      §        § §        §          §Be directly involved in the region’s largest urban farming enterprise§          §Southern Auckland location, covering Southern and Western farms§          §Take this opportunity to further develop your shepherding skillset§        §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §Auckland Council’s farming operation spans across 19 Regional Park locations throughout the Auckland region and at 1430ha is thought to be one of the world’s largest urban farming enterprises. The farming operations comprise 6650 sheep/1200 cattle in total, both breeding and finishing. Stock class management, breed type, stocking rates and sheep to cattle ratio are set on the best fit for managing public land without compromising the park resources and wider objectives.§ §With a new structure in place, Auckland Council now requires a Shepherd to work on the region’s Southern and Western farms. The key focus of this position is to work collectively with the Farming Operations Manager and Block Supervisors to implement the operational plan in a way that optimises farm performance. This is a fantastic opportunity to further develop your shepherding skillset with involvement in all day-to-day tasks on farm including stock work, animal health, pasture management and general maintenance.§ §He kōrero mōu: About you§ §The successful applicant for this position will have 1 – 3 dogs under good command along with proven practical farming skills such as stockmanship, fencing, general maintenance and the ability to use farm machinery and equipment safely. jobTitle: Lecturer/Senior Lecturer/Associate Professor Plant Science Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50844530.txt	§Lecturer/Senior Lecturer/Associate Professor Plant Science§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lecturer/Senior Lecturer/Associate Professor Plant Science§§Advertiser: §Lincoln University§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§Lincoln University is the longest-running agriculturally-based university in the Southern Hemisphere. As New Zealand's economy diversified, so have we. Lincoln University is here to enhance and enrich lives. To grow the knowledge of our students so they can shape a world that benefits from a greater understanding of the relationship between our land, the food produced from it and the ecosystems within it. With three academic faculties, one teaching division, several research centres and a range of corporate service units, the University draws its students from throughout New Zealand and from over 60 countries. Lincoln University has a student roll of around 3,000 and approximately 700 staff.§Right now we are looking for a Lecturer, Senior Lecturer or Associate Professor in Plant Science to join the Faculty of Agriculture and Life Sciences in the Department of Agricultural Sciences. Your responsibilities will include teaching and research in the plant sciences, and in crop and livestock production. Essentially you will bring your expertise in the areas of plant breeding, crop and pasture physiology and agronomy. You will also be expected to forge links with the New Zealand crop and pastoral industries and relevant research entities. This is a busy and varied role, where your enquiring mind and passion for working with and educating young people will be key to your success.§To be considered for this role, you will have:§a PhD in an appropriate discipline§the enthusiasm to lecture at undergraduate and postgraduate degree level§the ability to supervise postgraduate students§experience in undertaking and publishing high quality research§the desire to collaborate and work collegially with other faculty staff§strong communication skills§a warm, friendly personality§This is a fulltime, permanent position.§Please apply online with your CV and cover letter.§For more information, please refer to the position description on the Lincoln University careers page or contact Patrice Wilkin, Recruitment Business Partner, on §03 423 0312§.§Applications close on 26/11/2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50847730.txt	§Lead Veterinarian§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Veterinarian§§Advertiser: §National Veterinary Care§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Lead Veterinarian §        §Pet Doctors West Harbour§ is located in West Harbour, §Auckland§ and has been part of the local landscape for the last 30 years. West Harbour is a great place to live and work and provides easy access to Auckland city, as well as the West Coast beaches and Waitakere Ranges. Closer to home there are the vineyards of Kumeu, and the weekend farmers’ market and bustling craft beer brew bar at Hobsonville Point. We are also lucky to have wonderful, educated and loyal clients who are willing to go that extra mile for their pets and provide ample job satisfaction.§   § Pet Doctors West Harbour is 100% small animals and is well equipped with digital radiography (Fujifilm CR Prima II system), iM3 elite dental machine, iM3 digital dental radiography system, ultrasound, a full Idexx lab suite, and IV fluid pumps. We run on the Ezyvet management software which is integrated with our lab and x-ray systems for seamless ease of use. There is no afterhours work, and we are closed on public holidays. Saturday work is shared, and we are open 9am to 12pm.§   § We currently looking for an enthusiastic, compassionate §Lead Veterinarian§ to take the reins of our fast-paced clinic!§   § §We’re offering:§          §            §An excellent salary commensurate with experience and skill set§            §Health insurance discounts and benefits, including subsidised health insurance for private hospital and specialist costs! (After meeting the service provision)§            §Incredible training opportunities through our Veterinary Training Centres, free for our team members§            §Health and wellness benefits, including an employee assistance program and wellness program§            §Personal and leadership development investment, through our Online Training Centre and other leadership programs§            §Great discounts of personal pet care, including up to 50% off some nutrition products and unlimited free consults, plus a friends and family discount scheme§            §Financial rewards and overseas travel for outstanding performance and living our CARE values§          §   § There is also a residential flat located above the clinic which may be negotiated for tenancy!§   § §What we’re looking for:§          §            §An experienced and confident Veterinarian, capable of team and case leadership,§            §Sole charge and practice management skills, with ability to manage the overall clinic workload§            §Exceptionally high standards of care with a proactive and accountable attitude, and§            §BVsc or equivalent, and registration to practice in New Zealand.§          §   § National Veterinary Care (NVC) a group of 100 clinics located across Australia and New Zealand. §What makes us different?§ National Veterinary Care believes that if we put our people first, the results will follow. We achieve this through having a highly qualified Veterinary Surgeon as our General Manager – Vet Services, who keeps our clinical standards at the forefront of business decisions. Closer to home there are the vineyards of Kumeu, and the weekend farmers’ market and bustling craft beer brew bar at Hobsonville Point. We are also lucky to have wonderful, educated and loyal clients who are willing to go that extra mile for their pets and provide ample job satisfaction.§   § Pet Doctors West Harbour is 100% small animals and is well equipped with digital radiography (Fujifilm CR Prima II system), iM3 elite dental machine, iM3 digital dental radiography system, ultrasound, a full Idexx lab suite, and IV fluid pumps. We run on the Ezyvet management software which is integrated with our lab and x-ray systems for seamless ease of use. There is no afterhours work, and we are closed on public holidays. Saturday work is shared, and we are open 9am to 12pm.§   § We currently looking for an enthusiastic, compassionate §Lead Veterinarian§ to take the reins of our fast-paced clinic!§   § §We’re offering:§ § §An excellent salary commensurate with experience and skill set§ §Health insurance discounts and benefits, including subsidised health insurance for private hospital and specialist costs! At 45 degrees south of the equator, his vines were right on the knife-edge of possibility for grape cultivation. Everyone thought that it was too cold for grapes here, but the Gibbston Valley Wines founder had a hunch, and he was right.§ §Gibbston Valley has a rich history and excellent reputation for creating award-winning wines. GV also hosts guests for wonderful events, tours, cheesey cafe and restaurant experiences, and in December 2019 opened a luxury lodge accommodation and spa offering for guests. Our diverse offerings make GV an interesting place to work and our rich history make us team members proud to be a part of it.§ §The role§ §We are taking applications to be a part of our 2021 vintage crew! Our vintage will commence around mid-March and run for 8-12 weeks depending on harvest conditions. During this time, we will need a few fixed term cellar hands to help us begin to produce our prized wine.§ §Skills & experience§ §If you have:§ § §previous winery cellar experience§ §a passion for wine§ §an appetite for outdoor hard mahi§ §a positive can do attitude§ §a sense of humour§ §then you should fit in here nicely!§ §What's on offer?§ §Great wine deals, beautiful views, colleagues who will become your harvest family, and the opportunity to be involved in the creation of a truly quality product. Imagine yourself sipping a 2021 GV pinot, knowing you helped make it!§ §How do I apply?§ § §Ensure your CV contains information about your visa status and if possible a screenshot of your visa. If you are a kiwi, please state this.§ §Ensure your CV clearly states whether or not you will need accommodation provided. § §Click apply on Seek!§ §We are excited to hear from you!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following forklift licences do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

An exciting opportunity has become available for a Fisheries Liaison Project Manager within the Marine Species team.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §As our new Fisheries Liaison Project Manager, you will be responsible for working with DOC, the New Zealand Government and external stakeholders to oversee the delivery of the CSP Protected Species Liaison Project. This is a 2 year fixed term role.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §Required:§          §            §Significant project management skills and experience. §            §Ability to build and maintain professional relationships across multiple stakeholders and sectors.§            §Experience in preparing reports and presentations for multiple audiences.§            §Understanding of commercial fisheries and fisheries bycatch.§            §Understanding of bycatch mitigation devices, their function, and uses in commercial fishing.§          §          §Desired:§          §            §Relevant qualifications in project/programme management.§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          §Excellent development opportunities across the Marine Species Team and wider Aquatic Unit and Biodiversity Group.§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. jobText: TXT/50861765.txt	§Orchard Sector Assistant Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchard Sector Assistant Manager§§Advertiser: §Rockit Global Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§About the role§ §A key role in the sector management team operating multiple orchard blocks in the Omahu area. Duties include:§ § §Overseeing the day to day implementation of orchard management plans§ §Recruiting and leading staff and contractors§ §Ensuring quality standards and health and safety requirements are met§ §Coordinating the full range of orchard tasks and ensuring efficient use of resources§ §Skills and Experience § §Applicants will ideally have:§ § §Experience in the pip fruit industry and sound knowledge of horticultural practices§ §Experience leading teams and building a positive culture§ §Grow Safe and Approved Handler certification§ §National Certificate in Horticulture§ §Strong organisation and project management skills§ §A positive attitude, physical fitness, flexibility regarding work hours and a full driver’s licence are essential. We pride ourselves on being a drug free environment and all potential employees will need to pass a mandatory drug test.§ §Benefits§ § §Competitive remuneration§ §Opportunity for career progression§ §Training programmes available for willing employees§ §Health Insurance available§ §Being a part of an innovative and fast- growing company§ §About the Company§ §Rockit Global Limited is an innovative and vertically integrated fruit grower, packer and exporter, marketing unique miniature apples under the Rockit™ apple brand.  We are a motivated and passionate group of young Orchardists with the freedom to create our own future and make our mark on the New Zealand and Global map.  We are not bound by preconceived ideas and practices, and we pride ourselves on being trailblazers and industry leaders.§ §How to Apply§ §If this sounds like you, and what you are looking for, join the Rockit™ apple team and enjoy a career that will be full of exciting and fulfilling experiences.§ §Send your CV and cover letter to RMS Coordinator §samantha-jo.tawhai@rockitapple.com§ §Applications close §4pm 1 December 2020§.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50847599.txt	§General Nursery Work§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Nursery Work§§Advertiser: §Zealandia Horticulture§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§We’re growing strongly.  We operate from a new six-hectare state-of-the-art facility in Clevedon to accommodate increasing demand and allow us to keep innovating in all we do.§ §We are recruiting for a nursery worker, based at our nursery on Tourist Road in Clevedon, with the successful applicant being given full training in this multi-task role, which includes the operation of various production machinery, on-site vehicles, and working with our large range of crops. § §The role requires a strong level of fitness, a keen attitude to ensure tasks are completed in an efficient and timely manner and would suit somebody looking for an exciting career in a fast-paced environment.  We envisage a long-term view whereby you will become involved in all aspects of the nursery as well as growing into future leadership roles.§ §We look forward to applicants with some or all of the following attributes:§ §An energetic and enthusiastic attitude§Attention to detail§Physically fit and enjoys a physical role§Able to work extended hours or weekend work during peak season and when required§Good communication skills and a positive problem solving attitude§ §Zealandia offers a friendly, positive work environment and an attractive remuneration. § §To Apply:§ §Complete the application form on our website www.zealandia.co.nz [link removed] and attach your cover letter or CV.§ §If you have any questions, please contact Ross on §(03) 323-9898§.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobTitle: Horticulture/Viticulture Technical Advisor - Cromwell Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50858108.txt	§Horticulture/Viticulture Technical Advisor - Cromwell§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Horticulture/Viticulture Technical Advisor - Cromwell§§Advertiser: §Farmlands Co-operative§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Nov 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Salary§§Salary, vehicle, shareholding & personal insurance§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§About Farmlands§Like most great New Zealand stories, Farmlands was born from people joining together to do things differently. Fast forward from our humble beginnings in 1962 and we are a Top 20 NZ Company with an annual turnover of more than $2 billion, with over 1000 staff members from Cape Reinga to Bluff.§Our team of Technical Advisors are a vital service to our shareholders. As a "growing-guru", you not only need to know the Farmlands business inside and out, you also need to know about the shareholders you deal with every day.§About The Role§Based in the Central Otago region, rich in viticulture and horticulture, the role has a strong focus on providing technical advice to our shareholders. You'll be on the road so the ability to work well autonomously will serve you well in being able to service the territory.§Ideally you will be based in the Cromwell area, with the ability to travel within the Central Otago region (full work vehicle provided). This role would also suit somebody with strong horticulture/viticulture experience who may be open to relocating to Central Otago.§You will be the face of Farmlands to many shareholders - so we need someone who believes in what we do and the service we have been providing for more than 50 years.§In this role you will be responsible for:§Providing expert technical advice to our clients - mainly viticulture clients§Maintaining and ensuring continuous growth within your managed accounts§Building robust relationships with your client networks§Identifying and securing prospective shareholders/customers within your territory§Achieving and exceeding all sales targets§About You§We are seeking expertise and background in Viticulture (and ideally horticulture), with a strong sales background and confidence providing technical advice - you could make the difference to someone's very livelihood!§You will be:§A self starter with great organisational/planning skills§An effective communicator and able to relate to a wide range of stakeholders§Strong relationship building abilities§Proficient on computer systems, using technology will be a part of your day§Culture and Benefits§Our culture is one of unity and working together to make a difference in our communities and for our shareholders. Grow your experience and career with us and reap the rewards of Farmlands, which includes:§Competitive salary§Work vehicle§Farmlands shareholding + medical and personal insurances§Annual health checks and flu shots§How to apply§Click APPLY (with your CV and covering letter ready) to submit your application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50849434.txt	§Grower Services Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Grower Services Representative§§Advertiser: §Personnel Resources/Temp Resources§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§§Salary§§$70,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Grower Services Representative §    §    §      §        §Our Client’s provide Orchard Management and Post-Harvest Services with a clear vision of growing great fruit, growing great people and growing great communities. We are looking for Grower Services Representative to manage relationships and communication with growers and deliver meaningful technical advice to maximise quality fruit production, performance and returns for growers.§        §Duties and responsibilities include:§        §          §Nurturing and building strong relationships with growers§          §Providing technical analysis support and technical horticulture advice§          §Providing crop profiling insights and monitoring of grower crops§          §Offering ongoing support and assistance to growers with meeting compliance requirements§          §Negotiating contracts to align with our grower’s commercial requirements§          §Advising growers on orchard and vine management support§          §Assisting with sustainability, and Development initiatives§          §Working collaboratively with orchard and post-harvest teams to coordinate harvest activities§          §Ensuring all employees and contractors follow Health & Safety and Food Safety requirements and policy.§        §        §You will have at least three years proven client relationship management experience, have sound technical abilities and be able to work independently while managing your time effectively. You will ideally have a horticultural background and experience with soil nutrient and agrichemical management, a tertiary qualification in horticulture and be great with problem solving and providing solutions. You will have a collaborative approach when working with growers and internal teams to establish clear strategies on increased growth, returns, production and performance.§        §If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. Hit ‘apply now’ or send your cover letter and CV to §admin@personnelresources.co.nz§. For more information contact Andrea or Chris on §07 307 9266§.§        §CONFIDENTIALITY ASSURED§      §      §      §    §    § §  §§§Our Client’s provide Orchard Management and Post-Harvest Services with a clear vision of growing great fruit, growing great people and growing great communities. We are looking for Grower Services Representative to manage relationships and communication with growers and deliver meaningful technical advice to maximise quality fruit production, performance and returns for growers.§ §Duties and responsibilities include:§ § §Nurturing and building strong relationships with growers§ §Providing technical analysis support and technical horticulture advice§ §Providing crop profiling insights and monitoring of grower crops§ §Offering ongoing support and assistance to growers with meeting compliance requirements§ §Negotiating contracts to align with our grower’s commercial requirements§ §Advising growers on orchard and vine management support§ §Assisting with sustainability, and Development initiatives§ §Working collaboratively with orchard and post-harvest teams to coordinate harvest activities§ §Ensuring all employees and contractors follow Health & Safety and Food Safety requirements and policy.§ §You will have at least three years proven client relationship management experience, have sound technical abilities and be able to work independently while managing your time effectively. You will ideally have a horticultural background and experience with soil nutrient and agrichemical management, a tertiary qualification in horticulture and be great with problem solving and providing solutions. You will have a collaborative approach when working with growers and internal teams to establish clear strategies on increased growth, returns, production and performance.§ §If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. Hit ‘apply now’ or send your cover letter and CV to §admin@personnelresources.co.nz§. For more information contact Andrea or Chris on §07 307 9266§.§ §CONFIDENTIALITY ASSURED§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobTitle: Supervisor and Client Manager Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50861276.txt	§Supervisor and Client Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Supervisor and Client Manager§§Advertiser: §Thornhill Horticultural Contracting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Supervisor and Client Manager§ §Thornhill Viticulture/Horticulture Labour Specialists is a well-established, progressive fast-growing labour supplier with 800+ staff across Hawke’s Bay and Marlborough.§ § §Thornhill has a full-time position available for two §Supervisor and Client Managers§ to urgently join their Hawke’s Bay-based team. The role involves working with the Field Reps and Supervisors to determine and meet labour requirements, along with liaising with clients and providing a point of contact for workers regarding timesheets, worksheets and associated documentation.§ § §Key duties include:§Ensuring pre-employment associated documentation is completed accurately§Monitoring, motivating, training and supervising workers across multiple sites§Maintaining employment records§Assigning work and monitoring work performance of staff§Travelling between sites to oversee workers§Liaising with clients§Ensuring H&S responsibilities are met§Training teams in orchard and vineyard work.§ §Previous experience in the horticulture or viticulture industry is essential, as well as experience as a communication conduit in a similar role. A sound knowledge of industry Health and Safety is also required.§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ §A New Zealand Register Diploma or at least two years proven experience in a similar role§Flexibility to work on the weekends when required§Ability to lead and supervise a team of workers§Knowledge and experience using computers, i.e. MS Office§Excellent time management and organisational skills.§ §Applicants for this position must be a New Zealand citizen or resident, or have a valid NZ work visa.§ §Applications close 5:00pm Sunday 15 November 2020.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

We are open to considering candidates that are based anywhere between Northland and Auckland.§        § §        §This position provides an important service for the Crown to effectively deliver its fisheries obligations in four main areas:§        §          §The support for the development of policy and regulation affecting Maori rights and interests in fisheries; and§          §The §Fisheries Act 1996§ section 12(b) - Input and Participation; and§          §The §Fisheries (Kaimoana Customary Fishing) Regulations 1998§ and the §Fisheries (South Island Customary Fishing) Regulations 1999§ (The Customary Fishing Regulations); and§          §The negotiation and implementation of specific Historical Treaty Settlement obligations.§        §        § §        §You will have credibility, be confident with Te Reo Māori or tikanga Māori, and possess in-depth knowledge of Māori and Māori politics. §        § §        §This is a challenging role that will see you utilising all of the relationship management skills in your EQ basket, as there are times when you will face strong resistance.  You will need to be able to draw a line in the sand and say no at times, while always being focussed on the positive outcomes identified and delivery of fisheries management and the Crown's obligations.   §        § §        §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§        §A tertiary qualification and/or relevant experience in biological sciences, resource management and/or fisheries management§        §          §Knowledge of Te Reo Maori to facilitate consultation processes and to effectively present information to different groups.§          §Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with tangata whenua, internal and external stakeholders, and government agencies.§          §Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain working relationships with tangata whenua.§          §Understanding of the Treaty Principles and the Crown's obligations to Māori under the Treaty of Waitangi Fisheries Claims Settlement Act and other statutes as they relate to customary fisheries.§          §Sound writing skills.§        §        § §        §About the branch - Mō te peka§        §Fisheries New Zealand is a new business unit established within the Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) to drive a stronger focus on managing New Zealand's valuable fisheries resources, and their place in the wider marine environment. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. MPI also has strong relationships with other government agencies, primarily within the economic, border, and natural resources sectors. With the New Zealand economy set to grow, MPI's important role in leading, regulating, and enabling the primary sectors will only increase. The Agriculture and Investment Services Business unit works with those on the land today and in the future. Supporting communities of farmers and growers to achieve their aspirations, and to meet the expectations of customers, government, and the public. And investing in tomorrow's world, as partners to increase primary industries' value and sustainability.§          §Mō tō mātou rōpū§ - §About our team§          §The Extension Services team is responsible for delivery of practical advice, information and tools for farmers and growers to improve their operations on the ground.  One of the ways we will achieve this is by pulling together clusters of farmers and growers in different regions across the country, to share information, insights and advice with like-minded people who understand local issues.  This initiative sits in the wider Productive and Sustainable Land Use Programme. §          §Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§          §We have an exciting new opportunity for a Project Lead North Island (extension services). E.g. forklift training, first aid, etc.§About the position:§We are looking for entry-level horticultural team members, with the positive attitude required to learn new skills, and advance your career. You do not need any previous experience or skills in horticulture, as onsite training is provided.§We want to upskill you, to enable you to progress your career in horticulture. We want you to join our team in Tuakau and help us continue building a better horticulture industry.§You will be required to learn new skills and follow reasonable instructions to achieve a high-quality product for our customers.§This is a full-time seasonal position, a minimum of 40 hours a week, Monday to Friday, 7:30am to 4:00pm. Additionally you need to be willing and available to work extra hours and weekends as requested.§What are we looking for?§The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the following skills and attributes:§Able to work in warm to hot temperatures§Able to do moderate, physical work (lifting a maximum of 25kgs)§Onsite parking available§Monday to Friday 07:30 am - 4:00 pm, and any extra hours as requested§Willingness to improve your use of the English language.§Able to work up to 3 metres if requested§Reliable transport is a must§A bit about us:§T&G is New Zealand's largest producer and packer of hothouse tomatoes. jobTitle: Cropping Manager Mid Canterbury -  Turley Farms Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50854571.txt	§Cropping Manager Mid Canterbury -  Turley Farms§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Cropping Manager Mid Canterbury -  Turley Farms§§Advertiser: §AgRecruit Human Resources§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§31 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Rest of Canterbury§§Salary§§Remuneration based on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§At Turley Farms, we run three Canterbury based cropping units.  Our farming operation has grown and evolved over time, with our focus now being to produce top quality arable crops, seeds and vegetables using environmentally sustainable and technically advanced farming practices.§ §As Cropping Manager – Mid Canterbury, you will be based at Pendarves and answer to our experienced Farms Manager. You will oversee a 1000 hectare cropping unit which produces potatoes, onions, small and hybrid seeds plus wheat and other crops. It is fully serviced by modern irrigation infrastructure.§ §You will work closely with our in-house agronomists who will advise you and recommend crop management programmes. Our in-house accountant will work with you to ensure crop budgets are maintained and managed correctly.§ §Effective job scheduling, irrigation management, budgeting, machinery operation and solid team leadership will be your key deliverables.§ §You have the option to live in a recently renovated four-bedroom home with ensuite on the property. Schools are close by and a school bus runs past the gate.§ §This is a busy, hands on role where you will lead your team by example, working alongside them to achieve the farm’s production goals. Expect to work extended hours during spring and summer.  § To succeed in this role, you will bring:§ § §Extensive crop management experience (any crop)§ §Mechanical aptitude / experience operating modern machinery & equipment§ §A strong work ethic with a focus on efficiency & organization§ §Collaborative in-field team leadership skills§ § §Remuneration for this role is generous and will be based on your skills and experience.§ §To inquire about this role in confidence or to request a PD, please phone AgRecruit - either Deb Francis on 021 2245000 or Sue Jennings on 021 2262923. Otherwise, forward your CV with covering letter by Wed 11 November via this portal.§§§§
