jobText: TXT/50840352.txt	§Part-Time Front of House Receptionist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Part-Time Front of House Receptionist§§Advertiser: §Carevets Business Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Front of House superstar to join our fantastic team on a part-time basis!§ § §Competitive remuneration§ §A real focus on personal development – grow your career with us§ §Non-corporate family workplace culture – join the CareVets family§ § § §About the Clinic§ §CareVets Rototuna is located in northern Hamilton and has been part of the growing Rototuna community for the last 12 years.§ §We are a full-service companion animal practice with a large retail space, cattery, doggy day care and grooming facilities on site.  With a large team of Veterinarians and Veterinary Nurses, support staff and groomers we are passionate about our furry clients, dedicated to providing them with the best possible care.§ §For more information, please visit: http://carevets.co.nz/branches/carevets-rototuna/§ § § §About the Role§ §We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about animals and customer service.  This role could be well suited to a nurse in training.  This is a great opportunity for those willing to learn and to get your foot in the door in the Veterinary industry!  You’ll be positioned at our front of house.  Here are just a few of the key responsibilities that you will be contributing to together with the rest of our team:§ § §Front of house client relations§ §Retail sales and assistance§ §General customer service§ §This role will be part-time and involves weekend work.  Currently rostered for 15.5 hours per week.  Additional shifts or on-call work may be required.§ § § §About You§ § §Genuinely care for pets, your colleagues and our clients§ §Work well both in a team and independently§ §High level of integrity§ §Good communicator§ §Great customer service§ §Veterinary / pet care experience a plus§ §What’s on Offer?§ § §Generous remuneration§ - commensurate with experience and role type§ §Strong focus on personal development§ with an ongoing focus on your career interests§ §Non-corporate family workplace culture§ – become a member of the CareVets family§ §Fantastic location§ §Work-Life balance is important to us§, so rosters are geared with this in mind§ §Dynamic & supportive clinic team§ along with a responsive leadership team§ §Access to a wide network§ of like-minded colleagues across the North Island (and the opportunities that come with such a network)§ § § §To express your interest in this role ‘apply now’ via SEEK with your CV and cover letter attached.  Any applicants shortlisted will be contacted directly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have customer service experience?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

You'll be on the road so the ability to work well autonomously will serve you well in being able to service the territory.§Ideally you will be based in the Cromwell area, with the ability to travel within the Central Otago region (full work vehicle provided). This role would also suit somebody with strong horticulture/viticulture experience who may be open to relocating to Central Otago.§You will be the face of Farmlands to many shareholders - so we need someone who believes in what we do and the service we have been providing for more than 50 years.§In this role you will be responsible for:§Providing expert technical advice to our clients - mainly viticulture clients§Maintaining and ensuring continuous growth within your managed accounts§Building robust relationships with your client networks§Identifying and securing prospective shareholders/customers within your territory§Achieving and exceeding all sales targets§About You§We are seeking expertise and background in Viticulture (and ideally horticulture), with a strong sales background and confidence providing technical advice - you could make the difference to someone's very livelihood!§You will be:§A self starter with great organisational/planning skills§An effective communicator and able to relate to a wide range of stakeholders§Strong relationship building abilities§Proficient on computer systems, using technology will be a part of your day§Culture and Benefits§Our culture is one of unity and working together to make a difference in our communities and for our shareholders. jobText: TXT/50836309.txt	§Forest Resource Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Forest Resource Manager§§Advertiser: §Oji Fibre Solutions Pulp and Paper§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Forest Resource Manager §      §        §§        §Oji Fibre Solutions (NZ) Limited is New Zealand's largest pulp & paper manufacturer. We have an extensive team of people, who work together to produce quality kraft pulp, paper and fibre packaging products from renewable, sustainably harvested forestry and recycled wood fibre. We are proud of our circular economy 'solutions by nature', creating value from natural, renewable and recyclable resources, is key to our ongoing operations, customers, communities and sustainability success.§        §We are looking for a highly motivated, self-starter to fill the newly created role of §Forest Resource Manager§ in our Fibre Supply team.§        §A key role in the fibre supply team you will be focused on overseeing the management of the businesses Radiata and Eucalyptus plantations in the Central North Island as well as identifying, analysing and overseeing new afforestation opportunities.§        §We want to hear from candidates with a relevant qualification in forestry and proven experience in forest management, including the analysis, development of and implementation of improved silvicultural regimes. This clinic endeavors to keep ahead of the game and engaged with new techniques and technology and has a very family orientated, open door management style. The roles will either have a great mix of variation between consultations and surgeries with small animals or have a focus on dairy animals to maximise animal health and production or a combination of the two.§  §Depending on the specialisation of the confirmed position, the after- hours or weekend component is not too onerous, allowing for easy access to local recreational pursuits, with numerous lakes, rivers, forests and beaches within an hour’s drive. §  §In terms of experience, we will look at candidates from new graduates to late career as there are plenty of ongoing professional development opportunities within the group. jobText: TXT/50890036.txt	§Biosecurity Field Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Biosecurity Field Officer§§Advertiser: §AsureQuality Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§The Opportunity:§Our Biosecurity Field team provide services to support with the protection of New Zealand against exotic pests, disease incursions, surveillance trap monitoring for the MPI surveillance programmes and eradication.§We are currently seeking a Biosecurity Field Officer to join our Christchurch team on an 8 month fixed term basis from December 2020 to May 2021. This is a part time role working a minimum of 20 hours a fortnight.§The Field Officer will manage a range of Biosecurity monitoring activities. This is a wide-ranging of trapping, site selection, inspection, data entry and sampling. This includes assigning trapping locations, monitoring weather conditions, following set procedures and processes, problem solving, and ensuring that electronic data is recorded accurately.§About you:§You will be passionate about New Zealand's biosecurity, you enjoy the great outdoors and field based work. You will pride yourself in having a strong health and safety focus, a clean driver's licence along with a keen interest in technology.§Your verbal and written communication skills, eye for detail and passion for quality are second to none. You will have a natural ability to build and maintain positive relationships, be detail orientated, and have a resilient nature with resolving challenges.§Prior experience in the primary sector (farming, forestry, horticulture) and Inspection would see you do well in this role as well as knowledge and skills in Biosecurity. Current registration with Growsafe and/or a Chem handler's certificate would be advantageous but is not essential.§About Us:§Everyday our experienced team of 1800+ people work alongside farmers, producers, and others throughout the food supply chain to help them uphold what Aotearoa stands for in food - a higher standard of quality and safety. We are passionate about our shared role as Kaitiaki Kai, guardians of food, and have a deep responsibility to do the right thing for food and the environments it comes from. We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining great people, and supporting them to be the best they can be. We know diverse teams are stronger teams and we believe in fairness and opportunity for all.§Helping Aotearoa shape a better food world.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50887471.txt	§Animal Nutrition Sales Representative - Northland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Animal Nutrition Sales Representative - Northland§§Advertiser: §AgRecruit Human Resources§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Northland§§Salary§§Remuneration based on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§At Agrifeeds, we supply 'complementary' stock feed to farmers throughout New Zealand.  We use on-farm FeedSCAN and FeedXtra technology which enables bespoke, scientifically-backed nutrition advice. Feeding optimization creates real cost efficiency, better quality milk and enables full production potential. Our world-class blending and supply chain operations ensure a secure and reliable feed supply at competitive prices. See www.agrifeeds.co.nz§ § §Using FeedSCAN’s unique technology, farmers can now make feed decisions in real time, based on what is happening on farm.§ §Our people are technical experts in cow nutrition and recommending solutions from our extensive range of animal feeds and minerals. We spend our time on-farm, ready to assist with calibrating feed solutions which optimize animal welfare and production.  § § §We are now searching for an agri-business technical sales professional.  In this role, you will report to the National Sales Manager and work alongside our Northland farming clients.  §Check out this link to see what we do every day.  https://youtu.be/CpISPfKb-AA § § §You will join a thriving national sales team, all of us dedicated to the delivery of sustainable, best practice feeding systems.   § § Competencies required to be successful include:§ § §Minimum three years’ technical sales or account management experience§ §Exposure to animal nutrition, dairy farming or agri-business§ §Excellent relationship development and management skills§ §Drive & passion to deliver top quality outcomes within our premium brand§ § This role will provide you with a favorable remuneration package comprising  salary based on experience, incentive, and a vehicle which is also available for your private use.§ To discuss this role in strict confidence and to request a PD, please phone either Deb Francis on 021 224 5000 or Sue Jennings on 021 226 2923 from AgRecruit. §Otherwise, forward your expression of interest – covering letter and CV, by Thursday 19 November via this portal.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50890448.txt	§Senior/Adviser Monitoring & Evaluation- Māori Agribusiness Te Tapuwae Ahuwhenua§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior/Adviser Monitoring & Evaluation- Māori Agribusiness Te Tapuwae Ahuwhenua§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Senior/Adviser Monitoring & Evaluation- Māori Agribusiness Te Tapuwae Ahuwhenua §        §          §Māori Agribusiness - Te Tapuwae Ahuwhenua§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is looking for a Monitoring and Evaluation Adviser, or Senior Adviser to join the Māori Agribusiness Directorate. You will be working towards increasing primary sector assets by connecting people with resources. §          §The Māori Agribusiness (MAB) Directorate is responsible for contributing to the identification and implementation of viable primary sector economic development opportunities through the provision of information, intelligence and advice on issues specific to Māori; for ensuring MPI and MAB are well connected and engaged with relevant Māori fora, initiatives and people; and for providing advice and informing MPI on Māori-related issues and impacts. §          §If you like getting out in the field and measuring the impact of funding programmes on the ground, have an eye for detail, and can add value through identifying and sharing learnings, we would love to speak with you.  Success in this role is the ability to be strategic and identify opportunities and engage with existing and new clients.§          §Your knowledge of monitoring and evaluation methodologies and their practical and accessible application is critical. An understanding of Māori tikanga and kawa and being comfortable on marae is important.§          §If you have strategic vision, can establish and build relationships skilfully, and are looking for an opportunity to benefit the regional and national primary sector landscape - this role could be the opportunity you've been waiting for.§          §Key Skills / Experience§          §Bring your tertiary degree (economics, management, law, government, resource management, biological sciences, etc.) and/or corresponding / relevant work experience along to:§          §            §Experience a team culture which places value on Te Ao Māori and the Treaty partnership.§            §Experience working with external contractors.§            §Experience leading projects and achieving effective outcomes in situations where there are diverse interests.§            §Apply your knowledge of evaluation/ research methodologies, tools, techniques and channels.§            §Effectively teach your team, new to evaluation/research, the relevant methodologies. §            §Apply your knowledge to make sense of complex or ambiguous issues and to determine the most appropriate response to these.§          §          §See the benefits of working at MPI§          §Our mahi stretches all the way from the Beehive to the border. Cover)§§Advertiser: §Carevets Business Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Fixed term Maternity Leave Cover§ § § §Looking for an exciting and challenging new role in emergency and after-hours nursing?!§ § § §At Waikato After Hours Veterinary Hospital we work nights, weekends and public holidays and strive to offer the best medicine and care possible for our patients and clients regardless of the time of the day.§ § § §We are a fun, passionate, welcoming and supportive bunch of vets and nurses and work very well as a team.  We provide afterhours services for all the primary clinics in Hamilton and surrounding areas. § § § §We are looking for a friendly and dedicated vet nurse with a minimum of two years’ experience to join us for a fixed term Maternity Leave cover who is keen to extend their knowledge and take that next exciting step in their career!§ § § §This is a permanent full-time position made up of a combination of weekend and nightshifts including overnight shifts.  The roster is designed to give you the best work/life balance possible, whilst working nights and weekends.§ § § §Your responsibilities will include:§ § §client relations§ §patient evaluation and triage§ §care and monitoring of hospitalised patients and critical transfers§ §taking bloods and placing IV catheters§ §anaesthetic monitoring of high risk patients§ §digital radiography, CT scans and lab testing§ §fluid therapy and blood transfusion monitoring§ § § §We have an onsite full IDEXX laboratory and blood gas capabilities, smartflow inpatient hospital system, digital radiography, ultrasound, CT, oscillometric blood pressure, doppler, capnography, ECG, endoscopy, fluid therapy and more.  We also have access to an Emergency and Critical Care Specialist who provides in-house tutorials on various relevant topics.§ § § §You will be able to work well in a fast-paced environment and must be:§ § §self-motivated and good at multi-tasking§ §able to communicate effectively with clients and staff§ §a good team player and willing to work extra hours if needed§ §enthusiastic and compassionate§ §skilled at using computers and being familiar with Vetlink software would be an advantage§ §a qualified veterinary nurse with at least 2 years experience§ §applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa§ § § § § §Experience in emergency nursing would be beneficial but not essential.  Full training on our emergency protocols will be provided.§ § § §We provide a competitive remuneration commensurate with experience and advancement in the practice, continuing education, membership with the NZVNA, new skills and learning opportunities on every shift, and you get to use your skills each day you work!§ § § §Please submit your CV or any queries to Erika Smith at §clinicmanager@wavh.co.nz§ §Applications for this position will remain open until we find a great match for the team.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§§§

jobText: TXT/50870436.txt	§Veterinarian Full Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinarian Full Time§§Advertiser: §National Veterinary Care§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Salary§§No§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Veterinarian Full Time §        §          §Palmerston North, home to Massey University, is a vibrant, youthful city set at the foot of the Tararua Mountain Range, with forested hills and native bushland. jobText: TXT/50870435.txt	§Mixed Veterinarian§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Mixed Veterinarian§§Advertiser: §National Veterinary Care§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Salary§§No§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Mixed Veterinarian §        §Waihi Veterinary Service§ is dedicated to helping our local dairy farmers and local companion animal community. Between us, we have over 50 years’ experience and we have created a fun culture with a family vibe. §You can be you, with us! § § § § Our clinic is fully equipped for all standard medical and surgical procedures and we are a part of the NVC Group, which means that we are have the support of an administration office and a Regional Manager who looks out for the operational side of the business, letting us do what we love – helping animals in need!§   § §Waihi – A beautiful spot!§ Waihi is a popular destination for those who love the outdoors; the beach; and a relaxed lifestyle. We are an extremely popular holiday spot in the summertime and a peaceful place of residence throughout the year. We are very central to the Coromandel, Waikato and Bay of Plenty! Waihi has strong community development initiatives in place, including those supporting culture and heritage, the arts and fitness and well-being. Come and join us!§ § § § §A bit about the position - §In this role, you will be helping to treat our companion animal clients in the clinic, and you will be assisting our dairy vets with the large animal side of our business. Therefore, it is important that you share a passion for mixed-practice work and are capable in both areas. Of course, we have an amazing team who will support you and if you require upskilling or any further training, we will provide that for you!§ § § § §What you can offer us:§          §            §BVS or equivalent, and registration to practice in New Zealand.§            §You are a passionate and driven vet with experienced in a mixed animal practice§            §You enjoy working as part of a team and dedicated to providing Gold Standards of service§            §You ideally have at least 4 years’ practical experience however we are open to other applications§            §You can work after hours on our rotating roster§          § § § § §What we can offer you:§          §            §A fantastic team environment§            §No Weekend work§ – this position is Monday – Friday (except on call roster)§            §Access to practical training programs through our purpose-built Veterinary Training Centres§            §Continuing education allowance and study leave for annum§            §Endless opportunities with the possibility of working across any one of our NVC clinics in Australia and New Zealand§          §   § Our clinic is part of National Veterinary Care (NVC), a group of over 100 clinics located across Australia and New Zealand. § § § § §What makes us different?§ National Veterinary Care believes that if we put our people first, the results will follow. We achieve this through having a highly qualified Veterinary Surgeon as our General Manager – Vet Services, who keeps our clinical standards at the forefront of business decisions. We achieve it through our Veterinary Training Centres – industry firsts where we offer practical CPD in everything from behaviour through to orthopaedic surgery – so that you have the skills and confidence to care for every pet who comes through your clinic doors. Click here to see more! https://veterinarytrainingcentre.com.au/  §   § For further information about our clinic, please visit https://waihivets.co.nz/§ § § § §Sounds great, how do I apply? § Please contact Jwan Kattan, Talent Specialist on §Jwan.Kattan@vet.partners§ or Apply Now.§   §  §   § § § § § §        §        §Jwan Kattan §      §    §  §§§Waihi Veterinary Service§ is dedicated to helping our local dairy farmers and local companion animal community. Waihi has strong community development initiatives in place, including those supporting culture and heritage, the arts and fitness and well-being. Come and join us!§ § § § §A bit about the position - §In this role, you will be helping to treat our companion animal clients in the clinic, and you will be assisting our dairy vets with the large animal side of our business. Therefore, it is important that you share a passion for mixed-practice work and are capable in both areas. Of course, we have an amazing team who will support you and if you require upskilling or any further training, we will provide that for you!§ § § § §What you can offer us:§ § §BVS or equivalent, and registration to practice in New Zealand.§ §You are a passionate and driven vet with experienced in a mixed animal practice§ §You enjoy working as part of a team and dedicated to providing Gold Standards of service§ §You ideally have at least 4 years’ practical experience however we are open to other applications§ §You can work after hours on our rotating roster§ § § § § §What we can offer you:§ § §A fantastic team environment§ §No Weekend work§ – this position is Monday – Friday (except on call roster)§ §Access to practical training programs through our purpose-built Veterinary Training Centres§ §Continuing education allowance and study leave for annum§ §Endless opportunities with the possibility of working across any one of our NVC clinics in Australia and New Zealand§ §   § Our clinic is part of National Veterinary Care (NVC), a group of over 100 clinics located across Australia and New Zealand. § § § § §What makes us different?§ National Veterinary Care believes that if we put our people first, the results will follow. jobText: TXT/50890067.txt	§Poultry workers required§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Poultry workers required§§Advertiser: §Select Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Labour§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Poultry workers required §      §        §Have you got basic general labouring experience? We need good reliable workers for ongoing casual positions to work around the various farms on the outskirts of Dunedin. §        §The Company:§        §Founded in 1998 Zeagold foods originated in Waikouaiti and has grown in both size and reputation throughout New Zealand. With the acquisition of existing farms and further expansion they now have production and distribution operations through New Zealand making them the leading producer of eggs and egg products with Zeagold branded products now sold through New Zealand and as far away as Hong Kong and Singapore.§        §Zeagold foods has one of the most modern poultry farms in Australasia with every aspect of the production matrix carefully evaluated from biosecurity to bird welfare, human resources through to the environmental impact and manage every aspect of the egg production process including the growing of grain, the production of feed, rearing of chicks, egg laying, livestock health, grading and packing right through to the processing of egg products giving them the ability to optimise the quality of the eggs and egg products produced.§        §About the role:§        §The farm roles require the handling of livestock and includes a variety of tasks including bird maintenance, preparation of the birds for transport, cleaning of the sheds and other tasks as required.§        §We have multiple roles available within their tight knit team which all require a good work ethic, a keen eye for detail and the ability to multi-task. You will need to be a morning person as the standard hours of work are 7:00am-3:30pm, there may be the requirement to start early and finish late dependant on business requirements so flexibility is a must, transport is provided from Dunedin to the various farms.§        §Key requirements of the role:§        §          §Reliability§          §Great work Ethic§          §Two verbal referees with emphasis on teamwork and attendance§          §Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol screen§        §        §This is a clucking good opportunity, don't delay apply today!§        § §        §If you are interested in the above role press §APPLY§ now or if you would like to know more call Select today §034770873§ discretion is guaranteed.§ § If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please phone us for a confidential discussion on your career.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Have you got basic general labouring experience? We need good reliable workers for ongoing casual positions to work around the various farms on the outskirts of Dunedin. §The Company:§Founded in 1998 Zeagold foods originated in Waikouaiti and has grown in both size and reputation throughout New Zealand. jobText: TXT/50882231.txt	§Assistant Herd Manager §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Herd Manager §§Advertiser: §Findex§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Rest of Southland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§ §The Farm§Located 10 minutes from Winton, McBeth Dairy is a family-owned winter on dairy farm, fully self-contained with a long history of successful yields. Originally converted from a sheep/beef farm in 1995, our farm has improved year on year, and we have almost doubled in size over the years. At present we run a 200ha operation and are milking up to 400 cows using a 40-bale herringbone system.§We’re a respectful hard-working team who value family and self-improvement. These values transpire to our working environment, where we offer flexibility around family needs and school events. This position offers three-bedroom house on the property and we are school bus zoned for Central Southland College and Lime Hills. §Along with our focus on family values is our respect for people who want to develop and improve. We understand that developing your skillset is important, so we offer good on-job training with genuine career progression opportunities. If you are hardworking, respectful and show us you can work independently there is a genuine opportunity for promotion to Herd Manager.§The Role§In this role you will be responsible for the:§  §Milking§  §Grass management – setting up blocks etc§  §Monitoring the health and condition of the cows§  §Cropping, pasture and supplement§  §Drenching animals§  §General farm maintenance§  §Making and cleaning calf shed – keeping the milking shed clean/tidy§  §Managing run off activities§  §Maintaining and fixing fences and gates§  §Fix any water problems on farm§  §Ensuring all animals receive appropriate housing§  §Tractor work e.g. bailage and topping grass etc.§This newly created Assistant Herd Manager role would be ideal for someone who is looking to further develop their dairy farming career or an established Herd Manager looking for something family friendly.§The successful candidate will bring:§  §At least 1-2 years dairy farming experience§  §Demonstrated ablity to work independently would be an asset§  §Previous experience working in a close-knit team environment is preferable.  §  §Positive attitude and a willingness to learn.§  §A “can do” attitude and excellent communication skills§  §A current full driver’s licence.§  §Good work ethic and pride in the work you do§  §Honest and hardworking§  §Punctuality§  §Genuine passion for working with animals§You must be a New Zealand citizen/resident or be able to obtain and maintain a relevant work visa to be considered for this role. Successful applicants will also be required to pass a drug and alcohol test. §For more details about the above role, please contact Daniel Mee on §03 211 0146§. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50901585.txt	§HAND GUN SPRAYER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HAND GUN SPRAYER§§Advertiser: §Eastern Bay Sprayers (2012) Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§We are looking for a Hand Gun Sprayer to join our team at Eastern Bay Sprayers (2012) Ltd. The responsibilities would include operating a spray unit on a 4WD ute, mixing chemicals in the spray tank (under supervision to start with) and working with remote retractable 200mtr hoses for spot spraying of weeds for our clients. The work is mostly farm work but we do have other work at certain times of the year spraying for the Councils and other Companies. You would be working with another person, there are two hoses and you would need to be fit and able to walk around hills dragging a hose to spot spray targeted weeds. The job involves early mornings to make the most of the weather and we are looking for reliability and keeness to work. If the successful applicant fits with our team we will put you through a Growsafe course to further your education. It is a requirement to have a full drivers licence and a Workplace First Aid would be an advantage. Our workshop is based in Whakatane township where the usual work day begins.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

Share our values of Safety First, Respectful, Responsible, Collaborative, Innovative?§      §Deep Sea Fishing Crew §      §      §      §        §          §Nelson based§          §Trip on and trip off§          §Career pathways for progression§        §        §A classic story of commitment and determination, our people play a significant role in making Sealord a proud New Zealand company and the country's best-known seafood brand. With operations in New Zealand and Australia we're one of the largest seafood companies in the Southern Hemisphere. And with nearly 60 years of fishing experience, our business consistently delivers quality seafood to our customers around the world.§        §At Sealord, we encourage an innovative, safe working environment and a positive culture. Our people are engaged, motivated and likely to tell you that Sealord is their employer of choice. Coaching, career development, succession planning and promotion from within, are aspects of every employee's career journey at Sealord. We have a performance-based culture and pride ourselves on reward and recognition initiatives that recognise top talent and outstanding performance.§        §Currently, we're looking to add to our team of 1,200 employees, and have opportunities for Deckhand and Factory Hand crew positions. Passionate about the sea, fishing, and developing your career in the industry, including gaining qualifications while you work, then this opportunity is not to be missed!§        §Deckhands§        §Learn to operate and maintain deck and fishing gear, handle and stow the catch, repair damaged nets, maintain on deck equipment, work on bridge watch duties and support factory processing operations as needed.§        §Factory hands§        §With a fully operational processing factory on board, develop your competence with knife skills, operate conveyer processing lines, weigh and pack products.§        §Trip lengths on the vessels range from two to six weeks and crew operate on a trip on, trip off rotation. While out on the water, resilience is a life skill that is critical, as is respect for each other and the environment. Being committed to your team and tasks is imperative for the whole crew to be successful.§        §Being at sea is a way of life unique and exhilarating! jobText: TXT/50872238.txt	§Horticultural Apprentice§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Horticultural Apprentice§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Horticultural Apprentice §      §        §•    Three years of' fixed-term position§•    Based at the Auckland Botanic Gardens§•    Achieve NZ Certificate in Horticultural Services – level 3§        § §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity §        §Do you want to work at one of New Zealand's award-winning and Qualmark accredited Botanic Gardens? §        §This is an amazing opportunity to gain paid hands-on experience resulting in achieving an acknowledged qualification - a Level 3 New Zealand Certificate in Horticultural Services (Amenity). The learning programme is backed with a variety of training and development opportunities, that will leverage your career in horticulture in a way that traditional studies cannot compare.  At the end of the three years, you will be a capable and qualified gardener and horticulturist.§        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §The team at Auckland Botanic Gardens ensures their plant collections are cultivated and maintained to the highest standards of presentation and reflect the principle aims of a botanic garden: conservation, education, research, and recreation. §        §You will be learning from and working alongside some of the best people within the amenity horticultural industry and have an opportunity to work within a variety of areas within the Botanic Gardens. Primarily though you will assist the collection curators and gardeners in the cultivation and maintenance of the plant collections and amenity gardens; as well as supporting the team with their day-to-day operations. §        §Whilst gaining all that experience, you will be trained on the maintenance and operation of a variety of machinery and tools of the trade. You will also be trained in the practice of first aid, and complete a Growsafe certificate in the safe use and handling of agrichemicals.  In your third year, you may even have the opportunity to apply and take part in the 'Young Amenity Horticulturist of the Year' competition.  §        §What a journey and what a way to start a new career!§        §To be successful in this position, you must have a passion for plants as well as some basic horticultural knowledge and practical experience. You'll need a clean, full NZ driver's licence (manual driving skills are desirable).  You must be physically active, be able to handle manually shifting often heavy loads and be willing to working outside in often trying weather conditions.§        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        §If you're ready for a new challenge, a new career in horticulture, and can contribute to a great team environment - look no further.  Auckland Botanic Gardens is home to over 10,000 plants from both here in New Zealand and around the world.  It's a great place to work - where both people and their ideas are encouraged to grow.§        §Please note, the official title for this role is Horticultural Trainee.§        §Visit our website http://www.aucklandbotanicgardens.co.nz/ for more details about Auckland Botanic Gardens.§        §Note: Our apprenticeship works full-time on a 40-hour week - Monday to Friday 7.30 am - 4.00 pm.   You will be provided with a full work uniform as well as personal health and safety equipment.§        §This role is deemed safety sensitive and in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing.  §        §Auckland Council is committed to the protection and wellbeing of children.  This role is classified as a Children's Worker role under the Vulnerable Children Act 2014. As such applicants will be required to undergo police vetting prior to commencing employment. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check.§        §Applications close Monday, 16 November 2020.§  For more information, please contact Enna Cecilio on 021 223 2212.§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§•    Three years of' fixed-term position§•    Based at the Auckland Botanic Gardens§•    Achieve NZ Certificate in Horticultural Services – level 3§ §He angitūtanga: The opportunity §Do you want to work at one of New Zealand's award-winning and Qualmark accredited Botanic Gardens? §This is an amazing opportunity to gain paid hands-on experience resulting in achieving an acknowledged qualification - a Level 3 New Zealand Certificate in Horticultural Services (Amenity). The learning programme is backed with a variety of training and development opportunities, that will leverage your career in horticulture in a way that traditional studies cannot compare.  At the end of the three years, you will be a capable and qualified gardener and horticulturist.§He kōrero mōu: About you§The team at Auckland Botanic Gardens ensures their plant collections are cultivated and maintained to the highest standards of presentation and reflect the principle aims of a botanic garden: conservation, education, research, and recreation. §You will be learning from and working alongside some of the best people within the amenity horticultural industry and have an opportunity to work within a variety of areas within the Botanic Gardens. Primarily though you will assist the collection curators and gardeners in the cultivation and maintenance of the plant collections and amenity gardens; as well as supporting the team with their day-to-day operations. §Whilst gaining all that experience, you will be trained on the maintenance and operation of a variety of machinery and tools of the trade. You will also be trained in the practice of first aid, and complete a Growsafe certificate in the safe use and handling of agrichemicals.  In your third year, you may even have the opportunity to apply and take part in the 'Young Amenity Horticulturist of the Year' competition.  §What a journey and what a way to start a new career!§To be successful in this position, you must have a passion for plants as well as some basic horticultural knowledge and practical experience. You'll need a clean, full NZ driver's licence (manual driving skills are desirable).  You must be physically active, be able to handle manually shifting often heavy loads and be willing to working outside in often trying weather conditions.§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§If you're ready for a new challenge, a new career in horticulture, and can contribute to a great team environment - look no further.  Auckland Botanic Gardens is home to over 10,000 plants from both here in New Zealand and around the world.  It's a great place to work - where both people and their ideas are encouraged to grow.§Please note, the official title for this role is Horticultural Trainee.§Visit our website http://www.aucklandbotanicgardens.co.nz/ for more details about Auckland Botanic Gardens.§Note: Our apprenticeship works full-time on a 40-hour week - Monday to Friday 7.30 am - 4.00 pm.   You will be provided with a full work uniform as well as personal health and safety equipment.§This role is deemed safety sensitive and in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing.  §Auckland Council is committed to the protection and wellbeing of children.  This role is classified as a Children's Worker role under the Vulnerable Children Act 2014. As such applicants will be required to undergo police vetting prior to commencing employment. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check.§Applications close Monday, 16 November 2020.§  For more information, please contact Enna Cecilio on 021 223 2212.§Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Biodiversity Community Facilitator Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50892017.txt	§Biodiversity Community Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Biodiversity Community Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Biodiversity Hawke's Bay§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§Biodiversity Hawke's Bay is a community-based initiative created as part of the Hawke's Bay Biodiversity Strategy §2015-2050§ and Action Plan §2017-2020§ to lead and nurture the restoration of indigenous biodiversity in Hawke's Bay.§ § § §Biodiversity Hawke's Bay comprises the Hawke's Bay Biodiversity Trust, a Charitable Trust, and the Biodiversity Guardians of Hawke's Bay, an incorporated Society with members.  Together we work to ensure the vision of the Strategy:  Working together, Hawke's Bay's biodiversity is enhanced, healthy and functioning.§ § § §Three part-time contractors – a General Manager, an Administration Manager, and a Communications Advisor - currently support Biodiversity Hawke's Bay in our work.  We are looking to supplement their work by contracting a Biodiversity Community Facilitator.§ § § §We seek an energetic independent contractor to contribute to Biodiversity Hawke's Bay's strategic goals by reaching out to those in the community engaging in biodiversity related projects, supporting those efforts and removing barriers for the community to contribute to enhancing biodiversity in the region.§ § § §The Biodiversity Community Facilitator will identify, support, and actively connect the various community biodiversity projects and work closely with the Communications Advisor to share the biodiversity success stories with the community.§ § § §The successful candidate will also:§ § §Support the work of the General Manager in engaging with mana whenua.§ §Organise and convene appropriate community forums on a regular basis.§ §Meet regularly with those undertaking community biodiversity projects, Biodiversity Hawke's Bay members and Strategy Partners.§ § § §The scale of the services to be provided is negotiable though we expect it to be an average of 30 hours per week.  You will need to confirm you are able to invoice Biodiversity Hawke's Bay for your services on a monthly basis.  An initial term of 12 months will be offered and a fixed rate for that period will be negotiated with the successful service provider.§ § § §Applicants should send a cover letter and updated CV to §info@biodiversityhb.nz§. Closing date for applications is 9am on Monday 23 November 2020. A full job description is available on request.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50894774.txt	§Analyst, Audit & Accreditation (Wellington)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Analyst, Audit & Accreditation (Wellington)§§Advertiser: §OSPRI§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Analyst, Audit & Accreditation (Wellington) §      §        §About OSPRI§        §OSPRI is a non-profit organisation which operates in partnership with New Zealand’s primary industries and government to achieve on-farm biosecurity objectives through animal disease management and traceability.  We work closely with our shareholders, Beef and Lamb New Zealand, Dairy NZ, Deer Industry New Zealand and the Ministry for Primary Industries, plus a range of other stakeholders, to deliver on our value statement: §Farmers and markets can depend on us to provide assurance as to the health and status of animals§.§        §OSPRI has a key role in the biosecurity system to contribute to New Zealand’s national and international reputation in animal products.  TBfree and National Animal Identification and Tracing are OSPRI programmes.§        §With a new Chief Executive at the helm, significant and exciting changes have been made over the last 12 months and the next step in OSPRI’s evolution is to establish a high performing, collaborative and forward-thinking organisation with a strong emphasis on organisational agility.§        §What will you be doing? §        § You will be delivering and maintaining the organisations internal control systems and procedures with a focus on ensuring customers and entities are compliant with their obligations in both traceability and TBfree testing.§        §You will be responsible for the end to end audit process including, ensuring the timetable of audits are followed in line with the Program Plan, co-ordinating internal and external audit providers, monitoring the Audit and Accreditation Framework and updating audit accreditation policies, procedures and audit tools. You will also look after the accreditation and authorisation processes.§        §    What we’re looking for§        §          §A motivated self-starter, who takes pride on delivering exceptional results and who is detail orientated with a commitment to high quality output§          §Organised and is able to prioritise§          §Is effective at building professional relationships to ensure great results§          §Data management experience including excellent skills in excel§          §Experience with and strong interest in data management and reporting§          §Experience with SQL and Microsoft databases§          §Analytical skills and ability to translate business information needs into technical specifications§          §Problem analysis and solving skills§          §Highly organised with strong time management skills§          §Ability to identify trends and inconsistencies in data or process§        §        §In return we offer §        §          §A supportive and energetic team, interesting and exciting work and development opportunities§          §Flexible working options§          §Employer funded Life and Trauma Insurance§          §Annual flu vaccinations§          §Employee Assistance Program§        §        §Please view a copy of the position description by visiting https://www.ospri.co.nz/careers/vacancies/ or email careers@ospri.co.nz .§        §How to apply§       §        §To apply please click ‘Apply for this role’ and include your cover letter and CV.§        §Applications close at 5 pm, Monday, 23rd November 2020. §We will be assessing and interviewing suitable applicants as applications are received. jobText: TXT/50872069.txt	§SOLE CHARGE GAMEKEEPER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§SOLE CHARGE GAMEKEEPER§§Advertiser: §Equine Estate Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§Equine Estate, New Zealand’s longest established game shooting reserve, seeks an experienced gamekeeper.§You will be in sole charge of all gamekeeping duties, and must have verifiable experience in the following areas:§Habitat management for pheasants§Efficient pest and predator control§Gamebird husbandry, their management, care and welfare§Annual cropping management§Pen infrastructure maintenance§Planning and execution of shooting days, including organising teams of helpers§General estate work; care and safe use of machinery and off-road vehicles§Equine Estate aspires to achieve excellence in the sport that it offers guests.  Our focus is on quality with a relaxed, but well organised atmosphere.  In order to succeed in this role, you will need to display the following attributes:§Diligence: you will manage your own working hours, which will revolve around the requirements of your birds, the weather and season§Diplomacy: you will need to successfully manage relationships with a wide range of people in this role§Be a tidy, efficient worker§Organised: you will need to manage multiple commitments, be able to prioritise and have exceptional attention to detail§Common sense: Equine Estate takes health & safety seriously and you will be expected to play your part in ensuring a safe workplace§You will be required to live in the gamekeeper’s house on the estate, and all necessary vehicles and equipment will be provided.  This role is for an immediate start.§Situated just off the coast in Bay of Plenty, Equine Estate is a 350 Ha privately-owned property roughly 50 minutes from both Rotorua and Tauranga.  The main activity is gamebird and clay target shooting amongst carefully managed grounds which includes large blocks of native bush and exotic stands.§Equine Estate is also a working farm; however, the grazing is leased out.§The property has extensive parkland and landscaped areas, fringed with ornamentals and exotics.  Grounds are mowed as needed with a large zero-turn mower, and small lawns with a conventional ride-on.§The estate has a culture of tidiness and teamwork, and new staff will be expected to follow these principles.  All necessary equipment is provided and maintained to a high standard.§The predominant activity throughout winter is organised pheasant hunting, hosting over twenty days from May to late August.  A full-time gamekeeper is employed to organise this.§Equine is an easy drive from Rotorua and the lakes for Trout fishing.  A new express-way connects Tauranga and Mount Maunganui for great beaches and Whakatane is less than 1hr drive for sea fishing.§Please apply with covering letter, stating your experience and why this role may interest you.  C.V. and references relevant to the position are essential.§If this sounds like you, please send your C.V. and covering letter to §equine@farmside.co.nz§Salary commensurate with experience.§Applicants must have a right to live & work in New Zealand.§Applications close on 4th December 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50902581.txt	§Ranger, Biodiversity/Heritage and Visitors, (Posting)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ranger, Biodiversity/Heritage and Visitors, Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Ranger, Biodiversity/Heritage and Visitors, (Posting) §        §          §An exciting opportunity has become available for an Island Ranger within the Auckland Inner Islands team.§          §Are you passionate about the conservation of New Zealand's history, skilled and experienced in visitor engagement and up for a challenge?  §          §            §Full-time work for three years§            §Living on the beautiful Kawau Island within the Kawau Island Historic Reserve §            §Helping in the maintenance of Mansion House, a Category 1 Heritage Building, and the restoration of surrounding heritage gardens to a Governor Grey era. §            §This opportunity is full of projects such as increasing Treaty Partner presence, enhancing volunteering opportunities, drainage and water system upgrades, interpretation upgrades for visitor experience, heritage gardens review and potentially a restoration project of the greater reserve, returning what is not heritage to native forest.§          §          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §As our next Kawau Island ranger, you will be responsible for all the daily happenings within Mansion House and around the greater reserve.§          §You will lead the daily maintenance of the house and grounds for the visitor experience, engaging with Treaty Partners, volunteers, community groups, contractors and concessionaires to bring collaboration and to expand our capacity.§          §You will ensure the maintenance of infrastructure such as water supply, wastewater systems, buildings, and fencing, as well as the equipment used by yourself and others.§          §You will need to be sympathetic to historic heritage, to balance current recreation needs with preserving the island's heritage features, mostly dating from Sir George Grey's period of residence and the copper mining era and with future intensions to better tell the stories of Treaty Partner connections to the land.§          §You will need to be a good communicator, to act as the key contact on the island for residents and all that you collaborate with. This will be particularly important during upcoming major projects.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §Required:§          §            §A current First Aid certificate§            §A full Drivers Licence§            §Light utility vehicle certification§            §Trailer towing skills§            §Scrub bar skills§            §Hospitality skills§            §Genuine interest in historic heritage§            §Experience with maintaining visitor facilities§            §A strong focus on health and safety§            §Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with others.§            §Practical skills and trouble-shooting abilities.§            §Police check: Children's Act§          §          § Desired:§          §            §Building skills§            §Skippers license§            §Chainsaw license§            §Tractor qualifications§            §An understanding of the connection our Treaty Partners have to Kawau Island.§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          §The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          §Excellent development opportunities across the Auckland Inner Islands district/operations group.§          § §          §Should you be the successful applicant for this position, you will be required to undertake a Children's Worker Safety Check before you can start the role. This safety check includes NZ Police Vetting and other background checks as deemed necessary as per the §Children's Act 2014.§          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiry, please contact Sophie Kynman-Cole, telephone §(0272632936§), quoting vacancy 400/9832.  §          §Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 23 November 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§An exciting opportunity jobText: TXT/50886600.txt	§Regional Manager - Lower South Island, UPL§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Manager - Lower South Island, UPL§§Advertiser: §AgRecruit Human Resources§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Southland§§Salary§§Remuneration based on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§UPL’s global vision is to be an icon for technology growth and innovation. Our mission is to change the game - to make every single food product more sustainable. § §In New Zealand, we provide unique crop solutions with a wide and diverse portfolio of crop protection products.   We are New Zealand’s leader in adjuvant technology, providing specific products for specific needs. With a large R&D pipeline across multiple areas of crop protection, UPL will bring new and exciting innovation to the New Zealand market.§ §Our business is growing significantly, so we are now searching for a person to fill the newly created role of Regional Manager – Lower South Island to support our retail distribution partners. §As part of the sales team, you will report to the Country Manager and be supported by a highly experienced UPL team. The role is focused on delivering value to our customers through technical advice, training and market support activities.§ §Competencies required to be successful in this role include: § §Experience with delivering profitable value-based sales outcomes§ §A technical background in seed, retail distribution, crop protection or another relevant field§ §The ambition and curiosity required to embrace change within a changing farming landscape§ § To inquire about UPL and this role in strict confidence or to request a Position Description, phone Deb Francis from AgRecruit on 021 2245000. §Otherwise, please register your interest by sending your CV and covering letter via this portal by Wednesday 18 March.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50890327.txt	§Vintage Cellar Supervisors §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vintage Cellar Supervisors §§Advertiser: §Yealands§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§In 2008, a wild and rugged stretch of coastline on the north-eastern tip of New Zealand’s South Island became home to one of the most sustainable wineries in the world. §In just 12 years, Yealands has grown to be one of NZ’s most recognised wine labels with an award winning reputation.§Yealands is currently looking for Vintage Cellar Supervisors, who are as excited about exceptionally produced sustainable wines as we are.§We are looking for people with:§  §Fantastic communication skills§  §The ability to lead and coach §  §Previous winery experience - 2 - 3 vintages §  §A positive and collaborative attitude§  §Strong initiative and self-motivation§  §The ability to multitask §  §The attributes of a team player with a good sense of humour (and the ability to put up with ours!)§As you will be supervising a team of fixed term vintage employees, you will have previous experience in the wine industry particularly in the winery environment during the busy vintage period. §The successful applicants would be expected to start in early March 2021, for a period of 6-8 weeks.  During the peak harvest period 12-hour shifts, six days a week can be expected.§Non NZ citizens/residents will need to have a valid NZ Work Visa.§As well as a stunning place to work, we’ll provide:§  §Competitive pay§  §Subsidised Accommodation§  §A meal if you are working a 12 hour shift§  §Night shift allowance§  §Transport to and from the winery§  §A fun, friendly environment§If this sounds like you, and you're keen to experience Vintage with one of NZ's most sustainable wineries, get in touch – we can’t wait to have you for vintage 2021!§Please note, all successful applicants will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Vintage-Cellar-Supervisor.pdf§§§§

The ability to communicate in Russian would be an advantage.§        §Being at sea is a way of life, unique and exhilarating! Ready to step up, manage a team, and contribute to making positive change in your region?§ §We are looking for a Parks and Reserves Manager who is ready to hit the ground running, take ownership of, and oversee the successful day-to-day operation of all Parks and Reserves activities.§ §The role is responsible for leading, managing, and providing strategic direction to the Parks and Recreation team. This is achieved through effective management, leadership and planning of Council's reserves and facilities, and by working in partnership with the community.§ §This exciting and varied role involves:§ § §Implementing and maintaining the Capital work forward planning programme§ §Project managing both capital and project works including contract management of major projects§ §Leading staff in the planning management of assets they are responsible for§ §Updating and continuously reviewing the Parks and Reserves Asset management Plan and Reserve Management Plans§ §Managing the Parks and Reserves team, including establishing performance/goals, providing training, and facilitating professional development§ §Providing assistance with strategic planning, working with the leadership team and contributing to Long Term Planning processes in relation to Community Outcomes§ §This is an incredibly important role in our Council team, reporting directly to the Asset Group Manager, with 1 direct report and 5 indirect reports.§ §To succeed in this role, you will need to have:§ § §A recognised postgraduate qualification in parks and outdoor recreation, or relevant qualification§ §At least 10 years' experience in a relevant field§ §Demonstrated experience in successful staff leadership, mentoring and management§ §Extensive work knowledge and understanding of community facilities and asset management§ §Financial acumen and experience managing budgets§ §Knowledge of and experience with technical reports§ §Competence with developing and implementing new systems and processes§ §Working knowledge of the relevant statutes and regulations to Council's parks, reserves, and community facilities would be beneficial, as would previous knowledge of a working Council environment§ §Waimate District is one of New Zealand's best rural communities. We are a tight-knit, family-friendly Council in South Canterbury, who pride ourselves on our inclusive, fun and friendly team culture, and being a great place to work!§ §To apply for this job go to: waimatedc.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5267168. §§§§

We have grown more than twentyfold since 2002 and continue to lead wine industry growth. We have grown more than twentyfold since 2002 and continue to lead wine industry growth. We have state-of-the-art wineries and world-class vineyards in the prime grape growing regions of New Zealand and focus exclusively on making the world’s most sought-after Super Premium wines under our Oyster Bay brand. We believe deeply that it is our people that bring our plans to life, turn our goals into reality, and truly make the difference.§ §If you have the passion to be amongst the very best and thrive in a high-performance environment, please apply.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50874448.txt	§Senior Adviser - He Waka Eke Noa§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Adviser - He Waka Eke Noa§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Senior Adviser - He Waka Eke Noa §        §          §Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi§          §With your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper§ §          §The primary industries are the backbone of the New Zealand economy and part of our cultural identity as a country. Many farmers and growers are working hard to maximise the value of their products, look after and improve the environment, and actively contribute to the wellbeing of their rural communities. We can be proud of what our primary industries are achieving, however there is more to be done to support and encourage innovation, to improve environmental outcomes (for example freshwater, biodiversity and greenhouse gas emissions), and to improve the economic resilience of the sector.§          §He Waka Eke Noa is a primary sector climate action partnership between industry, Māori and Government who are combining their resources, expertise and knowledge to support farmers and growers to adapt to climate change and measure, manage and reduce emissions from their farms.§          §We seek a talented senior advisor who can join our team to be the Government co-lead for the Extension workstream of the He Waka Eke Noa Programme.§          §Te whainga poto o tēnei tūranga (What is the purpose of this position?)§          §Regional Economic Development is a directorate that forms part of the Agriculture & Investment Services Business Unit, and is responsible for partnering with primary sector businesses, regional councils and catchment community groups to improve regional employment and sustainability outcomes.§          §This role is responsible for:§          §            §Acting as the Government co-lead for the Extension workstream of §He Waka Eke Noa§ and working collaboratively to deliver this workstream with the Industry and Māori co-leads.§            §Helping to shape and deliver advice on MPI's approach to extension services in the context of greenhouse mitigation and climate adaption.§            §Linking the broader §He Waka Eke Noa§ work and extension services activity into other relevant areas of MPI work, in order to inform and connect with the wider Productive and Sustainable Land Use Programme and policy.§            §Identifying, supporting and managing the development and implementation of initiatives that lead to extension services in the primary sector.§            §Developing and maintaining networks, knowledge and intelligence of extension activities across the agriculture sector in order to feed into the development of policy, new programmes and tangible support for farm decision makers.§            §Linking ideas with appropriate resources, e.g. avenues for funding, expertise or access to people that support the translation of ideas into concrete initiatives.§          §          §Ngā kawenga mahi§ §(What will you be doing?)§          §The Senior Advisor will:§          §            §Contribute to the timely delivery of work-stream outputs/milestones and ensure effective collaboration by work-stream participants§            §Ensure delivery of workstream outputs that highlight where there is consensus (or possibility for consensus) or where there are alternative positions and options, to support Steering Group decision making§            §Engage with broader agriculture sector stakeholders and farmers to understand their requirements§            §Contribute to the development of extension service initiatives including clear guidance on necessary departmental action, relevant timely and accurate advice to the Minister of Agriculture, and reporting back on the effectiveness of the government's priorities and work programme.§            §Develop, and assist with developing, ministerial correspondence, including ministerials, aides memoire, briefings, parliamentary questions, and Official Information Act requests.§            §Contribute to ensuring the Director-General, the DDG AIS and relevant Ministers are provided with high-quality, relevant and timely advice.  §            §Develop and maintain effective relationships with the broad spectrum of stakeholders involved in primary sector extension services in order that intelligence and information on issues relating to primary sector extension service is up to date and reliable and can be used to inform future policy and initiatives.§            §Ensure effective partnerships with team members and staff throughout MPI, government agencies, sector groups and Maori by driving appropriate engagement strategies that build and sustain effective relationships.§          §          § §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako (Skills & Experience):§          §            §Sound understanding of primary sector structure and operating context.§            §Previous experience in establishing and effectively maintaining collaborative relationships with stakeholders, Maori and Government agencies.§            §High level of negotiation and influencing skills with evidence of creating agreements or compromise for goals or new positions of understanding. §            §Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to present to small and large groups§            §Good problem solving skills.§            §A strong track record of achievement of results.§          §          §Tonu mai inaianei (Apply now):§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          §In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand.§          §The successful applicant must be able to obtain the relevant security clearance Please visit §http://www.mpi.govt.nz/about-mpi/careers/apply/security-clearance§ for more information.§          §For information please refer to the position description on the MPI careers website or email §ruth.greening@mpi.govt.nz§    §          §Applications close 18 November 2020§          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that jobText: TXT/50890951.txt	§Aquaculture Technician - Tory Channel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquaculture Technician - Tory Channel§§Advertiser: §New Zealand King Salmon§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Rest of Marlborough§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Fishing & Aquaculture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Aquaculture Technician - Tory Channel §      §        §Here at NZ King Salmon, we're the world's largest producer of King salmon. With the option to stay on the onsite company accommodation during your 7 days working shift. Based in the Marlborough sounds, the role will involve all aspects of fish farming, including feeding, net handling, diving tasks and aquaculture farm maintenance.§        §A Dive qualification / ticket preferred. Applicants do not need to be qualified divers but the ability to complete training as a diver is essential. Therefore, applicants should be confident in the water & be in good health.§        §The successful candidate would have commitment to ensuring their own and other’s safety in the work-place, Aquaculture experience or qualification would be an advantage, however full training will be provided. Someone who prides themselves on the ability to work well in small teams and can work unsupervised, has good communication skills and attention to detail, with a strong work ethic with a commitment to continuously improving the business.§        §At times, this can be a labour-intensive role and applicants must be physically fit, and comfortable working outside and on the water. With the option to stay on the onsite company accommodation during your 7 days working shift. Based in the Marlborough sounds, the role will involve all aspects of fish farming, including feeding, net handling, diving tasks and aquaculture farm maintenance.§A Dive qualification / ticket preferred. Applicants do not need to be qualified divers but the ability to complete training as a diver is essential. Therefore, applicants should be confident in the water & be in good health.§The successful candidate would have commitment to ensuring their own and other’s safety in the work-place, Aquaculture experience or qualification would be an advantage, however full training will be provided. Someone who prides themselves on the ability to work well in small teams and can work unsupervised, has good communication skills and attention to detail, with a strong work ethic with a commitment to continuously improving the business.§At times, this can be a labour-intensive role and applicants must be physically fit, and comfortable working outside and on the water. If you’re keen for a new challenge, don’t miss this opportunity to work in the beautiful Marlborough sounds.§All applications need to be submitted to§https://www.kingsalmon.co.nz/working-here/#join-the-team§(Please copy and paste the link into your browser to apply)§All applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand.§“New Zealand King Salmon is committed to a drug and alcohol free workplace and has a pre-employment, post incident and reasonable cause drug testing programme in place."§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
