strive to offer the best medicine and care possible for our patients and clients regardless of the time of the day.§ § § §We are a fun, passionate, welcoming and supportive bunch of vets and nurses and work very well as a team.  We provide afterhours services for all the primary clinics in Hamilton and surrounding areas. § § § §Due to team growth, we are looking for a friendly and dedicated vet nurse with a minimum of two years’ experience to join us who is keen to extend their knowledge and take that next exciting step in their career!§ § § §This is a permanent full-time position made up of a combination of weekend and nightshifts including overnight shifts.  The roster is designed to give you the best work/life balance possible, whilst working nights and weekends.§ § § §Your responsibilities will include:§ § §client relations§ §patient evaluation and triage§ §care and monitoring of hospitalised patients and critical transfers§ §taking bloods and placing IV catheters§ §anaesthetic monitoring of high risk patients§ §digital radiography, CT scans and lab testing§ §fluid therapy and blood transfusion monitoring§ § § §We have an onsite full IDEXX laboratory and blood gas capabilities, smartflow inpatient hospital system, digital radiography, ultrasound, CT, oscillometric blood pressure, doppler, capnography, ECG, endoscopy, fluid therapy and more.  We also have access to an Emergency and Critical Care Specialist who provides in-house tutorials on various relevant topics.§ § § §You will be able to work well in a fast-paced environment and must be:§ § §self-motivated and good at multi-tasking§ §able to communicate effectively with clients and staff§ §a good team player and willing to work extra hours if needed§ §enthusiastic and compassionate§ §skilled at using computers and being familiar with Vetlink software would be an advantage§ §a qualified veterinary nurse with at least 2 years experience§ §applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa§ § § § § §Experience in emergency nursing would be beneficial but not essential.  Full training on our emergency protocols will be provided.§ § § §We provide a competitive remuneration commensurate with experience and advancement in the practice, continuing education, membership with the NZVNA, new skills and learning opportunities on every shift, and you get to use your skills each day you work!§ § § §Please submit your CV or any queries to Erika Smith at §clinicmanager@wavh.co.nz§ §Applications for this position will remain open until we find a great match for the team.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§§§

jobText: TXT/50944503.txt	§Dairy Farm 2IC§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Dairy Farm 2IC§§Advertiser: §Findex§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Rest of Southland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§The Farm §Located 15 minutes from Winton, Offrey Farms are 50/50 sharemilkers on their fifth season, we are a winter on dairy farm, currently running a 437ha property spilt across our dairy operation and a separate run off. Our dairy operation is milking up to 710 cows (peak), 550 cows twice a day and the remainder once a day, using a 39 herringbone with cup removers and Protrack auto drafting. §We believe in efficient lean systems and take pride in our farm, and that is reflected in our farm culture, we are proud to be part of the dairy industry and we genuinely care for our animals. We also value people who share these same values and who are looking to make an honest career in Dairy Farming. §This culture is important to us and as a result we prioritise the coaching and training of our staff, so they can develop their skillsets and go further in the industry. If you’re able to demonstrate you’ve got what it takes, there are further opportunities in the future to take on greater responsibilities. §The Role§The 2IC position is an animal health focused role where you will support the Operations Manager to manage the day to day running of our milking shed and all aspects of animal health. You will also be responsible for coordinating and mentoring three staff members (Pasture Manager, Farm Assistant and Junior Farm Assistant). §This role would suit a person who is currently in a 2IC position (or who has been in one previously) who is looking for a new challenge in a people focused role that supports your career goals or someone ready to step up and make a real career in the dairy industry in a family-oriented environment. §If you are part of a farming family or couple and you are both looking for a change, we also have a Farm Assistant position available for the right couple. §The Person § §To be successful you will be a personable family orientated person with a real passion for animal care. You will also be expected to display a high level of commitment and passion towards dairy farming while achieving good results on a well-oiled and efficiently structured setup. §To be successful in this role you will need:§  §Previous experience in a 2IC position (or similar) would be advantageous §  §At least 3 years’ experience on a dairy farm in New Zealand;§  §High standards and attention to detail in milk production and animal husbandry;§  §Passionate about best practice people management;§  §Excellent leadership skills with the ability to motivate a team to achieve goals;§  §Strong communication skills and an ability to plan and organise daily tasks for the team;§  §Commitment and passion for animal health;§  §A current full drivers license§  §Enthusiasm to learn and drive to be successful in the dairy industry.§Our farm recognises the value of work life balance so we operate a 5 and 2 roster. For this position, we are offering a good remuneration package and a 3-bedroom cottage is available, however drive in applicants will also be considered as this is an option too.§Do not miss out on this opportunity to be a part of a high performing team with a commitment to developing people in an environment that genuinely cares. §APPLY NOW!!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50905591.txt	§Large Animal Receptionist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Large Animal Receptionist§§Advertiser: §VE Veterinary Services Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§LARGE ANIMAL RECEPTIONIST§• Real People • Real Animal Health • §VE Veterinary Services is a New Zealand owned and operated veterinary practice that has serviced farms and communities in the Waipa and King Country for over 30 years. We offer our clients the best advice, health programmes and ethical products on the market and have proven our commitment to delivering high quality veterinary services and we are a ‘Best Practice’ accredited clinic. §Within our Te Awamutu clinic, the Large Animal Receptionist is part of a team that will ensure the efficient and effective day-to-day operation of our dairy farm and large animal division.  Responsibilities include warmly greeting clients and visitors, scheduling farm visits, managing our ‘on the road’ team of vets and technicians, answering phones, responding to emails, making appointments, solving queries and assisting the stock control and product management staff. Additional responsibilities include animal health advice, selling products, stock management and being a ‘subject matter expert’ regarding veterinary products for our customers. §A background in the animal health industry is a pre-requisite to be successful in this role. You must have previous experience in a frontline customer service role and a passion for animal health. A high level of initiative, attention to detail and multitasking ability is essential, as well as having excellent communication skills with the ability to disseminate information within the team and other divisions. You must be an exceptional team player, well organised and possess empathy and understanding to deal with our clients at times of distress. You must also be proficient in using the Microsoft Office suite of products.§This is a busy and varied role that will suit someone that can juggle multiple tasks at once and isn’t fazed by being constantly interrupted. You will join our existing customer service team in a friendly and client focussed environment, who support each other and are committed to providing excellent service.§This full-time role will be required to be part of the Saturday morning roster (one in four weekends). §To apply, please email a current cover letter and CV to:§ §Sandra Rodgers (Practice Administrator) §vet@vevets.co.nz§ § §Applications close: Wednesday 18th November 2020 (or sooner).§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50951930.txt	§Business Development Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Representative§§Advertiser: §Halter§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§The Role§ §Halter is a high-growth technology company that has developed technology that enables dairy farmers to physically shift, manage and remotely monitor their herd from anywhere. This  technology will enable farming techniques that have never before been possible. § §With the first handful of customers deployed we are now looking to scale the company. As such we are expanding our Waikato Business Development team and are on the hunt for Business Development Representatives to sell the world's most sophisticated cow movement and monitoring system.§ §As a successful applicant you will be passionate about farming and will enjoy being on farm speaking with dairy farmers. You will thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced working environment and use your initiative to achieve ambitious sales targets. Reporting directly to our Business Development Manager. § §You will be backed by a team of exceptional people at Halter’s HQ and Pilot Farm to ensure this is the best job you’ll ever have.§ § § §What will you be working on?§ §Our vision is to unlock the connection between humans and animals to create a better world. This means we convert intentions that humans have into cues that animals understand and actions from animals into insights that humans can understand.§ §Over the last three years we have been on a mission to create guidance control techniques to shift cows remotely using a smart device, removing the need for fences and eliminating the manual nature of shifting animals. Farmers now have incredible new opportunities to unlock efficiency, productivity, and sustainability across all aspects of the farming operation.§ §Our GPS enabled, solar powered devices are designed to remotely guide cows. These require multiple levels of control software in order to record everything about the animal, understand it and act on this information accordingly. We use this to monitor stock health, feed, behaviour and emotion so that farmers can better understand and treat the needs of each animal. We are always pushing to use the latest advancements in technology and want you to be representing this technology. § §We are backed by a set of sophisticated investors that have supported a stream of other leading technology companies including SpaceX, Tesla, AirBNB and Spotify. We are also incredibly fortunate to count Rocket Lab CEO, Peter Beck, as an investor and board member.§ § § §Core Duties§ § § §Screen and qualify incoming leads to assess their fit and priority§ § § §Present Halter’s unique value and benefits to new leads on-farm or to groups§ § § §Clearly communicate functionality and highlight value relative to each farming operation § § § §Build and grow a pipeline of quality farms fit for Halter's product§ § § §Manage and maintain your pipeline, with swift execution of deals§ § § §Maintain relationships with customers by providing support and insight§ § § §Build and leverage industry relationships to establish and maintain Halter's brand§ § § §Provide clear lead progression reports to the Business Development Manager§ § § § §Desired Skills§ § § §At least 3 years experience building and managing customer relationships§ § § §A proven track record closing deals§ § § §Well prepared with strong communication skills§ § § §Exceptional time management skills§ § § §Ambitious and driven§ § § §Dairy farming knowledge strongly preferred § § § §Relevant University degree or equivalent§ § § § §What we can offer you§ § § §A chance to define the future of farming and make the world a better place§ § § §An open and supportive environment where input from all members is encouraged§ § § §The opportunity to work with and grow alongside a dynamic, and highly talented team with diverse backgrounds§ § § §A fast-paced work environment with exposure to world first technology§ § § §Opportunity for rapid development and career progression§ § § §The excitement, risk, and reward of a high-growth technology start-up§  § § §If this sounds like you, click apply§ §and submit your CV and cover letter today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Our dairy operation is milking up to 710 cows (peak), 550 cows twice a day and the remainder once a day, using a 39 herringbone with cup removers and Protrack auto drafting. §We believe in efficient lean systems and take pride in our farm, and that is reflected in our farm culture, we are proud to be part of the dairy industry and we genuinely care for our animals. We also value people who share these same values and who are looking to make an honest career in Dairy Farming. §This culture is important to us and as a result we prioritise the coaching and training of our staff, so they can develop and go further in the industry. A good example of this is our previous 2IC started in a Farm Assistant position and was promoted twice within three years to join our leadership team. If you’re able to demonstrate you’ve got what it takes, there are further opportunities to take on greater responsibilities. §The Role§Our Farm Assistant position is a ‘hands on’ role that gets involved in all aspects of the farm. Day to day your main tasks will be milk harvesting, animal health, shed maintenance, break fences, and weed control. You will be part of a close-knit team of four and report to the Operations Manager (and the 2IC when appropriate). §This role would be ideal for someone who is looking to further develop their dairy farming career or an experienced Farm Assistant looking for people focused farm. If you are hardworking, respectful and have a genuine passion for animals this is the role for you. §If you are part of a farming family or couple and you are both looking for a change, we also have a 2IC position available for the right couple (be quick though). §The Person§ §To be successful you will be a personable family orientated person with a real passion for animal care. You will also have a high interest in learning and a passion towards growing in the dairy farming industry. §To be successful in this role you will need:§  §At least one year of NZ dairy farming experience§  §A proven ability to make a positive contribution to the operation through being reliable, honest, adaptable and driven to achieve personal and organisational goals;§  §Previous experience working in a close-knit team environment is preferable.§  §A “can do” attitude and excellent communication skills§  §A current full drivers licence§  §Positive attitude and a willingness to learn.§  §Good work ethic and pride in the work you do§  §Genuine passion for working with animals§Our farm recognises the value of work life balance so we operate a 5 and 2 roster. For this position, we are offering a good remuneration package and a 3-bedroom cottage is available, however drive in applicants will also be considered as this is an option too.§Do not miss out on this opportunity to be a part of a high performing team with a commitment to developing people in an environment that genuinely cares. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50951832.txt	§Ranger, Biodiversity/Recreation/Historic§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ranger, Biodiversity/Recreation/Historic§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Rest of Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Ranger, Biodiversity/Recreation/Historic §        §          §An exciting opportunity has become available for Ranger within the Mahaanui Operations team.§          §            §Permanent full-time work §            §The role is based from Duvauchelle and provides the opportunity to spend your days in stunning landscapes across Banks Peninsula working to enhance the environment and ensuring that Papatūānuku thrives.§            §This role gets to experience the full range of conservation tasks across biodiversity and marine and into recreation, historic and emergency work.§          §          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §You will be focused on the biodiversity mahi of the district and ensuring the work is done to a high standard. You will be working closely with the rest of the Mahaanui team, Iwi as well as other organisations,  agencies and the community on Banks Peninsula.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for?§          §Required:§          §            §A genuine interest and enthusiasm for conservation, experience working with iwi and Community organisations;§            §A relevant degree or qualification in biology, conservation or ecology;§            §Have a practical background with the ability and physical fitness to be able to carry out a variety of conservation tasks, including weed control, predator control and biodiversity monitoring;§            §Knowledge of plants, birds and animals and methods to protect, as well as strong communications, and practical skills (e.g. fencing).§            §The ability to plan and prioritise your own work;§            §Leadership skills with the ability to lead a team and projects;§            §Proven organisational skills;§            §Be able to communicate effectively both orally and in written form and be familiar with and confident in the use of VHF radio systems;§            §A current first aid certificate and full driver's licence;§            §A Growsafe, 4x4 and LUV qualifications are desirable;§            §Boat skills are desirable to help with the local work.§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with a passion for conservation to get hands on and, make a difference every day in a truly iconic landscape.§          §This role will have a close working relationship with the Predator Free 2050 initiative on the Peninsula.§          §The Department provides a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§  §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§An exciting opportunity has become available for Ranger within the Mahaanui Operations team.§§Permanent full-time work §§The role is based from Duvauchelle and provides the opportunity to spend your days in stunning landscapes across Banks Peninsula working to enhance the environment and ensuring that Papatūānuku thrives.§§This role gets to experience the full range of conservation tasks across biodiversity and marine and into recreation, historic and emergency work.§§ §§He angitūtanga: About the Role§You will be focused on the biodiversity mahi of the district and ensuring the work is done to a high standard. If you are a level 3 or above qualified arborist looking for an exciting and dynamic working environment, this position may be just right for you.§The Parks Operations team provide a crucial customer facing support service, ensuring the city's residents and visitors enjoy a well-managed and maintained environment. Join the team and experience the satisfaction of contributing to make Wellington City a green and great place to be. Our team is responsible for;§Day to day maintenance of over 14,000 street trees and 700km of road network§Maintaining Wellington's Parks and Reserves, including Karori cemetery, Botanic Gardens and Town Belt§Contributing to the safe and efficient day to day running of the team and its resources§In this role, you will be responsible for carrying out all operations relating to tree works and assist with the development of the Arboriculture team. You will gain experience in a vast array of arboriculture work including complex tree removals in Karori cemetery, fine pruning in the botanic gardens, road network maintenance and risk assessing trees throughout the city. You will also develop and expand your skillset with an organisation that values and encourages training opportunities§As well as being passionate about trees and working as part of a team you'll also have the following:§Level 3 qualification or above in Arboriculture§A professional manner and a demonstrated commitment to providing a safe and efficient working environment for you and your team§A keen interest to develop your skills, experience and qualifications.§Because this is a safety sensitive role, all the shortlisted candidates will have to pass pre-employment drug and alcohol screening. Please note that all the staff in this team will be subject to random testing as well.§If this sounds like you, click the apply button to make an application and/or to view the position description. All applications must be submitted online. You must be passionate about taking care of our customers' precious pets and delivering exceptional service both in the pet hotel & doggie day care and grooming areas of the business.§  §Pets In The City is an exclusive Pet Hotel and Doggie Day care facility dedicated to offering the very best care and facilities to our customers beloved dogs and cats. Pets In The City is a unique concept in pet boarding and pet care offering a variety of services including Doggy Day care, dog boarding, grooming, training and pet focused retail – all in the heart of the city. We operate 7 days a week including public holidays.§  §As a senior member of the team you will be responsible for the day to day care of our doggie day care, pet hotel and grooming guests. In this senior role your ability to interact confidently and professionally with customers is also essential.§  §In addition, as this is senior role, at times you will be responsible for the daily running of the play park facility and supervising less experienced members of the team. Good communication skills and maturity are required.§  §You will be required to work on a rotating roster across any 7 days in the week, including evenings and weekends, public and school holidays as required.§  §While a professional qualification such as animal husbandry, dog training/handling or similar is desirable, practical experience working in a similar role for a minimum of 2 years is essential and will be regarded highly.§  §In return for your skills, expertise and training you will be provided with a fun, supportive working environment, a competitive hourly rate, training and uniforms.§  §Please note that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.§  §To apply for this position please email your Cover Letter and C.V. to: §debbie.m@petsinthecity.co.nz§  §Please note that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.§  § §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have professional dog grooming experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a qualification in pet grooming or styling?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§

jobText: TXT/50902750.txt	§Lobster Plant Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lobster Plant Manager§§Advertiser: §Ngāi Tahu Holdings Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Fishing & Aquaculture§§§§§§Kia hiwa rā! § § §Develop and lead delivery and operational excellence§ §Contribute to the success of this exceptional organisation§ §Use your leadership and industry strengths to achieve§ §Ngāi Tahu Seafood is a leader in the New Zealand seafood industry with extensive involvement in the harvesting, processing and marketing of Rāwaru (Blue Cod), Kōura (Lobster), Pāua (Abalone), Tio (Bluff Oysters) and Kourarangi (Scampi).  Ngāi Tahu Seafood is a niche supplier of the highest quality seafood to international and domestic markets under its TAHU brand, with facilities in Christchurch, Bluff and Kaikōura. To continue to deliver this exceptional quality product, Ngāi Tahu Seafood is looking for an outstanding Plant Manager to lead our Christchurch Lobster export Plant.§ §Based in Christchurch and reporting to the Chief Executive, the Plant Manager manages the day to day activities of the Plant, ensuring its resources are optimally utilised and that quality and process best practice is achieved across all functions of the operation. In doing this, the Plant Manager will lead, develop and motivate a high performing team to continue to enhance operational effectiveness and the efficient processing of quality seafood.§ §To be successful as the Christchurch Plant Manager; you will ideally have:§ § §At least 3-5 years of experience in leading/managing a processing plant, preferably within the seafood industry;§ §Relevant food processing and health and safety qualifications, preferably within the seafood industry;§ §Demonstrated leadership ability;§ §Strong communications skills;§ §Established relationships with suppliers and other industry stakeholders and groups;§ §Knowledge and respect for Māori cultural values and customs (Tikanga); and§ §Awareness of and affinity for the needs and aspirations of Ngāi Tahu Whānui.§ §People will describe you as a great manager and leader with the ability to develop and motivate your team to higher levels of success. You will also be known for your flexibility and commitment and your ability to  "roll up your sleeves" and take on a variety of tasks.§ §As the Christchurch Lobster Plant Manager, you will be rewarded with this unique opportunity to lead an experienced team in this progressive and innovative industry leader. Interested?§ §For further information and enquiries, please contact Laura Blackler, Toi Tangata Business Partner on 027 324 3052 or email §Laura.Blackler@ngaitahu.iwi.nz§ § §Applications close Monday 16 November 2020§ §Nau mai, haere mai, tauti mai!§§§§

jobTitle: Vintage Crew 2021 Job in Marlborough - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50933922.txt	§Vintage Crew 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vintage Crew 2021§§Advertiser: §Indevin Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Nov 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§We need help with 2021 Vintage in Gisborne, Hawke’s Bay and/or Marlborough! We’re looking for a number of team members to help us during our busiest period, so we can keep making delicious wine for NZ and the world. §  § §  §About Us§  §We might be a leader in the New Zealand Wine Industry but that’s not what makes us who we are. Our people are our winning formula; the secret sauce; the kiwifruit to our pavlova (yum). From our vineyard and winery teams, who work together to make sure our wine is outstanding; to our sales and admin teams, who keep everything running behind the scenes - our people are who we are.§  § §  §Find out more about us on our website: www.indevin.com §  § §  §Vintage 2021 - Dates & Shift Details§  §Vintage is our busiest time of the year! We work hard to get all the grapes in and processed into wine so we can get it out the door to NZ and international shelves. §  § §  §Typically, our vintages run from:§ § §Gisborne & Hawke’s Bay: February through to late March§ §Marlborough: March to late April/early May§ §There is some possibility of you doing two harvest periods (for example, starting in Gisborne, finishing in Marlborough)§ § §  §Because of the nature of our business, our vintage dates might change slightly but we will always keep you up-to-date with the latest information as we get it.§  § §  §The Roles§  § §  §Cellar Hands / Labourers§  §Ready to get stuck in? We need people with a can-do, will-do attitude, motivation and willingness to learn. You need to be physically fit and reliable, as you’ll be working in a very fast-paced environment with other highly motivated team members. Experience in a winery is an advantage, but we’ll give you all the training you need to be successful.§  § §  §This role involves a fair amount of manual labour and concentration, but you will be working with the same team every day so if that appeals to you, you’ll love this role! Our team usually become very close knit over vintage, so you’ll enjoy the benefits of getting to work with a fun loving, team environment who are all there to achieve the same goal.§  § §  §Cellar Supervisors / Team Leaders§  §Have experience as a Cellar Team Leader? Maybe you’ve supervised a team in agriculture or manufacturing? Or maybe you’re a sports team captain? Whatever the experience, we can train you in all things winery and cellar related!§  § §  §Working a winery vintage is not an easy task - we work long hours, and it’s an extremely fast-paced environment. Everyone needs to stay on task, on time and work together – that’s where your leadership skills come in. We’re looking for someone who can get the best out of their team and motivate them to achieve the tight deadlines and do what it takes to meet their goals. If you have strong communication skills, are great at building motivation and love a challenge, get in touch with us today!§  § §  §Vintage Forklift Operators§  §Do you have forklift experience? Maybe experience with a loader/digger? Or perhaps you’ve been a port worker? As long as you have experience with machinery and can easily get a ‘OSH’ & ‘F’ endorsement, we want to hear from you!§  § §  §This role will cover a broad range of operations ranging from barrel operations and fruit receival, to inward/outward goods and general harvest related tasks – this is a varied role, with the opportunity to get tons of experience across the board.§  § §  §Vintage Assistant Winemaker§  §You’ll have studied, or be currently studying a winemaking or science-related qualification.  Ideally you will also bring experience from a previous Winemaking role, but honestly, as long as you have some knowledge and a passion for winemaking, we can train you with all the skills you need!§  § §  §In this fast-paced role, you’ll be working closely with our Winemakers, so you’ll get tons of one-on-one experience and on-the-job insight into what it’s really like. You’ll need excellent time management and communication skills, as well as the ability to work well in a team – we have A LOT of wine to process.§  § §  §Laboratory Technicians§  §We might be bragging, but our winery lab is industry-leading, with state-of-the-art technology and a proud team who boast proficiency scores in the top percentile in the country. Our lab has it all, and a dedicated, accurate team is at the core of it.§  § §  §Ideally you’ll have some lab experience, but whether that is in a previous work place, a university lab or a winery, is not a problem for us – all our supervisor is looking for is someone who is as committed and high-performing as the rest of the team. We work under high pressure and tight deadlines during vintage, so you’ll need to thrive in that environment, work well in a team and be physically fit.§  § §  §In this role you will be responsible for grape maturity analysis, sampling and testing ferments, among other analysis consistent with industry best practice. We’ll train you to be the best.§  § §  §The Benefits§  §Though we are looking for short-term staff, our standards are so high that there is some opportunity for high-achieving vintage crew to eventually join our permanent crew – we can’t let great staff go!§  § §  §In exchange for your hard work and dedication we are offering:§ § §competitive remuneration package; § §delicious food cooked daily during vintage by our on-site vintage chef;§ §initial training & on-the-job experience;§ §assistance with accommodation, including recommendations;§ §experience with award-winning wine;§ §opportunity to get experience that can take you any where in the wine industry (and beyond).§ § §  §All successful applicants will be required to undergo and pass a Pre-employment Drug and Alcohol test in accordance with the Indevin Drug and Alcohol Policy.§  § §  §To apply, please email your CV and indicate the position you are applying for, and location if you have a preference.  Applications can be sent to §work@indevin.com§ §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Share our values of Safety First, Respectful, Responsible, Collaborative, Innovative?§      §Fishing Trawl Master §      §      §      §        §A classic story of commitment and determination, our people play a significant role in making Sealord a proud New Zealand company and the country's best-known seafood brand. With operations in New Zealand and Australia we're one of the largest seafood companies in the Southern Hemisphere. And with nearly 60 years of fishing experience, our business consistently delivers quality seafood to our customers around the world.§        §At Sealord, we encourage an innovative, safe work environment and a positive culture. Our people are engaged, motivated and likely to tell you that Sealord is their employer of choice. Coaching, career development, succession planning and promotion from within, are aspects of every employee's career journey at Sealord. We have a performance-based culture and pride ourselves on reward and recognition initiatives that recognise top talent and outstanding performance.§        §We are looking for a trawl master with solid recent experience within the Trawl fisheries and specifically with the Korean-style Trawl operations.§        §The purpose of this role§        §This role provides direct support to the Skipper and Senior crew in managing the safe and efficient selection, maintenance and repair of the vessel's fishing trawls whilst on-board and ensuring agreed company and customer expectations are met.§        §Essential skills:§        §          §Strong commitment to safety, prepared to model Sealord safety values§          §Proven experience in Korean style trawl fishing operations§          §Current and up to date knowledge of fisheries through time spent at sea over the last 24 months on vessels operating with Korean style trawls§          §Demonstrated problem solving skills§          §Excellent skills with repairing nets on board§          §Solid experience of directing trawl operations on deck§          §Strong bias towards quality and customer focus§        §        §Each rotation is six months in duration and the hours of work are generally shift rotations of 8 hours on and 8 hours off with all meals provided by our experienced cooks.§        §If this sounds like the right job for you and you have a minimum of 24 months fishing experience on vessels operating with Korean style trawls, then impress us with your positive can-do attitude, teamwork, safety focus, and the ability to follow instructions and rules. While out on the water, resilience is a life skill that is critical, as is respect for each other and the environment. Being committed to your team and tasks is imperative for the whole crew to be successful.§        §Being at sea is a way of life; unique and exhilarating! The Companion Animal part of our business consists of six veterinarians sharing  four full time positions so regular time off  is available. Companion Animal duty is shared amongst the veterinarians. § §We are expanding our practice and so are looking for a part-time veterinarian to join our team and contribute to our vision of outstanding veterinary care. This role has the potential to be full time in the future for the right candidate.§ §The position is for a general practice small animal veterinarian who is a great team player, and is enthusiastic with great communication skills. You must want to be part of a team committed to providing quality service in a busy but fun practice. Salary is negotiable depending on experience. Continuing education is encouraged and supported.§ §Te Puke Vet Centre is known for its friendly, caring and relaxed work atmosphere. The nurses are fully trained and very supportive. We have a modern, spacious purpose built clinic including two theatres, separate dog and cat wards, two consult rooms and a separate isolation ward. We are fully computerised and well equipped including digital x-ray processor, dental x-ray camera, iM3 dental machine, ultrasound and in-house chemistry & haematology.§ §Te Puke is a great community town nestled in the stunning Bay of Plenty.  It is well known for being the Kiwifruit capital of the world, and is a stones throw away from all of the fabulous beaches and sea and lake-side towns in the area, such as Tauranga, Mount Maunganui, the Rotorua lakes and Taupo.  The area offers a wide variety of outdoor and recreational activities including fishing, diving, water skiing, mountain biking and tramping. § §This position combines being part of a high quality companion animal service with the lifestyle of a medium sized rural town, with the added benefit of sea-side proximity.§ §For further information and applications please contact in confidence with a CV and cover letter to:§ §Kate Gloyn§ §Te Puke Veterinary Centre§ §P O Box 50§ §TE PUKE§ §Phone: §(07) 573 7606§ (Work)§ §0275414343§ §Email: §kateg@tepukevets.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary science?§§§

jobTitle: Export Veterinarian Job in Gisborne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50922030.txt	§Export Veterinarian§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Export Veterinarian§§Advertiser: §BEEFGEN§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Salary§§$80,000 - $94,999 + working vehicle + annual bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§We have an exciting opening for a veterinarian. We have built a fit-for-purpose facility located 20 minutes north of Gisborne at Whangara. The facility is fully equipped, ready for a veterinarian to build and experience a beautiful career path.§The primary objective of the role is to meet international standards for export and domestic market requirements for the successful export of semen and embryos from Bovine, Ovine and Caprine animals.  § §There are of course some essential requirements and these are:§Being registered with the Veterinary Council of New Zealand;§Ensuring and verifying the germplasm products meet the export requirements§Laparoscopic AI in Sheep and Goats§Collect and transfer embryos in cattle, sheep and goats§A background in animal care, animal nutrition and/or practical hands-on veterinary work§Previous experience in germplasm collection will be an added advantage§ §Did you new graduate from University? We can work with you to build up your ambitions in the genetic world. We need a Centre and Team Veterinarian to lead and direct our team of technicians and provide technical knowledge and advice for the extraction and export compliance requirements to be met. Big opportunity for the overseas applicant to grant exemption travel into New Zealand.§ §The Centre is bound by export compliance requirements for an embryo team and semen centre.  These are laid out in the official assurance export program for Germplasm which can be found at www.mpi.govt.nz/exporting/animals/semen-and-embryos/requirement-documents-for-exporting-semen-and-embryos/ [link removed]§ §The company is also doing live export of cattle and sheep as well, for which the contracts for live shipments are already in place.  Subject to MPI requirements, this could require the successful candidate to travel internationally. A competitive remuneration package is offered, hours of work are a minimum of 40 hours per week, with the flexibility to work additional hours at peak times.§Any applications, including a letter of introduction, or a CV and evidence of qualifications can be emailed to §info@beefgen.com§ [link removed]. We will get in touch with you as soon as it is received.§§§§

experience: REDA owns and operates three New Zealand Farms: Otamatapaio Station, (Rugged Ridges Station under the control of Otamatapaio), Glenburn Trading in the Waitaki District and Glenrock Station in the McKenzie District, totalling 30,000 hectares and farming 37,000 stock units. jobText: TXT/50952341.txt	§Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §Tavendale and Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§REDA NZ FARMS - OPERATIONS MANAGER§REDA is one of the leading brands in the merino textile industry. It firmly believes that it has the responsibility to promote change through sustainable innovation and environmental awareness, and that its future success will be built upon the strength of its people and social progress within local communities.§REDA owns and operates three New Zealand Farms: Otamatapaio Station, (Rugged Ridges Station under the control of Otamatapaio), Glenburn Trading in the Waitaki District and Glenrock Station in the McKenzie District, totalling 30,000 hectares and farming 37,000 stock units. There has been significant investment in the combined properties over the last 8 years, mainly into irrigation.  At Glenburn more than 370 hectares are now irrigated by spray irrigation.  As a result, the farms have been able to diversify their revenues, which today are coming from high quality fine merino wool, mid-micron wool, and the sale of sheep and cattle.§REDA is looking to appoint a full-time, dedicated Operations Manager to advance the success of its New Zealand operations and lead the business into its next phase of innovation and growth. §The Operations Manager position presents a great opportunity to join a team with a clear vision: to be the most innovative and sustainable farming operator, respecting the environment, while being self-sufficient and generating sufficient returns to allow investment in new business opportunities.§Reporting directly to and working closely with the board, the successful candidate will be responsible for: leading, supporting and developing a team of 4 Managers; cultivating team culture; maximising the efficient use of resources; financial management, including budgeting and forecasting; maintaining and growing our relationships with stakeholders; and enhancing our reputation in the community. §This role presents an exciting opportunity for the right person.  You will need an eye for detail, but also be able to see the big picture, identifying opportunities for growth, expansion and diversification.  You will also need to be dynamic, capable of embracing and driving change and innovation and have a proven track record in leading and managing a profitable farming enterprise. §We anticipate negotiating an appropriate remuneration package with the successful candidate to reflect the scope of the role and level of experience.§To obtain a Job Information Pack for this role, or to apply, please contact Tavendale and Partners by email to §REDAopportunity@tp.co.nz§. §§§§

We are so proud of what they do - and we want to help show the rest of NZ and the world what we see every day. We are growing fast, and we want you to grow with us. §As the South Island Regional manager, you will support our Senior, Specialist and Assistants to help farmers sustainably produce milk, meat and crops by developing MitAgator Farm Environment Plans, Risk Maps, OverseerFM nutrient budgets to support the requirements of various South Island Regional Councils. §You will champion our industry leading MitAgator tool that brings to life risk areas on farm and calculates the most cost-effective mitigation to meet each farmer's environmental compliance needs. You will engage industry and farmer groups, sharing learnings from catchment to catchment.§Primary responsibilities for the role are as follows:§•    To grow the South Island Farm Sustainability business §•    To delight our customers, ensuring our customer value proposition stays out in front and attracts additional value over our competition §•    To create a South Island vision, a strategy, business plan, and budget to ensure this function develops to maintain a leadership position in the market and to sustainably grow within Ballance§•    To lead a team of people to keep them safe, highly engaged, and on an accelerated technical and general leadership development path§•    To ensure the financial and customer performance of the South Island function is exceeding expectations, every year§•    To position Ballance as a best partner in the industry, leveraging relationships to accelerate our pace and to enhance our offering§•    To ensure the national Farm Sustainability team is coordinated, aligned, and collaborative with other functions in the Ballance business§Come and make your difference as a leader in our Farm Sustainability Services Team.  §Applications close: Thursday 3rd December, 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50944712.txt	§Casual Visitor Services Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Casual Visitor Services Representative§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Casual Visitor Services Representative §      §        §          §Casual position – be part of our small visitor team§          §Do you have a passion for visitor experiences?§          §Do you have knowledge of tracks in the Waitakere Ranges?§ §        §        § §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        §Kia Ora, Arataki Visitor Centre are looking for a friendly Casual Visitor Services Representative to help stimulate stewardship of the Waitakere Ranges. This customer focused position is to ensure the visitors experience in the Waitakere Ranges is safe and well informed.§        §This role would be ‘as needed casual basis’ weekdays, weekends, public holidays and school holidays. As part of the team you will cover busy periods, events, school holiday programmes as well staff absences. §        §It’s your challenge to offer exceptional manaakitanga. You will provide visitors with a wide variety of information on all Auckland Council Regional Parks, where to go, what to see. You will educate visitors on caring for the environment, share our local history, instruct people on how to be a kauri protector, by explaining kauri dieback disease. You will also take bookings for activities, community groups and general enquiries - as well as assisting visitors in the unique retail store, to find that perfect purchase to remember their visit. §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §Your background would ideally include customer service and possibly additional experience in outdoor tourism, recreation, conservation and visitor centres. §        §The ideal person for this role will be someone who has:§•    A love of people and enjoys providing quality customer service§•    Understanding of the Waitakere Ranges and surrounding area.§•    A passion for the environment, conservation and have respect for kauri dieback§•    Strong administration skills, including Microsoft Office (a bonus would be experience on Advanced Retail)§•    The ability to think outside the square and share your ideas for activities and events and find solutions to unplanned problems – be part of a team, but still work independently when needed.§•    A full, clean New Zealand driver's licence would be beneficial§•    Intermediate or fluent Te Reo would be a bonus§        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        §The Arataki Visitor Centre is a popular location for tourists and locals alike. You will have the opportunity to assist a range of visitors, from all over the world, all walks of life and all ages. We are a passionate and busy team which get to contribute to some fun events and activities for the community. Did we mention the views are exceptional? This is a unique opportunity that doesn't come around often, so if the above sounds like you, apply now. §        §This role is deemed safety sensitive and in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing.  Auckland Council is committed to the protection and wellbeing of children.  §        §This role is classified as a Children's Worker role under the Vulnerable Children Act 2014. As such applicants will be required to undergo police vetting prior to commencing employment. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check.§ §Applications close Monday, 23 November 2020.§  For more information, please contact Enna Cecilio on 021 223 2212. §        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Casual position – be part of our small visitor team§ §Do you have a passion for visitor experiences?§ §Do you have knowledge of tracks in the Waitakere Ranges?§ § § §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§Kia Ora, Arataki Visitor Centre are looking for a friendly Casual Visitor Services Representative to help stimulate stewardship of the Waitakere Ranges. Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§ViBERi New Zealand Ltd grows processes, manufactures and markets a range of innovative organic blackcurrant products and is seeking to employ an Operations Manager to run the orchard and oversee the processing facility. §This role is located near Pleasant Point.§The  position reports to the owners and the main responsibility is to run the day to day operations of the orchard and the processing facility. §Less significant responsibilities are to run a sheep flock on the orchard over winter and a small deer block and oversee the maintenance of Meadowlinks (a small residential completed subdivision).§The applicant would need to have:§* Proven managerial skills§* Preferably, but not necessarily, an academic qualification in horticulture or agriculture§* Some experience in the horticultural or arable industries§* Mechanical aptitude §* Superior machine operation skills§* Minimum full drivers license required, preferably with additional classes 2 and forklift§* Superior numeracy and writing skills§* Have experience and willingness to work in a tight compliance framework (health and wellness, food safety, quality assurance program, organic certification  and farm environment parameters).§* Be willing and experienced in training staff§* Have the aptitude to adopt Good Management Practices and Lean Manufacturing principles to the orchards and raw processing facility§ §This role is principally to manage day to day operations but there is also a good mix of hands on machine operations and office work§ §The operation utilizes modern machinery with excellent workshop facilities.§ §There is a good team environment within the organization and the applicant should be willing and capable of continuing to build on this culture§ §An attractive remuneration reflecting skills and experience and a near new vehicle will be supplied with this position.§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency.§ §Please apply by emailing your application along with a cover letter and C.V.§ §Applications close at 5pm on the 13th of December§§§§

jobText: TXT/50950848.txt	§Poultry Broiler Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Poultry Broiler Assistant§§Advertiser: §Hernly Farm Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Nov 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Salary§§$40,000 - $49,999 + House + Utilities§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Labour§§§§§§Hernly Farm Ltd§About us§We are a family owned Poultry Farm that prides itself on striving for excellent performance and exceptional animal welfare. The farm is a large modern farm (23,000 square meters) with up to date technology and comes under the highest Tegel Shed Standards. §Qualifications & experience§Experience in the poultry industry (or any farming industry) isn't necessary, however a farming background would be an advantage.§Must be able to work independently and effectively within a team.§The applicant is keen to learn new skills in agriculture, has an open approach to problem solving, can think logically, has great people skills and would relish the chance to work with animals in a rural environment in the Taranaki region.§Must hold a current full New Zealand driver’s licence.§The applicant will successfully work under management direction and will also have the ability to show initiative while doing tasks.§Tasks & responsibilities§The position involves managing the day-to-day welfare and production of broiler chickens from day old to approximately 42 days of age. There is currently a space of 18-23 days between batches.§Organise and setup Sheds for new batches.§The position will also involve general farm work and maintaining the farm to a high standard.§Computer skills are necessary to ensure required production values are entered and basic knowledge of spreadsheets for feed ordering etc.§Benefits§The farm is based outside a small town and is a short 15 min drive to New Plymouth.§There are excellent local schools and a thriving local community.§Modern 3 bedroom home is provided to the successful applicant.§Opportunity to have career progression.§Applicant must be:§Physically fit and willing to undertake a pre-employment medical check.§Willing to undergo a pre-employment drug test.§Able to work in New Zealand.§§§§

The Wildbase Hospital is part of the Massey University Veterinary Teaching Hospital.§        §The Wildlife Technician is a full-time (37.5 hours /week) role that assists in the clinical care of wildlife cases in the University's Palmerston North-based Wildbase Hospital, including assisting with maintenance of the native wildlife pathology service in collaboration with the Department of Conservation and oiled wildlife emergency response developed in collaboration with Maritime New Zealand.§        §Applicants will be able to show a demonstrated interest in avian health, conservation management or wildlife husbandry. A current driver's licence is required. jobText: TXT/50951028.txt	§Land Management Advisor - Technical§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Land Management Advisor - Technical§§Advertiser: §Horizons Regional Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Land Management Advisor - Technical §      §        §About us§  §        §The Horizons region extends over 22,200km2 – from Ruapehu in the north and Horowhenua in the south, to Whanganui in the west and Tararua in the east. It’s a landscape as vast and varied as the over 240,000 people who call it home. At Horizons Regional Council we work to make our region a great place to live, work and play.  §        §The role§        §We are currently seeking a Land Management Advisor based out of our Taumarunui Service Centre.  We are looking for someone with local knowledge who has a farming, land management or forestry background.  The candidate should be a practical worker who is also willing to learn new skills.   A great communicator and a willingness to work outdoors is essential. This is a 14 month full time fixed term position to cover for staff on parental leave. §        §You will primarily be involved in soil conservation projects with particular emphasis on erosion control activities. You will be working with landowners and you should have a good understanding of farming and farming practices in the hill country environment. It would be an advantage if you had knowledge in sheep and beef farming enterprises.  §        §About you§ §        §Ideally you will have sound technical and farming knowledge, good communication skills, and be able to deal with a range of customers. You will be supported to manage projects and organize your work programmes for farmers and contractors.  Being locally based, you will know the area, have the ability to build strong relationships with landowners and have a positive and friendly attitude. Being familiar with Horizons’ major work programmes and having knowledge of Local Government processes and procedures would be beneficial.   §        §Why should you apply?§ §        §When you join us, you can look forward to a rewarding career full of opportunities to develop, along with a positive and supportive work environment. We do this through:§        §  • Strong focus on employee health, wellness and wellbeing§        § • Flexible family friendly work environment§        § • Assistance with tertiary education §        §• Positive health and safety culture §        §• Capability development programmes that enable advancement into leadership roles, along with skill development across different functional jobs; and §        §• A supportive and social work environment where enduring friendships and collegiality develop.  §        §Applications close Sunday 9.00am 29th November 2020.§        §Horizons are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to ensuring we have a diverse and inclusive workplace so our people reflect the diversity of our region.  §        §Please Note: When applying through Seek, you will receive an email from QJumpers with a link to complete your application. We will not receive your application if this link is not followed and the application completed.    §        §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Land-Management-Advisor---Technical-Nov-2020.pdf§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About us§  §The Horizons region extends over 22,200km2 – from Ruapehu in the north and Horowhenua in the south, to Whanganui in the west and Tararua in the east. It’s a landscape as vast and varied as the over 240,000 people who call it home. At Horizons Regional Council we work to make our region a great place to live, work and play.  §The role§We are currently seeking a Land Management Advisor based out of our Taumarunui Service Centre.  We are looking for someone with local knowledge who has a farming, land management or forestry background.  The candidate should be a practical worker who is also willing to learn new skills.   A great communicator and a willingness to work outdoors is essential. This is a 14 month full time fixed term position to cover for staff on parental leave. §You will primarily be involved in soil conservation projects with particular emphasis on erosion control activities. You will be working with landowners and you should have a good understanding of farming and farming practices in the hill country environment. It would be an advantage if you had knowledge in sheep and beef farming enterprises.  §About you§ §Ideally you will have sound technical and farming knowledge, good communication skills, and be able to deal with a range of customers. You will be supported to manage projects and organize your work programmes for farmers and contractors.  Being locally based, you will know the area, have the ability to build strong relationships with landowners and have a positive and friendly attitude. Being familiar with Horizons’ major work programmes and having knowledge of Local Government processes and procedures would be beneficial.   §Why should you apply?§ §When you join us, you can look forward to a rewarding career full of opportunities to develop, along with a positive and supportive work environment. We do this through:§  • Strong focus on employee health, wellness and wellbeing§ • Flexible family friendly work environment§ • Assistance with tertiary education §• Positive health and safety culture §• Capability development programmes that enable advancement into leadership roles, along with skill development across different functional jobs; and §• A supportive and social work environment where enduring friendships and collegiality develop.  §Applications close Sunday 9.00am 29th November 2020.§Horizons are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to ensuring we have a diverse and inclusive workplace so our people reflect the diversity of our region.  §Please Note: When applying through Seek, you will receive an email from QJumpers with a link to complete your application. We will not receive your application if this link is not followed and the application completed.    §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Land-Management-Advisor---Technical-Nov-2020.pdf§§§§

hence a good level of health and fitness is required.§ §Following safe work practices is paramount.§ §The role is based in Te Kowhai.§ §EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE§ § §Ability to read and write English§ §Basic computer skills§ §Licence to drive in NZ§ §Licence to drive a forklift would be an advantage, but not essential.§ §The variety and challenge of the daily work would suit a practical and hands-on problem solver who is willing to work long hours.  The hours would be approximately 7.30 - 5.30 Monday to Friday and would depend honey volumes.§ §Three Peaks’ beekeeping system is based on consistency and quality, supported by robust safety practices and a good team environment.  It is important to follow instruction and work as part of a team.§ §Three Peaks Manuka Honey is an expanding, mid-range apiary and honey brand company owned by the Perry Group.§ § § § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50916696.txt	§Field Operations Tractor / Machinery Operator & General Hand§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Field Operations Tractor / Machinery Operator & General Hand§§Advertiser: §Riversun Nursery§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Riversun is focused on “Growing Excellence”- providing a safe and nurturing environment for our people, our plants, our community and our planet.  We are committed to achieving genuine sustainability - having already eliminated artificial fertilisers, systemic sprays and herbicides from our field nursery operations.  We have been carboNZero certified since 2018 and have many other exciting sustainability initiatives well underway.  Riversun is New Zealand’s premier supplier of certified plant material.§ §Riversun is based in beautiful Te Tairawhiti, first City to see the sun, home of beautiful sandy beaches, fantastic surfing, fishing and hunting.  We may be small, but we punch well above our weight when it comes to our beauty and natural resources.  A traffic jam in Gisborne mean’s it takes you 15 minutes to get somewhere instead of 10, a crowded beach is when you can see someone a few hundred metres down from you and there are such things as your “good” shorts when you go out in Summer!  Gisborne offers a more relaxed and family friendly way of life, where you won’t be stuck in your vehicle for hours each day commuting, where the beach or bush is truly on your doorstep and Lake Waikaremoana is just up the road.§ §Tasks & Responsibilities§ § §Operating specialist nursery equipment.§ §The safe and responsible operation of tractors and machinery.§ §Ensuring machinery is set up and calibrated to correct specifications prior to use in order to produce required result.§ §Regular monitoring and checking of machinery when in operation to ensure job is being carried out within required specifications at all times.§ §Daily basic tractor machinery maintenance including greasing, air filter and fluid levels.§ §Trimming across all Field Operation crops.§ §Fungicide spraying – safe use and application of agri-chemicals as directed, for all required crops, including mixing of chemicals and recording of applications in spray diaries.§ §Mechanical weeding across all crops.§ §Weed spraying – within all company blocks, along boundaries, fence lines, drains and around outhouses and building areas.§ §Mowing - Within ALL company blocks and along boundaries and outside perimeters.§ §Ground Prep – deep ripping, power harrow, rotary hoe, discing, cultivating etc.§ §Plastic Laying – Preparing beds for planting of all crops at Nursery sites.§ §Lifting – Operation of specialist nursery equipment and Lifting machine to harvest Field Grown Plants.§ §Small Truck driving – Transportation and cartage of gear to and from Blocks.§ §Forklift work - loading and unloading trucks as required, including general forklift duties within blocks.§ §General tractor driving duties to assist field crew as necessary.§ §Qualifications & Experience§ § §Minimum 2 years relevant experience at a comparable level§ §Current Full New Zealand driver’s license§ §Adaptable, flexible, able to change plans based on the changes in the plants, a problem solver.§ §Self-aware, regimented/understands and works to the time sensitive nature of the plants.§ §Takes responsibility for results, organised, sets standards§ §Strong interpersonal skills, a clear communicator, collaborates well with others, builds relationships.§ §Benefits§ § §Company Medical Insurance§ §Lunch provided 4 days per week§ §To Apply§ §Download the full job description at: §www.riversun.co.nz/employment/§ and if this sounds like the job for you please apply with a cover letter and your CV attached to:§ §Anna Thorpe§Riversun Nursery Ltd§Email: info@riversun.co.nz §Or drop your application into our offices at 257 Awapuni Road, Gisborne.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50950280.txt	§Come and do your OE (Orchard Experience) in sunny Hawke's Bay!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Come and do your OE (Orchard Experience) in sunny Hawke's Bay!§§Advertiser: §The Fresh Fruit Company Of New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Nov 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Freshco orchards are wide spread from Havelock North to Taradale in Hawkes Bay. Our task is to grow the best fruit and vegetables in New Zealand! Then we get them to the consumer, anywhere in the world, as quickly as possible in the FRESHEST condition. Freshco orchards currently produce nine apple varieties including our IP varieties such as Breeze, Sonya and Cheekie.§ §Orchard work is available all year round for a limited number of employees, but we require a large number of seasonal workers from November through to May during picking season. This is where you come in.§ §Freshco is continually looking to add motivated, hardworking people to our team. If you enjoy working outdoors and are prepared to work hard, we have employment opportunities waiting for you. Whether you're a skilled worker with your forklift ticket, or just getting into the workforce, we've got a Job for you: Picking, Packing, Tractor Operator, Forklift Operator, Coolstore work, Quality Contro,l Data Entry, Machinery Operator.§ §At Freshco there’s a job for everyone, no matter what kind of qualifications, and there’s guaranteed work all the way until April next year.§ §If you’re after a summer in the sun and to keep the money coming in while there’s less going out please head to www.theorchardexperience.co.nz and click on the ‘apply for work’ tab. Fill out the online employment form and our recruitment team will be in touch to get you started for work asap!§ § § §Check out our video at https://vimeo.com/§463694604§ or https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dat1igvwyJs§§§§

We are 100% farmer-owned and funded and work on behalf of New Zealand's sheep and beef producers. Our vision is for profitable farmers and thriving farming communities, valued by all New Zealanders.§B+LNZ is committed to supporting our sheep and beef farmers in meeting the challenges and opportunities of managing the sector's environmental impact. As an Environment Policy Analyst for B+LNZ you are pivotal to that process, providing quality policy analysis at regional and national levels. You will support delivery of B+LNZ Environmental Policy work and be the key regulatory relationship manager for specified policy processes, utilising your strong existing networks to stay ahead of environmental policy issues, risks and opportunities. You will, as part of a dedicated and professional cross organisational team, contribute to delivery of B+LNZ organisation and environment strategies.§A critical part of the role is empowering sheep and beef farmer involvement in policy and planning processes. You will be required to travel to represent Beef + Lamb New Zealand and participate in regional and national collaborative processes or similar forums.§What we offer§This role gives you a chance to be at the forefront of deciding how New Zealand makes best use of our natural resources as part of New Zealand's biggest manufacturing industry. jobText: TXT/50923621.txt	§Prospa Orchard Foreman§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Prospa Orchard Foreman§§Advertiser: §EastPack Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Prospa Orchard Foreman §        §          §EastPack is the kiwifruit industry’s leading grower-owned post-harvest operator with facilities in six locations in the Bay of Plenty.§          §Prospa is EastPack’s Orchard Management Division which offers a full range of services that aim to optimise productivity and maximise returns for our growers.§          §We have an exciting opportunity for an Orchard Foreman to join our Prospa Team based in Te Puke for the 2020/21 growing season.§          §Reporting to the Prospa Growing Manager, this role will assist in all managerial operations as required and will carry out various orchard tasks ranging from pruning, bud counting, fruit thinning, and machinery operations. A key focus of this role will be to effectively plan, motivate, and supervise orchard teams in the field to achieve quality results.§          §To be successful in this role, you will need:§          §            §Proven experience in orchard work (preferably in Kiwifruit).§            §A good understanding of mechanical and machinery operations – mowing, mulching and weed spraying. §            §Excellent time management and organisational skills.§            §A good level of physical fitness as you will be required to work outdoors for up to 8 hours per day.§            §Strong initiative to work unsupervised at times.§            §Flexibility to work sometimes long hours including weekends.§          §          §You will be required to complete “on orchard” qualifications such as First Aid, Tractor and Chainsaw Certificates, and other training.§          §Applications will need to include a detailed cover letter and CV.§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§EastPack is the kiwifruit industry’s leading grower-owned post-harvest operator with facilities in six locations in the Bay of Plenty.§ §Prospa is EastPack’s Orchard Management Division which offers a full range of services that aim to optimise productivity and maximise returns for our growers.§ §We have an exciting opportunity for an Orchard Foreman to join our Prospa Team based in Te Puke for the 2020/21 growing season.§ §Reporting to the Prospa Growing Manager, this role will assist in all managerial operations as required and will carry out various orchard tasks ranging from pruning, bud counting, fruit thinning, and machinery operations. A key focus of this role will be to effectively plan, motivate, and supervise orchard teams in the field to achieve quality results.§ §To be successful in this role, you will need:§ § §Proven experience in orchard work (preferably in Kiwifruit).§ §A good understanding of mechanical and machinery operations – mowing, mulching and weed spraying. § §Excellent time management and organisational skills.§ §A good level of physical fitness as you will be required to work outdoors for up to 8 hours per day.§ §Strong initiative to work unsupervised at times.§ §Flexibility to work sometimes long hours including weekends.§ §You will be required to complete “on orchard” qualifications such as First Aid, Tractor and Chainsaw Certificates, and other training.§ §Applications will need to include a detailed cover letter and CV.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50909571.txt	§Boat Skipper / Deckhand§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Boat Skipper / Deckhand§§Advertiser: §Fiordland Discovery§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Rest of Southland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Fishing & Aquaculture§§§§§§We are a small family owned and operated New Zealand tourism business, offering luxury boutique-cruising in Fiordland. §  § §  §We are looking for an experienced and professional skipper to join our small crew aboard our luxurious boat, the Fiordland Jewel.§ §  §Skipper§ §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a qualified Skipper to join the Fiordland Discovery Team in our Fiordland Operation as skipper /deckhand.  §  §Reporting to the Head Skipper, this role is responsible for ensuring we deliver an outstanding experience and safe journey for our customers. §  §Working on a roster with our other skipper. Currently 2 weeks on, 2 weeks off.§  §Duties:§  §• Leading and motivating your crew to deliver outstanding guest experience within the highest possible Health & Safety standards§  §• Responsible for carrying out crew training, safety drills and regular safety reviews  §  §• Providing excellent customer service to our visitors and giving them an enjoyable and memorable stay §  §• Delivering an outstanding customer experience which includes commentary and the ability to interact with visitors§  §• Managing passenger & crew safety on board at all times§  §• Performing day-to-day upkeep of the vessel, including oil and filter changes §  §• Assist with documentation reviews and updates as required§  §• Performing a range of hosting duties including general cleaning§  §Skills, Experience and Attributes:§  §• You must hold a New Zealand or Australian Skippers ticket - preferably either a ring fenced CLM/ILM ticket or SRL ticket for a vessel up to 24 meters with a Passenger Endorsement for 20 passengers or more.§  §* Must have a high level of competency in skippering vessels of this size, plus a willing attitude towards learning.§  §• Excellent communication skills for commentary delivery§  §• Ability to successfully lead and support a team §  §• Ability to work both under direction and without supervision§  §• Due to the remote location of the operation a can-do, problem-solving attitude definitely an advantage.§  §• Passion for the natural environment of Fiordland§  § §  §Remuneration:§  §Remuneration will be based on the experience and ticket the candidate holds.§  §The position includes accommodation/food whilst employed and stationed on the vessel. §  § §  §If you would like to be part of a new and growing business whilst spending time in one of New Zealand's most beautiful destinations, please apply via Seek with CV and cover letter.§  § §  §Please note a valid working visa is required to work in  New Zealand. You must already have the right to work in New Zealand and the required visa for this job. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§
