jobText: TXT/50915314.txt	§Orchard Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchard Manager§§Advertiser: §Blueberry Country Ltd.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Blueberry Country is a family owned business based in Ohaupo in the Waikato. We have established Orchards in Ohaupo, Ngatea, and Otautau (Southland) and have an orchard under development in Waipu (Northland). We are New Zealand’s Largest holder of Blueberry land with 560 acres (230 hectares) currently in production.                        §Our head office and main packing facilities are located just 20 minutes south of Hamilton, and the blueberries are grown, harvested, frozen and packed all on site. We also run Pick Your Own (PYO) and café operations through the summer across all our existing orchards.§The Role:§As the Orchard Manager for Blueberry Country you will be responsible for overseeing your team of orchard staff to optimize production of the Ngatea Orchard. Providing guidance and training to orchard staff, setting budgets, and ultimately improving orchard performance. Ensuring excellent direction of orchard tasks, development, and supervisory personnel.  As the company’s Orchard Manager, you will ultimately maintain and build on the level of supply and its profitability and conduct various trials to improve the overall success of the orchard.     §Responsibilities    §Orchard plans are followed according to best practice and are adapted where necessary to ensure optimal results for Ngatea orchard.§Ensuring Health and Safety processes and procedures are followed.§Direct and coordinate Orchard staff, ensuring all orchard activities, such as irrigation, general maintenance, chemical application, and harvesting are completed in a timely manner.     §Recording and reporting key orchard data.§Ensuring all orchard compliance is upkept.§Ensure spraying has been carried out, along with maintaining diaries and assessing chemical usage.§Management of the Cafe Manager during the fresh season (December to February).       §Maintaining accurate administrative records of orchard activities including spray registers, work progress, payroll, health & safety reports and expenditure records combined with expanded management responsibilities.§What you need to succeed:§• Previous orchard experience and/or relevant qualifications.§• NZ drivers’ license with F endorsement.§• Excellent communication skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships.§• Strong interpersonal skills, ability to multitask and a keen eye for detail.§• Ability to train, supervise and lead staff.§• Willingness to work in all weather conditions.§• Willingness to work flexible hours during the peak seasons (Dec-Mar). §• Basic math & computer skills§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§

This key management role will need strong leadership, relationship and operational skills to change and drive new and existing opportunities. §Key responsibilities will include:§          §            §To oversee the day to day running of the Grain Trading business.§            §Develop and maintain relationships with growers, pastoral farmers and end users. §            §Accountable for ensuring all feed grain is supplied to meet end user requirements.§            §Expand Carrfields Grain and Seed customer base in conjunction with the NZ Sales Manager and other relevant team members. §            §Be responsible for the sales contracting of grain with key customers and the purchasing of free feed grain to meet their requirements.§            §Provide timely communication and advice to key customers on the current market, forecasts and trends that may affect their business when procuring grain.§            §Negotiate Grower contracts in conjunction with customer requirements.§            §Liaise with the New Zealand Sales team on available grain contracts and ensure growers are planning proactively ahead for the next season.§            §Arrange transportation of grain purchases§            §Manage the testing of feed grains in conjunction with Carrfields Grain and Seed Lab §          §To be successful in this role you will have:§          §            §An understanding of the grain or arable industry§            §Experience in the development and implementation of sales targets and budgets§            §Ability to effectively communicate and utilise interpersonal skills for a customer focused approach§            §A high level of self-motivation, common sense and aptitude§            §Business administration and reporting§            §Computer literacy – Power BI/Microsoft Dynamics/Excel§            §Accuracy with all documentation §          §If you have the experience and feel you have the capability to fill this role then apply today. The large array of peas, forage and vegetable seed produced are sold to more than forty countries around the world. §We are seeking a Grain Trading Manager to manage and lead the Grain business. This key management role will need strong leadership, relationship and operational skills to change and drive new and existing opportunities.   §Key responsibilities will include:§To oversee the day to day running of the Grain Trading business.§Develop and maintain relationships with growers, pastoral farmers and end users.  §Accountable for ensuring all feed grain is supplied to meet end user requirements.§Expand Carrfields Grain and Seed customer base in conjunction with the NZ Sales Manager and other relevant team members.  §Be responsible for the sales contracting of grain with key customers and the purchasing of free feed grain to meet their requirements.§Provide timely communication and advice to key customers on the current market, forecasts and trends that may affect their business when procuring grain.§Negotiate Grower contracts in conjunction with customer requirements.§Liaise with the New Zealand Sales team on available grain contracts and ensure growers are planning proactively ahead for the next season.§Arrange transportation of grain purchases§Manage the testing of feed grains in conjunction with Carrfields Grain and Seed Lab §To be successful in this role you will have:§An understanding of the grain or arable industry§Experience in the development and implementation of sales targets and budgets§Ability to effectively communicate and utilise interpersonal skills for a customer focused approach§A high level of self-motivation, common sense and aptitude§Business administration and reporting§Computer literacy – Power BI/Microsoft Dynamics/Excel§Accuracy with all documentation §If you have the experience and feel you have the capability to fill this role then apply today. jobText: TXT/50933982.txt	§Senior Investment Adviser, Maori Agribusiness§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Investment Adviser, Maori Agribusiness§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Senior Investment Adviser, Maori Agribusiness §        §          §Senior Investment Adviser - Māori Agribusiness - Te Tapuwae Ahuwhenua§          §            §Are you a strategic and analytical thinker who understands investment opportunities in the Māori primary sector?§            §Do you want to work with a great team that values relationships and outcomes?§            §Do you want your day to day work to contribute to greater Māori prosperity?§          §          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is looking for a Senior Investment Advisor for a 24-month fixed term contract to support the effective delivery of programmes in the Māori Agribusiness Directorate. Our funding includes the Māori Agribusiness Extension (MABx) programme, Māori Agribusiness Pathway to Increased Productivity (MAPIP) programme, and the Sustainable Food and Fibres Futures (SFFF) fund. Our funding supports Māori to maximise the benefits from the sustainable and productive use of their primary sector assets.§          §The Māori Agribusiness (MAB) Directorate is responsible for contributing to the identification and implementation of viable primary sector economic development opportunities through the provision of information, intelligence and advice on issues specific to Māori; for ensuring MPI and MAB are well connected and engaged with relevant Māori fora, initiatives and people; and for providing advice and informing MPI on Māori-related issues and impacts. §          §If you are skilled in the development and implementation of effective investment strategies and best practice to support Māori landowners and agribusinesses in the primary sector, we would love to speak with you. You will be working closely with the programme office and MAB regional advisors across our funds, providing investment analysis and guidance as well as directly supporting a range of projects through the funding lifecycle.§          §Success in this role is the ability to be strategic, and to identify and act on opportunities. An appreciation of Māori tikanga and te reo, as well as an in-depth understanding of the Māori economy and the primary sector is important in this role.§          §If you have strategic vision, can establish and build relationships skilfully, and are looking for an opportunity to benefit the regional and national primary sector landscape for Māori - this role could be the opportunity you've been waiting for.§          §Key Skills / Experience§          §Bring your tertiary degree (economics, management, law, government, resource management, biological sciences, etc.) and/or corresponding / relevant work experience along to:§          §            §Apply your knowledge of investment management to growing the Māori economy within the primary sector§            §Contribute to a team culture which places value on te ao Māori and the Treaty partnership§            §Experience leading projects and achieving effective outcomes in situations where there are diverse interests§            §Experience working with a diverse range of people, interests and skills§            §Effectively support your team to apply best practice in managing investment programmes§            §Apply your knowledge to make sense of complex or ambiguous issues and to determine the most appropriate response to these§          §          §See the benefits of working at MPI§          §Our mahi stretches all the way from the Beehive to the border. You will be responsible for the day-to-day management of the clinic as well as head the responsibility of leading the team to deliver positive patient outcomes and exceed client expectations.§ §We are looking for someone who is a positive team player, has a sense of humour and is able to cope well in any situation.§ §Our ideal candidate will also possess the following attributes and skills:§ § §A minimum two years’ experience in a Veterinary Clinic or an Agricultural business§ §Willingness to roll up your sleeves and get involved at all levels, with energy and drive§ §Ability to successfully develop and train the team§ §Facilitating regular clinic meetings§ §Administrative reports and returns§ §Daily, weekly and monthly staff rosters including leave and time sheet management§ §Reception duties including answering phone calls, taking messages, serving and advising client§ §Stock and inventory control including placing orders, stock monitoring and coordinating stock takes§ §Daily mail and banking processing§ §If you have the above skills and wish to be considered for this position, apply now by clicking on the link.§ §Applications close on 6th December 2020.§ §To learn more about Veterinary Enterprises Group Ltd (VetEnt), please see our website:  www.vetent.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years of retail management experience do you have?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50921750.txt	§Veterinary Nurse role§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary Nurse role§§Advertiser: §Robson Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced veterinary nurse to join our friendly and dynamic team.  This specialist nursing role will see you working with the internal medicine department, ensuring client expectations are met by providing exceptional care for our patients.  This is a busy and varied position which involves: high-level nursing care and monitoring; assisting with client and internal communication; and playing an integral part in diagnostic procedures.§  §This is an opportunity to increase your skills, to be involved with endoscopy, oncology, transfusion medicine and more. The position is part-time, with the potential to extend to full-time role.§  §Our ideal candidate will possess:§* Diploma qualification in veterinary nursing§* A minimum of 2 years veterinary nursing experience§* Computer literacy and willingness to learn§* Team player with good relationship building abilities§* Outstanding communication skills§* A compassionate and caring attitude with commitment to high level veterinary nursing§* Ability to adapt and multi-task in a busy environment§  § §  §What we offer:§  §* Generous remuneration, commensurate with experience and role requirements§  §* An ongoing emphasis on career and personal development, with a focus on CPD§  §* A caring and busy team who are also lots of fun§  §If you have a desire to learn and further develop your skills, and want to work with a great team in a supportive professional work environment, don't delay: click "Apply" now.§  §Alternatively, email your CV and application to:§  §Shannon Reed: §shannon.reed@vsg.co.nz§Candidates must have the legal right to work in New Zealand§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§§§
